The breakfast was more than enough with fruit, eggs, yogurt and a variety of Vietnamese food included. All the staff was very friendly and helpful, we already miss Alan at the front desk.

They even arranged a car to take us to Hoi An, rented a motorcycle for us and gave us restaurant advice. We are very grateful to have chosen them!

Dolores and Ramiro
h_title_comment: A very good hotel in the perfect location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were a little disappointed when we arrived as we had specified twin bedded room for 2 traveling companions but told they only had a double bed but could change it the following day. We were shown to our room & could see that although there was only one bed, it was extremely large and was not a problem for us to sleep in together.
We asked reception to recommend somewhere to eat local food and we were given a map and instructions to go to a restaurant that was full on f locals and westerners. We selected the set menu which was delicious and we also tried the local wine which was quite acceptable.
A very centrally located hotel with kind, professional staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
When we arrived and saw the old, faded sign and the road front under construction we were worried and even considered finding a different hotel for our two nights in Hue. (The road work is out the hotel’s control, but that sign really has to go...haha!) We are so glad we didn't judge they book by it's cover so to speak.

The staff, especially Alan at check in, were so friendly and welcoming. In fact, he was the main reason we stayed. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom wasn't fancy, but had a tub/shower that worked for us. This hotel offers outstanding service and value for money!

Our second night, we asked to upgrade to a room with a balcony and they were able to accommodate. They moved everything for us while we were out for the day. The city view from the balcony was awesome.

The restaurant was excellent and Selena and Nga were so sweet and friendly. It really deserves it's #2 ranking in the city. We ate breakfast and the room service we ordered was over the top! Food was hot, fresh, delicious, beautifully presented and at a very reasonable price ;) My husband was so impressed he even took a photo!

The hotel is in a great location, close to most tourist sites if you like walking or only a short taxi or cyclo ride away. It is close to lots of shopping, night market and restaurants.
We are so glad we stayed and would stay again if we are ever back in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We picked this hotel because of the good reviews and I’m delighted that they were all true. The staff are incredibly warm, welcoming and helpful. The bedrooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. We were slightly concerned when the taxi driver dropped us at the end of the tiny road (he couldn’t get through because of parked van) and we trudged down the lane a bit apprehensive partly because the recent floods had caused so much damage to the road surface. But our fears were completely unfounded.

The hotel is in a very good location being so close to the centre making it easy to get to the Imperial City and the Royal Tombs.

I’d have no hesitation coming back here again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The vibe here is just great. It doesn't offer anything particularly amazing but the staff, food, and atmosphere are more then adequate. Breakfast is pretty good. Definitely a place I would come again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great little hotel, staff are so helpful and friendly go out of their way to help you. Great breakfast, good food in the restaurant , clean rooms and comffortable beds. Reasonable rates. Would highly recommend to anyone.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a cute little hotel, with very friendly staff. The hotel is clean and the service is excellent. There was some construction going on outside, but we where never disturbed by the noise. The restaurant served a good buffet breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: In our fortnight travelling round Vietnam, the Serene Palace was one of the best hotels we stayed in. All the staff were so welcoming, friendly and helpful, and we were particularly impressed by Cookie, Alan and Kerry. Our room was spacious, comfortable, beautifully decorated, and full of all sorts of useful and luxury items. We also ate delicious meals in the hotel restaurant (dinner on two evenings, and breakfast on one morning). We wish that our stay had been longer. We would say to all travellers looking for rooms in Hue, do not look any further than this very special Hotel.
h_title_comment: A truly wonderful experience at the Serene Palace, Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were positively surprised. Hotel much better than expected, even though location is a bit tricky to find. Everyone super kind. Room clean and comfortable. Lots of restaurants and lots of places to eat and drink very near from hotel. We highly recommend the hotel for your next stay in HUE. Breakfast is included, food very good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: very kind, smiling, listing us employees. room quiet without noisy and nice; large room, confortable beds.we enjoyed the breackfast, plenty of choice; very friendly helpful : gave me very useful information concerning the best places to visit. (massage... shopping...)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
From the moment you arrive, you are greeted by the friendly staff and offered a refreshing drink and some delicious fruit, while the porter brings your suitcases to the room, and makes sure everything is ready for you. Rooms have a good AC, is nice and clean, and the bath is big and comfortable. The hotel is located in a small side street, so it's very quiet at night. Breakfast is great, with a wide selection of food at the buffet, and your choice of cooked dishes from the menu. We had fruit, yoghurt, eggs and pakcakes every morning, so delicious. And the staff is great. They really do everything to make you feel comfortable. We stayed 4 nights, but would love to stay 2-3 weeks if we had the time.
It will be very hard to find as good a hotel anywhere else, especially for the price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed in room 303 and it was not enjoyable.

It was extremely loud from echos of people talking, walking, slamming doors, furniture moving around. It woke me up at 6 am both days I stayed there. I was going to book in for a 3rd night but the noise was way too annoying.

Furthermore, I got put into a room with no windows so I felt like I was living in a cave. No thanks.

On a positive note I did feel that the rooms were super clean, staff we extremely friendly and it was in a good location relative to walking street.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Great location, walking distance to most everything (but alleyway a bit dauntingly narrow for some taxi drivers). Staff were EXCELLENT. Jenny, at front desk, was so helpful and professional. Breakfast was fresh and tasty with good selection. Our room was VERY comfortable and clean with modern nice amenities, digital room safe for valuables, and a small balcony. Bathroom was large with a jetted tub that my partner enjoyed. Wished we could have stayed longer than one night. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nice Hotel , Clean , Nice Rooms . Excellent Restaurant , so close walking to the Citadel . Good for a long stay . Good Service Reception . Very Friendly Staff . Transfer to Hoi an by Private Car a good Price , where you could enjoy the view on the Road .
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 4 nights, the staff were excellent and very helpful. The hotel is clean and rooms were good, however fitting into showers is somewhat of a challenge when you’re 6.2’. Many restaurants only a 5min walk either way out of the hotel plus motorbike rental across the lane (if that’s what you’re into).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had two nights here as part of our arranged trip in Vietnam. The rooms were very spacious and nice and the staff are very friendly. Nice quiet location but very handy to the party part of town of that is what you are after. Generous and nice breakfast. I'd stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Although hidden away down an unmade road this place is a hidden gem. Really spacious rooms, great food, great staff. Ten minutes taxi from railway and near the river and yet in a pretty secluded area. I only stayed for four nights but really enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Like its sister restaurant, the service and standards here are exceptional. The room we had was quiet and immaculately clean. The staff go out of there way to be helpful and made our stay the best in Vietnam. The breakfast is enough to keep you going all day with the most extensive range of choices.
Thank you :)
h_title_comment: Lovely hotel in a great location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We booked this hotel not knowing quite where it was. Jenny was very patient and e-mailed quickly with all of our questions prior to arrival. The pre-arranged pick up by the hotel bellman at the train station was like clockwork and he has been great since our stay. We locked ourselves out of the safe and he quickly came up to re-program. Julia greeted us and shared all sorts of options for tours around the city and suggested a better option to get to Hoi An in private car vs the train. She helped with getting our laundry done and it was returned the next day at a very reasonable price. We had a balcony and enjoyed sitting at the end of the day with a cool one. Breakfast included menu items such as omelettes and eggs but also Pho and rice dishes. The hotel is quiet and yet close to many restaurants. The Motorvina Travel company is across the alley for scooter rentals or guided tours. We really scored on this stay. Great service!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here shortly, got a free upgrade with balcony, fantastic room. For our train from the north arrived early we could not check in right away. But we were offered to have breakfast downstairs first, and later they brought our luggage to the room. The girls at the reception were very helpfull. I’d certainly go there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We would like to say a sincere “thank you” to the friendly and competent staff, who had always a friendly smile for us. We thankfully remember the particular attention and rapid help for any kind of problems we had, be it organizing a trip by car or providing us with raincoats in unexpected rain. Every morning in the inviting atmosphere of the restaurant, we enjoyed an excellent breakfast buffet, which was ample enough to try something new every day. All in all, we enjoyed our stay in Serene Palace, which offers a very good standard of accomodation and excellent value for money. We will come back.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had a lovely, comfortable stay. It is a fabulous value--but even if it were more expensive I would review it very favorably. The staff was helpful at every turn, including meeting us with some food in the lobby that we could take with us for our 6AM train ride.

I absolutely recommend this hotel and will stay again if I am lucky enough to return to Hue.
h_title_comment: Wonderful service, super clean, quiet and comfortable
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I am Canadian and my name is Denys and my girlfriend Sylvie.
Hue Serene Palace Hotel, the staff was really kind and professional. The kitchen staff were particularly friendly. The food was also very good.
h_title_comment: We visited the imperial city and the cave of paradise. Hue is a must in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Location of this hotel is excellent a bit secluded from the craziness of the city but right in the mix. Walking distance to the citadel and all the great restaurants and bars. Amazing attentive staff. This will be the only place i stay at if in Hue again.
h_title_comment: Perfect location, perfect room, perfect price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Best little spot in Hue; on a quiet backstreet, steps from the action. Great value. Amazing breakfasts (and amazing dinners too! Restaurant is worth checking out!) But what really sets this gem apart is the awesome staff. From the rose petals on the bed, to daily fresh fruit, to remembering my name and itinerary, and hooking me up with other Canadians travelling to the same place (appreciated as I'm a solo traveler), and always asking how things are, the staff here always have a smile and go the extra mile. Their personable nature really made this stay very memorable! Rooms are comfortable and clean. Thanks to everyone, Cookie, Selena, Cindy...there are lots more, sorry I can't remember all your names! But you are all excellent!
h_title_comment: Friendliest gem of a hotel: they go the extra mile!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Stayed at Hue Serene Palace Hotel with my parents in Feb 2018. It was indeed the best hotel I’ve stayed at!

We booked the hotel’s car service from Da nang airport to Hue. The driver who picked us up was very friendly, spoke very good English, very knowledgeable about the history of Vietnam. We had an excellent drive from Da nang to Hue. We had pre-arranged for the driver to stop at certain places of interest otw to Hue and the driver was very good, took us to the best stops, explained the history of the places and was very patient. Didn’t get his name though, but he deserves a rating of 12/10!

The location of the hotel is slightly off the main road, which is good. The receptionist are very friendly, speaks good English and there was welcome fruits and drinks. :)

We stayed on the 7’th floor, the room was very big, clean and has modern toilet facilities. Best thing is the room had a computer in it! Which was really amazing, even the 5* hotels in London don’t have a computer in the room! There’s also complimentary fruits given everyday.

Breakfast at the hotel is amazing. Again it beats the 5* hotels in London, Australia and etc. You can choose an array of food from the menu which taste amazing!

However, don’t opt for the tour packages offered by the hotel at the reception, it’s really very pricey and they are not really honest about prices. Do grab a taxi from the streets yourself or do your own research.

Overall we had a good stay at Serene Palace Hotel and will definitely recommend it to all travellers.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The room was simply excellent, I wish we could have stayed longer. All requests were met promptly. Definitely great value for money. Very close to most restaurants/cafés, and also not too far from the old town.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The bed is comfy, the rooms are spacious and clean, the shower had good shower pressure. The staff were all so kind and courteous. My husband was in the hospital for two days and I got some takeaway from the restaurant downstairs and they provided me with a bowl to take to the hospital. And upon discharge everyone asked how he was and seemed to genuinely care about his well being. We also rented a motobike for a day and the prices were reasonable and the bike was in good condition. We also intended to do the Hai Van Pass and the price was also very fair. I highly recommend this hotel not only were the facilities excellent, the staff was phenomenal.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I was there only 1 night, but for this I have very good memories. Staff was very (!) friendly, room was big and clean, restaurant was outstanding (I had the 4 course dinner) and probably the best one during my Vietnam trip.
h_title_comment: Top Hotel, very friendly staff, Resrtaurant outstanding
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The customer service here was of really high standard. They couldn’t have done more for us. The room was really nice, big and cosy. The location was really close to all restaurants and bars. The breakfast was incredible, so much food. I will recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My daughter and I enjoyed our 3 night stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel. They arranged a spa visit for us, tour guides, and drivers. Everything they recommended worked out great. Nice food and a lovely view from our room.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We had an absolutely phenomenal experience with Hue Serene Palace hotel. I got really sick in Hue (not from eating here) and ended up staying for a full week. The staff was so caring and were always asking to see how I was feeling and if I needed anything. When we needed to extend our stay, no more rooms of our type were available, but they upgraded us at the same rate. Down in the restaurant they made me custom, easy to palate foods and brought me ginger tea for my stomach. Tons of TV channels in the rooms plus large bathrooms with tubs. The staff spoke English fluently and were incredibly helpful while not pushing travel services onto customers.
h_title_comment: Great stay, comfortable hotel, incredible staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Serene Palace is a lovely hotel, but what made our experience so special was the staff. The room is spacious and well appointed, and the lobby is welcoming, with a great breakfast included. The staff went out of their way to help us get around Hue and see the beautiful city, and had fun conversations with them. I would highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Pros
Nice clean rooms, good bathrooms
Decent breakfast
Price
Close to waterfront
Friendly staff

Cons
Along with a few other hostels and hotels it is located on a street that needs upgrading. Very mucky when raining
Pushy check in lady trying to sell tours
We had a very long wait for main course dinner close to 1 hour then food arrived cold. I did comment on this when checking out

Stayed one night only as planned
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We booked based on the level of good reviews on TA. I ignored the silly reviews that said that it's down a dark and possibly dangerous alley. It's not! As in the rest of Vietnam lots of hotels are in narrow streets and in fact in terms of noise it's a far better option than a busy and noisy street. We had 2 nights and paid extra for a late check out. The room was of a good standard and a good size.
We were a little disappointed with breakfast, the range and quality could have been better, but it was acceptable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I visited the Hue Serene Palace hotel for the second time, with friends for a long weekend...and it was just as good this time around as when I visited 2 years ago. The room was in the front with a great view of the city, and a balcony, well appointed and very spacious. The daily fruit was a great extra, and the daily breakfast was great! The staff remembered me, and that was very nice as well. I will go back!
h_title_comment: Still great the second time around
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I loved this newer hotel. Probably had the best night sleep of my three week trip. Modern comfortable room with terrific marble bathroom. Staff is terrific both at the front desk and in the dining room. I tried to extend my stay by three nights but they were full. I'd recommend booking in advance. Some people complain about the dirty, muddy alleyway leading to the hotel but unless you are wearing stiletto heels and it's pouring down rain you will be fine.
h_title_comment: Fabulous room, great service,best breakfast in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Spent 2 nights at this very comfortable hotel. All of the staff were exceptional, especially Cookie and Mary. Welcome drinks and fruits offered at check in. Rooms very spacious and super clean. WiFi worked well. Breakfast was good - very slick service. There was some noise from the street but it faded out before midnight.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had the chance to spend 1 night in this hotel during our 2 weeks trip in Vietnam. It was by far the best hotel we've been to. The service was very good: everyone spoke English well, was smiley and helpful.
The breakfast was also very nice.
Perfect stay, would definitely recommend it!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Best place in Hué staff and hotel perfect the restaurant is verygood one of the best in town. Perfect location to viait around the palace and to walk beside the river. Room are clean included breakfast very good one I recommand to any peoples
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very good value hotel. Friendly staff Julia is super helpful and the breakfast is great. Can’t fault if at all. It’s a fairly new hotel so it in very good condition. Also, it’s very clean and you get plenty of soap, tooth brushes etc. It in a good location for restaurants and bars.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
=+ Room was Very clean, bed was huge, place is located on a quiet street, helpful Staff who gave Good recommendations and orgsnized trips plus gave extra care and attention to us as a family, money matters were exactly as agreed.

- breakfast was Good and sufficient but the buffee corner was too small to handle all the guests and the area together with the kitchen itself that could be seen through an open window did not look too clean.
h_title_comment: A very decent and clean hotel, suitable for family
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I really liked this hotel. It is down a “muddy alley” but if you get past that you will be pleasantly surprised. Very clean. Excellent breakfast with eager to please staff. Try there Vietnamese coffee for breakfast. Laundry service a available. My husband and I purchased a Day City tour from the hotel for 39$ pp + 2% for using a credit card. All others on our tour only paid 30$ (people not at our hotel). My advice to the hotel is don’t rip off your hotel customers, it’s not about the money, it’s really about the bad feelings.
So enjoy the hotel but don’t purchase anything through there sales desk.
h_title_comment: Don’t buy and tours through the hotel!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
I stayed for two nights last weekend.

I have stayed at many hotels throughout Vietnam, all have been good, but this has been the best so far.

Rooms are modern, spacious, well equipped and spotlessly clean.

Only a two minute walk to the main bar/cafe/restaurant area and only a few minutes more to the river.

The staff, wether from reception or the restaurant, were the most friendly and helpful I have ever met at any hotel anywhere.

I would definitely stay there again.
h_title_comment: The most friendly and helpful staff
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: You enter through a dodgy alley, not expecting much- but wow do they blow you away. From the moment we walked in the staff were welcoming, helpful and friendly. Our room was simple but extremely comfortable and clean. We had everything we needed. The breakfast included was also delicious. The restaurant in the lobby is rated number 2 in Hue, we only ordered room service and were not disappointed! The location is a walk away from all the business of bars and restaurants. We walked to the imperial palace from there. Overall we had a wonderful experience and would definitely come back!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel provided a unique experience. The rooms were big enough for two days. Room was very clean. No complaints about this hotel at all! Loved the access to the massages! Everything was reasonable.
h_title_comment: Perfect room - The best hotel I have stayed in
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We come to hotel for just on night and the staff was very friendly, at reception helped us find transport to the next destination. Room was clean and very nice, breakfast was good too. Over the street you can rent a motorcycle for 3dollars per day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I stayed here just before christmas 2017 for 3 nights. The hotel is down an alley which can get dark and you may not want to walk alone however you shouldn’t have any problems, the city seemed safe to me. On arrival the hotel is very welcoming with drinks and fruits. Julia on reception and all the other receptionists were really friendly and informative of the local area. The room was massive and had everything you would need and more, for a 3 star hotel this exceeds expectations massively. Unfortunately i had food poisoning on Christmas day and the staff were really kind and helpful in making me small snacks and asking if i was okay. The hotel even emailed a few days later to see if i was better. The hotel is in a good location by many bars and restaurants and easy to access the attractions and train station. This hotel is amazing and you should stay here if you are in hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Excellent service from all staff. We arranged a pick-up from Da Nang airport to take us to Hue via Hoi An and the driver was excellent as was the pre-arrival customer service. The room was very big and staff went out of their way to make our stay a good one. The buffet breakfast was good, although sometimes the breakfast staff were a little over enthusiastic which became a tad irritating. We booked a day tour of the local sites which was very good. The hotel is in a convenient location to explore the town and we would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Staff is annoyingly pushy about filling in Tripadvisor and rating them 5stars.
And they keep pushing you by email
The hotel is good, spacious rooms.
On checkin in they try to sell excursiosn - i booked a trip on teh Perfume river for 35 USD - later i found out that you can get the same trip with the same boats for 10 USD (if you go to location of the boats)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My friend and I stayed at Serene for one rushed night (flights delays etc) in January and it was very pleasant. The staff were welcoming and friendly. Our twin room was huge with two double beds and a bath tub. Amenities and breakfast were great. We also ordered a tuna salad from the restaurant, made to go, and it was really yummy.

The hotel is about a 25 minute walk or cheap cab to the Citadel entrance. The front desk can arrange anything you want. We decided to get a private car to Hoi An, arranged by the hotel which was an incredible experience. I recommended it. It was $60 for the car regardless of the amount of ppl and by the time you catch the train to Da Nang ($19) and take a take to Hoi An ($20) the car is worth the price because our driver stopped at multiple places on the way.

PS DO NOT eat at the restaurant across from Serene called Koi. Risotto has decent Italian food, it’s about a 5 minute walk.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We arrived at the hotel for a three night stay and were very warmly welcomed. We were invited to sit on soft couches and served juice and fruit while the receptionist sat down with us providing an overview of the hotel services. Our very attractive rooms on the top (7th) floor provided expansive views the city. The morning breakfasts were very pleasant offering a wide range of choices.

The hotel reception arranged a personal tour guide to showcase the city’s major attractions. The guide showcased the major imperial sites via walking, dragon boat ride along the river and private car and driver. The time spent in this hotel and Hue was certainly memorable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here for two nights and paid a little extra for a room with a balcony. The room was spacious and clean with large beds and a safe. The computer in the room came in useful for looking up things to do in Hue. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was lovely - fresh pancakes, fruit etc. They offer a laundry service which I think was around $2 per kilo. The location was perfect.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 2 nights during a two week Vietnam trip. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. They helped us with lot of day trip options and we took the 1 day personal tour of Hue. Would highly recommend taking a personal tour over a group one as you can time your own our pace. Hue is the old capital of Vietnam so there is lot of history in those tombs and pagodas that you will visit. Highly recommend our tour guide Mr Hue (check for him at Serene reception). Breakfast was very good too. Not a lot of options but whatever was there was just right to fill you up before you embark on your day journey. We also booked transfer to Hoi An from the hotel. The driver spoke good english and waited for us patiently while we visited a lot of places on the trip. The hotel also provided a desktop in the room which was kind of cool as we spent some time planning our remaining trip on one of the nights.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I styed there from Dec.29th 2017 until 1st Jan.2018 ,during my stay in this Hotel, I found very comfortable rooms great breakfast convenient to every where especially to central city and main markets,and friendly staff especially 2 staff member 1 Ms.cookie and other was Ms.jenny ,I would like visit and stay there once again ever if have chance
Cordially ,Ely
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I had a short 1-night stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The hotel is located at quiet street parallel to the city walking street, not too rowdy yet close enough for action and amenities.
The room I had was big, and had a computer with internet access.
The hotel team of staff (particularly Mr Alan at the reception) is outstanding, with quite genuine attention to guests' needs and also offered advice on options for food and further travel.
I found Hue Serene Palace Hotel to be budget with excellent value, good location and very serious about guest experiences :)
h_title_comment: Memorable Dec 2017 stay, with outstanding value and service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
You would never choose this hotel from the outside – it’s on a muddy, crumbling street that looks like a back alley, and the front of the building doesn’t make much of an impression – but inside we found a very clean, modern and lovely hotel with excellent service at a good price.

Alan at the front desk was especially helpful with arranging travel plans and tour packages, including private tours of the Citadel, Thien Mu Pagoda, Minh Mang and Khai Dinh Tombs, as well as the DMZ and Vinh Moc tunnels. And Sally in the restaurant was incredibly sweet, bringing us food to take with us on our tours when she felt we didn’t eat enough for breakfast!

The bed was huge and comfortable, and the bathroom was large, with plenty of storage room. Towels, robes and sheets were all plush and high-quality. There was a nice jacuzzi tub but no shower – apparently the rooms have either a tub or a shower, but not both. Inside the beautiful room was a computer for guest use, as well as a refrigerator and small safe. The WiFi worked everywhere and the TV had plenty of channels, including CNN.

The hotel is also located within an easy walk to the riverfront and night market. There were plenty of good restaurants nearby, but the hotel restaurant was just as good as any of them! See separate review of the restaurant.

Despite the exterior appearances, we would definitely recommend this hotel!
h_title_comment: Don’t judge a book by its cover – this is a great value!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My wife and two sons (6 & 8) and I stayed two nights at the Serene Palace, and we were very pleased with our stay - the staff, especially Sally, Sarah and Tom, were always extremely friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and well stocked with amenities, and the Serene Cuisine Restaurant serves a great breakfast and dinner. It was my wife's birthday during our stay - when the staff found that out, they secretly ran out to a bakery and had a personalised birthday cake made. About a half hour later, they all sang Happy Birthday and brought the cake and candles to our table. Again, we didn't ask for or order the cake - the staff took it upon themselves. This is the very high level of personal and kind service we received - we would recommend the Serene Palace very highly!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This hotel is up a side street which can be challenging to find. However when you get there you are met with a reception team second to none. They were so helpful and attentive the likes of which I can honestly say I have not come across before.
The breakfast team were equally the same
The hotel room was very comfortable and clean and quiet at night
Their recommendations were spot on and made our visit to Hue seamless. I you are going to Hue you should stay here.
Would like to thank Julia and Cookie for being so good at their work.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
In the Hue Serene Palace Hotel I have had a very nice stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable.
I like this hotel and later I will check in ones more.

Together with my friend I had three amazing days in Hue. Often the staff of the hotel gave us tips for trips and other important informations.
Thank you very much!!!
h_title_comment: Hue Serene Palace Hotel is one of the best in Viet Nam!!!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Staff here are very helpful with booking tours. Great food in the restaurant especially local specialities. Also good prices Location is down a narrow muddy alley parallel to the 'walking street' where there are bars and restaurants. No complaints with our stay here. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Would come again if I return to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here for three nights in two rooms and it was a great stay even though some of the other rooms are more attractive with much larger windows.. The staff’s concern for guests’ needs is outstanding and very genuine - they could really teach some more expensive establishments a thing or two on that score! The day trip they arranged for us was reasonably priced including an excellent set lunch at the Elegant Restaurant (we returned the next day for dinner), the guide’s English adequate if not fluent. A massage at the Shining Spa was fantastic and incredibly good value and I’ve left a separate review of the in-house restaurant where we ate twice. Unless you want serious luxury, I can’t think of any reason not to stay here!
h_title_comment: Outstanding service, especially at these prices
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very spacious rooms. Good selection at breakfast. Clean rooms and good shower and bed. Great service from all the staff. Booked us a car from Danang and to the airport. Highly recommend for price range.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I had written the review once and then realised that I had been too harsh. Thus I decided to revise my review and here I am

Location - It's on a nondescript lane which has just enough space for one vehicle at a time. Not a very good first feel. Lot of eateries within a short walk. Perfume river flows close by. Reaching there was no issue as the Taxi from the Airport took us straight without any hassle

Front Desk - Efficient. All the ladies willing to help with their workable English. They guided us with whenever we asked something - be it with tourist attraction, money exchange, travel booking et al. They were also extremely helpful to connect us with our bus driver when we had got separated inside the Bach Ma National Park

Lift - Only one lift which becomes kind of rush during peak hours. Not a big deal though

Room - We had booked a family room. Spacious enough for a family of 4. Two large and comfortable beds. Very clean. A little short on furnitures Also, the balcony is of little use as it oversees the same small lane

Sleep Quality - Being off the main road, it becomes very quiet and one can enjoy a good night's sleep. The hotel can consider upgrading their pillows

Bathroom - Large bathroom with different rooms having either bath tub or shower area. Overall quite clean but there was some room for improvement

Breakfast - Limited Menu. Only Breads and fruits on the spread. Rest made to order. This can be a hassle during rush hours but the food is served hot and it is very tasty. We really enjoyed the noodle soup and seafood fried rice. Eggs were made to order

Restaurant - Small restaurant at the lobby level - same place where breakfast is served. Though they boasted of 1-for-1 cocktails, the cocktail maker can do with some training. The restaurant closes at 10 PM

Travel Desk - They provide all kinds of travel arrangement. We decided quite late on the tour to Bach Ma National park and they could still arrange that for the next day morning. They can even book the train tickets (albeit for a small premium). However, we chose to book our tickets from the station. The girls at the travel desk and reception were ever willing to help. At one point I thought that they were over insistent on selling their travel packages (city tour, river cruise etc) rather than paying attention to what we wanted - but perhaps that was because of the language issue - persistent all through Vietnam.

Laundry - The hotel laundry has a fantastic rate of USD2 per Kg and returns within 12 hours. I have never got such a good price in any hotel

Overall - A small hotel with a lot of personal touch put in by the staff. A little pricey in my case when I compared my stay in Danang.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel has a lovely staff who went out of their way to offer help. The room was exceptionally clean and spacious. We had a wonderfully and very reasonably priced meal in the hotel. We had to leave the following morning before breakfast service started so the staff offered us a take away breakfast for our ride to the airport. I would absolutely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for two nights whilst touring Vietnam, it provided the perfect base for us, the welcome was so lovely and they provided cake and decorations as surprise for my birthday which was really kind.

We arranged a car and driver through the hotel for a tour of some Hue sights and this was very good value, our driver spoke very good English and was able to provide us with helpful insight on the sights so no need for guide.

Breakfast was lovely and cooked to order but it could be very busy so worth arriving early.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Due to flooding, the hotel where we had reservations had to unexpectedly close for repairs. Fortunately, we were recommended Serene Palace by fellow travelers. Communicating with the hotel was easy and they allowed an early check in which was so helpful after our bumpy train ride from Hanoi. We received a warm welcome from Alan upon arrival, with drink and fruit. He helpfully reviewed options of sites to see in Hue. Room was lovely and comfortable and breakfasts are plentiful and delicious. A perfect stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We only stayed one night in Hue but was very impressed with the Serene Palace hotel in one of the side roads.

The room was spacious and the red petals on the bed and towels folded into a little puppy gave it a special charm. The staff was friendly and very helpful and a lovely breakfast was served.
h_title_comment: One night stay over in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed here with my family for a couple of days and the hotel was really nice. The rooms were lovely, spacious and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food in the hotel was good also.
It was a little unexpected that the hotel was down a street alley but don't let that put you off. The location is very close to restaurants and bars.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very friendly and helpful staff,the rooms were spacious and clean. lovely breakfast and dinner.We had hamburgers and I would recommend it. I would highly recommend this hotel to stay while visiting Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We did stay in Serene Palace for 2 nights in Hue. The hotel was located in the small narrow street, its very close to the main walking street and main sightseeing attractions of the area. The hotel had nice spacious room and very clean. Hotel had a good restaurant for the breakfast and dinners.
Hotel staff was very welcoming and helpful. They did help to arrange the tours and related transport for us. They did advise us on every important detail. They did arrange us also a transport with a tour from Hue to Hoi An. It has been really a very nice experience and highly recommend to stay while visiting Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The serene was great with amazingly friendly staff (Allen and sally in particular) and great breakfast and dinner at the hotel. Staff made us feel very welcome and great with the kids.

Recommend about 3 days in Hue as we did four and ran out of things to do with the kids.
h_title_comment: Couple of days in Hue with our kids
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My wife, grandson and I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel (which I found on Trip Advisor). From picking us up to checking us in to being so friendly there is one thing I need to say....Stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: A 10 minute drive from the train station and in a great location near to plenty of restaurants and the walking street. Me and girlfriend stayed here over christmas. We was greeted by a very nice lady called Julia who brought us some juice and a fruit platter. She then gave us a map with plenty of information about Hue and the main attractions. Unfortunately my girlfriend was ill for our whole stay so we didn’t leave the hotel but the staff were very helpful and did everything they could to help her recover.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I cannot day enough about this wonderful hotel. Every aspect of our stay was excellent. A big thank you to Sally for her amazing hospitality. Every staff member was extremely friendly and helpful. You’ll not regret staying here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
My family of four stayed here for three nights while we were traveling through the area. We felt like we might have made a mistake as our driver was taken us to the hotel, as it’s located down a narrow (alley) street, but once we entered the hotel and were greeted by the staff we knew we made the right choice.
The room was spacious, we had the quad room and was able to fit everyone comfortably.
Our first morning there we were unable to eat the breakfast because of an early morning tour, but the staff was gracious enough to pack a “to go box” for my family, which was definitely appreciated.
The hotel is situated conveniently to the city center which makes walking to the pedestrian zone easy and quick, while keeping a majority of the night life noise out of hearing distance.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to our through Hue!

Well done team well done!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We were impressed by the hotels hospitality. The staff was always ready to help you based on your needs. They recommend travel tour and good driver as well to ensure a pleasant stay in Hue. The place is centrally located. 5 mins walk to walking street, 15 mins walk to night market and 30mins walk to Citadel. The Serene Palace restaurant is just at level one serving delicious food.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for a few nights and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. The staff are amazing so helpful nothing is too much trouble.

The room was perfect. Clean and big with a good bathroom. Even a computer.

We would not hesitate to stay here again. Thank you Cảm ơn <3
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Only a short stay but we were so pleased. The staff went of thier way to make us feel welcome. The rooms were lovely and the tours they helped us organise were great. One the hotel highlights of our trip. Would come back in a flash.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great hotel, in a great location with super nice staff. May(Tyyet) was unbelievably accommodating and service oriented. She went out of her way to help us with many reservation needs. Highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were made feel extremely welcome. The reception staff and doorman are extremely polite, professional and charming.

The hotel itself is beautiful the rooms are spacious and decorated to a very high standard. The housekeeping staff kept our room spotless and left fresh fruit by the tea and coffee station every day.

They also have a sister hotel in Hoi An, that we would have loved to have booked into but due to high season it was unavailable.

We truly loved our stay here and would highly recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We highly recommend this hotel. Impeccable service, immaculate large rooms and a pleasing price. The staff here are amazing and nothing is too much trouble. We found Alan and Julia and team interested in you and what you wanted to achieve. There is no doubt that Alan with his business degree has much to offer. It is situated down a lane close to most things. All drivers Quảng, Ron and Phuc were excellent and managed the traffic to perfection! The restaurant had beautiful food very reasonably priced. We loved it so much we ate their every night. Beautiful Sally, Cindy and their team were just delightful. Nothing was too much trouble and by the end we felt like family. We will be back!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: On arrival the staff were exceptionally welcoming. Mary was really helpful with recommendations and making tour bookings for us. The free breakfast was really nice, the kitchen staff were keen to make sure you were happy and comfortable. The beds were really soft and comfortable, and the shower was a consistent temperature and pressure! Very clean and tidy hotel. Would highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We highly praise the Serene Palace Hotel .The staff, particularly ALAN and Sally, was extremely attentive and helpful. The food was so good that we ate in the hotel restaurant every night. Price/ quality very high on the quality side!
Hugh & Melba, Venice, CA USA
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Amazing quality and spacious rooms with kind and friendly staff. Awesome shower and such a massive and Comfy bed. location and good to book a car to hoi an and out for the day too! Make sure you see some of the mausoleums in the afternoon!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Centrally located hotel, but still a quiet little street. Large room and bathroom. Clean and nice and very comfortable
The staff is extremely helpful and will and can arrange everything for you! excellent breakfast. Never had a better hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is lovely and modern, super clean and tidy, bathroom was new and clean, comfy bed. The window looked into a wall which wasnt great but to be honest after being out all day and coming back when it was dark it didnt really bothered us. Staff were great, lovely and very helpful. Food at the restaurant was fantastic, very tasty, freshly made and cheap. Would 100% recommend!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Thank you and your staff for everything. While we were staying at Serene we had the best hospitality. I would rate it the best we have ever had from organising our trip from Danang and also organising day trips and even trip to airport. Your staff members were so friendly and helpful it made our stay most enjoyable. We would have no hesitation staying with you again or recommending to our friends. Miss Jenny was so so helpful.

The breakfasts were also fantastic

Thank you all again and hopefully one day we will be back there again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The Serene Palace Hotel was fabulous! All the staff were attentive and smiling. They helped me organise my day activities/tours when I arrived and Alan at reception was particularly helpful! The deluxe double room was spacious and spotless. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers 😎
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We had a wonderful 2 night stay here in November '17. The staff were unfailingly polite, professional, helpful and pleasant - a credit to the hotel. Our rooms were well above average and had everything for a most comfortable stay. Breakfast was delicious with a huge selection to chose from. We were so well looked after throughout and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a fabulous stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Stayed 2 nights and the entire stay was fantastic. They knew we would arrive early in the morning after a 14 hour over night train ride, so they had a room ready for us to check in already at 9 am - very much appreciated!
Everyone was super friendly, breakfast was really nice and the room was spacious, super super clean and well air conditioned.
This was one of the best places we stayed at so far.
The price is great for what you get.
Also booked two trips with the hotel and weren't disappointed.
The hotel is only a small walk from the center of town which is also very convenient.
Loved our stay here.
h_title_comment: Great price for value. Awesome rooms.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Three of us touring Vietnam found this hotel to be excellent. Rooms were well fitted and comfortable Service desk reps Selina & Katie both fairly new employees worked to assure our complete satisfaction. Breakfast was great - and don't miss an evening visit to the DMV Bar for pool and a great crowd. I can't recommend this place enough and I would go back for a longer visit to this charming town anytime!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: What more can I say to add to the glowing reports about Serene Palace? It is hard to overstate the great experience we had at this hotel. The food was great, the staff could not do enough for us - all in all a very pleasant stay at this hotel, located in a small alley in the middle of Hue.
h_title_comment: Great hotel in the heart of Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very nice and clean room. Good located and central in a small street.
We liked the great breakfast and the restaurant. Stuff is very polite and helpful with tours and transfer. The hotel is an excellent choice for a stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We have just checked out of this accommodation tucked away in an alley way of Hue. It was a pleasant surprise exceeding the advertised 3 stars. The staff were exceptional, even offering to walk guests into town (short walk). Clean rooms. Would absolutely stay again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Châu, Julia, Mary, Jack, Alan...and all the crew makes you feel at home and they help you in anything you need. Good mood. We had a wonderful time. It's a five star hotel in all the senses unless in the price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very good hotel for a very good price.

The room was spacious and had a great view, and all the ladies from the reception were super kind and friendly.

Also, the driver that took us to the hotel and works together with the hotel, Mr. Hai, was great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We have had some amazing staff throughout our Vietnam holiday but the staff at this hotel take the cake. Extremely kind, friendly and caring. We left a package in Hoi An and the staff called our hotel and organized for it to be put on a bus to Hue the next day and even went to the bus depot to pick it up for us! Beautiful, clean rooms too!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 2 nights. Got a very nice bowl of complimentary fruit when we arrived and Katie was very friendly and helpful, explaining how to get to various places of interest around the town. Breakfast staff the next day were fantastic, real 5 star service, very responsive, efficient and friendly. The second day we went earlier for breakfast, and there were only 4 guests and 2 staff members - I asked a waitress for some coffee and was told 'you can go and get it yourself'! Apart from this one occasion, all the staff were great - friendly and efficient. The hotel was spotless.

Really nice large room, with wooden floors and a balcony. Only negative about this hotel is that the sidestreet where it's situated is unpaved, so it gets muddy after heavy rain. It's just a few minutes walk from the main areas, which we preferred, as it's much quieter at night than hotels right in the centre.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a five-star rating for the staff. It’s amazing how the staff at all the hotels we’ve visited in Vietnam go out of their way to make your stay as memorable as possible. This one is no exception. It’s also a five-star for the restaurant - both breakfast and lunch/dinner. We tried the set menu for two and it was excellent. The room was large and well appointed - bed, bathroom - all comfortable, clean, in working order. Also, quiet room as the hotel is in a small alley. Why only 4 stars? Because the hotel has the charm of an airport holiday inn. This was not helped by the fact that we came and left under pouring rain. Very depressing weather. Also, the hotel is a bit far from the citadel. Not really walking distance, especially in heavy rain. But again, thank you to all the staff for arranging drivers, laundry, and helpful visiting guidance, all on the spot. Flawless performance.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Unfortunately we only had enough time in Hue to stay here for one night, however we had an excellent experience, the hotel is very clean and has all modern amenities required. The hotel also has a great restaurant, and the service was fantastic, especially from Cindy, very friendly and helped us to choose local dishes we may enjoy. Her recommendations were very welcome and the meal was excellent. Highly recommended if staying in Hue, very good value for money and very comfortable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Spent two nights here and were overwhelmed by the friendliness of the front desk staff and restaurant staff. Nothing to complain about. Do not be concerned about the location in a very small alley, all is safe. But the hotel is really easy to miss if you do not have a driver that knows it.
Lots of eating possibilities in the vicinity, but we also recommend the hotel restaurant, not really what you call a romantic place but great food at very reasonable price!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Super hôtel well located, nice room and the team is awesome ..! Very helpful, customer oriented. This hotel and the team get all 4 and 5 * codes. A real pleasure to stay in this hotel in this beautiful city.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Stayed here in November. Staff go above and beyond, extremely friendly and helpful.
Despite our persistence that we would walk Flooding didn't stop the driver dropping us right outside the hotel.
The hotel is located down a quiet side street (the best bar nextdoor the secret garden!)
Our room was larger than expected with fresh fruit everyday. Breakfast was buffet of fruit cereals etc and cooked to order options as well.
We ate dinner several times which again we would highly recommend.
Organised our bus to our next location.
Would definitely stay here again if in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Tucked away off the Main Streets it’s be easy to miss, but the hotel is in a great location. 5-10 mins walk from the tourist area and main Citadel over the river.
Staff were very attentive and helpful, explaining routes around the city and advising on places to eat. I very much enjoyed my stay. The breakfast was fruits, meats and a selection of food to order (from local dishes to omelette).
My room was clean and tidy, quiet apart from noisy guests hanging round the lifts, my room was well presented. For the money I paid it was a bargain.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Excellent hotel down a very narrow street. Our first impressions were down to the taxi driver dumping us at the top of the street so we had to hike down the uneven street! every other cab including a 4x4 we hired could make it down there. When we arrived the staff were very welcoming and couldnt do enough for us. Early check in was welcome after the sleeper train. Very large room with no external windows which is a vietnamese oddity as the buildings are very narrow.

Hot water was plentiful so after a welcome shower and lunch we went on a trip around the city to see the tombs and citidel. The city had only just been hit by a typhoon a few days before and surrounding villages were still under water. Hue had cleared the water and showed no sign of the floodwaters.

Sorry we only had a short time to explore this historic city.
h_title_comment: Great hotel with a few quirks
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace is off a small lane, but this is no problem (unless a typhoon has been recently). At all times the staff made our stay memorable (especially Allen) and supplied maps, restaurant discount vouchers, and heaps of useful advice. The hotel is a short walk from the main street along the river which has shops and markets. There are numerous restaurants close to the hotel. A great place to stay, and we would stay again.
h_title_comment: Great hotel, top restaurant, superb staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed only for one night, totally wet and dirty from the rainy weather, we were warmly welcomed. With the perfect mix of caring about us and giving us the possibility to only arrive, the staff is the most sensitive we`ve met at our whole trip.
The room, was confortable and clean, the food at the restaurant really tasty, and the staff in any case helpful and sympethatic.
I can recommend this hotel with all my heart.
Thank you again for everything,
Bine and Heide
h_title_comment: Best hotel in our whole trip
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We arrived at the Serene Palace shortly after Typhoon Damrey. There was so much rain that cars could not reach the hotel entrance, so walked up the narrow lane with water up to our knees with the Bellboys carrying our luggage! The staff were so helpful. Sally and Amy in the restaurant cannot be more charming, Mary and Julie at the front desk can arrange everything that you need. We used Brian, the hotel driver for our onward journey to Hoi An, he is excellent company and helped us to understand the lives of Vietnamese people. The hotel policy is to use European names for all of their staff, we understand that it makes it easier for visitors to remember names but we think that people ought to be called by their real Vietnamese names. I highly recommend this hotel and it's staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were at the hotel during the typhoon mentioned in the review below. The street outside the hotel flooded to at least waist height making leaving the hotel impossible. We were very well looked after with lovely food, thanks to a generator when the power went off! The staff were patient and calm with all our questions about the floods, such professionalism given they would have been so worried about their own homes and families during the flood. Many thanks!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
In the midst of Typoon Damrey (November 2017) we made countless changes to our reservation at the Serene Palace as one travel option after another was precluded by flooding, airline flight cancellations, etc. Ms. Linh at the hotel was unfailingly gracious and helpful, finally advising us that the only way to get to the hotel was by boat. She then refunded our deposit one day before our last scheduled arrival, all this while dealing with much greater problems at her end than changing a vacation schedule.
Consequently I have not (yet) been to this hotel, but would give these folks my business in a heartbeat.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The room and bed were very comfortable, the shower was nice, and the customer service was wonderful. The hotel is located in a quiet alley with a motorbike rental service next door. The food in the restaurant is amazing and the complementary fruit is very nice. Shout out to Allen at the front desk and Sally in the restaurant for making our stay extra memorable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment:
Wow. The service in this hotel rivals five-star hotel service! Staff were excellent from check-in to checkout, giving map, recommendations, and arranging everything for us to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. Even if the weather didn't cooperate with us (it was rainy when we were in Hue), we still enjoyed our stay because of the staff!

Car Service: We arranged for two-way car service from and to the airport ahead of time. Emailed the staff our arrival and departure details and everything was arranged in time. One-way car service is $15 and roundtrip is $30, so there's no reason not to get it.

Check-in: Check-in was done seamlessly with welcome fruits and drinks. Maps were provided and a 10% discount coupon on their restaurant was given to us for lunch and dinner (which is the #2 Best Restaurant in Hue!)

Room: Room we booked was at the top floor with a balcony at only $48 which already included breakfast! It has a great view of Hue and the room was spacious with thoughtful Vietnamese art and decor. There's also a private desktop computer in the room, which was very helpful for checking in with our next flight. Bathroom is spacious with adequate amenities and warm water for shower. There's a bidet in the toilet, which is one of the things we wish all hotels would have. There's a welcome fruits and small bottle of wine waiting for us in the room.

Checkout: Checkout was fast and the staff at the restaurant gave us a parting gift of food to take to the airport!

Service: Staff service is most commendable. All staff were great from the receptionist to the wait staff in the restaurant.

Breakfast: Small buffet spread of pastries and coffee plus you can choose any from their breakfast menu. We were so stuffed. A must-try is their Bun bo Hue which is the noodle soup specialty in Hue (better than Pho, I must add.)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Amazing food, friendly and helpful staff, lovely clean rooms, excellent price! Cannot recommend this hotel more! Breakfast buffet had lots of choice and dinner in the serene restaurant was so good we decided to stay another night!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
My flight from Hanoi to Danang was delayed and I missed the train to Hue. Given a very short notice, they were able to arrange for my transport from Danang to Hue in the middle of the night.

The following day they recommended a number of options that would allow me to get to know the top attractions in the short time I was there. Meanwhile, they were kind enough to get me my train ticket, check the departure times and ensured I was able to get to the train in time.

Really good customer service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Spotless room and a good size. Spent two nights here and enjoyed our stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. A little off the beaten path but once you get to it, all good. The restaurant is terrific as is the spa, though the spa is a few blocks away at a sister hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed three nights in Hue at Serene Palace. Hotel was located conveniently not far from walking street area and a great choice of restaurants and bars. Room was very comfortable spacious and clean with good wifi and large clean bathroom.

The real stars of the hotel however are the staff. All very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Jack the bell-boy who came to meet us at the train station and to Si on reception who was so helpful with suggestions on Hue and assisted in our onward travel planning in Vietnam. Of course a big mention to Sally and her team in the dining room. Everyone was so friendly and the breakfasts were wonderful. There is a buffet section and also a choice from the menu if you'd like eggs, Pho, or pancakes etc. I tried them all over the course of our visit and all were beautifully prepared. We also appreciated the kindness of giving us a fruit selection to take on our departure for our drive to Hoi An. Acts of kindness like this are what makes the hotel so special and we won't hesitate to return should we come back to this wonderful city.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Pros:
1. All the staff made an effort to talk and assist you, whether is it the bellboys, front desk attendants or waitresses in the restaurant. It makes the stay a truly homely one.
2. Room is rather spacious with basic necessities.
3. Breakfast was sumptuous and all you can eat from the menu. Love the wide range of fruits.
4. 1-1 drinks are really value for money.
5. Complimentary fruits everyday, ready in room.

Cons:
1. Located in the back alley. Bigger cars are unable to drive in and drop you off.
2. Additional roll-out bed and pillows are not so comfortable.
3. Trip arrangement by hotel seems a little on the pricier side. Train tickets booked by the hotel is $8/pax but it seems that direct purchase from train company would cost as little as $2-3.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Interesting hotel with lovely staff Slightly hard to find so take a taxi as its up an unmade road .Close to tourist area and Purple Palace. Good breakfast. Good accomodation. Lovely staff! Can recommend
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Stayed 2 nights. Why can’t More hotels be like this one. Very helpful staff. Spotless rooms. Very good breakfast. They arranged pick up at the train station, any tour you want to perfection, and timely ride to the airport. I can’t say enough good things about the staff and the driver they provided.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here during our trip to Vietnam. The location is very convenient- close to the walking streets and bars/restaurants but far enough away down the alley street to get away from the noise. The staff is very friendly and our room was large and modern. Our only complaint is that our bathroom had a tub with a shower head that you had to hold (no holder on the wall) which was a bit annoying, but not the end of the world!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We spent here one night in our trip to Vietnam. Room was clean with a big bathroom and the staff was really kind. It is located close to a street with many bars and restaurants. Breakfast was ok with both Vietnamese and a bit of Northern-European food (scrambled eggs, omelette..)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel. Really fine rooms, good staff and fine breakfast. It is in a little lane right in the centre of Hue, away from the noise but easy walking distance to the main walking street and only about 25 walk from the Citadel. Don't miss it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: What a great hotel to stay in. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and couldn't have been more helpful. They offered suggestions for things to do and booked for us. The rooms were great and when we told them our air conditioner had started beeping in the middle of the night, something to do with the clock setting which I managed to sort, they wanted to shift us to another room in case it happened again. The food was good and the rooms clean.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We spend two nights during end of October 17 in Hue.

Arriving at night you might wonder where the driver is going to drop you when you turn into the very narrow street of the Serene Palace Hotel but you will be amazed about the quality and service!

The very charming receptionist Mr Alan was very professional and helpful in organizing a private boot tour to the pagoda and drop off at the Palace on the way back for USD 20 for the two of us in no time!

The ladies at breakfast prepare your eggs "a la minute" and just as you want them.

The room was large, well equipped and very clean.

Perfect deal in the absolute center of Hue... Bars and Resto's around the corner.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
the hotel is wonderful,
the room is clean and comfortable, the location is fit for tourists to visit,.
the expense are within budget,
The staffs are helpful, enthusiastic, care and scinere, the food is fresh and delicious,
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Short taxi ride from train station. The hotel is sited down an unmade road about 15 minutes walk from the centre. To their credit the staff allowed us to check in early and made every effort to welcome us.
We paid extra for a room with a city view. That said this hotel offers excellent value for money. The room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and a large balcony. The shower room was large and worked well. Facilities include free water, tea & coffee making facilities and free wi-fi.The hotel also has a well regarded restaurant with a varied menu but we found breakfast choices were a little limited.
The staff are keen to impress. Alan at reception especially who had a detailed knowledge of the English Premier League. They helped arrange a taxi at the station (although charging us US$4 when the taxi fare was half this) and a river trip (again charging us $20 when we could have paid 50% less) but these are the perils of using hotel services.
We enjoyed our stay in this hotel which should be your top choice for a stay in Hue.
h_title_comment: Away for a night in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My girlfriend and I stayed here with four of our friends for a few days while passing through Hue. It's a very nice hotel for the price but the two things that stand out are the restaurant and the staff service.

I'm always the last person to want to eat at a hotel when traveling but, after a long day hiking and a late arrival, we were too beat to go out for food. Luckily the kitchen was open and to our delight they served a tasting menu of local dishes. I enjoyed them and later tried the street vendor version of each and the hotel's version was equally delicious.

The staff themselves are always accommodating. Alan was extremely pleasant and helpful setting up massages, transportation and helping us navigate the city during our stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Cannot fault this hotel. From the wonderful staff to the lovely room, our three nights here were exceptionally comfortable. There’s a lot of choice for breakfast, both in the menus and the buffet. Every single member of staff here provided excellent service and made the whole environment so very positive! Get location too. We also highly recommend the restaurant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our 2 nights here weren’t long enough. It is the friendliest and cleanest hotel we’ve stayed in by far, so far in Vietnam. The concierge Alan, the restaurant staff, especially Sam and Cindy could not have been more helpful and pleasant. A beautiful hotel in the centre of town with everything you need near by. If you can’t find it, ask the staff!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were feel so welcomed and the staff were friendly, warm and highly efficient. The hotel is clean with amazing staff. We did have a dinner in the hotel restaurant (raining outside) and Vietnamese food was delicious. We will be back. 5 stars.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were made to feel so welcomed and the staff were genuine and warm and highly efficient.
Beautiful clean hotel with amazing staff. We even had dinner in the hotel restaurant... excellent Vietnamese food... delicious and tasty and affordable.
Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We will be back.
Definitely 5 stars.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Hotel has a good location in the center of the city. Road they are in can use some renovation, but this is not a problem. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They give great advice when needed. Good breakfast and spacious rooms. Can absolutely recommend them!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were guided by reviews when we booked Hue Serene Palace Hotel and it was so much more than we expected. We were welcomed with a plate of fresh fruit, a cold hand towel and friendly service that just continued from there. All of the staff went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed, the room was fantastic - spacious with a little balcony and with welcomed toiletries. The food was wonderful - great breakfast and prompt service. It was a shame to have to leave. Many thanks to everyone at Hue Serene Palace.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Honestly couldn't rate this hotel high enough. Rooms are gorgeous, incredibly clean... staff so helpful and friendly. Breakfast was lovely. In a great location, walking distance from Imperial Palace of quick cheap taxi for $2. Incredibly good price for such a nice hotel.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
From the moment I first made contact on email with Hue Serene Palace Hotel I knew we were in for a special stay. All questions & enquiries were answered promptly with offers to arrange transport and even buy train tickets. We organised tours through the hotel and were more than happy with what they suggested. Never have I received this type of service outside of Vietnam.
The hotel is located down a narrow street but well located for walking to explore the city. There are many restaurants close by.
Our rooms were large & clean with big beds and very nice bed linen. There was plenty of hot water & toiletries in the bathrooms. There were English speaking channels on the TV not that we had time to watch it. Good to know what was happening in the world though!
There was a good selection of both hot & cold food for breakfast. We ate in the hotel restaurant on our first night and the food was delicious.
Our stay was wonderful thanks to the gentle and warm staff. A very special thank you to Jenny, Julia and Sally.
I can't recommend this hotel enough.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We only stayed for two nights at the Serene Palace but would have liked to stay longer. All the staff are so welcoming and helpful. We also dined in the hotel restaurant and the food was amazing.
The hotel is in a good location - central but quiet.
They also organised airport and onward transfers that worked well.
We would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
By Western standards this hotel is cheap. By Western standards this hotel is 5 star. Reception not only gave us a gracious welcome but also quickly organized our personal tour this afternoon and our onward travel tomorrow.
The restaurant offers real Vietnamese cooking at the highest standard. We had a delicious five course meal tonight and the waitresses showed us how to eat those dishes we were not familiar with.
Most impressive
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
When we arrived at the hotel, we got a welcome drink with fruits while they did our check in. We had to wait another 15min until our room was ready. During that time the lady explained us Hue in a nutshell with maps etc. Everything was well prepared and she was speaking very good english.

Our room was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable. We got an upgrade to a higher floor room, which had a nice view.

Although everything seemed perfect, we got a little bit confused about how the staff kept on asking about our plans. Everytime we passed the lobby somebody asked us "Where did you go?", "What are your plans?", "What time are you going to check out tomorrow?" Being personal is a good thing, but it became a little bit too much.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel entrance lobby is spacious with very polite front desk staff.
The rooms are clean and provides daily plate of complimentary local fruits.
Every morning I look forward to meeting the friendly staff and the selections of breakfast from the menu.
Location of the hotel is walking distance from the Perfume river and various amenities.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Great location , confortable stay, people very friendly and helpfull (Allan at the reception is very very nice and helpfull) the breakfast is very good quality (part buffet and part a la carte) i recommand strongly this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
