h_title_comment: Enjoyable stay in Hue at Serene Palace
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for three nights with our two girls, aged 12 and 9. The room was very comfortable and although the bathroom could have benefitted from a little updating, it was clean and the shower (mixer over a bath) provided lots of high pressure hot water. The hotel was very helpful in arranging trips (our favourite was the boat trip down the perfume river to the pagoda, and then back to the citadel) and prices were very reasonable. The hotel restaurant is on the ground floor by the lobby, and although it's not enormously luxurious, the food was decent (offering both Vietnamese and Western) and excellent value. Can't fault the service throughout the hotel. Worth asking for a room that is not next to a cleaner's cupboard (they start work early!)
h_title_comment: Comfortable and convenient with lovely staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Booked this hotel with Agoda after reading the good reviews on TA, for my two night stop off on my travels.

Arranged a transfer with the hotel and the driver was waiting for me with a board with my name on it.

When we turned down a small lane with backpacker hostels and tour operators I began to wonder what I had booked but I need not have worried. The hotel entrance was lovely with a water feature and open through to the restaurant. Check in was quick and I was taken to my room which was quite big, good a/c, flat screen tv with plenty of channels and a laptop. Bed comfy but slightly hard. Also a set of scales was provided in the room which I thought was very thoughtful for weighing cases before leaving. Tea & coffee and a plate of fruit provided.

I had dinner in the hotel and it was very nice. Breakfast was good, not too much choice but eggs were cooked to order.

Staff were very helpful and friendly and gave me a map and told me where everything was. The receptionist arranged a trip up the perfume river to the pagoda for me and asked how I enjoyed it when I got back.

Quite close to shops and bars/restaurants, about a 20 minute walk.

No problem recommending this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This small hotel is tucked away down an alley but don't be put off by first impressions - it is a great hotel! We only stayed one night at this hotel which was a great pity! The staff are lovely, meals good, very comfortable , quiet rooms with good bathrooms. We can highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We only spent one night at Serene Palace Hotel due to our busy schedule, but we were amazed by the people and services. By far, a very good value for money, big modern rooms (we even had a computer in our room), very clean, amazing breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff. We needed the laundry service and it was adjusted to fit our needs and be ready by our departure time. They also helped with booking the transport to Hoian the next day. Overall a great experience which we highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was a really modern and lovely hotel and the staff were so helpful and friendly and always extremely cheerful. The room was huge, comfortable, and had a balcony. The breakfast was excellent (a la carte, plus a fruit buffet) with a range of Vietnamese food and also some western options. I think we paid about $45 for our room which seems excellent value. I read a couple of reviews on Tripadvisor cautioning that the hotel was located down a 'dodgy' alley way -- you can safely ignore such descriptions as these minor lanes are quite common in cities in Vietnam and not at all 'dodgy'. This particular lane also has a great cocktail garden bar, right next door to the hotel (called The Secret Lounge). I only have one negative comment on the Hue Serene Palace Hotel, which is that the airy rooms with timber floors do come with the cost of a bit of noise. You can hear doors, footsteps and voices from the other rooms and the hallway. It's not a major problem and easily solved with a pair of earplugs for sleeping, but it could be a dealbreaker if you are sensitive to noise. All in all though I think the positives greatly outweigh this one negative.
h_title_comment: Great modern hotel with wonderful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
需加強樓梯間安全網(原本底層才有，應該1~2層就有)，這樣就適合兒童居住。
If you want hotel good for families with children, Need to increase the Between staircase safety net (originally the bottom only), so that suitable for children to live.
h_title_comment: The staffs was Very helpful and so kindly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 3 nights with our two children (8 and 10 years). The hotel arranged train pick up, tours (DMZ and Hue city tour) and onward travel to Hoi An, with everything running smoothly. The stand out was the staff. Everyone was exceptionally personable and helpful. The family room was clean and neat. There was a good selection of food and drink for breakfast. The hotel is in a good location. Being on a back street it is quiet, but an easy walk to restaurants and shops.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: I have visited 63 countries, and have stayed in many hotels. Serene palace is one of the best run and best value for money I have come across in all that time. They responded to our emails really promptly and helped us organise transport to and from Hue. On arrival we were treated excellently and our room was of a much higher standard than the price would suggest. The food at dinner and breakfast was excellent, and the local food they make was especially good. Prices were all more than reasonable as well. For the price of a budget hotel you get mid range quality room, and service that is better and more attentive than most 5 star hotels.
h_title_comment: excellently well run hotel- great value
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We enjoyed our stay at the Serene Palace. Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. They helped us organize our stay with tours to the major sites. As well, they organized a car and driver to get us to Hoi An. Our driver, Hai was wonderful. He kept the pace to our needs and stopped at the major sites along the way. At the hotel, Sally (Hein) was particularly friendly and helpful and we enjoyed talking to her. The hotel is on a back alley, but don't let that disuade you. It is clean and quiet and the breakfast is great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed two nights in thuis Very lovely hotel. THE room was beautiful en Very clean. THE staf was Very helpful and so kindly. We enjoyed our good breakfast.so many tjonge that you can visit in this area.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed for two nights in this hotel. Big, nice and clean rooms, comfortable bed and a very good location! Good breakfast!
The staff was very helpful and friendly. They helped us planning our stay.
During the weekend there is a night market at the riverside .
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This is a tiny hotel, tucked away down a little lane, but when you see the rooms and experience the friendly staff ,you will want to stay. Breakfast is adequate and the staff are willing to do everything they can. The bedrooms are lovely. Quite spacious, with fresh flowers on the bed. For the price this is outstanding!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My heart sank when the driver stopped here and said this was our hotel. It’s on an unpaved alley that looked a little scuzzy. But once inside, it’s a really nice hotel at bargain prices. The staffers were very sweet, the room was shockingly inexpensive, and the restaurant is surprisingly good and reasonably priced. And it turns out the alley isn’t scuzzy, just unpaved. Also highly recommended: The hotel arranged for a tour of Hue for us. The town is OK for walking, but the great attractions of Hue are farther out of town. We went to the Thien Mu Pagoda and the Citadel, both great. Then we went to two of the seven emperors’ tombs: Khai Dinh is fantastic, and Minh Mang is less spectacular, but beautiful in a much subtler way.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Lovely clean, modern hotel in a good location for sight seeing and restaurants etc.

Room was superb, extremely nice decor, huge room, could not believe how nice it was for what we paid it was extremely reasonable and far surpassed our expectations.

Breakfast was lovely.

The highlight was the staff who could not have been more welcoming, friendly and helpful. They were absolutely wonderful and we working so hard to make sure everyone was happy. I was so impressed by them.

Would strongly recommend this hotel as an excellent choice in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed two nights in this hotel . It is an excellent hotel for the price .The room was big enough and very comfortable . I really appreciated the computer in the room .The staff is just incredible , so nice , so polite and so helpful . I will come back here without any hesitation .
h_title_comment: i was in Hue for a trip in the DMZ
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We had a wonderful welcome with cold juices, and all the staff were efficient and friendly. Ms Trung at the front desk was full of information, and was very quick to organise everything we wanted to do so we could do it quickly and affordably in our time there. The food really was excellent. Try the Serene cocktail!
h_title_comment: Fantastic base for exploring Hue with cityview balconies
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This is a small Hotel in a back street of Hue, but don't be put off by its location. We have just spent three nights here and the service and accommodation have been excellent.
The tours organised by Julia were first class and very well priced, whilst the service in the restaurant from Suzy and the other girls could not better.
Thanks again for making our stay even more enjoyable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: After a long journey, we were greeted with a very welcoming drink and pieces of fruit. This set the high standard for the rest of our stay. Our room was clean and well appointed. However it was the people who made this hotel stand out. Every member of staff we came into contact with, contributed towards a very welcoming, helpful and professional atmosphere around the hotel. Breakfast offered an excellent choice, and great quality.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We recently stayed here for a couple of days while traveling through Vietnam, and were blown away by the service provided by all of the staff members. They helped us arrange cars to various sites and the airport, were quick to help us with any queries we had pertaining to the room, and the staff in the restaurant were incredibly polite and accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel if visiting Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel was clean, reception and restaurant were very kind and helpful. We especially enjoyed chatting with Sally in the restaurant ..... She provided excellent service and the food was great! She was fun to visit with! We were happy our tour company Asiatica booked us here for two nights! The hotel also provides a laundry service which we were very pleased with at $2/kg.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace Hotel has European quality standards. The staff is very professional and friendly. They always went an extra mile to help us and make our stay in Vietnam as comfortable as possible. they helped us arrange a private driver to show us around Hue's historical parts and temples, and additionally researched and arranged tours in other parts of Vietnam for us. They also gave us some great pieces of advice on where to go and what to see in Vietnam.

The English skills of all the staff was quite good, everyone was extremely nice and friendly.

The hotel itself is amazing, with great clean rooms, and delicious breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is excellent for a short stay in Hue. Breakfast was great. The staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. The room was nice and left us missing nothing.

Only smaller problem we had was that we had a few things ants in the room. When we mentioned it at the reception they said they were sorry and asked if we were bitten and how bad it was. So a very good response. In these countries I expect small insects in the rooms. What I expect is that the hotel staff shows that they are sorry about it and take am interest and take action. This happened, so it was fine.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: On arriving we were concerned as the hotel is located on a dark lane but undergoing improvements-- small old abodes are making way to trendy coffee houses and restaurants. Serene Palace is not as new as some establishments, yet the service is bright and cheerful. For one night our small room and bath were adequate. Our breakfast was definitely above average-- we enjoyed the Hue style pho-- a bit spicier than that in the north and delicious! One word of caution: we stayed Thursday night to Friday and upon departing I noticed the karaoke club right next door! Our stay was serene, but careful if you need to book weekends!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Unfortunately we only had one night here, but this hotel stood out well above the others we stayed at in the 11 nights we spent getting from Hanoi to HCM. The room was great & the service was excellent! It is located in a narrow street, our minivan only just fit but a short walk to lots of restaurants and bars.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Wonderful to enjoy a fresh, clean, newer hotel in the middle of our busy 3 week tour of Vietnam. Generous rooms, friendly staff, great service. Particularly enjoyed the support of an outstanding, knowledgeable, freelance tour guide Thu Hang Nguyen who fascinated us with her pride and understanding of the sights and history of Hue, the old imperial capital of Vietnam.
h_title_comment: Beaut, newer hoteland amazing Tour Guide Ms Thu Hang Nguyen
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed two nights at this lovely hotel and it was memorable due to the excellent service we received. Staff was really friendly, specially the restaurant staff. Room was very clean and tidy. Included breakfast was excellent. Both nights we had dinner from the hotel restaurant without going out because food tastes very good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed there for one night and the staff made our stay unforgettable. Recommendation of amazing local food. Traditional massage and provided us with a map. Further they organised the transfer to Hoi An by private car - with an excellent driver. Super nice and helpful staff!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This place offers all a guest can expect from a three star hotel.
Family room is bout 1 million Vnd.
Complementary drinks and fruits offered, early check-in possible (11am), and tours on demand.
Staff particularly helpful and attentive.
Location is a bit far from the Citadel (25 min by foot) but as we book a tour a pick-up service was arranged.
Good deal for sure !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We had a warm welcome at this hotel with a drink and some fruit. The room with balcony was clean and spacious. Breakfast was both buffet with fruit and toast and a la carte with plenty of choices like eggs and phở. The restaurant itself looks a bit simple but is clean and the staff is very friendly.
The staff of the hotel arranged traintickets, a taxi and we booked a tour with a private car through them. They are very helpful and accommodating.
Location is good, definitely worth the money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We spent two nights at the Serene Palace and were not disappointed. We were warmly greeted by the staff upon arrival and checked in promptly.

The room with city view was very nice and spacious. The only thing that I did not like was the fact that our bathroom had no shower (only a bathtub).

Breakfast was simple but delicious.

Location was very good - only a few minutes away from the "hustle and bustle" of the main streets in town!

All in all, a great place to stay for a few nights!
h_title_comment: Very good hotel at a great price!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Our stay here was absolutely amazing. The staff there is WONDERFUL, and the hotel itself is clean and big by Hue standards. Si, who works at the reception even went the extra mile to sit with us for 2 hours and plan out the rest of our Vietnam trip. She booked our trains/buses/activities and sat with us to give us information on each and every single thing we plan to do. Seriously she saved us HOURS of planning and searching. She was so patient and helpful we are so grateful to have had her there.

Cindy, Sarah and I think her name was sally who work at the restaurant were so amazing. Super helpful, so accommodating, and so friendly. We loved our stay here and actually felt bad leaving this place because the people are SO nice. We only wished that every hotel we stayed at was THIS good. 10/10!!!!!
h_title_comment: We have nothing but amazing things to say!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff and accommodations are A-1, I cannot say enough good about this hotel. You are given fresh fruit everyday, have a computer in your room, and food is great in their restaurant. They also have an excellent tour service available. We went to the beach and also took a trip to Marble Mountain which was great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A great clean hotel in a great location. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very good with a great selection of food. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The hotel is well located with easy access to the local bars and restaurants. Despite this, the area is quiet at night. Comfortable room and good breakfast. Hotel organised our transfer to Hoi An. Happy to recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great location and great room will meet you, but be warned it will seem a little daunting going down a small dirty alley to the hotel, but don't let that put you off.

Great room, nice size, fully equipped with a decent city view. The staff were also brilliant. Great thing is, the restaurant here is also #1 on trip advisor in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This place deserves all the plaudits it gets. Every place I have stayed in vietnam has been brilliant but this place wins hands down when it comes to the service of the staff. Everyone was so chatty, so friendly and so helpful. The room was excellent and the location provides easy access to local bars, restaurants and the citadel. 5 star service!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
During our 3 weeks in Viet Nam, we stayed at several hotels and saw a wide variety of rooms because we were in a group. The Hue Serene Palace Hotel ranked as the best hotel we stayed at in Viet Nam by far. We wished that we could take it with us to all of our other Vietnamese destinations. For starters, they welcomed us with delicious juices. The elevator made getting up and down super easy, especially during check in/out with our luggage. The staff was amazing throughout our stay. They always made sure that we were comfortable and taken care of. The rooms are immaculate, and the beds were very comfortable.

The daily breakfast had a good variety as part of the buffet, and beyond that, as part of the included breakfast, you're able to order from the menu to get hot items too. We had dinner at the restaurant one night because we were too lazy to go out, and it was quite good, though a little pricier than the local restaurants.

Speaking of, the hotel was in a very good location close to some great restaurants, most notably Hanh Restaurant, which served a great prixe fixe menu that gives you a sampling of local Hue foods, and an unmarked oc (snail) restaurant on Ba Trieu. For the oc restaurant, just look for a commercial-looking restaurant (A Mo Quan on 04 Ba Trieu) with lots of big colorful food signs along the right-hand wall and DON'T go there; go to the divey one that is next to it to the left. Just ask the owner what you should eat.

The hotel also provides laundry service, and there was another (cheaper) laundry service just down the street too if you're willing to deal with the slight inconvenience of taking laundry out of the hotel.

Again, we cannot speak highly enough of the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. Wonderful! Would stay again.
h_title_comment: Best hotel in Viet Nam that we stayed at..by FAR!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The hotel room was very nice and the staff were helpful and warm. They organised a driver named Hai for us to sightsee, he picked us up on time and took us to see everything we wanted, even took us to a very good local restaurant, looking after us at every stage of the trip. If you are staying at this hot I recommend you also request to get Hai show you around the city.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Lovely hotel with very helpful English speaking staff. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony which was very nice. Breakfast good offering buffet and freshly cooked options. Reception arranged a car with driver to take us to Hoi An for a reasonable price. Only one night spent here but enjoyable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We have spent 1 night at the hotel. We are a family of 3 (2 adults and 1 boy) and stayed in a room with 2 beds. Beds are queen size, so enough for us. The room was quiet, spacious and very clean. Bathroom very clean too. The decor was simple and pleasant. There is a PC with internet in the room, so it's convenient. The breakfast was good: order 1 hot dish and buffet of sides (bread, cereals, fruits, some ham, juice, coffee...). The restaurant serves good vietnamese food too, full of tourists at night :-), but we are not sure whether it was really the best ever in Hue. Overall experience was very positive, with friendly front-desk staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed for 3 nights here. We booked the serene room and we were on the 7th floor. Room was lovely clean and spacious with a big balcony. Breakfast was good staff very pleasant. We booked a private car to do the tombs and a boat to see sunset and pagoda through hotel. Both were good value. The hotel also organized our train tickets to Da nang although they tried hard to persuade us to get a private car. The location was great and very quiet. Nice bar Secret Lounge and nice restaurant Plumeria which were on same lane as hotel. All staff very polite and friendly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Room was spacious and immaculately clean, staff were fabulous and the breakfast excellent. Meals at the bistro were inexpensive and very enjoyable. Hotel organised a driver, Hai (Hi) for us who was a treasure.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights , and do not be fool about the price or the location of this hotel
The staff are well train and excellent . The facility is very clean and nice , the breakfast is outstanding .
If we coming back to Hue we sure be back
Thank You Serene Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I could not be more happy with our 2 night stay at this lovely hotel.
The staff were a delight - very friendly, helpful and accomodating.
Scarlet welcomed us warmly and made us feel right at home, the drink and fruit on arrival was also a nice touch !
We were tired from an overnight train trip and they had the room prepared early with it laid out splendidly with petals adorning the bed and complimentary fruit.
The reviews on the hotel's restaurant were glowing and we ordered a room service lunch. Very, very nice. So nice in fact we had nearly all our meals there. Some nice cocktails and dinners with delightful staff. Special mention to gorgeous little Mia and to Sally who looked after us so well. There warm smiles will be missed until we go there again.
This was by far the best hotel in our 16 day tour of Vietnam.
Really great value but the lovely staff and meals were such a highlight.
They deserve to be no.1
And as they say so often, thank you so much !!!
h_title_comment: Outstanding - highlight hotel of our entire trip !! You deserve it !! Thank you
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Good value for money - we paid 33 $ for double with window to the back.
We borrowed bikes and had breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant. Great food although it lacks some atmosphere- it is a very "sterile" hotel atmosphere but the friendly and smiling staff and great food makes up for it.

It takes 2 min to walk to the main restaurant street in Hue and 5-10 min to the citadel on bike - perfect for a short stay in Hue
h_title_comment: Fine hotel with very dedicated staff - central location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Brilliant value hotel,rooms great,comfortable,staff make you feel so welcome. Only one tiny thing,we had noisy neighbors (next room), inconsiderate to others on the day they left,banging about from 5 am! Not hotels fault,we enjoyed stay and restaurant is def no1 in hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great location next to all the Hue attractions. Hotel staff were superb , everyone the front door staff ,the restaurant staff and the doormen were all so welcoming and could not do enough for us. Our room was spotlessly clean and had a computer. we had a few hours spare time on our last day and the front door staff were brilliant in organizing a trip to the Pagoda on the river for us by bicycle ( we didn't pedal, just sat back and enjoyed the sites - great , We would certainly use this hotel again if visiting Hue in the future.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Words cannot describe how wonderful this stay was. Two nights of luxury with fabulous welcoming staff. It was the little things that mattered, drinks and a fruit platter upon arrival, early check in after the overnight train from Hanoi, flower on the bed, a free upgrade, helpful tourist advice and a convenient location. I would recommend this to everyone visiting Hie
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I would easily give this hotel five stars for comfort, helpful and pleasant staff, king-size bed, good breakfast and good location, except for one thing: the shower. Water pressure was low, and the hose extension was so short that you had to sit, kneel or crouch in the bath tub to rinse your hair and shoulders. Otherwise, the hotel was great.

Also, its restaurant is listed as #1 in Hué on Trip Advisor. We tried their set menu dinner, which is good value at less than $15 for two people, and it was good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A very welcoming place! People are pleasant and this is comfortable. The decoration is beautiful: flowers on your bed for your arrival and a little balcony with a perfect vue. This is modern with a computer and the WIFI, but also typical with an asian atmosphere. The team is qualified, bilingual in english and very helpful for their advice. Nice place !!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The moment I stepped into this hotel, I knew I'm onto something good. Front office staff made me and my brother in law welcome with a friendly attitude, welcome drink & platter.

Our driver turned into a small dirt road as we nears our hotel. I thought it is going to be a crappy hotel. Wrong. Serene Palace is nice, new, clean and its staff superb.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This boutique hotel is located close to major attractions. It is quiet, spacious, clean and comfortable. We appreciate the travel and dining suggestions provided by the hotel front office staff especially Ms Mary Truong and Jenny. Breakfast served in the hotel was excellent and generous.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is modern and the reception areas are all marble which makes it a little noisy as it has an open view from all 7 floors down to the reception area.
The room was spacious and the bed was a king size and was very comfortable.
We got complimentary fruit and juice on arrival and complimentary fruit, tea coffee and water in our room.
The only gripe was that we had no hot water morning or night it was at best slightly warm even after ringing down to reception who tried to fix it.
Breakfast was okay eggs bacon and sausage or pancakes to order and fresh fruit. I have had better breakfast at other hotels.
I would stay here again as it is close to the sites and staff were lovely
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We've stayed for 2 nights at Serene Palace and had a room on the 5th floor. The room itself was very spacious and very clean. The view from the balcony holds nice sunsets. The breakfast is ok, nothing special but still good. The best thing about the hotel is their lovely, caring and helpful staff. Doesn't matter if you are in the restaurant (which is a must try, so delicious Vietnamese food!) or at the reception - they were all super friendly and open for a chat. The only disadvantage is the noise in the room, unfortunately it was so baldy soundyproofed, you could hear door slamming all the time as well as your neighbors talking. Besides this we highly recommend to stay at this place.
h_title_comment: The best staff you could wish for
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were a little concerned when our car drove down a lane and then pulled up to the Hotel, but we were very warmly welcomed into a lovely reception area. Our room was simple but large, clean, with a comfortable large bed and it was very quiet. We usually like to go out and explore places to eat, but the Hotel restaurant was so good and not expensive we ate there twice. The highlight of the stay though was the staff both at reception and in the restaurant, they were just wonderful.
h_title_comment: Wonderfull staff and a brilliant restaurant
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is tucked away in a small street but still in very good location, just walking distance from everything. Staff are extremely friendly and all of them are speaking English. They are trained well and there to help you with everything, even suggesting places for good Vietnamese food. There breakfast are very nice. Rooms are clean and spacious. Internet connection was excellent. Overall very pleasent and nice hotel with highlights on hospitality.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace is a very friendly good value hotel near the centre of Hue. It also has a wonderful restaurant which always ranks 1 or 2 on TripAdvisor and it is good. Nice rooms too and a great staff. Enjoy it
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Having been to Hue a few times, I was disappointed my normal hotel was not available. After much searching we decided to try the Serene Palace based on reviews here. I must say we weren't lrt down. Honestly I didn't expect much for the price but the room (family room) was larger, the decor was great and the staff friendly. The only let down was breakfast. It was adequate with some choices but the dining room is small and it can get busy, meaning you may waiy. Overall, it was a great stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The hotel is in a great location and the staff are very helpful and attentive. Nothing is too much trouble for them. The deluxe room was very spacious with an enormous bed, a laptop, TV and a large bathroom. Breakfast was included and was great but if you book an evening meal (10% discount if you stay there) you can be assured of fantastic food for a very reasonable price. I had a starter, main, a beer and 2 cocktails and it came in at under £10. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed here for three nights. Hotel is located on a quiet side street, although they do provide ear plugs (not needed by us!) We chose a room on the top floor, which came with a desk top computer, a beautiful bed display, wine and bouquet of flowers on arrival (wondered if there was some confusion and they thought we were a honeymoon couple!) Comfortable bed and my husband was very happy with the jacuzzi bath tub. The shower is of the hand held variety. If watching TV on vacation in Asia is important to you, they do have CNN, BBC etc. The hotel has an excellent restaurant, so convenient when it's pouring rain outside. The breakfast has a great selection of tropical fruit and juices as well as the usual egg choices. Probably the best breakfast in Vietnam so far. Staff are so helpful and attentive, especially Mary on the front desk who arranged a car to Hoi An for us, and Sally the waitress in the restaurant. A very good choice in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This small hotel is on a side street which is actually nice because it is quiet in the busy city of Hue. The room was always well taken care of and the entire hotel is very clean. There is a restaurant where we had several meals and the food was good. The rates are very moderate considering the quality of everything in the hotel. But the hospitality is the best thing about the Serene Palace. Every single staff person form receptionists to bellmen to servers in the restaurant were so friendly and helpful. We spent 4 nights here and enjoyed every minute. One of the perks of this hotel is having travel plans set up for you. We arranged a tour of some tombs in advance which was great. But they also were able to arrange a last minute afternoon boat trip on the Perfume River for me. When my husband was sick the breakfast server made him ginger tea and toast. A great experience all around
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Food choice plentiful. Served piping hot. Loved chicken with cashews and crispy noodles. Also can recommend skewers. Sami delightful with great english. Very personable and professional. Highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I can't say enough great things about this hotel. Stylish, friendly, great personalized service, clean, modern, and wonderful good food.

Breakfast was amazing. Set Hue menu for dinner was interesting and tasty.

We rented a scooter from the hotel to head out to the tombs and staff were very helpful as they were in everything we did

Highly recommend
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I stayed in this lovely hotel for 3 nights and really enjoyed our time there. The breakfast menu was more than adequate, the lunch and dinner menus were vast and the cocktails excellent. It was great having a restaurant on site, particularly for weary travellers. Other dining options in the area are easily accessible. Our room was more than adequate - clean, welcoming and the bed was very comfortable. What stood out the most though was the excellent service. We could not fault it. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you to everyone for making our holiday a memorable and enjoyable one. Warm regards, B. and T. James (Rm 602)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We only stayed one night at this hotel, but the hotel staff could not have been more helpful! They arranged pickup at the train station for us, greeted us with juice and fruit, and offered us the option of a shower after we returned to the hotel after a hot day of motor-biking around Hue. The room was comfortable and quiet. It was only as we were leaving and enjoying a late lunch, did we also realize they have one of the very best restaurants in Hue. Overall, this was a great stay and I'd highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We have just finished a 2 night stay at this hotel and this was the best hotel in Vietnam so far! The staff were so friendly and I think provided the best hospitality we have had so far in Vietnam. Room was lovely, clean and big. We were greeted with a welcome drink and fruit platter, which was really refreshing after an uncomfortable journey from Hoi An (good tip: book a day trip between Hoi An and Hue, not the morning bus!).

Nothing seemed like too much effort and we were sorry to leave.
h_title_comment: Excellent Hotel, would definitely stay here again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Everything is as great as other reviews have stated. The rooms were nicer than the pictures show. This I normally find to be the opposite. The receptionist met us at the car door, and was the one to take us to our room and was the one to wave us off when we left.(sorry I have forgotten her name). There tours are very informative with very knowledgeable guides, Most of the time I close my eyes when I am in the cars. (scary) The driver Q, picked us up from the airport and also was our driver in 2 tours that we had. He was a very good driver,who made me feel very safe. The Serene Palace Hotel was the best hotel out of 6 we stayed at in our 4 week holiday.
Would highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for three nights and thought the hotel was great. It is situated down a shabby alley but don't let that put you off as the benefits are that it is quiet. I would imagine much quieter than some of the other hotels on main roads. The rooms are clean and the bed comfy. The staff were great and helped us arrange some tours l, plus we got them to do some laundry at the same time. Breakfast was good and they also give you a 10% off voucher when you stay but we didn't try the food for dinner. I would definitely recommend staying here.
h_title_comment: Fab hotel at a good price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is amazing. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the service is very good, the staff were kind and helpful. It is totally worth the money. The area is quiet so you can relax. There are many things to do in a walking distance.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Apon arrival i was very tired as i drove there on a motorbike, was greeted warmly with some freshly squeezed juice and some fruit while the staff unloaded my gear from the bike.

the room was clean and quiet and the staff were very friendly and helpfull.
It's located down a little side street which is perfect for noise.

I can honestly say that this has been the best hotel I've stayed in on my trip so far.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here it was a nice hotel and staff were good..reasonable food was only for a night but all in all clean,tidy and helpful..It was cold and raining and was lovely to walk into a nice warm hotel with friendly faces
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: It's was great stayed in this hotel because it's was good walking distance in the area.The hotel staff was very friendly and food was delicious.The room was well managed.Breakfast included,lunch and dinner was fantastic plus well served from restaurant staff(keep up the good work and smile always 🙏👍🙏)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Don't be put of by the location of this charming hotel in a back lane in Hue. It is very accessible to the Perfume river bridges and all the shopping and the markets. The staff were fantastic, the rooms large and comfortable and clean. There was a bit of noise from the bar next door but never after 10pm and not enough to complain about. Sally in the restaurant could not have been more helpful and even packed fruit for us for our road trip to Hoi An. One evening we ordered a dish not to our taste but perfectly fine and she gave us 30% Discount? Now that's service. Hotel organised driver for our trip and we requested Hai who had collected us from the airport. His english was excellent and his knowledge too. Highly recommend him for his safe courteous driving.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We booked a deluxe double room for 3 nights. The hotel is new, and the room was large with a comfortable bed, a patio, good air conditioning, cable and so so wifi.

The staff were friendly and helpful.

Highly recommend
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This is a hotel that is situated out of the way, difficult to find because it is situated in a side road but is compensated by a fantastic staff. Staff willing to help. Had problem getting a taxi to get into the side road.
Not advised for the older folks as the bathroom requires climbing into a bathtub for a shower. The Vietnamese food served is good however, western food is mediorce except for the pumpkin soup. Breakfast is good, a kind of alacarte buffet with bread and fruits.
Lightings in the room is abundant but location of switches requires more thought as it is hidden between the bed and wall.
The rooms are clean and toiletries are supplied.
h_title_comment: A very good hotel due to warmth of staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I generally do not like boutique hotels, but was compelled to book this one after reading previous reviews. I was not disappointed! Large clean rooms, nice amenities, and a computer in the room were great. But the Staff is the real reason to come here. From the doorman, to the check-in clerk who walked us up to our rooms, to the breakfast staff...every one was amazing. Very large smile and helpful attitudes greeted us every day! The cooked to order breakfast was amazing, and when I asked the attendants if I could combine a few different items from the menu into one dish, they cheerfully delivered.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
I've been to a lot of hotels and Serene Palace was the most welcoming I've ever stayed at. All of the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, but a special mention goes to trainee Kelly for being so very cheerful and attentive.
You not only get a welcome drink, but a welcome plate of fruit too.
The rooms are quite big and spotlessly clean. My only criticism is that the safe deposit box in my room was not big enough to hold even the smallest of laptop computers.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
This hotel is well located down a groov'n lane. It has extremely helpful staff - all of the women were welcoming, kind and helpful. The staff of the restaurant even gave us a care package for our drive to Hoi An.

The rooms are clean, and there is a computer with internet in the room, as well as wifi. The balcony is small, but gives a nice place to stand and contemplate the view (rooms at the front). What makes this hotel good is its people. We stayed as a family of four, and always found everyone very engaged.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel was about a 15-minute walk from where the airport shuttle stops in the city of Hue. The room was beautiful, clean, and stocked with fruits and water during my two day stay. I was upgraded to a balcony room at no charge which really made a difference. Breakfast was included and is a mixture of menu ordering and a small buffet. I enjoy the menu option because the food is always fresh regardless of the time you choose to eat. The staff was amazing and had a place set aside for me in the morning when I arrived. I took advantage of a scooter city tour with one of the hotel staff (believe his name was Brian) and he was very kind and took me to wherever I wanted to go which included souvenir shopping. The location was also excellent for walking around town. The price was about 40 CAD a night and was the best hotel of my stay on Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
This was an excellent hotel, and the staff went out of their way to help you. A special thanks to Mary and Scarlett.
Our room was large, and very comfortable, and we even had a computer in the room.
The hotel was also very conveniently located.
As the driver drove us to the hotel the first night, we entered an alley way. We got concerned thinking maybe the hotel was a dump. When we got to the front doors, and entered the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. The first thing they greeted us with, was their smiles and refreshments.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A great hotel close to local bars and restaurants and although on a back and narrow street, it was accessible by car. We were a given a refreshing fruit juice on arrival and the staff were welcoming and friendly. Our room was spacious and had a balcony, overlooking the city. Breakfast was al la carte of western (mainly egg based dishes) as well as Vietnamese specialities with a small help yourself selection of fruit, bread and drinks. The hotel arranged an airport pickup, a day tour to the tombs, and a transfer to Hoi An. All the drivers were professional, reliable and friendly. We used the laundry service which was quick (back within the day) and, at $2 per kilo, we thought was good value. Would highly recommends this hotel for its location, quality of accommodation and the friendly staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I, along with 2 other couples, spent 2 nights at the Serene Palace Hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly, the room large and comfortable with a king size bed and large modern bathroom. We had a city view and found the room very quiet. This hotel is an amazing bargain that looks much more expensive and even included a very nice breakfast. It is located on a narrow street that is a short walk to the river. We would all stay here again .
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Lovely hotel, 5 minute walk to the main strip
Our room was a large room with king bed and small single. Room had a bathroom tub! Which is the first hotel we have been in with Vietnam with a bath which was a nice surprise.
Fresh fruit in the morning and lovely cooked breakfast.
What made this hotel is the staff they are so helpful and lovely. We had to leave early the next day and they made us a packed breakfast. Also let us come back to have a shower even though we had checked out after our day trip a few days later.

Would recommend definitely.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: It is located off a Main Street up an alley of other small hotels. But the service is big. Very comfortable place with great staff and good food, in particular a very nice breakfast. You can't go wrong in staying there. Only regret was we didn't have longer in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was a really nice place, very clean and tidy. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The staff helped us book our next destination accommodation and transportation based on our choices. The restaurant at the hotel produced lovely meals and the kids loved the breakfasts; again nice friendly staff. The Hotel was in a quite location with easy walking access to good food and the Hue sights.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Room was comfortable and clean. Staff was polite and helpful. Breakfast variety was limited but ok. Booking was direct with hotel and was easy. They had fruit platter awaiting for us when we arrived, it was welcoming and special. Would stay again in the future.
h_title_comment: Nice room with polite helpful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Perfect stay with incredible friendly staff. Clean rooms, very good beds and good food. Next time, if we should return to Hue we would choose this hotel again. It is a bit hidden in calm area, but in 10 minutes we were able to get to the tourist area.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: we arrived early but we're encouraged to relax with juice and fresh fruit while our room was readied. Mary from the front desk sat with us to give us an orientation to the city and offered to help with our plans. The room was very elegant with fresh flowers on the bed. Excellent linens, wonderful breakfast, easy walk to the historic sights, and great bar next door. This hotel was a delight from beginning to end.
h_title_comment: Lovely room in a great location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed four nights. There are cheerful, anxious to please staff speaking good English. Clean modern rooms with an OK breakfast. Excellent central location and there are lovely spa massages at their nearby sister hotel. It has been recently built and furnished and is modestly priced. What more could you ask for? Go there and you won't be disappointed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Can't fault the hotel at all. Breakfast was good. Service sufficient. Rooms more than adequate. But this is Vietnam; clean tidy gems are surrounded by dirty streets. Opposite the hotel is a shop fixing motorbikes, with all the associated oil leaks, for example. But the town is worth visiting just for the ruins of the Forbidden City
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel was cheap to stay in per night and as we were only staying one night we weren't expecting much. But the hotel rooms were amazing for the price and the hotel staff made sure they looked after us well too. Would stay here again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We were impressed by the wonderful service from the moment we arrived and were greeted by staff with a welcome drink and fruit platter. They organised car and driver for us to visit temples and were very helpful. The restaurant is excellent. Our room had everything we needed and was very comfortable. Great value for money.
h_title_comment: A gem! Five star service in a small intimate hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I have family in Hue and am very familiar with the area and hotels. Hue Serene Palace Hotel is definitely a new favorite! It is located in on a small quiet road, close to everything but away from the main traffic.

I truly appreciate them especially for their honesty when I inquired about the cheapest route to the airport. I did not want to pay for a taxi so they called a bus agency, gave me the exact details/price for the bus! No miscommunication! Overall extremely professional customer service, beautiful room, and delicious breakfast.
h_title_comment: Extremely pleasant stay in beloved Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff at the Serene Palace went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, from the welcome drink and fruit platter to decorating our room with flowers and rose petals when we told them we were on our honeymoon. The room was nicely designed and we had a great view of the city from our balcony (though unfortunately not great weather), and the breakfast was delicious. Would definitely recommend!
h_title_comment: Great stay at the Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace Hotel was perfect for a few days in Hue. It was walking distance to pretty much everything. The hotel was everything we needed: clean room, comfy bed, awesome shower. Friendly, helpful staff too! Thanks!
h_title_comment: Perfect for three days in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The service was just perfect.Great restaurant, room and amenities.
Very good value.The transfer service from the airport to the hotel and vice versa at an additional cost is an extra guest comfort. This transfer already becomes a tour through the beautiful landscapes on the way.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I arrived for my three day stay during a power cut which lasted for six hours - not the best start. However, I was given a 50 percent discount on my first night which was very customer friendly of the hotel. My room was large and clean but rather drab and uninspiring. That was my feeling about the hotel as a whole. It could do with some smart ending up. The balcony of my room had a rail consisting of thin horizontal metal strips which looked a bit frail to me and easy to slip through. If I'd had young children I wouldn't have let them anywhere near it. Breakfast was okay but not as good as I have had elsewhere. The staff were very friendly and helpful and it is for this reason that I am giving the hotel a rather generous 4 stars.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: My daughter and I stayed for three nights at the Serene Palace Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was the most comfortable of our two-week stay in Vietnam--roomy, clean, light, delightful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I was very impressed their professional hospitality and service.

1. We were not informed that the electricity would be out after the 2nd night. They said the notice was at the elevator, but one of them always smiled and talked to us while waiting for the elevator, so we were not aware of it, either. We really needed to take hot shower that morning, so they finally found another hotel for us to take a shower. They paid for round trip to the hotel. They also gave us 50% refund for that night.

2. I asked them to arrange the open bus ride to Hoi An. I realized that I left my jacket on the bus early next morning at the hotel in Hoi An. We contacted the hotel and they arranged it to be delivered to the hotel in Hoi An by 3 pm. We were supposed to leave for Da Nang airport at 3 pm, so I was a bit anxious.. however the gentleman brought the jacket in time!!

Anyways, I was very happy with their professional attitude. They always help you when you ask for help.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Highly recommend this hotel! Staff are great-very helpful and friendly. Restaurant is excellent. Rooms are great value- umbrellas and desktop computers!
Alleyway outside hotel can be v dark at night but besides that, we really enjoyed the hotel!
Michael & Laura
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I booked a superior twin room and was pleasantly surprised at how big the room is. There is a computer for our use and also they gave us a daily fruit platter. The bathroom is also very spacious with all the amenities present. The staff of the hotel from the receptionists to the bell boys to the restaurant waitresses, were all very helpful and attentive. The breakfast was amazing! You can choose any amount and item listed in the menu. We had a most wonderful and memorable stay in Hue, partly thanks to Hue Serene Palace Hotel staff who went all out to make us feel comfortable and also the amiable taxi driver in Hue who made our trip complete.
h_title_comment: A wonderful stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Found this hotel on a website for hotels. Looked ok on the pictures, but don't they all? Well, were we in for a big surprise. This was by far the best hotel we stayed in in Vietnam. Not the most fancy, not the best bed, but definitely best value for money. Big, nice, clean room with a bathroom with a proper door and no big window facing the room. That is something that seems to be very popular in many hotels here. Safetybox, computer and bathrobes in the room. Decent breakfast with very attentive personnel. Staff overall very friendly and helpful. Do stay here if you are looking for a really nice hotel for very little money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene hotel was clean, comfortable and modern. Staff was incredibly helpful from the beginning and gave us great guidance in making our visit memorable. They helped book all of our local tours. Hotel breakfast was also very good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I stayed in 405 and the door kept getting a little stuck - but the room was otherwise lovely. The staff members however were what made this stay special. I booked in two tours through them, and the staff was kind enough to arrange for breakfast half an hour before breakfast usually starts before I left so i would have a good meal. Additionally, they arranged for me to have some fruit as I left too. The service was some of the best I've had in Vietnam! Keep up the good work. (Taxis were a little bit expensive though. Arrange for your own transport)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Had an absolute ball at the Serene Palace Hotel during my three night stay. The premium room was absolutely massive, and was just perfect for hubby and I. Although it rained the entire time we were in Hue' and we couldn't make use of the balcony, it was still nice to have that extra space. Breakfast in the Serene Palace restaurant was fantastic, eggs and pho' cooked to order, and a nice continental buffet. The restaurant was also a perfect spot to have dinner, the food was fantastic. I can see why it is rated the no. 1 restaurant in Hue'. But the defining feature of this hotel is the staff. Ms Jenny, Ms Kelly and Ms Scarlett could not do enough for us. They were incredibly friendly, helpful and just so nice. They greeted us like old friends after a day of sightseeing, and always offered to assist in any way they could. The entire staff were always genuinely interested in how our day was going, and other places we were visiting on our honeymoon. They were very efficient in booking private cars, and they certainly helped us in navigating the Citadel. I will be recommending this hotel to anyone who visits Hue'. It is just perfect!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The rooms here were beautiful! Worth the price, the ladies working up front were really sweet & very helpful when checking in. They even rented us a moped to cruise around the city. Overall excellent customer service & very clean.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had a 2 night stay at this beautiful friendly hotel in November 2016
The accommodation was 4 star plus. The breakfast was amazing as were the staff. Thank you Sally for making us feel like family. Highly recommended
Ms Lizzy group
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Loved my stay here. The staff is professional, welcoming, and helpful. It's the little touches like towel animals on the bed that really made my stay here feel special. Reception helped me to book a bus to my next city, listened to my interests and suggested several activities I could do during my short stay, and gave detailed directions! The food was also delicious; I ate at about 4 pm while waiting for my bus and even asked for another dish to be packed as dinner en route to my next city!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We really enjoyed our stay here,everything was great, wonderful service, fantastic spa and restaurant,clean comfortable rooms, well priced tour service...no complaints whatsoever! We ( a family of four) stayed at Serene Shining over Christmas and the staff were so lovely and kind, we even received a gift and card from them. We booked a deluxe double and family room so we and the kids could have extra space to relax, both rooms were large and luxurious, I loved having a bath! Our double even had a separate lounge, both rooms excellent value. Can not fault this hotel, highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very nice accommodations with clean, comfortable beds and bathrooms, nice light in the rooms. Off the main road, so no traffic noise. At check-in they sit you down and help you figure out your touring plans and give advice for getting to the local attractions. We had a nice meal in the restaurant. They provided umbrellas for the rain ( which I understand is frequent in Hue).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: A small very friendly and we'll run hotel. Excellent staff and service. Lovely good size comfortable rooms with good facilities. Well maintained and very clean. Complimentary water and fresh fruit in room daily...Good size TV and desktop screen and keyboard for Internet. WiFi on all floors with good connection. Lots helpfull advice at reception. On a quiet back Street with nice restaurants on the street/lane...some excellent bars and restaurants few minutes walk away. Nice stroll to the river 10mins away.. if you can stand the heat and crazy traffic...chaotic with scooters..they are king here and take president over cars and pedestrians. The hotel is fantastic value for money and the food is as good as anywhere else. Best breakfast menu ever....not full English or anything but lots of local choices and great quality...noodle soup for breakfast how refreshing...good choice of western dishes as well..highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
This hotel is well located close to old city. The laneway access ensures a quiet stay! It is clean and the staff are very welcoming, helpful and friendly.
The wifi is great, the restaurant downstairs has very good menu. The rooms are tidy, very clean and comfortable. Our room with a balcony and views over city.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Hue Serene Palace has consistently friendly courteous staff with a willingness to help with all questions and needs. (Including helping us hide our son's Christmas gift!) Though we generally avoid hotel food, Hue Serene had a varied and ample menu with good quality food. Breakfast was consistently an all you can eat affair...fresh and plentiful. Thank you! The Iseri family
h_title_comment: Hue Serene Palace-Great find down a side alley
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I adored this hotel. From the moment I arrived and received fruit and a welcome drink, to when I checked out. The rooms are spacious, including your own computer and the breakfast was amazing. Also want to give a special shout out to Mike for being so helpful and kind. Thanks Mike!
The best hotel I stayed at in Vietnam!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We spent 5 nights here and it was a wonderful place to stay. We felt very taken care of by the friendly staff. Our room was clean and spacious and the location was good. The restaurant was a bonus - great food with the option of room service after a long day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We have only good words for Serene Palace Hotel. Service was out of this world, welcoming us with a smile every time we passed by the lobby.

We were allowed to check in early, after having been offered juice and fruit, and provided maps and information about what to do and where to go in Hue. The room was big, quiet and beautiful. It even had a computer! We also tried the restaurant (twice, not counting the awesome breakfast included in the reservation) and loved the food. The waitresses were extremely nice and chatted with us while we waited for our meals.

Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed for 2 nights right before New Years. It was a great hotel for the price. The staff were friendly and very attentive. They confirmed the booking with a personal e-mail and offered to arrange car transfers from the Airport for a fee. The room was great, a giant comfortable bed, great shower, fast Wifi, and lots of free toiletries in the bathroom. Hue can be very rainy in December, and there were umbrellas provided in each room for the guests.

The restaurant downstairs is also currently the top rated place in Hue on this site. Made dinner a lot easier on a very rainy cold night.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed here for three nights, during a wet and cold spell. The car to pick us up at Hue airport was on time and the driver drove safely. The hotel staff were very helpful with unloading all the bags. We were given welcome drinks and cut fruits as they checked us in. The junior suite room was large and very clean. There were complimentary tea/coffee sachets, water and fruits in the room. The heating worked well. The shower wouldn't stay warm for too long so we needed to wait for the water to heat up in between turns. The bed was comfortable, though only one side had table lamp or bedside table. The closet was small with only a few hangers. They provided slippers and robes, though the latter were very old. The breakfasts were good, with lots of fruits, bread, and cooked eggs if required. The standout is the service. They are very helpful, having arranged our cars to various sights for two days. The ladies during breakfast were also very helpful. The internet throughout was excellent. The hotel is good value for money and decent. It is not luxurious but for a short stay it is well recommended.
h_title_comment: Very good service and value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at this hotel summer 2016, and had a wonderful time. We were warmly welcomed when we arrived and got a nice spacious room. We were a bit concerned about noise as we got a room close to the karaoke bar next door, but it turned out to be very quiet.
Breakfast was great with a good choice of hot dishes (which you order from the menu so you can be sure everything is fresh) and fresh fruits and juices.
What impressed us most with the hotel was the staff, so helpful and friendly. They arranged day trips for us and transport to Hoi An, including great tips on what to prioritise (we only stayed for three days) and where to stop on the way to Hoi An. They were also very good at following up on everything and ensuring that it all went as planned.
The hotel may be a bit hard to find, but is actually quite conveniantly located.
All in all, this is an excellent hotel with fantastic staff and service. We strongly recommend this hotel!
h_title_comment: Great hotel with wonderfully helpful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Terrific service says it all. The room is well organized and they offer good amenities. Good electrical outlets, lighting, and comfortable bed. Mary was a superb travel advisor and organized a private driver for a day for us. There was a huge rainstorm when we were there and our plane was canceled. So grateful they had a room for us for another night. Definitely recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The service was insanely good, from the moment we walked in to the moment we checked out. It felt like 5 star hotel in terms of their service.

Due to some waiting time for our train we were offered showers before we leave, teas and coffees while we were sitting in the reception. Definitely I recommend this hotel as everyone from porter to front desk is smiling and walking extra mile in everything they do!!!
h_title_comment: At the price we paid, the service was extraordinary
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Without a doubt, this hotel gives you a lot for your money. At half the price of most accommodation we booked elsewhere in Vietnam, it was one of the best places we stayed.

The room was big and clean. We were on quite a high floor, far above the traffic noise. Generally, the place was pretty quiet - I had a good sleep.

The staff were all helpful, and we booked a private car through them for a day trip to the various monuments south of the city - this was really good.

We stayed here three nights, and were extremely satisfied with what we got.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were thoroughly impressed with the level of hospitality at Serene Palace Hotel. The rooms were spotless and beautiful. The unlimited breakfast was bountiful and delicious. Their concierge was kind and helpful with organizing tours, directing us to local destinations, and motorbike rentals. The service was so impeccable, we actually didn't want to leave. Fantastic stay for a really affordable price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We loved everything about this Hotel. At the price we paid we had not expected such a high standard. Our room was beautiful and the food was excellent. The staff here really made our stay very special. They were so friendly and welcoming, and they had a good sense of humour. I would definitely stay here again if we every returned to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This 3 star hotel packs a mighty 5 star punch when it comes to service. We loved every second at the Serene Palace and would base future trips around booking a room here. All the staff were friendly and helpful but Sally in particular made sure that we had what we needed to enjoy our whole Hue adventure experience. All staff spoke excellent English. Breakfast was a highlight with extensive menu choices and small buffet with the best bread I have ever tasted. We also used the restaurant for dinner and I had a large vegetarian selection to choose from the food was high quality, reasonably priced and tasty. Room 703 was spaceous, spotlessly clean, English movie tv, free fast wifi and computer for research was good. We used a hotel car and guide for the 3 tombs tour and really enjoyed it. The laundry service was good with everything back in under 24 hours. Improvement suggestions: The shower could be upgraded to a separate cubicle but I'm being picky as it functioned fine.
h_title_comment: The service enhanced our Vietnam experience
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great hotel in Hue, Vietnam.
Wonderful service from most friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable room.
Food is good, traditional Vietnam.
Definitely visit My Sun ruins. Must use a guide though because lots of background detail that needs to be illustrated. Take walking shoes. Amazing that it was built by worshipers in 800 BC. Hard to believe the detail in the construction of the walls and statues in that time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had such a lovely time at this hotel in Hue. Everything about our stay was just perfect. The staff were wonderful, especially Sally, Kate & Scarlett. We thought our evening meals here were among the very best we had over the three weeks we spent travelling around VIetnam and we were genuinely amazed at the excellent value for both the B&B and the food in the restaurant. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Serene Palace Hotel to friends and family and if we ever return to Hue in the future this is where we will be staying!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This is a lovely hotel. Not too flash as there's no pool and no gym but the staff from the manager to the night watchman are incredibly friendly and ALL speak very good English. That is what sets it apart. Nothing was too much trouble: they called cabs, recommended restaurants even though theirs is excellent, organized a driver to Hoi An, etc. all with a smile and sincerity. And the price is great! A/C was great. There was a tv but we never bothered.
I highly recommend it and would stay here again if our travels ever bring us back to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Was recommended to stay here from their sister hotel in Hanoi. We're glad we took their advice. They picked us up from the train station and in minutes arrived to a cup of tea. Check-in was quick and we immediately went for a walk to tour the Citadel. It's nearby many attractions. Breakfast was fast and yummy. Terrific staff helped booked our bus trip to Hoi An. Highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Awesome staff close to restaurants and pubs.Rooms very comfortable and comfy beds .Food very good Would definitely use again .The hotel being down an alley way a little inconvenient but the hotel makes up for it
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Only stayed for 1 night, but staff was very very friendly and the way they prepared our room with flower petals and towel animals on the bed was cute!
Comfy furnishings and a nice little bottom floor restaurant.
Breakfast was fantastic! Self serve fruit and drinks with all you can order ala carte dishes.
Thank you Kelly and all the staff for a warm reception and stay at your hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Don't be fooled by the shady looking alley you have to go down to get to the hotel, the hotel is great! Lots of attentive staff (sometimes you felt a bit too looked after, but that could be me being a reserved swede). When we arrived we got a fruit plate and water melon juice. Thet also gave us information about the tours and cars and scooters....maybe a bit too much, we didn't even ask for the information and it felt like they were pushing a bit for it. We arrived in the morning, around 9am, had to pay extra (4$) for breakfast that day.
Good wifi, big clean rooms, big bathroom. Breakfast was standard, not too much to choose from.
All in all a great hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Love this place!!! Unbelievable value for your money, extremely helpful staff, and very cute hotel! Breakfast and food are good, location is unbelievable. A must for Hue. It is very close to the bars and restaurants of Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Sophie and the rest of the staff were amazing; very welcoming and always helpful. For check in we got a welcome drink and a fruit plate and even after check out they served us free tee and coffee in the lobby. Room and bathroom very big and very clean. We even had a computer in our room. WiFi was stable and very fast. Breakfast was great; a big choice from the menu and a buffet with toast, juices and fruits. We did use a privat car organized by the hotel so we could visit the tombs and the citadel in one day and still catch the evening-train. It only was a bit noisy because of the open stairway-area. Overall: Best value for money we had on our southeast-trip. We should have stayed longer!
h_title_comment: Amazing staff and great value for money
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Stayed here for two nights during a trip through Vietnam. The hotel arranged a transfer from the train station, and also a driver to take us around the various temples surrounding Hue for the day. Rooms were very large, clean and with good facilities. Service was very efficient, friendly and helpful although I felt a bit 'hovered over' at times. We had one meal in the restaurant which was really good value and delicious, with great service, although the restaurant hasn't got much atmosphere. Breakfast was limited and slightly disappointing. The hotel is in a good location near the shops and restaurants and walkable to the citadel. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel for a great value, pleasant and easy experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great rooms, great service, amazing restaurant foods. Staff are great fun and always seem happy to see and help you. Rooms are very big. Hotel is modern and located in a nice area of town - near to the citadel, walking distance from nightlife, near the markets.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrive at 9:30 pm as our flight was delayed. We were tired and hungry. The staff at the front desk told us we could go into the restaurant and have something to eat. The cook prepared a great light meal for us which was really appreciated.

The staff are fantastic. They really make you feel at home. I only wished we could have stayed longer.
The room was quite large and there were lots of toiletries. The shower was huge.
The bed was extremely comfortable.
They provided a really good breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This place is a definite must-stay in Hue right from the service to location to breakfast to tour package.. everything was flawless. After biking 8 hours across the Hai Van Pass, I was abit hmmm when I saw the hotel in the middle of a small alley, wondering if I was at the right place. BUT, upon check-in, getting fruits, personally escorted to the room I was blown. It was soooo clean and so comfortable! An awesome respite from the long journey.

Service staff especially Jenny were very helpful in planning our very short stay, we settled for a day tour across Hue Citadel and tombs. Breakfast was great, especially the bread. Whenever we head back to the hotel they would always speak to us, ask about comments for improvement, very ready to ensure we are well and good under their eyes.

I'm really happy to stay in Hue Serene! Awesome choice!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were totally impressed with the quality of service that we received from everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping. Room was larger than expected and the amenities were also extremely impressive. The restaurant was GREAT...I would highly recommend this hotel..I do not do reviews very often, but felt this one was a must...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed in a Family Quad room for 3 nights and were very impressed with all the service staffs, the porters, the front desk staffs, the restaurant staffs and the housekeepers. They were all very friendly and helpful.

The hotel is located in a small lane but the neighbourhood is very safe and the location is good. It is only a few minutes walk to the Perfume River, Le Loi and Pham Ngu Lau, where there are many good restaurants and pubs.

The quad family room was a little small for our family of 4 adults but it did not bother us much because we spent most of our time outside the hotel. For the price that we paid, it was excellent value for money.
h_title_comment: Great Value for Money, Very Friendly and Helpful Staffs
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Only good things to say about our stay at Serene Palace. Our room was spacious and spotless. The food was absolutely incredible - so much so that we asked if we could meet the chef (young "Master Chef" by the way) after one of the best meals we had on our trip. All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly. Would highly recommend!!
