The hotel is small but really charming and nice decoration. We were greeted by welcome drink and warm atmosphere of staff at the lobby.
With the city map, nice recommendation, they made our short visit in Hue so easily.
My room has small balcony with city view, great shower, good amenities( But you can not expect more for small hotel like this).
Like other boutique hotel, the staff at Hue Serene Palace hotel are wonderful. They work so hard, always try to make us feel the most comfortable as they can.
The breakfast is quite basic, but good enough for us to start to discover the city.
Do not spend more time to search hotel in Hue, this is the best choice for you.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace lives up to its reputation as an excellent hotel. While I will give details of little things that may or may not affect your decision to stay there, the overall experience can not be faulted. This is due mainly to the staff, who provide excellent service with a smile from the moment you enter the door to the moment you leave. Welcome drink and fruit greet you, and fruit is also provided in your room each day along with a bottle of water and coffee and tea for each guest. Of course, breakfast pretty much has all you can eat fruit as well. Also included in breakfast is a menu that you can order from to your heart's delight.

We paid more for a balcony room, but there was no balcony furniture, so we couldn't actually sit out there, which is something we love to do and a reason we pay for such rooms. Perhaps they have furniture out there in other seasons, but honestly, there was very little room to accommodate furniture. It's more of a standing balcony, which for us, defeats the purpose.

Our room included a safe, a jetted tub (not so easy to shower in as the hand held shower head doesn't have a long extension, but lovely to soak in), a kettle, a comfortable sitting area near the window, and best of all a desktop computer (it would occasionally crash, but we found it more useful than we would have imagined and definitely missed it when we moved on to other cities).

As we stayed 4 nights, the hotel offered free pick-up at the train station. Our train was 2 hours late, but they were there waiting with a smile and a clearly marked sign with our name.

We would definitely recommend staying here and would come back to Hue simply to do so again.

p.s. Their restaurant is number 1 on tripadvisor, and we happily ate there every night! Still missing the pomelo salad...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great little hotel within walking distance to the river and main road (La Loi) in Hue. Front end staff and courteous, welcoming and helpful. Rooms are clean, linens and towels clean and fresh; good shower. The restaurant is rated #1 in Hue and I really don't know why....Unfortunately, the service is very poor and unorganized. Breakfast seems to be their worst time of the day - coffee is cold, no cutlery, forgetting orders and complete chaos in the dining room. It was convenient eating there but not worth the frustration after a couple of days. I think the dining room manager was on maternity leave - hope she returns soon! Would recommend the hotel but head out somewhere else for your meals.
h_title_comment: Hotel was nice; restaurant service not so good....
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This is a perfectly fine hotel although it looks like it needs a renovation. I got upgraded to a family room, which was quite large. The location is pretty good. The walls don't have good noise insulation - I could hear all conversations and toilet flushes from the neighboring room - but that is unfortunately quite common in hotels from all around the world.

The tour plans that the reception desk was suggesting were overpriced. I got longer tours for a cheaper price online.

The next time I'd probably go to their newer sister hotel Serene Palace Shining, which is just 100 meters away.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: My sister, son, and I stayed at this hotel in early January and were impressed by the high level of service by the friendly and helpful staff. Apparently early January was the high season for weddings in Hue, so it was difficult to find a driver for a day trip. But the concierge desk was able to find an excellent driver who took us to the countryside to visit family members. The food at the hotel's restaurant was excellent, with an attentive staff, and it was convenient having an in-house restaurant. Our room was spacious, clean, and quiet. I highly recommend this hotel for its accommodations and wonderful staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My partner and I recently stayed at Hue Serene Palace. We booked a room that we were not happy with because of the lack of sunlight, mould in the bathroom and the food smell from the kitchen below. The staff were generous enough to provide us with a refund for our stay because of the issues stated above. They informed us that the hotel will be renovated this March (2016), so hopefully all the problems we encountered will be irrelevant for future guests. We appreciate the way the staff at Hue Serene Palace handled our feedback and we will give this hotel another chance if we find ourselves in Hue again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was a true gem after staying in a place that cost more and was very budget in HCMC. Serene Palace is an extremely nice and well kept property in a central neighborhood of Hue. The staff could not be better. Just excellent in every way and helped me change a flight and take care of all my arrangements. No worries here!
h_title_comment: Beyond amazing service and beautiful hotel for the price
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: As you drive up this dark alley you come upon this small little hotel that doesn't look like much until you get into your room. Lovey accommodations. Very clean and nice with a fantastic breakfast. The staff were wonderful
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We had a wonderful experience here. Best hotel we stayed at in all of Vietnam. The hostess 'Julia' was the sweetest thing ever. Very much recommend if you find yourself in Hue!!! P.s. the spa treatments are also beautiful, and absolutely worth it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for one night we wished we could've stayed longer, hotel was amazing and they gave us a free upgrade, staff we so helpful in helping us around the city and booking our tour, great quite location 5 minute walk to the river and a great in hotel restaurant have dinner at
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A good choice in central Hue, the Serene Palace provides very comfortable accommodation and excellent value for money. Our spotless twin room was decorated to a high standard with great facilities. Breakfast was also good and with an extensive range to suit international tastes. Staff were very friendly and genuinely helpful, assisting with local tourist information and the arrangement of road transfers to Hoi An. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Serene Palace went over and above for our honeymoon! We arrived to a beautiful bouqet of flowers, a cake and decorations. Room service was very affordable and delicious. If you want a more authentic experience there are a ton of options within easy walking distance. The staff are amazing. Very friendly and helpful. Scarlette arranged a tour for us and also helped w laundry. (2$ per kilo) Our only small complaint was the shower and in room refrigerator. Water temp was not constant and any hot water didn't last long. The fridge didn't seem to work. Easy to overlook for the price. Fun neighborhood. And again, outstanding staff!
h_title_comment: Great hotel w a few small glitches.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great hotel with excellent staff both in reception and restaurant. Nice large room, with an added touch of a desktop computer for guests to use. Although tucked away down a little lane way it was easy to walk around the local district.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were welcomed by a hostess who served us fruit and a delicious drink, and then reviewed the booking plans we had been communicating about by email. They provided us with three drivers at very affordable rates. Our second driver was exceptional! Not only a good safe driver during the very busy Tet preparation time, in addition he acted as an interpreter for us when we visited a friend's Grandmother in a village a couple of hours out of Hue. He was a real gentleman! We were upgraded to the nicest suite with a balcony that we have stayed in during three months of travel. So clean! The food in the restaurant was superb! Both breakfast and dinner. It was an honour to meet these professional and sincere staff at such a busy time when most people in Vietnam were taking vacation with family for the Lunar New Year.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Everything at this hotel was excellent. The room was big and the bathroom clean, air conditioning worked really well and it was a quiet room. The breakfast was lovely with a wide selection of fresh food to taste. However the best part of this hotel is the staff, they were helpful, engaging and provided us with all that we needed. A nice touch was the fruit and fresh just that greeted us on arrival and the friendly conversations had with staff over breakfast. Could not fault this stay and would absolutely return!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel represents excellent value for money. The staff are very helpful, room was great and the breakfast of a very high standard. Location down a quiet street was away from the traffic yet within a short walk from the main tourist sites. Highly recommended
h_title_comment: Budget hotel with five star standards
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: From the moment we arrived at this hotel we were made to feel very welcome and relaxed. It has a bright and open lobby. Rooms are spacious, very clean and comfortable. Staff especially, Mary could not do more for you. We booked a private car so we could visit the Tombs and Mary's advice regarding which tickets to buy was really helpful. Staff at breakfast are so friendly and genuinely interested in what you've been upto and they love to help you learn Vietnamese!! Food whether it is at breakfast or in the restaurant is fantastic quality and delicious! Laundry is $2 for 1 Kilo, happy days!! Overall a wonderful hotel. Many thanks for a great stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is by far the best value for the money in my trip. Beautiful rooms, clean, fantastic breakfast and a number 1 restaurant. Everything was delicious. Good wi--fi. The staff is extremely friendly and they speak good english which makes the whole experience easier. The only minus is the road the are on : a dark narrow alley. But well, for the price, you can't get it all. About 30 minutes walk from the Imperial City. Thank you Serene Palace Hotel !
h_title_comment: The best so far in my Vietnam trip !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The hotel itself is very nice and people are very friendly. The street where it is located is not the best even though is close to main attractions. The food is quite good and breakfast nice. Rooms are large and well equipped.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed 3 nights here over Tet. Just phenomenal value for money: very clean room; comfortable bed; multiple breakfast options; and just the most friendly staff. Need a bike? They help you rent one. How about a tour? They give you some options. Always available to ask questions and pull out a map to highlight directions and location. While the Serene Palace is not within reasonable walking distance of the Citadel (probably should allow 45 min to walk to Citadel), it is right in the middle of the hotel-restaurant triangle and therefore near to many great places to eat. Stay here!! I'd also like to recommend the newly opened spa at their sister property the Serene Shining hotel. I asked Serene Palace about massages and they told me about the new place. Clean, safe, professional, and quality massage. They offer multiple massage, facial, and body scrub options for prices that seemed very reasonable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: I LOVE the hotel, although not the location and not so much the restaurant either. But if you need a hotel to arrange tours and unique custom travel plans for you, these prople will do it with a smile and get you an excellent price and select only really good drivers too. Nice room. Kneel-down shower, Slow elevator, a 15-minute walk to the "Backpacker" street with the restaurants. Other restaurants scattered on all sides for those fluent in TaxiSpeak.
h_title_comment: You will be comfortable with the personal staff
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Hi, we just came back from our Vietnam trip. We just want to say a big thank you to the staff at the Serene palace hotel. They were really helpful from the beginning. Jenny was always replying to my questions through the emails immediately and giving us some good advice as well. (eg: I asked her to organize a big car from the airport for 4 adults & 2 kids. Firstly she offered a 7 seaters car, but she thought we might struggle with lots of luggage so she gently asked if we needed 16 seaters car which she was right! we could not have fit into the 7 seater ! )
We also want to say thank you to the driver for both legs, he drove really carefully. ( and did not take any calls while he was driving.) We were very happy to see he was our driver again for the second leg to Hoi An.Please let him know how much we appreciated it. (always nervous with the kids.)

Our kids wanted to go back to this hotel when we were in Hoi An, as the staff were really kind with them.

We also liked the breakfasts a lot! The fruits (especially mango) were really tasty.
I had beef pho every day for breakfast. I already miss it!!
The hotel itself is relatively simple compared with big international hotels, but is has everything you need for a short trip to Hue and is kept really clean and is clearly very well run.
We have already recommended some of our friends who are planning to go in March.
When we go back to Hue again, we will def stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
A very good hotel with a super friendly and helpfull staff
You are treated with luxury, the hotel is clean and luxurous
The food in the restaurant is really good and not expensive
Highly recommendable

Excellent!!!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 2 nights and really couldn't find anything wrong with this hotel. The service was fantastic, the staff very helpful and the room was spacious with a clean and modern bathroom perfect for us! The breakfast had a wide range of options and the food was always fresh. The staff were the greatest part of this hotel though, they assisted us with everything from getting our safe working to organising transport from there to our next place. They were even pleasant enough to chat has to you at breakfast and provide us with local knowledge. The location of the hotel can seem doggy at first when you turn off the main road and down a small dirt alleyway however the hotel location is central and an easy walk from the main attraction and it's "off the beaten track" location provides a quiet nights sleep as there is little street traffic. Overall a 10 out of 10 and we would absolutely return
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed 4 nights and cannot fault this 3* hotel. The room was large, clean and airy. The staff were fantastic, went the extra mile, remembered you by name. Breakfasts great and the restaurant number 1. For us it was in the right area away from noise up a side alley. On top of the first class service it wasn't at all expensive. I would thoroughly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The best thing about this hotel is easily the restaurant, although it's great on almost everything else too. The restaurant in the hotel is (at the time of writing) TripAdvisor's number 1 restaurant in Hue, and is very tasty, especially since it's also really cheap. The breakfast they served was also quite good. The staff were very friendly and chatty and remember you and your food preferences when you return. When I asked if they could make a packed sandwich for my lunch, they did it with a smile and at no charge. The restaurant was packed every evening.
The check-in was smooth and we were given tonnes of info on Hue and possible tours. The staff were all nice and friendly. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable, and even contained a computer in case you fancy doing a bit of light work. Our standard room contained a bath, and the shower worked well. The soap and toiletries were pretty cheap and could do with an upgrade, along with the in-room safe which was old and fidgety and always took many frustrated attempts to get open.
The location is central but it's located down a dark and dodgy looking alley. If you approach from the north it's not too far into the alley and it's lit, but if you're coming from the south then you either have to walk down a long, dark & narrow alley, or go the long way around.
h_title_comment: Great hotel with a great restauramt
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Pity about the location - down that long narrow lane. We didn't know what sort of a dive the taxi driver was bringing us to.
However, as soon as we stepped out of the taxi, all our concerns were assuaged by the welcome, and the friendliness of the reception girls who made us feel right at home.
Even though we arrived before 11:00 am, they got our rooms ready, and our bags up while we had welcome drinks and fruit bowl.

The room itself was lovely, and the bed very comfortable. Good wifi.

Another advantage is that you don't have to go far for one of the best restaurants in Hue - it's inhouse. If you forget to book a table, they'll call you as soon as one is free, and the tables are turned over quickly.

Best of all, the price is so reasonable. However, we got better prices from Cafe on Thu Wheels for tours and transfers.

I would strongly recommend Hue Serene Palace Hotel, and would come back again.
h_title_comment: Great price for a great hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a wonderful stay at Hue Serene Palace. We had 2 rooms, both of which had balconies overlooking town. The rooms were very large, modern, and clean. The staff was exceptionally friendly and very willing to accommodate our requests. The restaurant food was great, both breakfast and dinner. The location was withing walking distance of great restaurants and shops. I highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Everything was perfect. For $38 USD a night, everything was perfect. Staff was extremely helpful, and warm and welcoming. Rooms clean and comfortable. Ms. Jenny responded to all of my emails very quickly and provided us with a private car to pick us up from Danang airport and take us on a scenic drive into Hue. Location was great for us. Plenty of great food close by. It took us around 30 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Citadel. There are plenty of taxi's or cyclo's if you don't want to walk, and the hotel will always get you a taxi if you need help. We got our laundry done quickly and easily at the hotel. Great, English speaking staff at front desk.
h_title_comment: Perfect experience, excellent hotel for this price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Date(s) Visited: Jan 31-Feb 2, 2016
Number of guests: 3
Room Details: 4th floor #401 family room (one double one single bed)
Pricing: $42/night via booking.com
Pros: we arrived very early in the morning at 7am, and the staff checked us in at 9am, a very fast turnaround as the hotel was fully booked (only 7 family rooms total). Food was pretty good as well, we had lunch and dinner there on the first day, as well as two breakfasts.
Cons: not many, just a couple of minor things. I went downstairs on Feb 1st evening to ask for a couple of packets of coffee, but they were not delivered. Also for the Pho noodle soup, the beef was way over cooked and dry.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel is excellent. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful staff I can imagine. Ms. Laura took care of everything; even offering to come to the market and help us negotiate good deals on items for our spouses. The breakfast was superb and the staff their was always helpful, as well. The location is just down an ally and off the tourist area. As such, everything is within a short walk. If staying in Hue, I can't recommend this hotel any higher.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This is one of the nicest hotels I stayed in in Vietnam. The staff were superb and made us feel very special the whole time we stayed here, from the fresh fruit in the room and upon arrival, to the tour recommendations and bookings they did for us. The rooms are extremely spacious, modern, clean and luxurious. Our room was on the top floor and with a balcony which we made full use of for soaking up the views and the sunset. The room came with its own computer and wifi which made researching and booking our travel plans very convenient. Breakfast is cooked to order and the Pho was one of the nicest I had while travelling. A little hidden gem in Hue.
h_title_comment: Friendliest staff who made our stay so memorably
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were blown away by the welcoming and friendly staff who made our stay at the Serene Palace so special. Our room was clean and spacious although I agree with an earlier reviewer that plug sockets were in short supply, but what a delight to find a bathroom with a bath. The breakfast was very good and we ate in the restaurant on one of our evenings in Hue and the food was great.
It was however the attitude of all of the staff that turned good to great. Nothing seemed to be any trouble; laundry done, car booked to take us to Hoi An, spa treatment at sister hotel organised - and at a 40% discount. I was sorry to leave this little gem of an hotel.
Excellent value for money as well.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: From the e-mails arranging the car at the airport in Da Nang to the welcome to the advice on where to go and what to see and the service in the restaurant, the staff were just brilliant. The narrow land leading to the hotel is unpromising but the care and attention you receive is a revelation.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Arrived early for check in but were greeted with free fruit, juice and cold towels. The staff managed to get our room ready early for us so we weren't waiting long at all.

The room itself was fantastic - spotlessly clean, modern, great air conditioning (which made the 45°C tolerable) and a lovely large bathroom.

At breakfast each morning (which was fantastic) the staff would enquire about your plans for the day and make recommendations with their excellent local knowledge. On the morning of our checkout we were quite rushed as had an early trip booked (Le Family Riders motorbike trip - if you are in Hue/Hoi An you simply must do this) so only had time to eat a small breakfast. This did not go unnoticed by the staff (Perhaps called Sally?) who ran over to us with fruit for our journey.

This is a fantastic hotel and probably one of the best of my whole trip!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Staff wonderful ! Very friendly and good english.
No noise at the hotel
The breakfast buffet is fresh : fruits, fruit juice, vietnamese soup....
The room is modern and very clean with a computer
A perfect stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace provides exceptional value for money.

On the positive side, the rooms are spacious & clean. The complimentary breakfast is generous. The hotel restaurant serves good food (try the pomelo salad!). The hotel laundry service is also very affordable (US$2 for 1kg of freshly laundered clothes!)

On the negative side, linens & towels are slightly basic. The location of the hotel & affiliated spa is slightly obscure.

Overall, an excellent 3-star hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: we stayed for a night here and were made very comfortable by their friendly and courteous staff. the rooms are modern and very clean. the breakfast buffet though limited is quite fresh and filling. the servers at the restaurants are especially very courteous. though the approach road to the hotel is a let down, but once you are inside, it more than makes up for this downside.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Staff wonderful! Very friendly and good english. For breakfast there is a little buffet with mostly fresh fruits and some bread. The big choice is à-la-carte and really good!! The room is big and clean.
The only "negative" points are a lack of electical sockets (we had to unplug the PC to get free plugs, there was only one free in the bedroom). And the shower tube was to short for our size.
But besides this, a perfect stay! Thank you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We (two couples) booked two nights here, not knowing of what to come. Turned out this hotel aint just terrific with the helpful and pleasant staff, the clean and luxurious rooms, it also got the best restaurant in Hué (according to tripadvisor).
Eat here, sleep here, you won't regret it. We didn't want to leave!
h_title_comment: Probably the best hotel in Hué.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Although a little difficult to find this is a perfectly located hotel - just a few minutes walk to the nearest Hue has to a bar street and within walking distance to daytime attractions. For instance, the Citadel is only a 20 minute leisurely stroll.

The rooms are very big and comfortable. The staff are friendly, helpful and speak good English. The breakfast is plentiful and good quality.

For the price I reckon this is an excellent hotel although obviously I've never stayed anywhere else in Hue. If I went back I'd book this hotel again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Located down a small quiet street, the Serene Palace lives up to its name. A peaceful place to stay, with a highly-rated restaurant that offers a good selection of breakfasts, and comfortable rooms (some with balconies).
The staff are excellent and extremely helpful. Whether you need to book onward transportation, or if you're looking for things to do, the highly motivated staff will do their best to make your stay as pleasant as possible.
Despite the presence of "Karaoke CoCo" next door, which is quite a bit of fun, the hotel and surrounding area is quiet by 10pm. Bars and other restaurants can be found within a 5-10 minute walk.
Would definitely stay here again!
h_title_comment: Lovely Stay at the Serene Palace
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Ignore the slightly unpromising approach to the hotel down a narrow bumpy road as this modern hotel is great value for money. The staff are very friendly and helpful and available to give you advice on exploring Hue and further. The hotel also has a great little restaurant providing great breakfasts and lunch/dinner (rated number 1 in Hue) which makes the often stressful 'where are we going to eat tonight' decision a lot easier.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is great place. Room is big and clean. Definitly EXCELENT value for money. Welcom fruit plate and juice, and fruit plate in room are so nice. I wait for my bus few hours, and they give me free tee and coffe. Great stuff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We enjoyed our seven night stay at the Serene. The rooms are reasonably spacious although a little short of storage space, the bed is comfortable (although the sheet arrangement is a little quirky) and the aircon works well. There’s also a computer terminal (as well as free wifi) in each room. Go for a room on the top floor with a balcony for nice views of the town. Breakfast is OK, and the other meals are actually pretty good, although the setting (basically an extension of the hotel lobby) lacks a bit of ambience.

Where the Serene excels however is it’s staff. Jenny was very helpful in answering our questions before we arrived and the wonderful Sally and the restaurant staff couldn’t do enough for us.

One word about the location: it’s down a quiet lane, which means it is out of the bothersome traffic (don’t be worried by the nearby karaoke bars, we hardly heard a peep from them). However, the lane itself is potholed and gets very muddy and slippery when it rains. My partner went over and cut her leg and hand quite badly just outside the hotel. Sally and other staff went immediately into action with the first aid kit, and there was no permanent damage done. However, the lane way sometimes needs hiking boots! Work was underway while we were there to smooth out the surface with sand but a more permanent surface would be a great improvement.

We’d highly recommend this hotel.
h_title_comment: A Three Star Hotel with Six Star Staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was large and well appointed. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfasts and dinners in the restaurant and found the quality excellent. Do not be put off by the narrow laneway which leads to he hotel. The only reason I did not give five stars was that we had a shirt returned from laundry, done offsite, with multiple stains. The hotel was very helpful in trying to solve this problem.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My husband, sister, and brother in law stayed three nights at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay there! The staff were all very friendly and professional.

The first room we stayed in was very clean and spacious. The second room we were moved to was clean as well but smelled like sewage. We finally figured out that it was coming from the bathroom and had to shut the door. We did inform them and they said that they would look into it so we hope they take care of it because the smell was suffocating!

Breakfast there was pretty good. Was a bit westernized for the guests which is good and bad. On the last morning, they were nice enough to allow my sister and her husband (who had booked the last night stay in Hue at their sister hotel-Serene Shining) to join us for our last complimentary breakfast together before parting ways. We really appreciated that they allowed us to do that!

Our only complaint was the location as it is located down a narrow alley and the van that took our family there had a very difficult time maneuvering through the alley. And also, the bad smell in our second room. Otherwise, we will most likely stay there again because of the price and enjoyment of our stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast and restaurant had great food. Comfortable room, with great view. The hotel organised a driver for us, and picked us up from the airport, and the next day for sightseeing. All organised very efficiently and the city of Hue was so atmospheric.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Min son, 27 and me visited Serene Palace Hotel in Hue on our roundabout in Vietnam and from minut one we feeld relaxed, welcomed and taken care of. The welcome fruit and Juice while waiting for checkin/paperwork, the recommandations and the arranged trip, the room ( nothing more than Beautyful) and the overall interest in our well being from the "bellboys" to the people in the restaurant, which by the way served excellent food whit a personal touch was amacing. And the breakfast was fantastic, not buffet jubiii, but order from menu ( and what a menu) and the possibility to get juices, caffee, bread and fruit yourself. We were going to Hoi An after our stay and enjoyed the hotelcar/driver taken us there with siteseeings on the way to a very good price. It's a 4 hours trip. So go there and enjoy, we will be be back on our next trip to Vietnam.
Mikkel and Maria from Denmark
h_title_comment: Best service, fantastic Rooms and the Best breakfast
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
The hotel was awesome. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was awesome. Beds comfy. Shower great. Bathrooms clean and modern. Staff helped book flights and got ride from train station in da Nang to Hoi. Got off train ride was waiting for us.

Canadians from Saskatchewan
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for two nights, the staff were very polite and attentive. They helped us book tours and train tickets, going through a variety of options available depending on our price range and didn't try to upsell. Beds were nice and comfortable!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent very little time in Hue, arriving late from the train and then leaving the next morning for some touring and then on to Hoi An. The booking process was excellent for this hotel: staff gave great information months in advance and then the short day we were there. The room was spacious for the three of us, and breakfast was bountiful. Be aware that hotel is a 15 minute taxi ride from the imperial citadel, but I'm not sure any hotels are close to it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Staff speaks very good English and are very helpful. I had a medical problem while in Hue, they found a dentist and made an appointment for me first thing in the morning. By 9AM the problem was solved and I could still enjoy the tour planned for the day.
They offer a very good tour, and have a very good restaurant downstairs.
h_title_comment: Helpful staff, great food, good value
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Stayed here for one night with my girlfriend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were all extremely courteous and friendly. The room was well maintained and the desktop PC was convenient. Great location to many tourist areas. We enjoyed supper at the highly acclaimed restaurant according to TripAdvisor and we won't let down. Highly recommended!
h_title_comment: Pleasant stay, excellent location, impeccable service!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed two nights and found room, staff and restaurant very good. Our only criticism is that it is not very easy to find down an untarmacked road, and not very centrally located. Good value compared to other hotels in Hue
h_title_comment: Excellent mid range hotel with good restaurant
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Lovely mid range hotel with fantastically friendly and helpful staff, comfortable rooms, and offering outstanding value for money.

Hotel restaurant provides delicious food too.

This is not a luxury hotel but provided us with a memerably good stay in this lovely city. Only small criticism is that the bathroom is a little tired and in need of refurbishment.
h_title_comment: Fantastic value, great service, good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The room was not fancy but comfortable and clean and had all the amenities that we require. We requested for high floor room and was given one on the 7th floor, the hotel's highest floor. Everything was spotlessly clean. The location, although it seems to be in a small alley as we approached it for the first time, is actually very good, it's just about 10 mins to the main street Le Loi. There are many other bars and restaurants near us. We only had time to sample 2 and we give top marks for both. The first was the Serene Palace restaurant, and the second was Risotto restaurant, both are rated by TripAdvisor. The hotel staff were exceptionally good and we felt very welcomed. Nothing was too hard for them.
h_title_comment: Excellent because of the Human Touch
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel is located very centrally and is waking distance from some very good restaurants and the main night life strip.

It is tucked away in a little side alley which rendered the rooms very quiet which is pleasant with a motorbike rental across the road.

The breakfast as nice with a wide selection of fresh fruits, tea and coffee. The breakfast itself was made ready to order including eggs, crepes, pancakes and savoury Vietnamese dishes.

The rooms were spacious, very clean, neat and tidy.

Overall highly recommended at an unbeatable value for money!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is wonderful. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and greeted us warmly every time we came and went from the hotel. They also helped us plan a wonderful visit to the area, where we were able to see all the important sites. The rooms are big, clean and comfortable. Each morning, we were treated to a delicious breakfast. The location is nice too because it's down an alley, which makes it quieter than many other locations in town. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Staff always willing to help & very knowledgable about the area/tours. Great breakfast to start the day......order as much as you like. Rooms nice & clean however not much space for clothes having a family of four in one room. Lived out of a suitcase, not enjoyable.
h_title_comment: Good location, very helpful English speaking staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Stayed here as a family of five in two rooms. Beautiful rooms, consistently excellent service, great restaurant. Superb breakfast included in the room price. Restaurant food was brilliant, as were the restaurant staff.

When making the booking, hotel staff were very prompt and helpful in their replies to our questions.

Notably, we asked the hotel to book a guide for a tour of the main temple complex and the old citadel. It was good value for money and extremely insightful.The young man they booked (his name was pronounced Sun) was excellent: great English (he's a film buff) and born storyteller who kept everyone interested (including siblings aged 10, 17 and 19). Ask for him by name.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Hotel was clean and satisfactory. Nothing fancy but perfect for our family. Comfortable beds with good linen. Staff were friendly and helpful. Their restaurant was excellent. Good location for exploring the sights of Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel for the price, with big rooms, a large breakfast and located on a quiet street. But the front desk staff was a little too aggressive in promoting tours of the city and surrounding areas (and discouraging us from doing things on our own). And their prices for other things (bicycle rental, driver to Hoi An) were higher than some alternatives. So just beware.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Thoroughly excellent hotel offering stunning value for money. Friendly and efficient staff, lovely rooms and good choice of food for breakfast. As many comments mention, it is down a side street, but that does not detract from the property at all. When staying in Hue we would definitely go back.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Room was big and clean (family room) WITH baby cot (quite rare).
Location is not convenient because in a small alley, and luggage need to be dragged down from the nearby street (and it was raining). Karaoke etc in the alley noisy.
Breakfast and staff very nice though.
Free wifi and large choice of TV channels (incl kids)
Hue itself is charming.
h_title_comment: Big room, good breakfast, but location so so
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: After the overnight train journey from Hanoi we were feeling very washed out and the friendly staff (Mary) immediately made us feel welcome. A bowl of fruit and juice was provided while we rested for ten minutes. As our room wasn't ready (10am - check in was Noon) the staff arranged for our luggage to go to another room so we could enjoy hot showers and get into some fresh clothes. Mary provided a detailed map of things to see and do ( along with Vietnamese phrases!!) before organising our day tour the following day with a driver and guide followed by our transport to Hoi An the following day. Extremely efficient. This hotel provided the best overall experience ever! Breakfasts fantastic. The restaurant although run by another owner is equally outstanding and as a result we decided not to venture out. Sally as supervisor made us feel welcome and went out of her way to ensure we went without. You will not be disappointed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This was a great hotel, and very cheap for the service you get. It's near the main tourist area but set back so very quiet at night. The rooms are large, comfy beds, with lots of nice touches like fruit for you when you check in. The staff were also incredibly helpful. I'd recommend this to anyone in Hue.
h_title_comment: Excellent quality hotel for mid range prices
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were greeted with cool drinks and a generous fruit plate. Room was ready and spotless. A computer in the room which was a nice touch. Staff were very helpful. Absolutely loved this place and wished we could have stayed more than one night. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the street, nice and quiet. A perfect stay. Breakfast is amazing!
h_title_comment: Loved it! Wished we had more than one night!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Lovely Boutique Hotel with very professional, friendly and helpful staff. Lovely rooms, great beds, very good breakfast and an easy walk to many of Hue's places of interest including across the bridge to The Citadel and main Market.
The Serene Cuisine Restaurant also provides an excellent selection of Vietnamese food served by lovely professional attentive and friendly staff.
h_title_comment: Serene by name serene by nature
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
For what we paid we have no complaints. Room was spacious and clean, serviced everyday with a modern bathroom. Bell boys, doormen and restaurant staff particularly good. Breakfast included and cooked to order which was nice.
Located down an alley which is a 5 minute walk to the main drag of traveller restaurants and bars. Metered taxis around town are pretty cheap e.g. to the Citadel.
Arranged 2 cars and drivers through helpful front desk, including a one way drop off in Danang for $65.
Thanks for the vote if you found this helpful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Central location, very clean hotel, attentive staff, good food (breakfasts). Would probably have given the hotel more but I received an email from them "All of us will be very eager if you can rate us 5 points in overall rating. I understand that 4 points means "very good" but we only can have some gift from my boss if the guest give full rating". I didn't appreciate that.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My friend and I just left the Serene Palace Hotel this morning and we felt that it more than lived up to its trip advisor reviews. The rooms are large, clean, and equipped with all the amenities. We were picked up promptly from our flight from Hanoi and we were met by cheerful staff who throughout our stay responded to any question or need that we had. Sally , the supervisor, was extremely friendly and knowledgeable and provided a very personal touch to our stay.
The hotel is indeed located down an alley with other hotels and coffee shops, but we found the hotel to be quiet and peaceful. It is walking distance to shops and restaurants ,and we walked several times to the river and the market. For those not inclined to walk the distance, the hotel staff promptly can arrange taxi service. One of the best features of the hotel is it's restaurant which serves a wonderful variety of dishes a a very affordable price.
Certainly everyone has different expectations when they travel, but if you are looking for a small affordable hotel whose staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome, then this is what you will find at the Serene Palace.
h_title_comment: A delightful hotel in a good location
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We had a great stay in the Serene Palace. The room and ensuite were enormous and had lovely facilities. Pretty central to the main tourist streets in Hue.

Staff were very helpful and attentive. They often checked in with us to see if we needed anything. We organised laundry and hiring bicycles with the ladies at reception and they were great.

Breakfast was nice too; buffet of fruit and bread plus we could order off the menu. We were unwell for a couple of days while staying here and ordered room service a few times. Not incredible food but always prompt and hot.

The location down the alley is a little odd perhaps but it gave it character and meant the hotel was pretty quiet. Close enough to walk to the Citadel - about twenty minutes. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This is one of those instances where what I found in TA did not meet my expectations. I stayed in hotels in Hanoi, Hoi An, Saigon and this was my least favorite. The pictures you see are better than what you get in person. One thing I realized about Hue is that there is no such thing as a central location. The sites are just all over the place that you just have to find a hotel that you like and go for it. Maybe the standards in Hue are different than in other places in Vietnam but if this hotel gets 5 stars from TA then I dont know what a true 5 star really means.

Let me start with the good, the email communication with this hotel is excellent. Jenny responded to every single question I sent via email, quick and reliable. I needed a very quiet room and they delivered on the top floor. On our first night our neighbor had their TV blasting, you can hear it through the concrete walls. Maybe they should rethink on how the TV is mounted on the wall. There is also a Karaoke bar close to the hotel and I can hear it from my top floor room. I had to wear my earplugs when I sleep. Keep in mind that I am very sensitive to sound so this might not be an issue for a normal person. Jenny also gave us a good rate for a pickup from Hoi An to the hotel (55 USD). Very good car service. The location is a bit not to my preference. Its on a narrow alley with a lot of local establishments which is fine if this is your taste. Is it central? it depends on what you are looking for. If you want the tourist sites then not really as I mentioned above, they are all over the place. We walked from the hotel to the Citadel and it was a 20 min walk and we are fast walkers. You can walk to a lot of restaurants and shops from the hotel. Which is why I put the location still on the positive side. The internet is really fast and they even give you a desktop in the room, this was very helpful.

Now for the not so good. Throughout my travels in Vietnam I have encountered a different level of excellent service in different hotels which made it very memorable. However, I did not get that impression from this place during our stay. I can't put my finger in it but the service was just lacking and inconsistent. I think I got the best service from the bell boys who help us with the luggage and open the doors for us all the time. Those front desk girls, not so much. I had a few instances when I felt some attitude. Maybe its a language barrier but I didnt feel that in other hotels in Vietnam. We dropped off our laundry in the morning and I asked the front desk what time will it be available and they said in the evening. When I picked it up in the evening, it wasn't there. Instead of being apologetic, the girl kept questioning me if I dropped it off because she couldnt find it. At last when Jenny looked into it, she found it. When we checked the items, we were missing a sock. We went down and they found it somewhere. You also dont get the best information when you ask for restaurants or whats what. Things like this bothered me about the service. Service for me is only 3 stars.

There were a few noise issues during my stay, the loud TV in the adjacent room, the karaoke bar and the dragging furniture from people who are cleaning early Sunday morning. Mind you, we were on the top floor so these noises came from adjacent rooms. For a small place like this with just a few rooms I dont think they should start dragging furniture till after 9. .

Aesthetically, beauty of the property is only skin deep. It is clean but as one looks closely, there are some things that are worth mentioning. The bathroom grout and caulking is falling apart. I dont know if it is mold or mildew but there are black stuff in the caulking. Hand held showers dont work for me. The interior is just cheap and tacky for my taste. You have to lock the door when you leave and it is not just a matter of click and close. Its more of a pull and turn and turn and turn. They need to upgrade their lock system.

Before you get too excited about more than a thousand reviews resulting to a 5 star rating for this hotel, pick and choose which reviews you can trust. Thats not just for this hotel but for any review out there. It is all about credibility. I am not saying this hotel is bad but im definitely not a fan. I just feel that there are other hotels in the same price point that could give me more satisfaction. In retrospect, I would have rather paid more money and stayed at the M Gallery or the Indochine Palace. If are a bit tight on budget and you are not concerned about the points I mentioned above then this place might work for you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our family of 6 thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Serene Palace Hotel. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and a special mention to Sally and her crew in the restaurant. Thank you for helping to make our holiday such an enjoyable and memorable one.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: All was absoluty perfect, with a spacious and beautiful room with all necessary equipment, staff very friendly and helpful, a very good restaurant, high quality service. A really very good hotel in Hue. We recommand this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great location in Hue, within walking distance of restaurants and shops. Arrived late at night due to flight delays so it was wonderful to be able to get dinner at their restaurant and scrumptious food as well. Breakfast was just as tasty. Having a computer in every room was a plus (only hotel that had these out of 6 hotels we stayed in Vietnam). The laundry service of $2 USD/kg was the least expensive of all the hotels. This would also be the second best value hotel that we stayed in while in Vietnam. They even managed to rescue our items (that we left in the room by accident) and get them to us before we departed on our motorbike tour to Hoi An!

Thanks Hue Serene Palace for a lovely stay!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: I can't say enough about the staff at this hotel; their English is excellent. I especially want to mention Si, who bent over backwards in making arrangements for us: found us a guide to tour the city; made us a reservation for a dinner of Imperial Cuisine, made sure our transfer arrangements were in place, all the little details that make a trip run smoothly. The hotel itself is very very nice, with large, comfortable rooms; and happens to have the #1 restaurant on Tripadvisor in it, a nice perk! But it is the staff that makes the place. Great location also.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We arrived from the airport around 10 pm, which is when the hotel's restaurant ordinarily closes. However, they kept the restaurant open an extra hour so that we could freshen up and dine. The restaurant is one of the best in Hue, and its all-you-can-eat breakfasts include an excellent selection of fresh fruit. The staff and service were excellent, the room was spacious and, in addition to reasonably fast wifi, a fully equipped desktop computer with an Ethernet connection was provided. Complimentary fresh fruit was left in the room every day, and the bathroom had a full size bath tub for bubble baths etc (complimentary bathrobes were provided). No negatives. Some guests might find the location a bit hard to find.
h_title_comment: Best value for money hotel in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Small hotel down an alley but the rooms are big, clean & beautifully decorated. Staff are very friendly & helpful. Wonderful service for a small hotel like this and certainly value for money! Will definitely recommend this hotel to all! Breakfast is really good , ala carte with many choices.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Superb value for money. Large spacious rooms with all amenities. Staff was very helpful. Ms Mary provided information about the city attractions.
Breakfast was nice with lot of options

However, they don't have a medical kit in the hotel. My friend had allergy at 11pm in the night. Receptionist said no medical kit in the hotel and no doctor available on call. A little more emphasis can be given on guest safety.

Besides this, would definitely recommend the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is located in the touristic area of Hue. So close to most of the restaurants, sights, etc.
The room was spacious, clean and very important, it was quiet. It also had a PC available, which was great for us!
They offer a washing clothes service for 2$ per kg, which was the cheapest I could find so far in hotels in Vietnam.
The breakfast was ok. Fruit and bread was available on a buffet. Vietnamese and western dishes were available on request.
The staff was very nice! Very polite and helpful!
We had to check out at 5.00 in the morning and received a packed breakfast which was a very nice gesture of the hotel.
In general, the experience in the hotel was good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Kudos to be given to the staff at the hotel for their friendliness and helpfulness. Also all the staff spoke English, so language was not a problem at all.

We stayed in the family room, so it was bit campy but it suited our needs just fine. Location wise, it was about a 15 - 20min walk to the Imperial Palace or a really short cab ride away. It's also off the main road, so it's nice and quiet and the room had a balcony, so it was nice just to sit outside.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Yes it's down a scummy alleyway but you get over that pretty quickly considering how centrally located the hotel is and how easy it is to get around in Hue. Friendly, reasonably sized rooms, quality food... The restaurant, oddly located at the rear of the lobby, is rated number one on trip advisor (?!), and while pretty good, nothing spectacular. The staff are intensely attentive, in a well mannered way. A nice, cost effective, boutique hotel. I would go back :-)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Really enjoyed our stay here in two City View rooms on the top floor. Rooms were spacious and comfortable with a balcony and view over the city. Staff all spoke excellent English and were friendly and professional. Great food in the hotel restaurant (although it lacks a bit of character, tucked away at the back of the ground floor) with excellent service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We had an amazing stay at hue serene! Staff were lovely and rooms were big and very comfortable. The restaurant downstairs both breakfast and dinner was nice and fresh and staff there are so friendly and welcoming. The location is good, easy to walk to many places with nightlife close by. Overall if you want a comfortable stay, with good food then this is your place!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Amazing little hotel, clean and modern. Big, well furnished rooms, good breakfast and helpful staff. And all of that for veyr very reasonable price! I definitely recommend and would like to go back one day:)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Wie stayed in 10 Hotels durind our 4 week trip! Here the people where the friendliest! Just perfect! We felt at home from the first moment on! Lots of hotels can learn from you! It's is a pleasure giving you 5 stars! You also had one of the best Pho for breakfast!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our stay in Hue Serene was greeted by very friendly bell-boys and reception. We received a drink and fruits on arrival. The room was very big, spacious and clean. Our room on the 2nd floor didn't have much of a view but that wasn't a problem for us. We really enjoyed the breakfast here with a large hot menu and great service. The bathroom was large and spacious as well, but unfortunately did have a slight smell every morning when we opened the door. All in all, we loved our stay in hue serene palace.
h_title_comment: First time in Hue- beautiful service and breakfast
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We enjoyed our 2 night stay. The room was large and comfortable. The food was really good; the vegetarian rice paper rolls were the best I've had yet in Vietnam. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive. I can also recommend the nearby Lotus Garden Spa where I went for waxing, the staff were professional and friendly, the place is new and is spick and span.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Three star Hotel with Five Star staff and service. We stayed for two nights and ate in the restaurant both nights. We enjoyed the set menu as it gave us the opportunity to try local specialities. The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean, we had a room on the 7th floor which was nice and quiet. The Hotel is tucked up a side street but well worth looking out. We would definitely stay at the Serene Palace again and recommend both the Hotel and the Restaurant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Thanks for a great and pleasant stay at the Serene Palace Hotel. The staff was very friendly and courteous.
The room we had was very luxurious and spacious, absolute more than western standard. The breakfast was also very delicious.
Unfortunately the hotel is not in the first row, but this is absolutely no problem because everything is walking distance.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews.I was a bit underwhelmed when we arrived as we didn't appear to be anywhere near the river.The hotel is down a rough alleyway that makes it hard to find at night.The river is a 8 minute walk away but there are plenty of restaurants around the corner and cyclo transport everywhere.Our room was on the 7th floor so we had a great view across the city but still couldn't see the river from there.Free Wifi,water,toiletries.Breakfast is served downstairs and they offer allot of food.We had room service the night we arrived and the food was pretty awful.We couldn't eat it and we are not fussy eaters.The staff were good at the front door ,there to open the door every time you came in or out.Bit of a language barrier with the guy at the service desk but that's just Vietnam for you.Power went out on our last day and we had to walk up and down 7 flights of stairs.Charged 30% day rate for late check out even though there was no power or shower water.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great little hotel in good location for visiting Hue. Unfortunately only had one night here but for a small hotel lovely spacious room and great breakfast. Staff very helpful and friendly. Would recommend
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This small hotel is conveniently located, yet on a small quiet street. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Our room on the sixth floor was large, with a comfortable bed and sitting area. The bathroom was large and there was plenty of hot water for a good shower. Overall, it was a reasonable value for the accommodations which included a full breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is very well situated. The staff is very nice and helpfull. Rooms are clean and very well furnished. We appreciated the wellcome drink and the fruits in our room. Free WiFi is also available in the room, which is very convenient. i will recommend this hotel to our friends.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My family and I have had an enjoyable and memorable stay here. The room is clean and spacious. I love the ginger tea at breakfast and the waitress. Especially, we are highly appreciated for late check out and tour arrangement. Thanks for your hospitality. I will come back and recommend you to my friends.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
When our taxi driver dropped us off & we had to walk down an alley way with our luggage I was a little hesitant, but when we got to Serene Hotel it definitely changed my mind!
Such a hidden little gem! The staff were fantastic & very helpful! The rooms were quite a good size! The bed was also very comfortable!
The food was great! We only had breakfast there one day because the second day we had a food tour booked in.
We were made to feel very welcome at the Serene Hotel Hue!
The only downfall was the roosters next door crowing in the morning. Thankfully my partner & I are both early risers & were keen to get up and enjoy the city.
I would definitely recommend anyone who comes to Hue to stay in the Serene Palace Hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is awesome. They welcome you with a refreshment and you immediately feel very welcomed. Room is very nicely furnished. Very nice breakfast and great staff. They even helped me with a tour booking I did outside the hotel. Definitely would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We arrived at the hotel very tired and hungry after an 11 hour train journey. The staff completed our check-in arrangements while we sat enjoying a cold drink and fruit in the lobby. The room was gorgeous, large and beautifully appointed, with a desktop computer as well as free wifi.
Too tired to venture outside for dinner we thought we would try the hotel’s restaurant for dinner. Trip Advisor had rated it number one in Hue and we were not disappointed. The food was fantastic! We tried the pomelo salad, morning glory salad, crispy seafood pancakes and chicken curry and loved every bite. The girls in the restaurant are very efficient and so friendly, all of them spend time at each table getting to know the clients. The lady in charge Miss Sally is delightful and ensures everything goes smoothly.
The breakfast buffet was also very good with the usual fresh fruits and breads and a good choice of hot cooked to order items.
After a full day visiting the tombs and citadel we returned to the hotel and once again had dinner there, we had enjoyed our previous dinner so much that we ordered the same food again and shared it between us! Whoever is in the kitchen is doing a fantastic job!
I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody, good value for money, lovely rooms, amazing food and wonderful people like Miss Sally. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer. We will return!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Service:
Staff were friendly. And the cleaning services were very good. Also had a complimentary birthday cake.

Food:
Was okay, rather overrated. Better than most food we ate at hue though. Tasted much better food in HCMC and Da nang.

Room:
Was great, but only ONE charging port in a family suite. Had many not needed items like: computer in the room, weighing machine etc. But everything else was great!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very nice hotel, quiet area but still only 5 minute walk to everything definatly worth the money as the staff were very polite and helpful! Breakfast is order of menu but can order however much you want with fruit, coffee, juice, cake and bread bar to help yourself! Service is outstanding, hired a motor bike from the hotel to do a ride to Hoi an through the hotel and they sent our luggage, bike broke down at the bottom of the Hai Van Pass thankfully made it over the hill and about 20metres from a repair shop haha, the guys fixed the bike and we got a refund for the work done through the hotel!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary and were made to feel so special. It was a real surprise and one of the highlights of our holiday. Thanks to all of the lovely staff particularly the wonderful Scarlet. The rooms were clean and comfortable and food delicious.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Serene Palace was one of the best hotels we stayed at in our 4 week tour and at a bit less than 27USD/night for the Superior Double it was exceptional value. Every aspect of our stay was impressive. Our room was large, very clean, nicely decorated and had a window that opened. The bed was large and very comfortable with good pillows. It had arm chairs and a coffee table as well as a desk and chair. It also had a computer in the room. WiFi connection was faultless. Air conditioning was adjustable and much appreciated after a few hours exploring. The en-suite was a good size with reliable hot water and pressure. The hotel had a good sized lift. The laundry service was good value. The staff were friendly and helpful. I especially appreciated the 'bell boys' who were engaging and quick with a smile, to open doors and to help with luggage. Breakfast was excellent with lots of variety. In a country where exceptional hotel service seems to be the norm, the dining staff at the Serene Palace really are exceptional. Sally who seemed to be the restaurant manager made a point of greeting all clients and making sure their needs were taken care of. When she knew I wasn't well, she made ginger tea for me and had a colleague go buy me yoghurt because my husband had suggested I might be able to eat it. The Serene Palace has the number 1 ranking for dining in Hue and we had some memorable evening meals at very good prices. If staying at the hotel, they give a 10% discount on food. Its location on a small road/lane meant the hotel was quiet but it is an easy walk to the river and Palace and we felt safe walking in the area at night.The fare from the railway station in a green Mai Linh taxi (one of the taxi companies reputed to be reliable) was 50 000VND (about 3.30 AUD). We did walk to the station and back one day but it is a fair distance with luggage. To tour the further sites, we had the hotel arrange day hire of a car and driver which cost 35USD.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I spent 2 nights here and was very pleased with the service and my room. All staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment we checked in. Our room was nice, clean and modern, and even had a PC with internet. Room service coffee was surprisingly good. Laundry service was very cheap for a hotel. This hotel gets all the small things right.

My only complaint would be the noise levels. I'm not sure if it's that particular guest but it sounded like an elephant was living above us. Also the sound of opening and closing doors in the halfway was quite loud.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I recently spent three nights at Hue Serene Palace Hotel and loved it! We were only planning to stay one but as soon we saw our room we went down to reception and booked another two. First of all, the room was huge!! It had lovely wooden floors, a comfortable bed, tv on the wall and a COMPUTER! This was the first hotel we had stayed at that provided a desktop computer in the room and it was amazing. We could use it for researching our trip and booking things. The staff were amazing- always wanting to help. The breakfast was also delicious and you could order however much you wanted from a menu. When we were leaving I realised that I had left my watch in the safe (it was unlocked but we hadn't noticed it when taking our other things out). Reception sent a staff member up to check and he came back down with it which I thought was very honest as it would have been easy to take. All in all this was an amazing hotel with great value for money and welcoming staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace Hotel is located in old Hue on a very quiet safe lane. Walking distance to many points of interest. Very Clean comfortable and peaceful retreat. Price and quality ratio is remarkable. Staff is attentive and always ensure that the customer is well served and pleased. The restaurant serves excellent food where numerous tourists come to the hotel for dining only. Guests at the hotel get a rebate in the dining room. Much appreciated! Also visited Kim Long orphanage run by Sister Chantal. God Bless!!! Booked private car hire for travel to Hoi An ($70 US) through hotel and shared costs for mini van with other hotel couple. We truly enjoyed our stay. Our sincere thanks to all.
Louise & Hélène
h_title_comment: Three great nights at a great hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: we loved to stay there. Best hotel we stayed in in Vietnam! Staff was great and very helpful and proactive, nice breakfast buffet. Fast internet. The restaurant serves delicious food and they also offer good vietnamese wine.
h_title_comment: Great place to stay! Highly recommended! Superb value for money......
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: 2 nights in December 2015. Excellent hotel, our 6th in Vietnam/Cambodia and produced the, by now, expected superb levels of service and accommodation. Nice location and easily walkable to the citadel. Excellent breakfast and we ate in the hotel both nights due to fatigue and the very good meal and service on the first night.
h_title_comment: Very good hotel in good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene palace Hotel, although in the heart of old Hue, hides down an unprepossessing lane and could easily be passed over as a result....but don't miss it!The service is outstanding, the rooms clean, comfortable and spacious and ours came complete with a large balcony. The breakfast was served at our table and the menu included many western and Vietnamese choices. We enjoyed the breakfast so much we stayed in for dinner one night and were not disappointed. Although the laneway is rather shabby and there is still some nearby construction going on, we were not disturbed at all and felt safe and comfortable walking back to the hotel at night. Hue is such a charming town and the Serene Palace Hotel is right in the cafe/restaurant precinct of the Old Town. After waling and walking one morning we decided to do a river cruise at late notice in the afternoon. Within half an hour of mentioning this at the desk we were being taxied to our own 'private' river boat and had a lovely cruise up the river to a charming 7-tiered pagoda. So easy and no fuss! All in all we were very impressed with our stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it.
h_title_comment: A fabulous hotel hiding down a backstreet lane.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I traveled Vietnam for 5 weeks and stayed in many different hotels during those weeks and Serene Palace is my no 1 favorite. Without any doubts!

Room was beautiful, very big and super comfortable with everything you needed like tv, mini fridge, ac, big comfy beds etc. Breakfast was amazing and you could choose as many options from the menu as you wanted. Staff was super friendly and helped with train tickets, taxi and information about Hue city.

I wish I could go back to Vietnam just to stay here again. To me it was as good as a luxury 5 star hotel for a ridiculously low price. Stay here, you will not regret it!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The Hotel was quite new. They were still some constructions going on. But it didn't bother us. We arrived early due to the fact that we took the sleeper bus from Ninh Bin. But this was not a problem. Our room was ready within 15 minutes. We had a welcome drink and some fruits. And we even had a room upgrade. So this was great. Room was really nice. The hotel is located close to the center and the imperial palace is on walking distance. In de surrounding area there are lots of restaurants and bars. So lots of options. Breakfast was nice too.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel was fine, but the service outstanding. We even had a little situation because we payed with extra 100 dollars, and the staff was so kind they allowed him to finish breakfast and then explained the situation and returned the money back. Not everywhere you see these attitudes!!! Breakfast service and diner also excellent, with extremely good service. I highly recommend.
h_title_comment: Excellent stay thanks to great staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: Everything here went very well. Room was nice and spacious. Staff were very helpful and lots of them always around. The location was quiet and fairly central. The food was very good and enjoyed every meal eaten there. The breakfast was tasty and they make a very good omelet. You can't go wrong booking here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We have been travelling Asia for the past month now and we stayed for two nights and it has been our favourite stay in all of SEA! The staff are incredible to begin with. So helpful and they all speak great English. They checked us into our room very early upon our night bus arrival and greeted us with fruit and drink! The breakfast is amazing! All you can eat and endless fresh fruit! The rooms are impeccable! Fantastic beds and the rooms with balconies are very nice. Great shower, great bed! We had a computer in the room which was great and the WiFi is the BEST in the country! We watched so much Netflix! I would recommend this place to anyone coming hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff is fluent with English, very helpful when you need help. Location is near local attractions, although it is in a medium-sized alley. When I first came here waiting for the room check-in, they offered some drink and fruit which also leave good impressions for us. It is very popular with foreigners.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed only 1 night but in that time we had room service, breakfast a taxi tour and a good night sleep.
Hotel very clean, food from menu very good although breakfast basic.
Rooms very clean.
Hotel down an alley a little out of place but a good hotel non the less.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Having visited the Best Western Premier Indochina Palace in Hue City we found the whole experience excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and the hotel facilities were first class. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would certainly make a point of going there again if we decide to return to Vietnam, and that part of the country.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We slept in this hotel for 2 nights. The driver from the hotel took us from the train station early in the morning. We got some nice fresh fruit and the room was already ready! The hotel lies in the middle of the city town, in a very narrow street. The rooms are big and very clean. The staff is very friendly and can arrange tours ( they booked for us a motorbike tour around Hue and to Hoi An). Breakfast is good with really nice fruit! Very good place to stay in Hue!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
the folks are very nice. The room with a balcony was very nice for the price.

It is not luxury, but the staff does great work. Breakfast is fair, but dinner is very good for the price

set up my transfers, tours and drivers and all were excellent.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace is a good choice to stay at - excellent service, amazing food and very good rooms with everything that you need - all rooms even have a desktop computer!!

Their breakfast is excellent - it is not buffet style. They have a menu from which you can order and the Vietnamese food options are very good. Their restaurant is also very popular in general and you can eat a meal there if need be. Food was very good and their chocolate mousse dessert is absolutely delicious!

It is located walking distance to an area that has quite a decent night life and restaurants around so it is nice. It is a short walk away to the main part of the Perfume River.

Overall, would recommend staying here - complete value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: An oasis in a small street. Nothing was too much trouble for all staff. The restaurant meals fantastic and beautiful cocktails. They also helped with transport to Hoi An. We would differentially stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
for $25/night with breakfast it was a very good deal. rooms were clean, decor was fine, no view. the light in the washroom was a bit abrasive though.
the lady at the desk told us that the perfume river was the most beautiful, it's okay.
just a walk to the restaurant and nightlife/shops area.
service was very nice though all around.
i did like how they were very honest about their private cars and taxi rates.
the hotel did seem quiet because it is down a very narrow alleyway.
great hotel for budget and staying in a casual spot.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is worth a mention even when it has been highly recommended.
