What most travellers may find fairly inconvenient by virtue of its location in a narrow street, the excellent services from all the staff at all levels from the front desk, to the housekeeping, to the dining area more than made up for it.
The triple bedroom on the higher floor was spacious and clean; full room amenities include daily fruit basket, bathrobes, a weighing scale and a desktop computer. We stayed 4 nights and did not encounter any uncomfortable situation at all. Minor requests were efficiently addressed.
The location of the hotel is ideal for travellers who would want to experience the local lifestyle. The market is within walking distance with shops, eateries and restaurants nearby.
Special thanks to Jenny for having arranged complimentary transfer from the railway station to the hotel. She was there at the entrance door to greet us upon arrival, arranged the hotel check-in and again, upon check out.
We would definitely stay here again if we return to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Stayed here with my fiance Nov 2015. First off, you're better off emailing the hotel ahead and asking to get a transfer from the airport. Our taxi driver wasn't sure where it was even after we gave him the address, or he just didn't want to drive down the narrow, almost hidden little alley, so we walked down until we found it. Luckily, it wasn't very far, took us about 2 minutes. Look out for signs for the "Serene Palace Restaurant."

The hotel staff were very attentive and spoke great English. They organised all our tours for us very easily. The room was very spacious and clean with the usual complimentary water, tea, coffee and also fruit which was a nice surprise.

One very minor thing though, the door is a bit stiff and the lock is a bit finnicky. Also, the bed was HUGE! But very comfortable. However, the sheets were actually two blankets layered in such a way to cover the whole bed. This actually worked out better when we took them off and just had one blanket each. These are all very minor things, did not detract from the experience at all.

Breakfast was also extremely good. The set up is not so much a buffet as it is a cafe. They seat you with a menu which has European and Viet options. Try the fried dumplings! Special mention to Sally there who always took care of us, and even packed us a bunch of bananas to take with us when we checked out!

Finally, definitely try the restaurant for lunch and/or dinner! The food was sublime, especially the garlic prawns. And you can get anything you like from the restaurant via room service.

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very friendly staff. Hotel is in a good location, in alley off main road. Restaurants are close by. The restaurant at the hotel has a high rating and we ate there one night. It doesn't have a lot of character, but good food and excellent service. Room was really nice. Like in other hotels in Vietnam, the staff really made a difference with their friendly, helpful service. Would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We only stayed for 2 nights at the Hue Serene Palace but we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. The staff were extrememly friendly and helpful in arranging a private tour of Hue for us they even suprised my husband with a birthday cake on his 60th. The rooms are spacious and the beds comfortable. I especially liked the PC provided in the room as I find typing on a phone difficult at times.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We were upgraded so had a larger room than expected which was a pleasant surprise. The rooms were lovely and the staff were amazingly helpful and friendly. We had some of the nicest meals in the hotel restaurant and the manager got the recipe for one of our favourite dishes. They offered to assist us with booking tours but also gave the option to a take private car for sightseeing. We opted to do this as it gave us the freedom to stop longer or shorter time on the way. Would definitely go back to this hotel
h_title_comment: A great hotel with excellent service
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Friendly staff, good food, nice location, clean rooms.

Got some information about Hue and the things we could do after dropping our luggage at our room.

We even received a room upgrade for free and without asking.

Not much more to add, we enjoyed our stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Hue Serene Palace Hotel is found in a quiet alley not far from the shopping area. The rooms are impeccable and nicely decorated. The food is delicious and well presented. The staff is very friendly and helpful and this is really what makes this hotel outstanding. I wish i could stay more days at this hotel and i highly recommend. Thumbs up for all the staff. Hope to see you again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Don't be alarmed when you drive down the alley (street?) to the hotel. It looks pretty rough. The interior is modest and clean. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent and reasonably priced. The staff are cheerful and very eager to help.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Our stay at the Serene Palace Hotel was short. We only stayed 1 night as we were on our way to Hoi An & Da Nang the next morning.

The room was very spacious. Clean. And nicely decorated. I am a bit of nit pick when it comes to bathrooms and the cleanliness of the bathroom fixtures. This hotel did not disappoint. The WiFi in the hotel worked better than in our hotel in Saigon.

The hotel is located in an alley that is nice and quiet. The location requires you to walk a little bit (500m) to get to the busy street on the south side called Nguyen Thai Hoc to get to the plentiful restaurants and side-walk food stands.I purposely look for hotels in quiet alleys for a bit of peace.

Most appreciated was the staff and the service that we received at this hotel - Serene Palace hotel. My parents and I were very happy with the young adults (recent university grads) who were happy to attend to our needs while also taking the opportunity to practise their English. The English communication skills of the staff was very good. (Disclaimer: I can speak Vietnamese. But like a child who grew up in the South of Vietnam. But, I have a difficult time understanding the strong Vietnamese accent of the Hue region. I prefer to speak in English whenever possible in Vietnam because thinking in English is easier for me. In Hue, it is difficult for me to understand Vietnamese because of the Central Region accent.)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We spent two nights in the hotel, it is well located to the town, restaurants and other sites and the staff were excellent, very happy to assist in any way they could.
They arranged for a car to collect us from the airport and also a car to take us to Hoi An at the end of our stay. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the breakfast is good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This is a very good address .
The hotel is located in a very small street with potholes , when you arrive this is surprisingly , and you are wondering where the taxi is driving you .
It is a calm area , very clean , not far from the the shopping area.
The staff is professional, paying attention at any moment .
We were pleasently surprised , because the price of the room is cheap , but the place is impeccable .
You can book this hotel , eyes closed , you will not be disappointed .
I strongly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Fabulous rooms, staff were delightful and a great location. Make sure you ask for a balcony because the views of the city are worth many an idle moment. Trip Advisor reviewers rate the hotel’s restaurant as one of the best in Hue and dinner certainly was good. However, the breakfast was pretty ordinary for those of us wanting to enjoy Vietnamese foods. The best restaurant we found (and kept returning to) was called the Risotto which is only a short walk away.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Picked up at airport by private driver and delivered to hotel. The staff were just as great as last time. They remembered me from last time and asked where was my dad.

Breakfast was awesome, just like before. Only difference this time is that you can have lunch and dinner at the hotel, which wasn't an option before. I never got to try either lunch or dinner.

The room was very spacious, with lots of space to spare. However the towels and the bedding had stains on them. Nothing serious and I never took it up with hotel staff until check out when they asked for feedback.

Rented a bicycle for 2 days at $2/day to bike around Hue. Very basic bike but it served its function. There was a in room computer and free wifi. Both worked pretty good.

When I checked out. They asked me where I was heading next. I told them I was just going down the alley to the Sinh Cafe office to take the bus, immediately they called a concierge to bring my luggage to the Sinh Cafe without me asking.
h_title_comment: Same as before but not as clean.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: As with it's sister hotel in Hanoi. The Serene has wonderful warm staff. The hotel is a little walk from the center of town. Apart from the restaurant downstairs it doesn't have a lot of facilities, but the staff more than make up for it. They booked us a tour to the city sights and the tour driver was terrific. We received an upgrade with a balcony view which was terrific.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very, very nice hotel with clean and beautiful rooms, great service and an excellent restaurant with the most wonderful staff! We really recommend this place for a stay in Hué and are greatful for a nice stay there with our children.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel were very accommodating, providing us with a map of the town and pointing out main areas for shopping and dining. Due to a family emergency we had to cut our stay short and return home immediately. The staff were able to help us organise our trip home which was most appreciative. The room itself is spacious and comfortable. The attached restaurant is also of high quality. A recommended choice when staying in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Arriving down a small alley, late in the evening we were greeted by the staff who unloaded the car a gave us a welcoming drink. We were taken to our rooms which were decently sized and clean. Our room also had a balcony which overlooked the town.

Unfortunately having arrived quite late the restaurant was shut and so we were advised that there were several open restaurants near by that were open.

Walking down an alley late at night, with little lighting, in an unknown area made me question my choice but within 5 minutes we were on the main street where there are lots of restaurants and bars.

We booked several trips through the hotel which were arranged to suit with a private driver arranged for a very reasonable charge. We visited several tombs and even had a driver take us to Hoi An and My Son for a day, approx 4 hours drive away.

The Imperial Palace is about a 30-45 minute walk from the hotel. We had a car drop us there and walked back which was pleasant along the river and past many department stores.

The staff were all excellent and I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We only had one night at Serene Palace Hotel. The real gem here is the helpful and friendly staff. I booked the dinner by email with Jenny at Serene Cuisine Restaurant for our wedding anniversary celebration. They gave us a surprise with decorated the room, a cake and a bunch of flower. We were upgraded to executive double room on 6th floor. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was cook to order. The food was fresh and delicious. We would definitely come back here again if we come to Hue next time. Highly recommended to everyone!
h_title_comment: Great Anniversary stay with 6 star service!!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed three night at this fantastic hotel. The room on the top floor was spacious and very well equipped. Cool aircon and spotless. Lovely balcony. Very inexpensive. The location is a bit odd as it is down a very inconspicuous laneway. Take a card from reception when you go out. Great restaurant within, known as Serene restaurant which is run independent of the hotel. Has a well deserved No 1 trip adviser rating in Hue. See our separate review.
h_title_comment: Great hotel tucked away in an alley
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here on our silver wedding anniversary. We had let the hotel know it was our anniversary and they decorated the bed bought a cake and flowers. It was a lovely surprise. The staff were outstanding and definitely the hotel's best asset. Both nights of our stay we had dinner in the restaurant. The food was well presented and very tasty. On the 2nd night my wife was feeling unwell and she only had some soup, the staff were very good and sympathetic and made her some ginger tea which they said would help settle her stomach. The next morning they were interested to find out if she was feeling better. Overall our room was excellent, the food very tasty and varied and the staff are the shining stars of this establishment.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very nice hotel where staff makes you feel utterly welcome.Rooms are big and very comfortable. Good bathroom. Breakfast is very nice, plenty of choice and pleasant environment. A pity we only stayed one night because our flight from Hanoi was cancelled due to bad weather. Would gladly have stayed longer and would certainly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed a few nights here in hue and glad we read up on tripadvisor. The hotel was a bit out of the way in an alley but very close to backpacker street and downtown. They offer an amazing breakfast that was served a la carte. Super fast wifi and easily get around without to much of the hassle of trying to dodge traffic. rooms were very clean and had a nice window.
h_title_comment: Lovely Small hotel with attentive staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Just stayed for 3 nights here with my parents. Had to say that this is a wonderful hotel! The room, facilities are good! The service here is best in Hue, or maybe best of Vietnam! I haven't seen any service like this at other places, even in 5 stars hotels of Ho Chi Minh, Da Nang, Ha Noi... Definitely would like to stay here again in the future! The staffs, security guards are doing a great job!
We stayed at rooms with balcony! The price was reasonable!!!
We tried the food at the restaurant and it was great, too!!!

About touring in Hue, everything was great, except for the listening to Hue old music in the big boat on Huong river!!! It can be noisy with alot of people on the boat!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We spent three nights here, the room having been booked for us by our hotel in Hanoi. The hotel picked us up from the airport and we were a little surprised when the driver turned into what appeared to be a single lane alleyway. It was however where the hotel was located, about a hundred metres in. Any concerns we had were, however, immediately dissipated. The staff were friendly and welcoming and check-in was quick and efficient. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable with a bath and shower and a good selection of cable channels. The restaurant was great for breakfast and we ate dinner there two nights. The food was fine and the variety good. The staff there were also excellent and the standard of English could not have been better. Thoroughly recommended.
h_title_comment: Great Hotel in a strange Location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We only stayed in Serene Palace Hotel for one night however the staff managed to assist us in a one day tour of Hue and arranged for a car to take us to Hoi An with various stops during the journey so we can see some further sites. Both were excellent. This was our second stop of our honeymoon trip and we were greeted in our room with flowers, swans and also a cake. It was lovely! Room was clean and spacious. Location of hotel was good, close to a number of restaurants, street food and cafes. Would recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very welcoming on arrival and staff couldn't do enough for you. Really good breakfast available that set you up right for the day. A little disappointed with the evening meal we had and would suggest its worth exploring the city to find others. The room was incredibly comfortable and very clean with a really good view of the city from the balcony. Got a fantastic deal from booking.com which help keep the costs very low.
h_title_comment: Great hotel for our Hue experience
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed in this hotel for just one night last week and really liked it, we wished we could stay longer. Why? Well, the incredibly friendly staff for one and secondly, the big, comfy beds and spacious rooms. We arrived off an overnight sleeper train and they were so welcoming helping with bags, giving us some tasty fruit and juice. The breakfast is another highlight as it's basically all you can eat so definitely worth paying for this. The only thing to be aware of us that it's on a lane, about 3 mins walk off the main road. I'm a girl and although it's not unsafe, I wouldn't have been comfortable walking myself so just stick with one other or get a taxi to the door. A superb hotel and I hope I'll come back one day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel was clean, the rooms were a good side and the facilities in the room were good. It lacked in character or charm compared to the other hotels we stayed in in Vietnam, but the price was great.

We found the hotel a little noisy and had to change rooms three times because the air con broke, which was a low light..,however, the staff did apologise and reduced our bill.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Once we reached Hué and the hotel we were welcomed with fresh fruits and cold beverage. The breakfast is sensation as you can choose how much you want in the variety (of the menu) you want.
As it began to rain we got offered umbrellas and after the return a hot green tea.
Overall a superb recommendation to everyone.
h_title_comment: Awesome service with low prices. A must-book
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The food is really good and cheap
Hospitality of the stuff is incredible. Even they serve free fruit while leaving hotel,
The rooms have computer inside. clean and tidy.
Breakfast is so variete, have local tours also. Love here. Suggest everyone
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Brilliant hotel with helpful and friendly staff at a very good price. Located in the centre of town & a short walk from the citadel this hotel was clean & comfortable with double beds in the twin room as well as your own personal desktop PC a godsend for uploading photos. The restaurant was also the best in town and the all you can eat breakfast was more that you could ask for!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This is another hotel where it's Tripadvisor standing is a puzzle to me. It was clean and staff were efficient but otherwise it was merely functional, lacking in any sort of charm, character or flair; Internally it was bland with cheap finishes.
The bed had a strange two duvet set up which was far too hot. However, when I took the top duvet off, the bottom one was so short that my feet stuck out the end and I am only 5'3"! The pillows were solid.
The bathroom had the most ridiculous bath I've ever seen in a hotel, so short it was impossible to do other than half lie and so narrow that elbows banged against the sides. Because it is a whirlpool bath, there is a nozzle in the end just where the small of the back should go - So uncomfortable!
The room is very noisy and it is possible to hear what is happening from quite a way away.
On the plus side the staff tried hard. A very good driver was arranged to collect us from the airport and he also took us on a tour round the tombs and citadel.
Breakfasts were fairly dull but the lunch we ate in the restaurant was excellent. We did not eat dinner here because the restaurant lacked atmosphere - it was just more fun to go into town to eat.
It was very cheap to stay here and, I guess, we get what we pay for.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nice room, friendly staff, great restaurant!! This hotel was booked for me by an agent so I was not expecting such a nice hotel for the money I spent. I had dinner in the restaurant twice and totally enjoyed both meals. Great flavor great presentation.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Serene Palace stood out as one of the best places we stayed on our trip to Thailand and Vietnam. Our room was beautifully presented with 2 really comfy queen beds, and had all the necessities, such as a fridge, great shower, balcony and it was spacious and very clean. The breakfast was amazing, with fresh juice, Vietnamese coffee (love) and a menu to choose from, you could order as much as you liked...very tasty! The best part was the service, not only did they ensure all our needs were taken care of, but they all seemed genuinely interested in What we were up to and happy to have a chat. This accom is extremely good value for $$.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Staff were very friendly & very helpful. Great location. Rooms clean, not fancy but great for what we needed. I was travelling with my twin girls 13 years and it was perfect for what we needed. They also provided a free taxi service to the shopping areas and back which was great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Cant even describe the week i had here. Everything was perfection. Staff was great food was great. Room was clean and big with a great view. I would definitely come back here again if i come to Hue again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Let me start by saying we did not book this hotel. We had booked a different hotel and they decided to close and go through renovations and transfered our reservations to them. After getting over our initial trepidation we went along to check the hotel out. Much to our surprise it was above and beyond our expectations. Staff is remarkably friendly and courteous. Rooms clean and nicely appointed. Cook to order breakfast included in their restaurant that is also rated one of the best in the city. Location on a quiet sidestreet away from traffic. Do yourself a favor and just book it first. You won't be disappointed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel we were very welcoming and obliging. Restaurant staff were good too. The location was very good. However, we came away with the feeling that whoever designed this hotel and its rooms had never actually stayed in a hotel themselves. The room itself was spacious and reasonably quiet but that's about the best thing I can say about it. The curtains were about 25 cms too short so that light entered under them early morning. Other than a rail in the robe on which to hang clothes, and the total of four tiny drawers in the desk and bedside tables (in which you might just fit a Gideon's bible), there was absolutely nowhere in the room in which to store anything else (underwear etc), which meant we had to leave EVERYTHING in our cases and rummage through them any time we wanted something. Doing this for the four days we were in Hue was very frustrating. The power outlets were in the weirdest places. We could not find anywhere to plug in the electric jug that didn't leave the jug (which had a ridiculously short cord) at a dangerous and preposterous angle. In the end, we placed it on the bench in the bathroom, on top of a book, so that the cord could reach the power outlet there. Admittedly, this hotel was very reasonably priced, but had we known what to expect beforehand we would have gladly paid a few more dollars or dong to get decent basic facilities. Maybe the hotel owners can provide each room with longer curtains, jugs with longer cords, and a chest of drawers, and charge a couple of dollars more. It would certainly make a stay in this hotel so much more pleasant.
h_title_comment: Good staff, room leaves a lot to be desired
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My stay at Serene Palace was indeed serene.. It was also peaceful, and comfortable.

The staff is warm and friendly, they greet you with a smile, a delicious fruit plate and mango juice upon your arrival.

The rooms are clean and very spacious. The balcony was a nice treat, especially after my previous hotel room, which had no windows. An added bonus was the PC in the room - how very thoughtful and convenient! The room is also supplied with bottled water and fresh fruit daily.

Food at the restaurant is FANTASTIC. I loved everything. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and they did not disappoint.

I would absolutely recommend this hotel while in Hue. And I will definitely stay here upon my return.

Thank you all for a wonderful stay!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We Would highly recommend this hotel in Hue.

Good location with friendly staff.

The rooms are large, lovely, clean spacious and with added bonus of balcony.

Breakfast was great

We had an all round pleasant stay here and would highly recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrived in Huê by overnight train and took a taxi from the station to the hotel. We were immediately greeted by staff who helped with our luggage. Check in was efficient and we were treated to a fruit plate and mango juice.

The rooms are spacious with a wonderfully comfortable bed (a delight after the soft sleeper on the train). There is also a pc for you to use in the room if needed. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room and fresh fruit and bottled water supplied daily.

Bathroom is big with a fantastic high pressure shower. Toiletries are supplied. My only complaint with the bathroom (at a push) would be that you couldn't adjust the shower head and so the water tended to leak over the side but this was countered with a recessed drain beside the bath.

Wifi was patchy on my phone but the tablet picked it up ok. Sound transmits, we could hear rooms being cleaned upstairs and footsteps on the stairs quite easily. That said we slept fairly soundly.

Breakfast steals the show. You can order as much from the menu as you like. Tea/coffee/fruit juice. The pancakes and dumplings are delicious.

Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. They are able to arrange bus/train/taxi as needed.

Hotel is a short walk to Pham Ngu Lao where there are plenty of restaurants and bars. It is easily walkable to the citadel in about 25min.

Would definitely stay here again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Serene Palace is on a tiny, messy "street" and so it surprises you to find such a modern, well kept hotel. Lobby is bright, rooms are large and well outfitted. A room with a balcony is an extra treat, giving you the chance to see the husle and bustle of Hue from above the fray. Located 5 minutes from the Perfume River. What makes this very nice (by American standards) building exceptional is the staff. Friendly, courteous, helpful to an extreme. English is spoken. They know you on the first day. Laundry and pressing services are prompt and produce good results. Housekeeping is efficient. The in house Serene Cuisine Restaurant (reviewed separately since it is a different business entity from the hotel) is also excellent. Both the hotel and restaurant are great values. Definately a place to stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
The staff are very helpful and kind. Tuyet (mary) helped me a lot by mail for our trip, booking and transport from hoi an to hue! She also gave us some tips.
The rooms are really nice and comfortable.
We were scamed by the taxi who drive us at the khai dinh tomb but we wanted to go to the citadel....
So we asked the driver to drop us again at the hotel and we complain to the reception.
Tuyet care a lot about us so she offered the late check out because of that incident.
The breakfast and food was excellent! No wonder they are the number one restaurant in hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This was my favourite place to stay when travelling through Vietnam. It was so nice that I extended my stay there!

The staff were so friendly and helpful. They even went to the market and bought me rambutans because I liked them so much.

Our room has a desktop with pretty fast internet which was great as I was travelling with my iPad.

The staff organised tours and transport for me which was all easy to organise.

The staff and food in the restaurnant was awesome.

You will not be disappointed if you stay here.
h_title_comment: Stay here. The staff, the service and the rooms are amazing
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: A small simple hotel convenient for the town. The room was a reasonable size, had a balcony with chairs and table, the shower room was good, it was clean and comfortable. The food was good and the staff was nice. The only thing. was a lack of efficiency on some things but staff are so nice it doesn't really matter - we just had to follow up on some things we asked for - like a simple packed breakfast to go when we left early on a day trip as it got forgotten despite us asking twice the day before. We thought it probably would get forgotten based on other things we had asked for so we went down early to ask again in the morning and the kitchen staff were very happy to do it on the spot. The taxi bookings and pick up/drop off from Da Nang we made through the hotel were all handled efficiently and all worked fine.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed at Serene Palace Hotel 2 years ago, when they first opened. It was excellent then and still excellent now. The staff remembered me and welcomed my return. It felt like coming home. The service is still awesome. The staff is soooo friendly! The breakfast is in a very comfortable area and has a wide variety of Western and Asian foods. Mary Truong is such a wonderful asset to the hotel. I met her on my first stay, and contacted her when I was making my travel plans to return to Hue. She helped me by making my bookings for the rooms I needed and transfers from the train station and to the airport. She also arranged an all day scooter tour for us, which we enjoyed very much. I highly continue to recommend this hotel to other travelers.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This hotel is a sister to the Charming 2 Hotel in Hanoi and has the same superb ethic of extremely friendly and attentive service. Serene Palace is a new-seeming boutique hotel, with everything sparkling and well maintained and the rooms quite enormous. It is situated in a side-street which also houses several little clubs and bars and a couple of other small hotels, plus ordinary residential. Sounds noisy, but isn't. Like all tourist accommodation in Hue, the hotel is situated on the other side of the river from the famous Citadel, and is a pleasant walk away from all central sights for anyone at all fit. The attached restaurant provides a really superb included breakfast, and is a handy place to try out local dishes for dinner in scrupulously clean surroundings.
The service at reception, from the bellboys, the cleaning staff and the restaurant staff was faultless, and always performed with a charming smile. It is a nice touch that reception staff wear traditional dress. My wife and I spent four nights at Serene Palace, and will come back for longer when next in Vietnam. Special thanks to Julia and Emily.
Thoroughly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I booked a room for 1 night via booking.com. Heard about good service and especially the famous restaurant. I required a parking place for our car. When we are there, they told us that they only had free parking place for 4- 7 seats car. We had a 16 seats car so we had to move to other place and had to pay for that. I told them it seemed like cheating as they hadn't mentioned about the car size required before. When I checked out, the asked me about the fee I had paid for car parking and they offered to pay me back. That's so kind.
About the room, its very nice. Room was clean, berth and pillow was soft and very comfortable.
Staffs were nice, welcomed us with smiles and helpful with motorbike rental and road guide(Receptionist and Bellman). And when we got back the hotel late in the evening, the Bellman still awake and waited for us.
Breakfast was not as I expected. They didn't serve buffet for breakfast and I had to choose the Menu with not really much of dishes.
Anyway, this is a good hotel :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel was very clean and staff is very friendly and welcoming.
We stayed in so many hotels in Vietnam this has the best restaurant.
This restaurant had the best Pho (Hue style)
Perfect location with plenty of good food available nearby
h_title_comment: Great hotel with excellent customer service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at Serene place 12 months ago on our last trip. This trip we took our good friends with us and did not hesitate to say here again. the staff are very welcoming and could even recall us from our last visit. We had booked the Superior rooms but found on checking in that they had upgraded us to the city view rooms. the location is in a quiet lane way with easy access to Hue activities. a short walk takes you to the river front and near by restaurants. we loved to eat at their restaurant and also tried dining out. they arranged all out transfers from the airport and they can also recommend and arrange various tours. All the staff are very pleasant and friendly, their smiles were always there to greet us.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We wished we could have stayed more nights as this was one of the best hotels my wife and I have stayed in. We are in our seventies and have travelled a great deal. The staff treated every guest as if they were royalty. When our cab pulled up in front of the hotel four or five staff came out to help and greet us. The manager should be very proud of his employees. A great big thank you to all the staff at this great hotel. Keep smiling and doing a great job.
h_title_comment: Spent one night here as part of a tour.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Wonderful 3 night stay at Serene.
First impressions of this wonderful, friendly hotel in Hue are misleading. It's situated in a non-description narrow road, the entrance is rather plain and the restaurant looks very functional. But don't be deceived! The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms spotlessly clean, comfortable and spacious, and the food in the restaurant is terrific. 'Sally' runs the restaurant. She and her team love to engage with the guests, and if you join in you will be treated to a lot of fun and laughter, but whatever you do you will receive attentive service. We ate in the restaurant every morning and had some evening meals. We were not disappointed, enjoying really excellent food for very little money. This is a lovely hotel which is brilliant value - you will be pleased you decided to stay there!

From the moment you step into the Serene Palace you are aware of a full and warm welcome. The staff fall over themselves to be warm, helpful and friendly. The staff here, from the door men, the service desk, the kitchen staff to housekeeping are fantastic. Nothing is too much trouble. From organising tours, helping with local information, providing airport pick up and drop off . Centrally located (walk) to restaurants and nightlife, this hotel offers just about everything that a traveller could want. Absolutely great value for the price! The rooms a spacious and comfortable, qualities that we have come to expect from Vietnamese hotels. We have no trouble in recommending the Serene Palace Hotel to anybody tavelling to Hue.The staff understand English fairly well also. Thank you Mary, and colleagues..
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: First impressions of this wonderful, friendly hotel in Hue are misleading. It's situated in a non-description narrow road, the entrance is rather plain and the restaurant looks very functional. But don't be deceived! The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms spotlessly clean, comfortable and spacious, and the food in the restaurant is terrific. The remarkable 'Sally' runs the restaurant. She and her team love to engage with the guests, and if you join in you will be treated to a lot of fun and laughter, but whatever you do you will receive attentive service. We ate in the restaurant one evening, noticing it was 1st in the Trip Advisor ratings for Hue. We were not disappointed, enjoying really excellent food for very little money. This is a lovely hotel which is brilliant value - you will be pleased you decided to stay there!
h_title_comment: Wonderful! Great value for money too.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Loved my time at serene palace hotel. I stayed 8 nights and found everything to be exemplary. Huge complimentary breakfasts. Large comfortable rooms. Lovely staff that are very sweet. I will definitely stay again. Do try the chocolate mouse, its incredible!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: From the moment you step into the Serene Palace you are aware of a full and warm welcome. The staff fall over themselves to be warm, helpful and friendly. We have stayed in a lot of hotels in Vietnam (our fourth trip) and the staff here, from the door men, the service desk, the kitchen staff to housekeeping are fantastic. Nothing is too much trouble. From organising tours, helping with local information, providing airport pick up and drop off or just extra pillows late at night. Centrally locates to restaurants and nightlife, this hotel offers just about everything that a traveller could want. Absolutely great value for the price! The rooms a spacious and comfortable, qualities that we have come to expect from Vietnamese hotels. We have no trouble in recommending the Serene Palace Hotel to anybody tavelling to Hue.
h_title_comment: Reluctant street appeal reveals a brilliant gem.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel by far was the best place we stayed in Vietnam over our two week stay!

Pros:
- room was spacious and clean
- breakfast each morning was spectacular
- the hotel team really did a good job to make guests feel comfortable
- amazing value for the quality of hotel

Cons:
- if I had to think of a con, the location although perfect for sightseeing was located in a small alley. The hotel was a bit of a challenge to find on arrival.

We would stay here again without thinking twice!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We traveled as a group and all booked rooms in the Hue Serene for three nights in Hue. The hotel was one of the best we stayed in at this price point throughout the country in terms of room size (very large), cleanliness, natural light, decor/upkeep, and staff service. It is located in an alley and easy to find. The higher floors have great views as well. Rates include breakfast, which is mostly standard for VN. Highly recommend the Hue Serene for this star rating.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
For this price, it is the best hotel I ever stayed at. Welcome drinks and fruits, decent breakfast, very spacious and clean room and amazing staff with very good English skills! The room even came with a desktop computer.
The hotel is located in an alleyway in the centre of tourist area - it's quiet, but all the restaurants and cafe are in walking distance.
h_title_comment: Lovely hotel with the best service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel is located in the heart of the city, only a short walk to everything (specialities, eateries, nails, spa...) Yet, you no need to waste money at outside spas as the room itself has a spacious bathtub. We arrived at the hotel after a long drive from Hoi An. I had a carsickness, the staffs was so attentive that they gave me fresh glass of passion fruit, cool towels and medicated oil. After soaking in bathtub, I felt so unwind. Staffs always lovely, helpful as they advised me some travel tips when in Hue.
Love this hotel the most. Obvious come back and highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very very good place ! The room is clean and big, the breakfast is generous, the staff so nice and the location is very quiet. And it's not to expensive. We arrived late the first day and they were very understanding. Everything was perfect, I definitly recommand this hotel !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We only stayed one night but everything was good. We had dinner in the restaurant, the staff were lovely and the food was good.
I liked breakfast because you could choose from a large menu and they would make it fresh for you. I only ordered one dish but the waitress said you could order whatever you wanted.
The room was clean and comfortable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Overall, Hue Serene Palace is a fantastic place to stay particularly given the price tag. However, we experienced a couple things that cause pause and should be voiced.

The Good: The cleanliness of this hotel for the price and location is absolutely astounding. The decor inside the room is new. The beds are incredibly comfortable. I can't believe we paid $17 USD for the room. Yes, they each have a desktop computer included in the room. Flatscreen TV, plenty of channels in English as well as strong wifi. Daily fruit and water are provided in the room.

Breakfast deserves some special accolades. It's beyond generous! ALYC and we ate our room rate's worth daily.

Could be improved: Aside from the many TA mentions of the hotel's location, I concur that the dirt, potholed road leading to the alley of karaoke bars is not ideal.

The other three areas that need attention include: the restaurant staff implying improper "services" provided to guests; the ease in extending stays and noise.

1) This is hard to report, as the restaurant staff is so kind. However, it deserves a mention. Restaurant staff commented at EVERY meal about my male travel partner - his looks, his relationship status, etc. One night, he ordered take away and they stated he could have room service instead. He was then asked which waitress he would like to bring up his meal. He asked for clarification and was then told that all the staff like him, so he could choose who brought his food to his room. It takes a lot to make a 6'4" white American man uncomfortable, but this offer absolutely did.

Hue has a huge issue with both prostitution and drugs. After several days of interactions with the staff, I could tell they are really nice women and tend to joke around a bit with guests. I don't think it was meant as a prostitution offer. However, to imply that he could have his pick of waitresses to bring food up to his bedroom could really put staff at risk had he expected anything other than the simple delivery of food. It should be addressed so the staff are kept safe (and wives and girlfriends don't get upset).

2) Upon expressing an interest in extending our hotel stay, it was a bit of a hassle to negotiate the same booked rate we found online. I prefer to have the hotel receive my money directly upon extension, rather than a 3rd party taking their cut, especially if I at all like the hotel. In my attempt to extend my $17 rate ($20.18 with tax), I was offered $32/night. When stating what I paid, I was told that was impossible, they didn't offer such a low rate. After pulling it up on the 3rd party site, staff then said it was a $17 rate with $8 in taxes. Again, I had to show them what I paid, tax inclusive. We went back and forth and I was finally offered the same rate. It should have been a bit more clearcut to provide them with my money.

3) the design of the hotel encourages noise to travel from floor to floor of this hotel. Guests slamming doors, yelling, running up and down the stairs at all hours is really disruptive requiring rear plugs. They've installed a door from the ground floor to floor two, muffling the breakfast noise so many other TripAdvisor reviews mention. These soundproof doors should be installed at least floor to floor. It would be even better to have these doors (the same as the bathroom doors) installed as the doors to each room. They would eliminate the noise issue.

Tip: Metered taxis from the train station are only 40K. Don't let them talk you into anything more than 50K.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I can't thank all the staff enough for looking after me so well. I left Hanoi for Hue and was collected by taxi at the train station which I must add the Hotel had arranged and paid for. On arrival the reception I received was so nice. So friendly. My room was great. Everything you could possibly need. Flat screen TV. Great bathroom and shower. Spotless clean. Venturing out the staff at reception had a map for me and gave me great advice with directions and advice about where to go and what to see and they will arrange tours if required. My stay was to short , only a few days but a home from home. I will go back next year for a longer stay. Thanks to every and a special thanks to Mary an excellent receptionist.
👌👌👌👍👍👍😊😊😊
h_title_comment: Mr. Patrick Fagan. Irish and proud.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Food was a delightful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were large and clean with comfortable beds. We arrived early in the morning after an overnight train, the staff immediately offered up fresh fruit and cool drinks while we waited for a few minutes while they worked to get our rooms ready 4 his before the allocated check in time. They quickly organised a good day tour for our group and nothing was too much trouble for them.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The staff really make this place, friendly helpful and a lot of fun. The rooms are large and clean with comfortable king bed. Food in restaurant was delicious and the breakfast was plentiful.
Karaoke bar next door and a fun bar two doors down. What more can you ask of a back-alley hotel?

Stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This people who work at this hotel are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is clean as could be and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. The restaurant is so good you'll eat there a few times. You can't go wrong here!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This Hotel was very good for what you expect out of a 3 star hotel.
It was clean, relatively close to everything.
Hotel Staff was very friendly and always ready to help.
Check in was pretty fast even if we arrived earlier.
its walkable to most areas.
Good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed there for 2 nights with our child. The room is spacious and beautiful, clean and quiet, with good views of the city.
Downstairs is an OK restaurant, a good option when raining outside.

The city itself is lovely, with a huge and super interesting and local market. A Must
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We were very happy with our four night stay at the Serene Palace. The room was huge and the bed was a little more comfortable than some we have had. We had a handheld shower over the bath but I would have liked a hook to put it on so I could actually get under the shower. Wifi worked well and the staff were very helpful. We booked our tours and a private car to Hoi An through the hotel. The prices seemed very reasonable to us. The location was good for exploring though our taxi driver the first night went past the lane. Luckily I saw the sign for the restaurant. We were very happy here and recommend the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: With no doubt 100% value for money! The hotel is well located, has good comfortable rooms (with various movie channels), delicious food and last but not least a great friendly staff. Staff takes all the time to help and inform you as good as possible.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This was a fantastic little hotel with a big comfortable room and bed with a great balcony overlooking the city.
The service was outstanding with a great breakfast and the staff treated you like a guest in a Vietnamese home (they kept trying to feed you) a personal touch. The Hotel is located on a dirt back lane the only detraction from staying here. This does reflect the price you pay.
I would recommend this hotel.
h_title_comment: Great little hotel Shame about the location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The staff was very efficient. We had to change our train tickets as we needed to take an earlier train to Dong Hoi in order not to miss the Paradise Cave 7km tour. They did everything for us (had to pay a 4usd service fee to the hotel and 20% to change the tickets for the train station).
Our hotel room was clean and the bathroom was quite big. The location was not that great though: in a small and dark alley, which is not comfortable to walk around at night. The breakfast was nice and you can choose whatever you want from their breakfast menu. The dumpling was the man tou, which was a bit disappointing. The Pho and the fried eggs+sausages were nice. I liked the vietnamese coffee with sweet milk!
Do not take their pick up service as it is totally overpriced!
h_title_comment: Well trained staff and good organized
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Arguably the best hotel we stayed in during our 3 weeks in Vietnam. Reasonable airport transfer with a patient driver who had to wait for our delayed flight, and who stopped along the way for us to take photos. Then the welcome drink and fruit on our arrival, and fresh fruit in the room each day. The restaurant was very high quality. We normally don't eat at hotel restaurants, but here, we did. Exceptional quality and variety from a superb chef. Room was spacious and comfortable, with above average amenities. Staff was patient and helpful with our travel needs. Would definitely stay here again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Well ocupied room.
Food in hotel's restorant was excellent.
The staff are doing what ever they can to make you fill comfortable.
Bad, the manager of the hotel not allow the staff at the front desk to suggest the best deal for the turist but tries to sell its own option like private expensive car to get to Hoi An instead of a VAN with six persons at one fifth of the price even if you ask if there is other optio.
Sally the supervisor of the kitchen is very service minded and her staff as well.
Also the staff of the front desk was very helpfull at any request.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This was a simple, and affordable hotel in the middle of town. Rooms were exactly as the picture, very clean and modern. The staff were EXCEPTIONAL. They were super friendly and accommodating in a very genuine way. The food was also EXCEPTIONAL. Seriously, the breakfast was a la cart and delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel to every person going to Hue. However, I was very disappointed with the 2 tours and 1 car with hired through them. The private tour to the tombs was basic but the driver took us to our first horrible meal in Vietnam, and pricey! The other private car we hired to go to Hoi An not only did NOT take us to the places were were told we would go, but also took us to the worst meal I have had in Vietnam and pretty much anywhere else. It was so bad that the owner even gave me my money back. Do your research about tours and get them elsewhere! Serene Palace should also reconsider who they recommend, as it really affects their reputation.
h_title_comment: Great hotel but find your tours elsewhere
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was the best one we've stayed at during this trip. The friendliness of the staff, the food in the restaurant (free breakfast included!), the rooms itself... Everything was beyond our expectations for a 3-star hotel. Don't be alarmed when you first arrive at the hotel; the exterior feels a bit sketchy, but the inside is a wonderful oasis!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Really good local hotel, friendly staffs, speaking good english, close to the bar and restaurant street, came here last year. Hue people very sweet and friendly, the breakfast was ok. Good price for a local clean hotel with good service...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Staff are and facilities are fantastic. We all loved our stay here very much so. Breakfast was amazing, best I've had in Vietnam. Excellent value. Great location with plenty of good food available nearby as well as the hotel restaurant being good. Thanks for a great stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Good hotel. Not exceptional but very good. The size of the cheapest room is great considering the price. The location is central although is a bit hidden, not in a Main Street. The personnel is correct. The breakfast is very good and the personnel attending the breakfast is extremely kind!
h_title_comment: Good hotel, in particular the size of the room for the price it costs
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The first thing that blew us away about Hue Serene Palace was the service. The staff were so helpful and accommodating, and they went out of their way to get to know us without being obsequious. The property is new and clean and a really great value. The location is great. The breakfasts are delicious. We enjoyed everything about our stay here. Hello to Ivy in the restaurant! Ivy, if you read this, you were a favorite part of our stay there! :)
h_title_comment: Amazing staff, nice clean new property, great food
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The place is clean and well run, but the topper is the welcoming attitude and goodwill of the staff at the hotel and in the restaurant. They ask about your day, and suggest good tours and driver options. The restaurant staff is very pleasant and they want you to try all their delicious food. Really a welcoming place to stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. Trips by cab company they use to each tourist attraction is very inexpensive compared to Hanoi which was uncomfortably expensive from the hotel; however finding an english speaking local to drive you around for the day for a quarter of the price was no issue. Location is good, within a half hour of all attractions by car or motor bike. Half hour from the Ana Mandara Resort on the beach which is fantastic for an empty private beach and spa.
Room was hot and took hours to cool down each time when returning to it and spent the first evening sweating in bed until it cooled down. No shower, only a jacuzzi tub with a shower nozzle attachment that extended about 2 feet. Also the windows arent sound proof and you can hear yelping and barking dogs periodically that can wake you up.
Great view of the city and mountains from the room window, and large balcony.
Food is very good and inexpensive at the restaurant.

Overall a good experience
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Only stayed here for a night but all the staff in the hotel and restaurant were very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are good size and clean, just what we needed! They are very helpful and recommend what you should visit and do in Hue. Would recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel in a good location with friendly and helpful staff and spacious comfortable rooms. I've been to nearly 60 countries and this is one of the best value hotels I've ever stayed in. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The Hotel was clean, the front desk staff were all very helpful and welcoming. The restaurant staff were so nice and the best I have seen in all of Hue, Vietnam. The food at the restaurant was very tasty. We had a great stay at your hotel. Well done everybody!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Everything is good !!!All the staff here were super friendly, from receptionist to restaurant staff. They were all very personal in their service.The restaurant is ranked no.1 on TripAdvisor. You could order anything off the menu for breakfast and mind you, the food is super tasty.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We were in many hotels in our trips across Vietnam and this one is by far the best we ever had. You feel like a king in there. If you want to visit Hue for few days, this is the right place for you.
Pros: everything.
Cons: nothing.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Staff were lovely people who were full of amazing things to say! They were also very helpful in the fact of we needed anything booked they would do it for us! Always a smile on their face and just genuinely good people! Very happy with the service they provided! The breakfast was good, although I have defiantly had better I am not going to complain! The restaurant downstairs is awesome and would recommend aswell!!! Overall would recommend to anyone who asked about where to stay in Hue! And also great location!!!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: My parents and I were in Hue for the very first time and our guide assigned us this hotel. When we were walking in the alley from the main road, we thought this hotel might just be the worse we will stay in Vietnam. Well, we were proven very wrong. As soon as we were at the entrance, the staff took great care of us, offered to carry our luggage, offered us a welcome drink with a plate of fruits. Then they carried our luggage to our room, got our room ready and then showed us the way to our room. All the staff here were super friendly, from receptionist to restaurant staff. They were all very personal in their service. The room itself is the best we have stayed in during our whole trip in Central Vietnam. Too bad it was only for a night. The restaurant is ranked no.1 on TripAdvisor. You could order anything off the menu for breakfast and mind you, the food is super tasty. We had our dinner in the restaurant as well, with a discount as in-house guests. I have never had a better stay than here. They even went all the way to send me an email after my stay to thank us for staying. My parents and I all agreed totally that this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in! Oh, the hotel is slightly off the main road so it's quiet and you can definitely have a good sleep.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We only stayed for one evening, but we really enjoyed our stay. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel and would highly recommend it- the food was amazing!

The only thing I would avoid against doing is booking your transport/car service in Hue through the hotel as we paid $35 to go to three different places (excluding entrance fees) and we could have paid a LOT less if we just booked separate taxis. It was convenient, but not the cheapest option.

Overall we would recommend this hotel though. The staff we excellent- very polite and had lots of information to share. Many thanks
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I don't know where to start! This hotel was unbelievably good, BOOK NOW! The location is perfect just off the main strip. Initially the street looks a little off the beaten track but that is a good thing, it's down a little alleyway so it's quiet and with no disturbance.

The friendly welcome, fruit juice and plate of fruit was much appreciated in the heat. Our room did not disappoint, clean, tidy. Had a safe and fridge, bath robes, TV. Everything you could need. Shower excellent.

Breakfast was a feast with a choice of western or vietnamese cuisine, or both! Plus a self service fruit buffet. The breakfast was in the restaurant which was itself a very decent eating spot and we chose to eat back at the hotel for a couple of nights because it was that good.

Lastly, service from everyone was outstanding. I can't rate this hotel enough. I recommend you stay here!
h_title_comment: Marker by which all other hotels will be compared!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Service at its best, clean, very good interiors, good beddings, safe, fantastic breakfast, friendly staff, these are just the beginning of the best that you will experience at Serene Palace. We were a family of 4 and marvelled our stay. Well my daughter happen to get a very good news from her Uni while we were at Serene. I indescretely asked for a cake to be ordered and presented during our dinner. This was to congratulate my daughter -- well it all went so well -- right from the way the cake was presented, music played by the staff and the dinner that was served amidst all these.

It was as if we were in a wonderland! If you plan to spend a night or two ar Hue, well Serene Palace is just the place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Great and very clean hotel, georgeous food, perfect rooms for little money. Big modern bathroom, nice bed, personal computer in room, very speedy WLAN and the kindest staff we had. Thank you for the wonderful time, we felt home.
h_title_comment: The very best hotel during our stay in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We've just stayed In this hotel couple of night and be amazing with the facility and service here . The stuffs in front desk are so friendly,helpful and dynamic . They have suggested us every thing nearby . Just around $30/room/night but we get more worthy than we pay .It is so clean and convenient , the bed is the most comfortable comparing with other hotel that I've stayed In Viet Nam . highly recommend for everyone
h_title_comment: the best hotel I've stayed - Serene hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
As soon as you enter the place, you are greeted by friendly and helpful staff with a complimentary drink and fruit. They quickly checked me in and took me into my room immediately (via elevator), especially great after an overnight train from Hanoi. I was even a few hours early for check-in but they still accommodated me. Brilliant!

Beautiful and clean room, which had complimentary fruit and water daily. This was about $25USD, bathroom and room itself is very spacious and modern. Safe is there for you to store valuables, Desktop computer there, tv and wifi too should you need it, closet with hangers along with some beautiful ornaments for the room. Almost felt museum-like.

Tip for room: One with windows. I was in a room with windows, but was covered up because it'd mean staring out into the corridoor. The room I had was in between rooms with window views, but they later upgraded me to a room with a balcony and massage bath. I think because of my earlier than expected check-in, I got the first room. Not that I mind, I was there for a really short 2 night stay. I was just grateful!

Staff are so friendly and very accommodating. Sourced me a driver to do my own personal itinerary when I called from room. Sorted in 10 mins. Staff provided great advice for tours, temples and local spots - found a really good restaurant - can't recall now, but oh so delicious! I went there a lot! Ask them! It might pay to take someone who can speak vietnamese with you for translations. I took my driver the first time, then they just knew my order eventually...

Driver via hotel = $15USD or so for the whole day. Found a tad pricey for what I'd received throughout Vietnam, but didn't have the time to go out and barter. Driver was friendly but relaxed. Watch out though, I found he'd take me through certain routes because he 'needed' to, but really gave locals the opportunity to try sell me things. I'd find myself being shown how to make essences then all of a sudden, I'd be looking at someone selling me postcards, paintings whatever while my driver was just sitting casually within the store staring back at me. So I just took it as an opportunity to chat with locals and gain some insight into their way of life

Aside from that, hotel is very nice! Breakfast is tasty (and free as part of the deal I got with hotel) and a lot of options both western or traditional. I went for plenty of rounds of banana choc pancakes, eggs and Vietnamese dishes. Really tasty and made to order. Location wise, it's a bit of a walk to the Emperors (about 10-15 mins), but it gives you the chance to just soak in more of Hue, because it's beautiful

When checking out, the hotel let me store my things there while I tiki-toured some more and when I came back, I was pouring sweat that they let me into a room that was free to freshen up before hitching a ride back to the train station to leave for Hoi An. Absolutely wonderful of them!

I highly recommend Serene place without any hesitation! Great value for money and I hope I have the chance to come back
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This is an amazing hotel for the amount of money that you pay. The rooms are clean and $45 deluxe room even has a spa pool. The breakfast is good, especially the Vietnamese food (try the fried dumplings) and the fruit selection. Close enough from riverside so that you can walk to the night market etc. Only thing is that the deluxe room is gigantic and takes a while to cool down even with the aircon at full force, and some staff spoke poor English. Overall good value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Fresh fruits on arrival, breakfast included (and what a breakfast it is!). Well located, and the restaurant in the hotel is absolutely amazing, it was the best dinner I have had in Vietnam. The staff were super friendly, and we had a lovely view of the Hue rooftops from our room. The room was very comfortable, and they even had some fresh fruit in the room for us too.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Being on honeymoon in Vietnam makes you feel very special and the Serene Palace Hotel made sure we felt welcome. Our modern room was decorated with flowers, swans and cake with Happy Honeymoon emblazened across it. After a day of sightseeing we were always all to happy to collapse on to our comfortable bed and enjoy the cool ac!

The customer service was superb and every morning at breakfast they insisted that we stuff ourselves silly before we started the day! Indeed, they looked disappointed when we only went back for three times. We also enjoyed an excellent 4 course dinner in the restaurant, which is worth a try!

We loved Hue and the Serene Palace Hotel contributed to our wonderful stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were offered a free upgrade to a bigger room. Not only was the room great, but also the food was excelent. Do not be afraid of the strange location, it is worth to give it a try. Staff is very handsome and it makes possible to have a great experience at the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Four of us (two adults and two kids) checked into the family room, which is spacious, welcoming and comfortable with two king-sized beds and a large bathroom en-suite. Hotel staff are friendly, dedicated, helpful and welcoming. The hotel, which is modern but tastefully decorated, offers good wifi, a solid breakfast choice, and a welcome refreshments and fruits upon checking-in. There is an elevator and the hotel is set in a quiet location but in close proximity to restaurants, the Perfume River and the night market. We stayed for three nights, one of which was non-consecutive and the hotel watched over our luggage left behind for the night we were away.
Hard to think of something we didn't like.
h_title_comment: Modern, clean, well-run, comfortable hotel with spacious rooms
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This is top rated for a good reason.
Stay here and you will not be disappointed. Top notch service and care and a budget conscious price point.

Everyone is great and friendly here- the beautiful ladies at reception are so lovely and welcoming. They are very happy to suggest tours and things to do in Hue.

The same goes for the staff of their top rated restaurant - they are genuinely friendly and engage you in conversation during your meals.

The rooms are super comfortable and very well equipped with computers.

You cannot go wrong here. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: A fantastic hotel in Hue. Staff are amazing, so friendly and cannot do enough to help. Food in the restaurant was very good and a buffet breakfast with the option of ordering further items on the menu. Great location also! Definitely recommend other people to visit for the money - fantastic value!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Fantastic stay! Beautiful, clean room with a lovely bathroom. We had a top floor, east facing room which was very quiet and great for watching the sunrise. The staff in the hotel are amazing. Really helpful, friendly and very professional. Great location for exploring Hue (it's down an alley way but really easy to find), they organised a great driver (hello Brian!) to take us sightseeing and a boat to take us down the Perfume River. The restaurant in the hotel is great, breakfast was good and we also ate there on our first night. Try their Hue specialty menu - delicious and great value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is really value for money. The staff makes everything perfect with their friendliness, advice, politiness, thinking with you, etc. Also the bed is really nice to sleep in. Really soft and comfy. The pc on the room is very convinient as we had to sort out something. Its a bit slow. Breakfast is really good. They have a wide variaty of choice. The restaurant is also good and also value for money. Only thing i missed was a pool. I would go back here for sure!
h_title_comment: Great hotel, especially due to the staff!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel, particularly the wonderful and friendly staff. Our Halong Bay tour got cancelled so we switched our plans very last minute and went to Hue earlier than planned to see the Phong Nha caves. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us and got everything organised in a matter of hours. All of the tours that we did through them were fantastic and good value. An added bonus that we didn't realise until we arrived is that they're one of the top rated restaurants in Hue and for good reason - we had excellent mojitos and traditional food!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
I booked a room at this hotel for a three-night stay on the basis of the very good reviews on Tripadvisor. I wondered if it could be as good as the review suggested. It is. The quality of this hotel is better than many other much more expensive alternatives.
As other reviews have pointed out the location of the hotel is less than perfect, down a narrow lane which when rain falls becomes muddy and covered with puddles. It is however in the centre of the ‘Tourist area” and there are many cafes, restaurants, bars etc in the surrounding area. However it is worth navigating the lane for the quality of the hotel when you arrive.
I had booked a front facing room on a higher floor. The room was large, very clean and with modern furniture. The bed was very comfortable. A computer was provided in the room and wifi was free, fast and stable. The air con was easily controllable and quiet. The water pressure in the shower good and warm water arrived very quickly. My room rate included breakfast . This provided both western and Vietnamese options, and I tried both during my stay, there is also a range of fruit and breads and pastries to which you help yourself buffet style. Overall the breakfast was good without being exceptional.
However what was in my view exceptional was the professionalism, efficiency, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff – all of the staff. I visit many hotels for both business and pleasure, some of them far more expensive that the Serene Palace; some have one or two staff whom one remembers for their efficiency or helpfulness, but I have never stayed in any hotel where ALL the staff have been so exceptional in both the performance of their duties, in their friendliness, whilst never being intrusive, and in going the “extra mile” to help. Well done Serene Palace staff you are a remarkable team.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This is a nice spotlessly clean hotel. The staff are wonderful and the hotel restaurant has lovely tasting food. Short walking distance to river. We had a room on the 7th floor with a balcony, nice for an evening drink. I found the spa bath a bit awkward to get in and out of, however that's just me as I like a seperate enclosed shower.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Serene Hotel is down a side alley, but the driver made it easy and come to find out it is within walking distance of the main drag, so once we arrived we could find it Very Simply. Comfortable rooms with a Free Computer & High Speed WiFi, Flat Screen TV, AC, über Comfortable Bed and Fresh Fruit. And the view from the Balcony was Stellar... A Perfect place to stay – best of all it's was like $20 per night... And has One of the Best Restaurants we ate at on our entire trip – Serene Cuisine. They serve Vietnamese Cuisine & Hue Local Foods. The Wait Staff is Wonderful – Hello Piglet... This is a Must Stay, Must Dine (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner & Drinks)...
h_title_comment: Great Location, Great Price, Amazing Restaurant...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The service is amazing, the bed and pillows are insanely comfortable, rooms are super clean, shower has high water pressure, room has a flat screen tv and a computer. Breakfast buffet was just ok , but for free breakfast, what more can you ask for. My husband had an omelette abd said it was excellent. The staff is so attentive and accommodating. I would stay here again and again and again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
From the warm greeting and welcome drinks upon arrival to the delicious all-you-can-order breakfast on our departure, this hotel was by far the best of our 10-day trip to Vietnam - beating even higher star hotels that we stayed at. Rooms were plenty big and clean, and even had a computer for personal use. Restaurant is even ranked #1 in Hue - it's a win win! (The chocolate mousse is the best I've had anywhere in the world.) And most importantly, service was beyond compare.

Definitely recommend it to everyone, definitely would stay here again.
h_title_comment: Best Hotel of my visit to Vitenam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Stayed here early July 2 015 superb rooms with queen size bed's computers in each room and outstanding service on front desk staff could not do enough to help!
I would definitely return and recommend this hotel.
HUE is a lovely town and the Citadel is worth exploring + nice restaurants and a very good day market for purchasing products
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My best hotel in Vietnam. This should be a 5 star hotel.
The hotel is modern, elegant. Even the towels in the bath room have a parfum smell. The staff is super, so helpful. The rooms are beautiful. Clean hotel. Every thing is the perfection in this hotel. Wow. I am impressed. Thank you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed for a night in Serene Hotel. Its one of the best budget hotels i have stayed.. excellent service, really high speed wifi ( with own desktop for the rooms) & the best restaurant in town! Their food was delicious..

Its located in a narrow lane & hence i suggest you to have a flash light if you are walking in the night..
h_title_comment: Excellent service, delicious food.. this hotel is oustanding in all aspects
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We found this hotel on TA, while planning our family trip to Vietnam. We were very happy with our stay there, athough it was only 1 night! Through an exchange of emails we arranged for airport pickup at Danang airport, for a private tour of of Hue .. and basically for everything. The staff is very helpful!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Immediately on our arrival, we were greeted with delicious freshly pureed watermelon juice. Our room was spacious with great views from the balcony. Fruit selection in the room and at breakfast were the best we had in the country. Staff spoke very good English and helped us make the most of our short stay in Hue, including arranging a very reasonable private car to take us to major sites so that we didn't have to deal with walking in the heat or being stuck with a big tour group. Dinner at the restaurant was very good. Only issue was some construction going on in the hotel, but it was only during the day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here at the Serene Palace Hotel in July 2015 for 3 nights - we scored a room upgrade for free (good start).
Lovely Hotel with elevator and very helpful staff - not too over the top service but very efficient and detailed.
Great advice about local restaurants and attractions from the lovely reception staff and map provided (we like to wander).
