h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is right in the center just half an hour walk from the citadel. They welcomed us with a fresh passion fruit drink and some cold towels, this was so refreshing after a day of travelling from Hoi An. The room was big and very clean. Everyday, they would give some fruits, tea and coffee. The breakfast is outstanding with a huge variety of fruits and an indefinite number of items to order from the menu. This hotel is one the best I have stayed through my travels in South East Asia and I will come back again!

A massive thank you to the waitresses at the restaurant, Sally, Ivy, Amy and the rest of the team for being so professional friendly!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The location of the hotel is perfect. It is near an area with a lot of street foods and street hawkers and a wonderful atmosphere, but in a quiet side street that we could sleep very well. Also the the Citadel and the market was not so far away. The room was well-resourced and very clean. All employees are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good too, it was always a good start into the day. When we would visit Hue again we would stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The staff here are incredibly professional and friendly, obliging to all requests. The breakfast was a massive highlight of excellent coffee, a fruit buffet and a selection of western, Vietnamese or pancakes from the menu - all included in the price.

Room was spacious, cleaned every day - we loved it so much we extended our stay in Hue by a week just to stay here (we were knackered after month of travelling around and just wanted a place to do nothing and relax before setting off again).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel in a good location for access to bars, restaurants and the citadel. Staff are brilliant without being gushing, room was comfortable, clean and well presented, and breakfast was good. The restaurant for lunch and dinner is brilliant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We are lucky to find such a place: nice hotel, friendly and professional service, and reasonable price. Hotel staff is extremely helpful and hospitable. Knowing we want to spend one more night, they extend living time quickly and hospitably.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: My family of 5 stayed for 2 nights during April in this lovely hotel and have nothing but praise for the hotel and its professional, hard working staff. Both our rooms were large, comfortable and well equipped including a sofa, computer and flat screen TV. The photographs provided on the hotel website are accurate. There was an ample selection of breakfast choices and the other meals we enjoyed in the restaurant provided some great regional specialities of very high quality. The staff arranged our tour of Hue with English speaking guide and also our transportation to Hoi An. Highly recommend this hotel.
h_title_comment: A great choice for travel to Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We only stayed for 1 night, having booked from their sister hotel in Hanoi, but still the level of service was excellent. Very friendly and helpful staff, extremely clean. Gave us tips on where to go and arranged transport for us.
h_title_comment: A very comfortable and friendly stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Ok, I know Vietnam is not your most expensive travel destination. That said for 32 dollars a night this was great. Located close to shopping and restaurants. Room pictures are accurate on hotel website. Great restaurant and on top of all this amazing customer service Nothing but good things to say about this place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Stayed two nights at this lovely hotel. As said before its a quality hotel found down a dusty side lane, very close to everything.. First class service, attentive, professional, friendly, hard working staff. Greeted with welcome drinks and fresh fruit when we arrived. Room large, clean and well furnished complete with flat screen TV and computer. We ate in the restaurant on our first night as we arrived late, lovely food, and they give you a 10% discount voucher. The second night we ate out and staff were happy to advise of places to go. We booked a tour with them to see tombs and a boat trip on Perfume river as we wanted to make sure we saw the sights only having one day, I thought the cost a little pricey, but we did have our own private car and boat, and all hassles removed trying to find and negotiate a tour. Breakfast great, loads to choose from. I thought hotel excellent quality and value for money and would return.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Yes, we have to recommend this hotel for every one because this is great choice in Hue. The staff were very friendly, hospitality & helpful. Lovely hotel and good location, our room was fantastic with large room, nice balcony, good view & ensuite bathroom...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at the Serene Palace Hotel for three nights. The hotel staff was welcoming and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the hotel is far enough from the main streets that there is relatively little street noise.

Both the front desk staff and the restaurant staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. Our three days there were one of the highlights of our trip.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel was really nice and the staff couldn't be faulted. The location is within a 30 minute walk of the citadel, or the hotel can organise a taxi.
The rooms were nice and new with complimentary water each day and a good selection of breakfast options, which were included in the booking.
The friendly hotel staff helped us out a lot by booking tours for us and also booking our Hoi An accommodation and a car to take us there.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: One night stay in this lovely hotel in a good location (don't be put off by the small side road it is located on). It was fantastic value for money. The staff were amazingly helpful and spoke excellent English. When we arrived we were given juice and fresh fruit and shown to our lovely room which was a good size and very clean. The hotel staff provided us with a map and advised us on places to eat, we also rented a scooter through them for a very reasonable price and changed our train tickets for us so we could spend a few extra hours in Hue. Breakfast was really nice and plentiful. Would definitely recommend this place and return ourselves. Wish we could have stayed longer!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff could not have been more attentive and helpful throughout our stay. We had a lovely large room, high up at the front with a good view of the skyline and it was quiet. The location is within easy walking distance of the shopping areas, markets, waterfront and the Citadel. The breakfast was excellent, as was the evening meal we had in the restaurant. There were several good restaurants within easy reach, such as The Risotto which offers a good balance of Vietnamese and Italian food. The hotel organised bicycles for us to see the sites. They also arranged a taxi to Hoi An with a driver who spoke good English and respected our wish to avoid "shopping" en route, but stopped at key points to enable us to take photos. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel with its exceptional staff and great value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A really good 2 night stay at the Hue Serene Palace hotel. At first we were not sure about the location but once we went to explore we realised we were very close to the river and all the restaurants and bars that transform this city in the evening. The staff were all very riendly and helpful and our room very spacious although there is really not much of a view from any of the rooms. Breakfast was very good but with so many great places to eat within a 10 minute walk you probably wouldn't eat there for other meals.
h_title_comment: A very pleasant stay in a good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Like the sister hotel in Hanoi, this place is made great by the staff. They are so warm and welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. Even though a mistake on our behalf meant we had to leave a night earlier than planned, we were told not to worry and the staff helped us to arrange a hotel in our next destination and change our flight. The rooms are lovely and spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. Overall it is great value and has a great restaurant too (with fantastic breakfast).
h_title_comment: Fantastic staff, great restaurant, good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrived off of the overnight bus at 9 AM. We were greeted with fresh fruit and and a room available for early check in.

The staff was professional courteous and similar to what that you would find in a five-star hotel.

The complimentary breakfast included an unlimited number of items made to order from their menu. You could choose eggs, crapes, noodle soup, or fried rice among many other items.

We wish that we had more time to spend in Hue. If we did there is no doubt that we would stay at this hotel longer.
h_title_comment: Best Value and Service in Vietnam
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed in Serene Palace for two nights and were really happy with everything. Spacious room, comfy beds, fantastic shower. Their breakfast buffet is exceptional and so is their dinner sample menu. The staff is really attentive, super friendly and helpful. They always had recommendations of where to eat or what to sea. They also booked our onward journey for us. It was by far the best hotel and the best value for money we had in the last 10 month of our travels. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel in March. First and foremost, the staff were absolutely fantastic. They spoke excellent English and everyone, especially Julia went beyond anything we would have expected to ensure we had a wonderful stay. The staff simply could not have been more helpful. Julia helped us to purchase gifts for friends we were visiting in Hue and arranged a car with a friendly and knowledgeable driver to take us to Hoi An to next day. The hotel was well located and the room itself was spacious, very clean and comfortable with every convenience we required. Breakfast was tasty with a good variety of choices, and again, the dining staff were very friendly and attentive. We were extremely impressed with the staff and hotel, and were very pleased we had chosen to stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We arrived very early but there was no problem checking in and we were given fruit and drinks while waiting. The room was spacious and clean and the laptop was a nice idea. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good. The only problems we had were with a taxi they ordered for us who didn't know where the entrance to the Citidal was, quite a disadvantage in Hue one would think, and a car tour to Hoi An. The driver again got lost and as it was pouring with rain didn't go over the pass but through the tunnel. He didn't stop anywhere except Marble Mountain where he tried to get us out of the car and shopping but in view of the dreadful weather it didn't matter too much.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The room was on the 7th floor with a balcony and a view over the city. It was not a phenomenal view due to surrounding buildings but the large doors allowed lots of light to enter the spacious room. The service and staff throughout the hotel were excellent. It was a short, safe walk to the market or the river. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of it. For a fee they picked me up at the airport and provided a car and driver to Hoi An when I departed. Car service was excellent. Would recommend the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The most attentive and wellcoming staff in Vietnam, fluently speaking english!Perfect location, tasty continental breakfast, clean spacious rooms, transfer facilities from the airport and across the landmarks by a good car with friendly driver. The Hue hotel looks like 4 stars. This is definately the best choice in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The best hotel ive ever been for the star rating. We got the treatment of a 5-star hotel. Plus the resident restaurants foods are good value for money and superbly delicious. The location is good, although we had problem to find it the first time using google maps. Its actually in one of the alleys, just like how most hotels, pub and restaurants are in Hue. We came early and checked in, they dont have the room that we booked, but upgraded us instead. The room are spacious, well kept, and clean. We had problem with the water heater, called them and got them repaired below 5min. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Hue especially my close friends and families.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Value for value, this was one of the best. You get five star service from the time you walk into this hotel, til you leave. Staff could not do enough for you. Rooms well appointed and good size, beds very comfortable. Breakfast really good. Would most HIGHLY RECOMMEND for a great stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel may be at the back alley but was about 15min walk from the night market along the river. Recommended to go for a walk along the river where the night market is.
Room was clean, although a little too tight to squeeze in 3 beds.
Tip top service from one of the front desk staffs, she even offered to send hot tea to our room as one of my friend was sick during the stay.
Breakfast was a wide spread, you can choose from local food to western food (pancake, crepes etc).
Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The staff of the Hue Serene Palace made our trip the most memerable experience we have ever had.The staff coulld not do enough for us E.G i lot my glasses in Howlong bay they organised a taxi to take us to a local optomitrist wrote in vietnames what i needed to make sure we were looked after,
The staff in the restuarant were so friendly they were so sad when we booked out
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This was the best hotel we stayed in on our trip around Vietnam made especially memorable by the hotel and restaurant staff especially Lucy and Sally. They were always happy helpful and travelling in a group of 10 people they made things very easy for us
h_title_comment: Fabulous staff extremely helpful and kind
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The rooms are spacious and all new furnishings. A goos size bathroom with room to spread out. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Even when my son asked for mango juice at breakfast which is not on the menu, they sent someone out to get fresh mangoes and fulfilled his request with glee. I am so impressed with the quality, and care of the hotel staff.
h_title_comment: Off the busy roads, but a top quality stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We had a 2 night stay at the Serene Palace. Although the approach is down what seems a back alley don't be put off by it. The hotel is fantastic and much better than I would expect of a 3 star hotel.
Greeted in reception by friendly, welcoming staff who sat us down with fresh fruit drinks and a plate of fresh fruit. Our room was 702. No noise and a good view from our balcony. The temps were around 36 degrees during our stay so we gave the balcony a miss as the air conditioned rooms were much more comfortable!
The reception staff organised a local tour of the pagoda, tombs and citadel which we really enjoyed.
The restaurant is fantastic and the staff particularly so.
Would definitely recommend this hotel.
h_title_comment: Stay here if you visit Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The staff here are exceptional, so kind and happy and helpful. If we ever go to Hue again this is where we will stay. 2 easy city blocks from main street along the river(Le Loi St?) and a gentle half hour walk to Ancient Citadel but off the main roads so quiet location. Rooms were spacious, bathroom lovely and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast is great and the restaurant is available for lunch and dinner also, they even packed a lunch for one of our group to take with them to the temples.
8 of our group of 10 got offloaded from our flight to Hue and sent to Danang followed by a 3 hr cab ride arriving at the hotel about 11:30pm after being on the road from 7am. Emails sent from airports advising them of the change were responded to super quick and they were waiting for us to grab our bags and get us settled straight away. We needed an english speaking pharmacist and an optometrist the next morning, and within moments both were recommended, cab booked, and glasses and medication organised without any problems. I became ill the night before we were supposed to check out and they were so concerned, offering to send up ginger tea and bananas with my husband, They held off our transfer to Hoi An (which they booked for us including stops for tourist sites) but it became obvious i wasn't going to make it. 8 left on the transfer and they organised for late check out for my husband and I. When time drew nearer to late check out, it was no problem to extend for an extra night. Great news was i recovered so the extra night cancelled with no problems and they booked a very comfortable private car transfer for us with an english speaking driver. They were so glad for us that i was better, they even sent an email afterwards. So much more, Hue Serene Palace really is the place to stay.
h_title_comment: Better than Excellent - Exceptional! Just stay here
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We booked our stay at Hue Serene Palace because of the good reviews and reasonable price of the rooms - and we were not disappointed! We were very impressed by the facilities - including the reception drink and fruit platter in the hotel's beautiful lobby. The rooms and ensuite were lovely - clean, spacious and modern - probably the nicest we had during our 2 week stay in Vietnam.

The location is great - hidden away down an alley and just a short walk from the tourist streets.

Breakfast was fantastic with a great choice of menu items as well as an amazing selection of fresh local fruit. This was the best breakfast we had in Vietnam. The veg pho is highly recommended!

And the staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and welcoming.

Highly recommended and quite posh for a 3 start hotel.
h_title_comment: Fantastic place to stay in Hue!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Price reasonable, about USD30, room is spacious, clean with nice decoration. Location also fine. about 5 - 10 min walk to travel agent and restaurant. Breakfast included and is good too

but dont book the bike tour from them, not ok. you only get a driver but not a guide and with poor english
h_title_comment: good location, nice hotel with reasonable price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We were very well looked after here on out stay with complementary flowers and cake for our stay due to it being our honey moon! Everything was hassle free and organised including a private driver for the next leg of our journey.
We ate in the restaurant which was very nice and extremely good value.
All staff were pleasant and friendly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This was a good hotel. Rooms were big, shower worked well, all very nice. Bed comfy although I would recommend a room higher up to get away from the noise of setting up breakfast in the morning.

The staff were very professional and arranged my excursions well.

Generally in a good location although slightly on the edge so a bit further of a walk to the citedel.

In essence a good hotel, but sort of missed so friendliness.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The staff at the Serene Place Hotel are very friendly and helpful, be it the receptionist or the wait staff. The room was comfortable and fairly sizable. Given the location of the hotel – in a lane that is partially paved – there was no street noise. Our room was on the 6th floor. Rooms ending in 1 or 2 seem to have a somewhat nicer view. Complimentary fruit and water was served every day. The breakfast was good but very modest compared to the hotel we stayed at in Hoi An. Fruit, juices and breads were served buffet style whereas all other items (eggs, pancakes, rice dishes, soups) had to be ordered a la carte. The hotel is located in walking distance to all major tourist restaurants.
h_title_comment: Good quality hotel with wonderful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent 3 days in Hue at the Serene Place Hotel and were very happy with the experience. Front desk staff helped me recover some important personal items left in a hotel in Hoi An with ease - and helped take the stress out of a potential disaster! Rooms are just as they appear on the website - ours on the 4th floor was large, well furnished and quiet. I think Serene Place offers very good value for money and can certainly recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The staff are special and go out of their way to help you during your stay. Breakfast was lovely and we missed the place when we left. It was a slice of home in the interesting and lively city of Hue. Can't imagine you will find better value for money. We really enjoyed our stay here
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This hotel is situated a short walking distance to restaurants and shops and is a clean, modern hotel with staff always ready to help in any way.

Towels and bath mats could do with an update as they were looking grey and the shower curtain in my room needed replacing as it was mouldy.
h_title_comment: Nice hotel at a good price
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Had 3 nights here and enjoyed it immensely. I was a big taken aback a bit on arrival when we came down a skinny, grotty lane where it is located but its a modern, clean hotel where the staff fall over each other to help you.
Our first contact was with Si who outlined all the different tours we could do and ensured we were comfortable about getting around the town.
Sabrina and Sally in the restaurant were helpful and friendly and looked after our every needs.
The staff in general were great
Rooms were quite good and showers and bath worked a treat which is always a bonus :)
Hotel position is easy walking distance to shops and restaurants.
Would stay there again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Such a fantastic hotel. Staff are so thoughtful and welcoming. They greet you by name and go the extra mile. It's in a fantastic location. The rooms are well presented and excellent value for money. Breakfast and the restaurant are delicious. Maybe even the best meal I had in Vietnam! Perfect stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Amazing service, truly amazing above and beyond . Food excellent
Lucy, Sally and Sabrina all wonderful.

Both pumpkin and tomato soup excellent, set menu fantastic quality and value,

Morning glory best in vietnam.

The food served was fresh and delicious. Sally, Lucy and Sabrina make the dining experience a real joy. The best staff I have encountered in Vietnam. I'ce buckets for the Huda beer a very good touch and the additional free passion fruit a great end to a great meal
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Very family friendly. Good food, great room, cenral location. The biggest advantage of this hotel is its staff, From doorman to cleaner you are greeted with a genuine smile. The computer in the room was useful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Good for coeliacs, with a nice restaurant on the ground floor too.

We stayed one night at the Serene Hotel in Hue. It is located about 1.5km from the Forbidden Purple Palace (Imperial Citadel), so an easy cab ride or you could just walk.

The hotel is on a bumpy back-street, but the area is safe to walk in at night. The rooms were good, including a bath. An under-sized room safe was a minor annoyance, but the security was good in the hotel.

The staff were friendly, competent and able to give a good recommendation for a boat ride to visit a pagoda out of town for 20USD.

Once more, a firm/hard mattress.

We would stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is tucked away in a grubby little alley way off the main road. Despite the off putting look of the location this is a very good hotel not far from the town centre. Breakfast was good and the restaurant served decent food at good prices. Our room was a good size, beautifully presented and very comfortable.Very good wifi, great bed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: very nice hotel , perfect location in hue, city centre and shop all around, staff very gentle and friendly, room was very clean and comfortable , fresh fruits every day on the room. breakfast was super!!!really nice hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Everything was truly outstanding !
Attention to details and helpful staff.
Julia, Emily and Si were really friendly. Si was very charming and helpful with planning my trip !
I would definitively recommend this hotel. Likely one of the best in Hue ATM.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Greeted very warmly by receptionist staff Mary and Anne and provided with a refreshing start with fresh juice, cool towels and fresh fruit platter. Room was spotless with good air-conditioning, 2 double beds (we had family room) and good size bathroom. Received complementary bottled water and fruit daily. Great choice of breakfast with staff (specially Lucy and Sally) always treating our son so kindly and made him feel special including making him his favourite mango juice for breakfast even though it wasn't on the menu. Not too far from sites, room always clean and staff always friendly. Would recommend for others to stay if they want value for money, friendly staff and quality place to stay.
h_title_comment: Nice play to stay in Hue - very friendly staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Rooms were spotless great shower working AC most welcoming staff in all my three weeks of travel. And best food I've had my entire month here in the in house resturant. Cannot rave enough about this place. Quiet near to all sites and tourist district and staff made you feel like royalty.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: we had a great stay here. It's very reasonable price with great choice of breakfast. The staff are just excellent . Anything you ask them they are absolutely spot on and very helpful. Always have smile in their face. Hotel is very convenient, clean, comfortable and comes with tea coffee making facility and fresh fruit every day. Can't fault them. There are few good restaurants are in walking distance from the hotel , only 200 mtrs. Highly recommend this hotel.
h_title_comment: Nice place to stay and see Hue city.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed here 2 nights and had a wonderfull time ! The staff speaks very good english, is very attentive and helpful ! From the first second we arrived till the last we left everything was super organised, very clean and delicious breakfast. We asked a private taxi driver to bring us to Hoi An and had a wonderfull time with him. He was a real guide !!! Explained us about history, economics, religion.... In one word..a hotel to recommend !! Thanks to everybody. Ann
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Loved this hotel- stayed for only one night but really loved it. Rooms lovely and clean and modern. We got a very reasonably sized clean room, complimentary fruit and water, free breakfast and a good bathroom.
No bad things to say! Thank you to the staff for their wonderful service and hospitality!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
A friendly welcome with a serving of fresh fruits was a nice treat.
The room was spacious, big bed, a sitting area and a small desk with computer, nice bathroom with new facilities and a modern set of taps and shower.
Breakfast was good, the location was convenient, a short walk down a side road to the river and the staff were helpful with arranging a local taxi for me in the evening.
I would recommend Serene Palace Hotel to any one.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed for two nights and decided to eat there one night. The restaurant scoring #1 on tripadvisor. The hotel is in a small alley way and quieter compared to the busy streets of Hue. Staff at the hotel are very attentive and made us feel welcome from the very start. They answered all our questions and were happy to recommend activities or restaurants without being "pushy" and trying to sell you something. The room was quite big for a 3 star and in comparison to the other hotels we stayed in. I highly recommend, if you like a serene stay in Hue.
h_title_comment: Most enjoyed our stay at the serene hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for four nights in March and really enjoyed it -- the room was spacious and comfortable, but above all, the ladies at the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly. They helped us to arrange train tickets and rental bicycles and in general were very willing to help with anything we could have possibly needed. A few specific pros: we thought the bed was very comfortable, we liked having a PC in the room so we could research our day's activities, and the location of the hotel was a tiny bit off the beaten path but a) still very convenient and b) not in the heart of what felt like the most touristy area. Breakfast was quite good, with plentiful food and a lot of variety in what was offered. Also, at $2 per kilo, we were very appreciated of their quick and capable laundry service. Minor cons: the room had just the slightest mildewy pong to it, although we quickly got used to it once in the room so it wasn't really an issue for us. The bathtub was very small and for some reason didn't have a thing to hold the shower head, so showering was a two-person affair with one person holding the shower head for the other. We had a brief issue with water dripping from the AC unit but they fixed it quickly so it wasn't really a problem. We would definitely stay here again, particularly given the great value it offers.
h_title_comment: Solid mid-range choice: excellent service, good value
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was by far the best hotel on our travels in Vietnam. These guys were they wonderful. All of them. The front counter, the drivers, the breakfast staff and the cleaning staff. We had two young children and everyone was fabulous. It certainly made our trip to Hue a highlight. There were no pushing sales tactics and it felt very genuine. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable and the food delicious.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We really enjoyed this hotel. When we arrived, we noticed the balcony was clean and well kept with good styling. They have a pond with Koi fish. The very first thing they did was offer us some welcome drinks, which was nice. We stayed in a family room. It was large with comfortable beds and very clean. We enjoyed the view from the balcony too and watching the people in the alleyway below. Breakfast and dinners were really good. It was nice to not have to go anywhere for dinner to get good, authentic, and reasonably priced food. Best of all was the staff. They were so friendly and loved our kids. We will most definitely stay here again when we return to Hue.
h_title_comment: Lovely facility, friendly staff, good food
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
my wife and i again had the great pleasure of staying at the serene palace hotel. we stayed here last year.
the hotel is still perfect, the rooms are spacious, spotlessly clean, a/c works well and there is excellent wifi.
the breakfast is delicious with western (cereals, yoghurt, squeezed fruit juices,eggs etc) and asian food. but what makes the hotel is without doubt the staff, they are attentive, courteous, helpful and absolutely gorgeous.
thank you all for making our trip to Hue again very pleasant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed at the Serene Palace Hotel this March,and couldn't fault it very nice large rooms
with all the mod cons. Tv safe Computer with WiFi Kettle Nice shower room everything clean fresh and tidy.Staff all very pleasant and helpful even gave us a good exchange rate when we cashed some money.Breakfast ok usual Fruit toast eggs coffee.
Overall we couldn't find anything bad to say about the Hotel and would stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Heading down a little lane way thinking what have I booked. Stopped out front and the doormen are straight out to collect my bag. I walk in and the place looks like it should be in an upmarket street. The staff are all friendly and helpful. Fresh fruit and a drink on arrival. Computer with internet in your room so you can write emails when you want to.

Only a short walk to places to eat, bars and can even walk to the citadel and markets.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: What a lovely stay. Shame only one night! Spoiled by very friendly staff. Wonderful city and definite highlight of Vietnam. We were worried driving up narrow dirt road but when we got into our room, were very, very happy. Top floor, balcony and very beautiful room. Flowers and a cake for honeymoon. Walked to forbidden city through old Vietnam - outstanding experience
h_title_comment: Haven in the middle of authentic Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I put a lot of thought into this review . I choose the serene based on trip adviser reviews .After a long day of a flight which was delayed 8 hours my husband arrived by transfer arranged by hotel very tired and hungry for our 5 nights in Hue ,check in very very quick with welcoming drink and very friendly staff ,we where shown to our room which was a city room with balcony and bath ,the room was very clean and spacious we where both so hungry we chose to eat before unpacking ,which we did in the hotel the food was lovely ( I will reveiw seperate) Upon returning to the room I took a bath the bath was a spa type bath which was the smallest bath I have ever bathed in I am 5.2 small build and could not relax in the bath as the spa jets stuck into me after a very short bath I jumped into bed exhursted the bed was very firm but I noticed the pillows themselfs where very old and stained ,my husband however had noticed he was being bitten once we looked the top sheet was absolutlet covered in tiny mozziesupon looking the ceiling and room was covered with them ,by this time I myself had been bitten all over my neck and sholders .We persumed that they had come in through the doors when we first looked at the balcony area although the door was only open for seconds ,upon looking again we saw that the balcony was covered with them probably attracted to the neon signs of the kareoke club which joined onto the hotel.My husband made the decision that this hotel was not for us so had a chat with reception who was so lovely about the whole thing my husband explained it was not the hotel at fault here but that we where used to a larger hotel in a quieter location ,The staff recomended a hotel and telephoned them and secured a very good rate for our 5 night stay ,Cannot fault the reception staff they where simply wonderful.
With hindsite I could of looked beyond the photos and reviews I would of realised the hotel is on a busy side street next to a night club I should of also taken into consideration this is a 3* boutique hotel not what my husband and I have got used to in previous trips around Thailand ,I do however believe that the high ratings on TA are more to do with the wonderful Staff than the hotel itself .The staff do indeed deserve 5* but my rating of 3 is for the hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff were super helpful and took care of all my planning, from taxis to boat trips to a multi stop guided tour ending at my next accomodation in Hoi An. Travelling has never been easier. the room service was great and the laundry service had a good quick turn around time,
h_title_comment: Couldn't ask for nicer staff or better service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We stayed for a couple of nights. Rooms are clean and the location is fine, though down a somewhat dodgy side street.

Unfortunately the power went out one morning, which appeared to affect the entire neighbourhood and of course cannot be blamed on the hotel. There was a generator which provided one light in the room as well as breakfast service. However, the generator was turned off right after breakfast ended, which meant no light in the rooms. I feel this should have been communicated to guests ahead of time (perhaps at breakfast).

As others have mentioned, the food was very good, probably the best we had in Hue. Staff were also helpful and friendly, and everyone we dealt with spoke excellent English. Tour and transportation options are easily arranged through them.
h_title_comment: Nothing fancy, but good value and excellent food
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Clean, comfortable, central, attention to detail, great value for money. Lucky to be upgraded on arrival. However, the biggest star goes to the team - charming, funny, helpful; exemplary customer service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at Hue Serene for two nights. All the staff were very helpful and nothing was ever too much to ask. When you stay make sure you eat at least one meal at the restaurant, we had dinner and it one of the best meals in Vietnam so far.
h_title_comment: Perfect location, great staff and a lovely room
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Fabulous service with lovely staff. Clean hotel, nice large room, delicious breakfast with great choice and Al la carte options which is always nicer. Organised a driver for the day who was very good. Overall would highly recommend and fabulous value for money. Loved the fresh juice and fruit on arrival - nice touch.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel arranged a taxi to pick us up from the train station. Upon entering the hotel - serenity.
Staff were fabulous and soon had us in our rooms. The rooms themselves were quiet and very comfortable, with plenty of space. Superb value.
I'm only sad that we stayed one night as Hue has lots to offer.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I was only in Hue for a couple of days but this hotel was fantastic. The room was good, I was in a city facing room on the 6th floor which had a great view from the balcony where you can watch the sunset. The food was terrific, a wide range of breakfast options were cooked to order. I had dinner in the restaurant on the first night as I arrived there quite late. It was fantastic!

The staff were incredibly attentive, friendly and helpful. Service was fast and very friendly in the restaurant and the front desk staff were very welcoming on check in and helpful throughout my stay. Thanks again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Our review of this hotel echos what other reviewers have experienced. Top service from everyone at the hotel from start to finish of our 3 night stay. Thank you to Julia and all staff. Perfectly presented room with a view and a balcony, with gorgeous romantic decoration, cake and flowers. In room, free computer was a bonus. The restaurant (we had one lunch) and breakfast each morning was great with very fine staff. My only criticism would be what some other reviewers have mentioned - a shower that is not user friendly. Simply having a longer hose and attaching it to the wall would make a lot of sense.But the shower experience did not deduct our opinion of this hotel. Would without a doubt stay again if ever we are in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The location was very good...with lots of good restaurants and bars within steps from the hotel. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. It offers a good breakfast. The wifi connection could be better, but it worked ok.
h_title_comment: Good quiet location and fantastic service in the best area to stay in town.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My boyfriend and I saw the restaurant rated high on TripAdvisor so we decided to eat here because they had vegetarian options. First off, we were greeted with "welcome drinks" and we werent even guests of the hotel. The food was EXCELLENT and the prices were so affordable, especially for 5 star service. Our server, along with the other staff, was so warm and friendly that we decided to come back for dinner the same night. Everything was perfect the second time around as well! Im not sure if I've ever had such great service anywhere else, they are just so friendly and attentive. There is no reason not to eat here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 1 night to visit Hue. Even though we were only staying for one night the staff treated us like we were going to be staying weeks. The room was fantastic and worth a lot more than the rates they are charging. Laura who worked on reception was especially helpful. Breakfast was one of the best we had in Vietnam. Location is great, right in the centre of Hue. Recommend staying here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is situated down an alleyway off a main road near to where all the bars and restaurants are situated. So made for a good base to stay. For example Citadel was only 25 walk away from hotel.

The room was extremely spacious, modern and clean. Had what you would expect in the room- safe, mini bar, air con, complimentary water and snacks.
Breakfast was very good - lots of cooked options and a choice of fruits, juices and bread.
Service at the reception was extremely good and they were really helpful. All had a strong command of English. They arranged a transfer from the train station, my laundry (not the cheapest but convenient) and a private car to hoi an flawlessly - excellent job.

Would recommend this hotel for a stay in Hue
h_title_comment: Very good hotel with excellent service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Serene Palace is located down a little laneway on the edge of the tourist quarter in Hue. This can make finding it a little tricky - our taxi driver dropped us at the nearest cross-street (it's too narrow for cars) and we then had to make our own way there - but this small inconvenience was more than made up for by the quietness of the location. There's almost no noise, which given its proximity to the tourist quarter's restaurants and bars was a lovely surprise. The staff were extremely friendly, pointing out Hue's main attractions and organising an excellent motorbike tour of the Imperial Tombs. Our room was well appointed and our bed very comfortable; for breakfast there's a generous spread of fruit and a menu with plenty of cooked options. The location was a terrific launch pad for exploring the Citadel and the parks and markets along the Perfume River. It's a lovely place to stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Serene Boutique Hotel is a great place to stay when you visit Hue. This was our second stay at Serene boutique Hotel in less than twelve months and our second stay was as great as the first. It is a small hotel full of charm. Clean and spacious rooms with a lovely breakfast included. Very central to restaurants and major attractions. You will be treated like family by Tri, Ruby and the rest of the staff
There is nothing but positive things to say about this place. We loved it and we certainly come back. Thank you very much .
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel is as exactly as it seems; great value for money, great service and great rooms. Coming from Saigon, the rooms are incredibly spacious though the beds are REALLY hard!

The hotel is located right near the touristy strip, with lots of great eating and drinking options near by. The only weird thing was, given how touristy the area seemed to be, when we were walking back to the hotel around midnight, all of the streets were dead! Like, no traffic, no open shops, nothing!

The breakfast was good, with options from a set menu (no buffet). The staff were always lovely and happy to help. Yes the Best Western looks great and has a pool, but you can go there and use the pool for a fee without having to stay there...so keep that one up your sleeve!
h_title_comment: What you see is what you get!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were only in this hotel for two nights,we really wish it had been longer as we moved on to Hoi An for five nights,in hindsight should have split it between the two .Make no mistake this a very professionally run hotel and the staff are incredible friendly people.The hotel is immaculate and all of the services second to none,we had a room on the seventh floor which gave us great views over Hue.It was Chinese new years eve and we had fantastic view of the fireworks at midnight,bed was comfortable,not like some we found on our tour of Vietnam,we ate at the restaurant and now know why it is the number one restaurant in Hue,just incredible,the way they present the food and the beer was cold as well(very important).The girl in the restaurant whose name was Sally was just so friendly and made our night,all in all a great place to stay,so if you are in Hue do your self a favour and stay here,you will not regret it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We enjoyed a couple of nights at this delightful hotel! The rooms were very large and spacious which was surprising in a city hotel. The hotel staff were all fantastic and couldn't do enough for you - they were truly superb! My father had unfortunately broken his ankle on a motorbike trip a few days before and was in a wheelchair. The staff were all wonderful and helped make our stay as easy and happy as possible. The location was good and central and the hotel can also arrange any trips which we took advantage of. The restaurant is also very good offering a lovely breakfast and good choices for an evening meal. Would recommend to anyone visiting Hue!
h_title_comment: Good location, great rooms and friendly service!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I say "almost" because of the tourism advice we got. They suggested a driver to take us to 3 temples, and said that a guide was not necessary. Well we thought it was and it was impossible to get one on site. One could just hire a taxi to do the same and it would have cost a lot less. So try to get a driver/guide or just take a taxi.
Other than that, the hotel was excellent. We arrived early and were able to have our rooms immediately. One was on the top floor with a large balcony. It was very spacious, beds very comfortable, large bathroom with lots of counter space.
The breakfast was great, part buffet and one could order whatever from the menu. The dumplings were different and very tasty. The Vietnamese coffee was the best I've tasted.
They arranged for a driver to take us to HoiAn at the normal cost.
I would definitely recommend this hotel. Quality/price was excellent.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Everything about the fit out of this hotel was first class, no expenses spared. Lovely staff, somewhat ordinary breakfast but this is one thing that Vietnamese places don't do well when trying to do a Western style one. Thought our taxi driver was taking us to the wrong place when he turned down a narrow dilapidated alley but no, that is where the hotel was. The best address on the worst street? Still, wish we had a few more days there.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This has to be one of the best hotels with the ALL the staff going out of there way to assist your every needs to make your stay as comfortable as possible. It was very sad to leave. I would highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Did' not know how to transfert fromHoi An to Hue the hotel try to arrange us a private transfert to the hotel and welcome us withdrinks and fresh fruits . Their constant help to arrange visits, dîners,taxis... Allways available for infos , allways' with a smile. Our stay at the serene palaces had been the most exquisite experience .
h_title_comment: A wonderfull experience at hue serene palace hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The staff at the Serene Palace were fantastic! They helped us to book private tours to the DMZ and Khe Sanh as well as making us feel very welcome the entire time we stayed there. We were impressed enough to change our booking in Hanoi over to the Serene hotel. Highly recommended!!

Brett and Cherie
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We only had one night with Serene Palace but could not ask for better service, great room and breakfast.Laura and her staff took care restaurant books , pick up from the airport and a great driver for our city tour and our drive to Hoi an.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel is a perfect place to discover Hué and its surrounding.

The service is simply outstanding. It starts with a complimentary welcome drink and some fruits. You can always ask the staff at the reception desk and get promptly an answer. Even a bike rental will easily be organised for a fair price.

The rooms are spacious and very clean. If necessary there are many international TV channels. The bed could be hard for some people, for us it was okay.

The breakfast is tasty with many options. We also eat for dinner which was delicious as well.

Would definitely book this hotel again for a possible next time in Hué.

It can be rather noisy in the morning as doors slam rather loudly but comparing to all the benefits this is not a main criteria.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Hue Serene Palace Hotel is a supreme value. The rooms are well appointed and immaculate, and the service is impeccable. The staff was unfailingly attentive, friendly, and competent during our stay in Hue. Breakfast in the restaurant each morning was a real treat! We looked forward to the delicious buffet and the warm smiles of Ivy and the other wait staff, who made us feel very much at home. The service surpassed that of many more expensive hotels we stayed in across Asia. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Stayed here two nights and found Hotel and staff excellent. Rooms were spacious and very clean and we'll maintained. Staff at breakfast dining were very friendly and outgoing. There was a good selection of breakfast to choose from.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace definitely exceeded my expectation!
The staff were extremely friendly and helpful in every single aspect of our stay which made it very enjoyable to be around the hotel
The hotel itself was very clean and modern, the rooms are very large and spacious, with great facilities, a comfy bed and a computer which was great!
It was in a good location, within walking distance to many restaurants and things to do
The food was also absolutely delicious!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed for 2 nights. Good value for money. The most helpful staff you could come across. Not quite the best location but good enough certainly for the value. Breakfast ok. Rooms are a decent size. Tucked away on a slightly scruffy side street but where isn't slightly scruffy in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: A smaller back-lane hotel with a truly international hotel service standard. Our room was clean and a nice size, the bathroom as large as the four star hotel we'd just moved out of and the breakfast every bit as good and served with pride. We had two minor problems whilst staying here with our air tickets and the airport bus. Whilst I was nearly in melt-down Anna, our front desk liaison, solved both problems graciously and quickly. I can't praise the staff standards enough. They made our brief stay a real plus.
h_title_comment: Stayed here for a night after moving out of a four star in search of a comfortable bed
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at this Hotel for a few nights in February. The two rooms booked were very spacious, comfortable and well maintained. The breakfast was particularly good with excellent fruit and lovely coffee. The staff were exceptionally welcoming, helpful and professional with very detailed information and advice provided when we arrived.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We got into Hue in a bus from Hoi-An, and this hotel was really close to the bus station, plus the taxi driver was already aware of the hotel by its name. So I figured this must be a busy/easy-to-find location, which turned out to be true.

The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The lady at the reception helped us with booking a private boat at a time of our choosing for a cruise on the Perfume River which also included a stop-over at the Thien Mu pagoda. She also gave us tips on where to go for sightseeing and eating good local food. Very useful !

Wifi and breakfast are complimentary. In-room services include toiletries (including toothpaste and disposable toothbrush and comb), towels, hairdryer, complimentary tea/coffee/water/fruit,TV, and also a computer in the room. Our room was spacious with a window opening to the city view.

The hotel is about 15min walk to the Walking street and night market by the bridge, and about 30min walk to the Citadel/Imperial city.

Overall my friend and I had a great experience at Hue Serene Palace, and would definitely recommend this hotel. It's a great value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Great hotel! We stayed for one night as a stop gap between Hanoi and Hoi an. The rooms are clean and spacious (we had a balcony). Staff are friendly and attentive - they helped us book our bus to Hoi An. The hotel is within walking distance of the Citadel and you'll stumble across a few markets/food stalls on the way! This is the perfect place to stay for a couple of days in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Staff at the serene palace are friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable and it is in a convenient location near the river. However I would rate this as a 3 star hotel. The towels,sheets are tired looking, A/C noisy and the breakfast are average. If I was returning to Hue I would stay somewhere else.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We traveled by train from DaNang to Hue and we had arranged for transportation to the hotel. A bellboy from the hotel was at the station to meet us and helped get our bags into the taxi and then departed by motorbike back to the hotel, very cute. The front desk checked us in quickly, Laura was very sweet.

Our room was one of the large front rooms, with balcony. We are on our honeymoon and the room was decorated with rose petals, a sheet draped in a heart, extra towels folded into swans and they even had a small cake waiting for us. Just lovely!

Wifi was good, 4 up and 4 down, but not great for streaming.

The hotel is located on a quiet side street about a 10 minute walk to the night market. They offer a nice breakfast, Sally was wonderful. The we ordered lunch and asked for it to be delivered to the room, it was very good too. Unfortunately they did not bring any cutlery or napkins. Luckily we had chopsticks, napkin, fork and spoon from the fruit plate in our room.

The bathroom was modern with shower, no tub. Everything was great except for the bed which was so hard I almost couldn’t sleep and needed aspirin the next day for my back.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: After 2 weeks of hotels in Vietnam, in 4 cities & 1 boat, we vote this the best hotel. The staff are very warm, friendly, helpful & flexible. The breakfasts are also the best we had in any hotel & the noodle soup was the best of any hotel or restaurant. They have a real restaurant in the hotel & we chose to eat other meals in addition to breakfast because it was so good. Actually worth going to just for the restaurant! If I returned to HUÉ, there is no question that I would stay there.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The big memory will be the service levels of all the staff. We were especially helped by Mary who was outstanding in providing a lot of help with prebooking bus to Hanoi (Huang Trach who are very good); Grey Line Halong Bay trip (which proved excellent); train to Sapa and bus back to Hanoi; plus booked us into sister hotel in Hanoi (also excellent).
The hotel itself is fine. Location down a side street but very convenient.
Very good all-round experience and very good value.
h_title_comment: Outstanding Customer Service at Reception desk
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel had wonderfully friendly and helpful staff, for whom nothing was too much trouble.
It is on one of the quieter streets of Hue but very near all the action, within walking distance of the Citadel, river, restaurants and shops.
A real pleasure to have stayed here.
h_title_comment: Delightful hotel in quiet street of Hue but near all the action
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
we where there the 8 of febr. 2015 we spend 1 night ,and i regret because it is was fantastic stay there it is was better 2 days
they pick up us for the Danang airport in perfect on time and show to us the beautiful place before going to Hue when we arrived the receptionist Miss Li was just fantastic to show to us everything about the city and the history place .she organize a trip for us with a nice price and she organize a dinner in a fantastic restaurant Ancient Hue i really recommend this one .all the staff was fantastic the room was very nice and comfortable big and clean
i really recommend this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We spent two nights at the Serene Palace hotel in February. The hotel is well located within walking distance of the Citadel, restaurants and shops.
The hotel appears new, is spotless and is staffed by the friendliest team we've met in our travels.
Our room was spacious, had a nice sitting area, balcony, comfy bed, personal computer and we had fresh fruit left in our room each day.
The bathroom was great, with a rain shower and fluffy soft towels.
The included breakfast was delicious and included western and local dishes.
Stay here, you won't be disappointed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had an excellent welcome with juice and fresh fruit after a very early morning arrival from the train from Hanoi.
A room for our use was provided until ours was free later on.
Staff are very helpful arranging trips , adjusting our onward booking in Hoi An.
Only areas for improvement are poor quality bed linen and a smelly stained uncomfortable pillow.
If these are rectified I would say it is very good value with a generally high standard.
h_title_comment: Good but could be even better
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: New but simple hotel with all the facilities required. Well situated. People very nice at the reception. Fantastic choice of the breakfast a la carte. For 40 Us dollars for a double room with view and balcony, difficult to find better...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is situated in a little alley which makes it more quiet than other places.
After some time in Vietnam you really appreciate that.
Everything works - good service, openminded staff and great help in arranging tours etc.
Highly recommendable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: If you are a young couple and willing to pay a little extra, get the the double double with city view. The view from the 7th floor was definately worth it! The complimentary Breakfast was the best and most diverse we've experienced during our 3 weeks, and the waiters kindly catered to our every needs. The room was large, bright and very clean. Our only complaints were that the shower door did not keep the water inside the shower cubicle, so a bit of the shower flooded every time, and the wifi often was quite weak. The reception staff were also very friendly and helpful, assisting us to find a last minute transport. They spoke and understood English very well . On the downside, each time I spoke to someone , I had to re-explain the whole situation as there was little communication between staff members, and because of their recommendation, we waited for almost 4 hours at Hue Train Station (5:30-9am) because they said a journey from Phong Nha to Hue would take over 5-6 hours by car (it only took over 3!) Waiting that long would have been fine if we didnt wake up at 1am. Overall don't let these minor flaws deter you, Hue Serene Palace is an excellent choice! They were extremely helpful and were a great place to stay.
h_title_comment: Excellent View and pretty great service!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Although located in the backpacker`s district of Hue, this place is quiet and very relaxed. You can walk to the Forbidden City. Comfortable rooms with computer, extremely helpful staff, good breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Agree with other reviews that this is a hidden gem,well located with lovely rooms & very friendly staff providing very good service & most enjoyable stay.Also very good value for money.Reception recommended a private car to take us one afternoon to visit the citadel,pagoda & tombs & this proved a very good choice.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Fantastic in every way this hotel is a great choice. Great rooms with comfy beds and luxurious linen. Breakfast is served promptly and the coffee is excellent. Best of all is the service, the staff really are excellent at what they do and I can't praise them enough.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
In all our travels both at home and abroad we would have to rate the Serene Palace Hotel as the best service we have ever experienced. Upon our late arrival we were promptly checked in and escorted to our rooms with complimentary some fresh juice and a plate of fruit. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Serene restaurant serves excellent local food and we enjoyed Bun Bo and fresh spring roll very much! These two dishes are the must try when you dine at the restaurant!
We were warmly greeted each day by all staff and very well looked after. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff we encountered from those in reception, room service staff, and especially the restaurant staff. Special thanks to Sally and all the staff who provided us with exceptional service for the 2 days we were guests. We would never consider staying anywhere else and highly recommend this hotel to other travellers. Great value for money.
h_title_comment: Excellent service, excellent food at an excellent location.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: It may seem like a most unlikely place to have a great hotel, but the Hue Serene Palace will make you forget the alley like road it is on as soon as you open the door. Clean, beautiful rooms and a most friendly and helpful staff made my stay delightful. I opted for the city view room, and although it rained , the view and balcony were a welcome addition. The location was good for walking anywhere in Hue, and it is surrounded by good restaurants. Will definitely recommend and stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Central location.Brilliant staff.Lovely room with city views as requested.Everything worked well, including the airport pick up and drive to Hoi An via the beautiful mountain route.Wok, the driver, is a fine young man.They also arranged other trips on the river /pagodas etc.Would definately use this hotel again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
First, a HUGE thank-you to the ladies at the front desk who made my partners birthday so special! I simply went to the deck inquiring about where I could pickup a birthday cake. They took matters into their own hands & said they would make sure there was 'something special' waiting for us when we returned from our tomb tour. My partner & I were blown away by the beautiful flowers, decorated cake and brilliantly arranged towels (looked like two puppies lying down!) that were waiting on the bed when we returned. There were even candles & a lighter for the cake!

I have never had that level of service even when staying at a 5 star hotel.

We had a delux city view (room 501) and were very pleased with the size, amenities and cleanliness. Wood floors, a complimentary computer as well as free WiFi, good size jacuzzi tub and a small balcony (perfect for launching a drone for aerial city pics 😏). They only weird thing was the street where it's located. It's like a tiny alley & there are karaoke bars on either side. Don't be alarmed! The area is safe, you won't be bothered by off-key singing, and it's actually centrally located.
h_title_comment: Great Front Desk Staff - Good Hotel
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The 7 story hotel is located in a somewhat incongruent little street, more like a lane, with all sorts of places along it. We arrived in Hue the rain and our transport was too wide to fit down the street so we had to run and find the hotel which was an amusing way to commence the stay. The location turned out to be just great and we could walk easily to everywhere we wanted to go. The Imperial Palace is about a 10 minute walk or you can get on one of those cyclo things. Our room was on the 6th floor with city views, not that there is that much to see to be honest. The room was very comfortable, well appointed, clean and quiet. No problems there. The staff were all very friendly and the desk staff in particular were extremely helpful and resourceful. Breakfast was a little bit limited but pleasant enough but again staffed by very friendly and helpful young women. This place is also a bargain given the hotel's amenities, the helpful and friendly staff and location.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Have been traveling in Thailand and Vietnam for the last 4 months this hotel was the best hotel
I have stayed in, and would recommend staying here to anyone ,
The facilities and staff was faultless, restaurant food was 5 star,
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Our stay in the hotel was great. It's so clean and the stuff ist so friendly. We can also recommend the restaurant for dinner or drinks.
The location ist near to river, the palace...
Thanks for your work and business.
h_title_comment: A famous hotel with a great stuff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was one of the best hotels we ve ever stayed for all around experience. The room was a really good size, very clean and the bed very comfortable as well.The staff make this place extra special and we were greeted with a beaming smile all the time and they just couldn' t do enough to make our stay special. Even arranging for me at the last minute something to be left in my room as a surprise while we were out as it was a special day. Two of the girls at the front desk were especially kind and sweet Anne at reception and Si put together a beautiful arrangement for the room. Extra convenience at the hotel with changing money, great location, very good wi fi, great breakfast and our airport transfers were both on time and flawless. Thank you to the entire staff and I would stay tomorrow again if I could.
h_title_comment: An Excellent stay from start to finish! Loved it!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
What a nice hotel!

Located close to literally everything you need to see in Hue! Rent a bike for 2 US Dollar and you'll be cruising through Hue in no time!

Checking in goes smoothly, you can enjoy your fresh juice and some fruit. Take a seat, and the super friendly staff will take care of the paperwork.
Staff is everywhere, super nice, and also very up to date about everything there is to do in Hue!

Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Bathroom is very nice.

Breakfast is included in the roomrate, and is quite extensive considering the price you pay per night.

Special thanks to Mary, Jenny and Julia.

This hotel is great, I would really recommend this hotel to everyone!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We arrived at the hotel only to find that I had made a mistake with the booking and it was full for what I thought was our first night. They could not have been more helpful, arranging another good local hotel for that night and even accompanying us to look at the room to make sure it was OK. The service is excellent and the staff all speak very good English. We enjoyed a special Valentines Day meal in the restaurant, 4 delicious courses for about £10 between us! The pomelo salad was outstanding and the chef was happy to give us the recipe. The room was very comfortable and stylishly decorated. Only small quibble was where on earth to plug in the kettle?! The fruit bowl was replenished every day and breakfast was freshly cooked to order. A great stay, thank you
h_title_comment: Excellent stay in welcoming centrally located hotel
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The hotel is situaties in a narrow alley, and not far from the rivier and restaurant and nightlife scène. Friendly staff, good breakfast and clean rooms. When you see the locatiion on the map you will be happy you have choosen the hotel it is quiet at night.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Off the main road down a little alley way, at first you will think your in the wrong place, but the Serene Palace turned out to be a good hotel. Very helpful staff and good hotel room - clean! Good selection of beauty products in the bathroom. Emily (?) was extremely helpful! - she organised a taxi tour to many places for us and printed some documents off we needed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Attention to detail - great little boutique hotel. Staff very helpful, cancelling a bike tour because of the rain (& not charging us), organising a coastal tour from there to Hoi An (our next destination), and advice on what to do in surprising Hue. Smallish, but nice rooms, with a postage stamp sized balcony that nevertheless was enchanting to stand on and watch life in this amazing city. Breakfast - just OK - could do with greater variety. Very good dinner in restaurant - tick! Very clean and light rooms.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was beautiful and the rooms were very modern and very clean. They also booked me into another hotel and arranged a car to pick me up. I cannot thank them enough.
h_title_comment: A very special hotel and staff.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 2 nights in January 2015. This is a great little boutique hotel in Hue that offers excellent value for travellers. This was one of our most enjoyable stays during a 5 week trip through Indochina.
We had room 702 which has a great view of the city. Nice rooms, and one of the best showers on our whole trip. Breakfast is included with the room and was good. Location is perfect for a downtown stroll.
The staff here are just wonderfully professional and helpful. Julia and her team do a great job. Need a scooter to run around on? They get one delivered to the hotel door. Need a car to Hoi-An, no problem. This team certainly know how to treat guests right.

Overall, we loved our stay at the Serene Palace. Oldbackpack highly recommends this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had booked this hotel at the suggestion of a tour agent we ended up not using from Danang. We typically stay in smaller guest houses or home stays so this came across as a "hotel" which is what it is!
Pros: Our pick up from the train station was right there when we arrived. The rooms are clean, spacious, with amenities one would expect from a hotel. The staff are very helpful, friendly and ready to assist with anything you might need. Breakfast was VERY good with many options from Western food to the common Vietnamese breakfast Pho. Location is very central to visit the local sites and we were within walking distance of many good restaurants in the area.
Cons: We had laundry done here and it was the first time in all our times in SE Asia that it didn't come back looking or smelling clean. We did bring this to the attention of the hotel who kindly waved the charges, offered to get it redone and truly responded professionally. This really should not reflect on the hotel itself as they send it out and apparently have been using the same provider for over 1 year without complaint. Perhaps we just hit a bad day!

Overall we would recommend this hotel for anyone that wants a good, clean place to stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I never was in such a friendly, nice and helpful Hotel, although I travelled very much. I only can advise everybody coming to Hue to book the Serene Palace Hotel!!!
The rooms are great with free wifi and even Desktop Computers.
I never met such a friendly and helpful staff in a Hotel before. No matter what, all of them always tried to help!
Whenever I will come to Hue again, I will stay in Serene Palace Hotel for sure!!!
h_title_comment: Wonderful and extremely friendly and helpful
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The service was very impeccable! The staff very friendly. We were welcomed with some juice and a plate of fruits. The room was nice, large, and clean. The location was very attractive, close to many restaurants and a short walk away from the river and the market The breakfast was delicious and also the dinners.
h_title_comment: Michel B. Very friendly staff and very nice and charming hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had such an excellent experience with Serene Hotel in Hanoi, there was no question we were going to stay here. On our brief stay in Hue, the hotel had everything we could hope for- comfort with close proximity to the Imperial Palace and access to local cuisine. Nancy and the staff was warm and welcoming, a standard we pleasantly discovered consistent with Serene Hotel.

When we arrived to Hue by bus, it dropped it us off in front of a popular bustling backpacker hostel. My first inkling was “Uh oh, I hope the hotel isn’t in a party neighborhood.” Luckily, it was nearby, just a couple of blocks away tucked away on a muted side street. We had a pleasantly quiet room on the 8th floor with a great view, a perfect place to rest up after a sleeper bus ride.

The Imperial Palace and The Forbidden Purple City was easily accessible. We hired a tricycle driver just outside the hotel for the day because we figured there will be a lot of walking. For 200,000 dong (he asked for a 50, 000 tip, so be aware when you negotiate) he toured us around the main sites and dropped us back at the hotel.

Within a couple of blocks, there are a variety of highly rated Trip Advisor restaurants so we were close proximity to a selection of recommended culinary experience. After a day of walking around the immense Imperial Palace, you’ll be glad that you are a short distance walk from a delicious meal before retreating to the comforts of the hotel.

With only 24 hours in town, we covered a lot of ground. We thank the great folks at the hotel ensured our brief stay was pleasant and next leg of the trip to Hoi An seamless.
h_title_comment: Quality Service, Close Proximity, Relaxing Stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here in Jan 15. A wonderful small hotel in every way: the staff are quite exceptional. The rooms are modern and comfortable with a desk top p/c included. Great place. Great value.

John & Jeanette
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our experience with this hotel started off very well with our pick up ftom the train station. Then we were warmly greeted at the hotel with a staff member who sat us down and gave us a welcome drink and a plate of fruit each. The hotel facilities were clearly explained as well as the best way to see the local attractions, including prices. Our room was very clean, spacious and functional. The hotel staff are beautiful and remember all of our names (we are a party of 6).
h_title_comment: Great location and very friendly staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at this hotel for just one night, but the service was impeccable! We were welcomed with a plate of fruit and some juice. The room was nice, large, and clean. The location was wonderful; close to many restaurants and a short walk away from the river and the Citadel. The breakfast was delicious! We needed transportation to Hoi An the next day, and the hotel arranged that for us. Our driver (his name was Ning) was fantastic! He spoke English very well and he took us to many stops and sites along the way to Hoi An. It was essentially a private tour for a great price! We highly recommend this hotel and the service.
