If we return to Hue, we'll definitely stay at this hotel again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I traveled one month in vietnam and I visit many city but the best hotel that I find in vietnam is Hue serene palace hotel ! very very beautiful and the guys of the hotel very kind and professional .
I went for two nights and I find a beautiful big clean room with two beds king size and the computer also in the room !
Each morning there was fresh fruit and water free in the room
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
=- great little boutique hotel with exceptional staff. the hotel is in a Good location with just a short walk to the river. the food in the hotel restaurant was superb, and Very authentic Vietnamese.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                everyone knew our names and even what we ordered last time we were in the restaurant !Would stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My girlfriend and I spent a couple of days in the Serene Palace Hotel and I must thank the great treatment that we had from the staff. They were very helpful and provided a great service at all time. Perfect location. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
When the taxi veered into the little alley where this hotel is located we were not sure what to expect.... But we were more than pleasantly surprised. We were greeted by the doorman in his official doorman's uniform and were escorted to the reception where a legion of staff was waiting to help us. Refreshments, a towel and fruit were immediately brought to us while they were handling in check procedures.
Another staff member provided us with tourist information, maps and arranged our bicycles. We already made our plans, but I am sure they would have gone out of their way to help us with bookings etc. if we had wanted to. Very good level of English spoken by the staff as well.
Location of the hotel is excellent, close to the sights and to the restaurants.

Room was spacious, well appointed and clean!!! Bathroom was unexpectedly large. Fresh fruit and tea making facilities in the room.
Our room was at the back of the hotel on the 5th floor; so we had a view. Guest who stayed at the front of the hotel had a nicer view, but then you have to pay extra.

The only comment I would like to make is about the restaurant. As it is next to the lobby and the staircase it is not the cosiest of places. Breakfast was ok with a nice selection of fruits and a choice of cooked breakfast. I had a look in the kitchen, which could be more professional and clean....
Lots of pots and plans on the floor, the Vietnamese way, but I think this hotel can do better.

But overall excellent and very friendly service, spacious rooms, great location! More than great value for money.
h_title_comment: Great value for money, excellent service!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
You are really taken care of from the minute you arrive. You are given a cool towel, juice and a fruit platter while they process your details.

The restaurant staff are also wonderful and the food is good. It's a pity the restaurant is not situated on the roof to have a city view.

My room was spotlessly clean, quiet and was a good size with a balcony and view of the city.

I would definitely stay here again if I returned to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We stayed 2 nights at this hotel, the best hotel we have stayed in Central Vietnam. The staff are great, speaks good English, v goal oriented and professional. The rooms are well appointed, plush towels, a new fruit plate each day, with tea making facilities. The food in the restaurant is good and great value.
A cold welcome drink and a fruit plate was offered upon arrival, and we were accompanied by the staff to our room, and brief explanations were given. We were made v welcome indeed!
I asked to print a boarding pass, I sent the attachment and wallah, its done when I came down for dinner! 5-star value and service for a newish 3+-star hotel!
Highly recommended!
h_title_comment: A gem in a small lane!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here with our 2 children in January. The room was very clean & comfortable and excellent value for money. The staff in the hotel really go above & beyond to provide great service, local information, assistance with tours and a smiling face / offer of a taxi, assistance to carry bags whenever they spotted us. The hotel is also in an excellent location.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: central, helpful staff, clean rooms, good breakfast and some incredible lunch is why you definitely should stay at Hue Serene. So much value for you money. We got a nice room on the top floor and the view was beautiful. Large rooms that was well organized. Will definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Once again Vietnamese service excels the welcome we received was so good and the staff could not have done more. Welcome drink, fresh fruit, maps, suggested sightseeing - nothin was too much trouble. The rooms were beautiful with excellent bathroom facilities. The breakfast was first class with lots of choices. They even took the trouble to learn our names without asking us. Highly recommended
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is pleasant inside.

The front desk staff was uniformly excellent. Polite, efficient, gracious, and when they talk to you they give you their full attention. They seem very well trained. We were immediately greeted with refreshments--fresh fruit and juices--when we arrived, along with the wifi password, which I thought was a nice touch.

Room was very clean and well maintained. I was surprised to see a complimentary desktop computer with internet access. We ended up not using it but were pleased to have it available.

There were other amenities available that we appreciated. They left fresh fruit for us in the room. They rented us a motorbike. The next day, when it was raining, they arranged for a car and driver to take us around. The car/driver was a package deal with a preset menu of sightseeing sites, but it seemed reasonably priced (I think around $45 for the day). We had the car to ourselves and it was a roomy, comfortable Toyota crossover-like vehicle that was very clean. The staff even thought to loan us umbrellas to take with us for the day.

The restaurant in the hotel is excellent, with same superb service. I understand that the restaurant has a separate TripAdvisor listing, so I put my (glowing) review of the restaurant there. But it's worth mentioning that it's really convenient to have a good restaurant right there in the hotel.

Overall my experience at the Hue Serene Palace was extremely positive. I normally never get around to writing reviews, but my traveling companion and I both were so delighted by this place that it motivated me to write.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Fantastic service. New hotel, large rooms, good restaurant, very good value. Best of all is their service. They are happy to help you in every way they can. They arranged a good tour guide to show us the sites. Airport drop off was free. I stayed at their sister hotel in Hanoi (Hanoi Serene Hotel in old town), same amazing service.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We had a lovely time in Hue staying at the Serene Palace. Set back away from the main street gives this hotel a good location - walking distance to everything - but away from the traffic noise. We had rooms on the highest floor which was also helpful. The best thing about this hotel is the wonderful staff. Emily, Jenny, Mary, Si, Julia, Laura and all the girls were so wonderful and attentive to our every need to make sure our stay was top notch. They deserve a lot of credit for the success of this hotel - and for making our stay a delightful experience. When it was raining they even provided us umbrellas for our walking about. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. I would recommend the Serene Palace to any visitors to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The hospitality that I have received in Vietnam, especially at this hotel in Hue have been amazing. It's one thing to receive good or great service but it's entirely a different story when the staff is incredibly attentive and go "above and beyond". Within minutes from the moment we checked in, we were presented with our welcoming fruits and drinks. Breakfast in the morning was always served with the friendliest waitstaff and the concierge staff were always always always helpful and eager to assist us with any questions we may have. Only downside, walls are paper thin, you can hear anyone who walks down the hall as they converse with one another. The hotel is located off a small side street, it irked me initially when we arrived but by the end of our trip, there isn't any other hotel that I would recommend in Hue given the service and experience we have had here. Simply amazing...
h_title_comment: The location may fool you but this is a fabulous stay!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Located on a tiny alley-street, Serene Palace is a small but nice place to stay. When pulling up we were a bit concerned about the quality of the hotel; however, as soon as we entered the place we were greeted with smiles, fresh juice and prompt service. The rooms were clean and nice. The breakfast was awesome! The staff spoke great English (which is hard to find in Vietnam) and the front desk was super helpful with lining up quality excursions. The wi-fi is free (bonus). We stayed at more expensive Marriott Hotels in other cities in Vietnam but none compared to Serene Palace in terms of friendly personalized service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Wow it is really great to know you can get amazing service, awesome food and super friendly staff for less than $30.00 a night! Don't go past this hotel it is down a back street and you will honestly wonder where they are taking you. But it is a little hidden treasure! Hue its self is worth the drive or flight and the hotel is within walking distance of everything. The rooms all come with well appointed bathrooms, tv's, wifi and any other normal travellers expectation. We found the outstanding staff to be the key. Never was anything too much trouble, they are helpful and friendly and remember everyones name. This hotel caters for families and couples. The restaurant was actually one of the highest rated restaurants in Hue and we ate there on the last night... should have done this sooner great food reasonable prices. We organised a car through the hotel to pick us up for Danang this was an experience of dizzying heights as we climbed along the cliff faces between Danang and Hue. But we arrived safe and to a cold welcome drink. I would stay here again and tell all our friends to do the same!
h_title_comment: Worth the effort to find this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We have just had only one night at the beautiful Hue serene palace hotel unfortunatley wish we was staying longer. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are large with big balconys. The staff are fantastic really lovely and very helpful. We would highly recommend this Hotel.
Zoe from England
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Fantastic service, great room, quiet but close to center, excellent breakfast, wonderful and exceptionally helpful and attentive personnel. We would also like to recommend the restaurant for dinner. We ate there one evening and enjoyed impeccable service, delicious fish, and gourmet mousse chocolate for dessert. We tried Nina's Cafe the following day, were quite disappointed, and regretting not staying at the hotel for dinner.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: stayed for four nights, would surely come again. Good rooms, good service, nice people at the receptions desk, will help you choose tours or in any other occasions (by printing out something in my case) - could recommend this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Everything was great and fantastic here. Lovely service all the time. Will come again for sure! Lovely balcony and big rooms. Hidden from the mainstreet, no noice besides from the locals. Breakfast delisious.
h_title_comment: What a wonderfull and hidden place in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Our group of four stayed at Hue Serene for two nights enroute to Hoi An. We share the same sentiments as previous 'Excellent' rated reviews so will save the details. The staff were attentive and very friendly, the rooms were spacious and faultless and breakfast was a nice choice between Vietnamese and Western dishes. Laundry was charged by the kg and very cheap - we did a week's washing for four adults for only USD3. The use of the in-room computer was a great plus.
We booked the pagoda and the 3 tombs private day tour with the hotel as well as a private car from Hue to Hoi An. Our driver on both days was Mr Nguyen. During the road trip, we had a crash course learning Vietnamese with Mr Nguyen and a karaoke session as we headed into DaNang. He showed us the best Vietnamese coffee in the region (and he was right) and had the most delicious Mi Quang noodles for lunch.
Not far from the hotel on Le Loi is a small family run bakery which sells the most delicious doughnuts. We bought a whole bag of doughnuts and assorted pastries for US$2. Needless to say we were there every day. The location was very safe and convenient, with the esplanade and night markets a short walk away.
We wish to thank the staff for a great stay in Hue and would recommend this hotel to others looking for great value accommodation.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We only had the pleasure of staying one night at the hotel but the staff was very attentive and kind always asking if we needed anything and asking about our day. The room is amazing for the price! Big and spacious and located away from any loud noise that may come from the main road.

Would definitely recommend this place for any of my friends who need a place to stay in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very warm and friendly staff, good breakfast, beautiful facilities. We really enjoyed our stay here in Hue! The restaurant in the hotel is also very good - be sure to try the pomelo and banana flower salad, it is amazing!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The staff in this hotel were just excellent. Very helpful and friendly.

The room was great and had a desk top computer which was very useful. They also left fresh fruit every day. There was an excellent wifi connection and good selection of English language tv channels. We enjoyed the breakfast which had a buffet and cooked to order option
This hotel was excellent value for money and would recommend to others.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed four nights and from the first moment we arrived when Jessie took our bags to the room, gave us a fresh fruit drink while he registered us, we felt welcomed! We had arranged with Jenny to be picked up at airport and Mr. Ninh was our driver; he was so friendly and nice that we requested him to drive us on the transfer from Hue to Hoi An that we had also arranged with Jenny. We cannot say enough good things about the excellent staff of the hotel and the restaurant and the facilities of the hotel. We had a Superior Double on the 7th floor and the room was immaculate, huge, PC on desk, divine bed with extra pillows, big bathroom with nice fixtures and tub/shower combo. Arriving tired and not looking forward to a walk to find dinner, we were so surprised to see that we could dine in the restaurant. We met An and Thanh-Thanh the first evening and they recommended we try Hoi An specialty of fried pancakes filled with pork and shrimp. It was delightful and this was the beginning of our love affair with the staff and the restaurant. We actually ate here every night and invited friends to join us one evening. Wine list is good too which is unusual in Vietnam. Breakfast was a feast of many fruits, juices, coffee, tea, delicious fresh baked baguettes and either traditional Pho noodle soup or western egg dishes with bacon or sausage. Sally, An, Thuy and Thanh-Thanh became our friends and each morning instantly brought my tea with milk and sugar and my husband's coffee. The hotel is modern, comfortable and since we had noise issues in some ways with every hotel we stayed in the echoing that some guests noticed did not bother us enough to complain about and we did not hear a rooster. It is not billed as 4 star, but very clearly is 3 star and exactly a good value at $32 per night including the huge breakfast. We cannot agree with some reviewers who were disappointed that it was not 4 star. We think it was incredible value for what we paid in other places, like Hanoi, Hoi An, Dalat and Sai Gon. Jenny at the front desk can arrange any number of tours and is very efficient, answering all questions that we had from afar as we planned our month trip to Vietnam. The hotel is centrally located, and although the street is not impressive, most hotels like this are tucked away in unassuming little streets like this and it does not take away from the charm. We were well satisfied and would return again and again if we could. We actually reluctantly took our leave of the staff. The girls in the restaurant gathered for a last photo and we felt we had made friends. Highly recommended for many reasons.
h_title_comment: A Perfect Stay in So Many Ways!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was super cute, we recieved a fruit plate and watermelon juice on arrival and a very sweet staff member went through all the local sights with us. Despite us being early, they got our room ready for us really quickly. The hotel room is huge, clean with lovely decor and the best bed! I slept so well, it was really comfy. The shower was good too. The location is good, right near the markets. The breakfast was very tasty with a good selection. I would definitely recommend staying here if you come to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The owners of this hotel know how to do it right. The staff is so well trained and it really showed. They are all very friendly, welcoming, helpful, and will do anything to make your stay wonderful. Everything is possible and they can arrange anything you need including tours, motorbike or bicycle rental, etc. The cost might be a little more than you can find elsewhere, but for the convenience, it is worth it.
Rooms were very clean and spacious. Breakfast had several options to order off the menu, and it also includes a buffet with fresh fruit and different breads.
We had dinner there one night because the restaurant got great reviews, but it was just okay, so we went elsewhere the next night. However, if you like chocolate, try their home-made chocolate mousse ice cream. It's to die for!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is tucked along a little lane, but within ready walking distance of shops, restaurants and market. The rooms are comfortable, with excellent facilities. What makes this a wonderful place to stay is the happy, friendly, helpful staff. In every instance they went out of their way to provide the most excellent service .A bonus is the fabulous restaurant. Truly excellent food at a modest price. We ate there every night of our stay, as it was outstanding quality and value (we normally don't eat at hotels at all). Good value, and recommended very highly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Comfortable, clean bed and bathroom, tv and internet worked, nice décor.
Sometimes I forget that I actually appreciate having a nicely appointed room, we came from a four-star that we left because it was depressing... though I must say the fish pond in the lobby was not very appealing to look at. The alley it is located in is a bit dark and dingy at night.
Staff is very attentive professional and well trained. You are initially greeted with a drink and fruit and the breakfast is so well organized. I wish all hotels would make the fruit, real juice, and hot drinks as a buffet and then the rest by a la carte ordering - there is much less waste.
The only elevator can be a bit slow when everyone is trying to use it at once, but oh well then we took the stairs.
We booked our train ticket through the hotel - enjoyed the train a lot more than the bus, they only charge you one dollar to arrange it and have it waiting for you in an envelope, what service!
We also booked a private daytrip with a company through the hotel - the hotel have the regular tombs as their recommendations - but we really preferred the huge (empty of people) Huyen Tran Princess Temple, which we added to the 'regular' trip to two of the tombs. Thanks to all the good, accurate reviews of this temple on trip advisor as we both agreed that we would have been sorely disappointed in just the tombs. Actually we should have skipped the tombs and walked to the An Dinh palace, which we had had recommended by a couple we chatted with a few times.
h_title_comment: Fabulous stay and value, really nice to have a comfortable hotel, when it is cold and rainy
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for three nights. The room was spacious and great value for money. The staff were excellent and extremely helpful. We had a car transfer to hoi an and our driver quoc was very good. We had a funny moment when I stood in something and brought it back in the car. He was very good and we all had a good laugh.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Just stayed at the Serene Palace which is actually not so serene. There is a serious issue with sound proofing in the hotel. You hear every foot step and every voice echo through the building. Had a front facing room with roosters crowing at the crack of dawn. Some dropped a plate or something in the early morning and you could hear it rattle through the hotel. You can hear your neighbors in the next room and foot steps clamoring in the room above.what the hotel lacks in serenity it makes up for in pleasant, very attentive staff. Rooms are large and clean. If you choose this hotel demand a high floor in the back of the hotel. Stayed on the 3rd floor and you could hear everything from the lobby. While restaurant gets good reviews it is nothing special. The Vietnamese dishes are watered down versions to serve a foreign clientele. Vietnamese dishes are rather flavorless which is a pity in s country with a spectacular spice and herb culinary tradition. We found this to be the case with most restaurants in the prime tourist area. Best head for street food, you'll get better food at lower price. And no you won't get sick! Places may look shabby but the food is awesome. That's just how people eat here! If you want pizza and spaghetti stay home!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
A very friendly and professional hotel - the staff were very helpful and wanted to make sure our stay was perfect. The room was large, modern, very clean and well equipped.
The breakfast was excellent.

The location was good - in the tourist area near plenty of restaurants and shops.

Would highly recommend.

Thanks to Anne, Emily and all the other staff for making our stay very pleasant (Sue is using her new mug at home).

Sue, David & Thomas
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Ver y nice and comfortable big modern rooms. Breakfast was excellent. Excellent shower. The staff were very attentive and keen. Kept serving me tea while I was waiting for my transporttion to the next town without having to aks. Overall I would describe it as very professionally run hotel that wouldnt be out of place in any big western city.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We traveled through Asia for 5 weeks and this place was the best we encountered. The service was something else, there were excellent staff who could have friendly conversations in English! The food was fantastic :)
h_title_comment: Best service and stay in 5 weeks
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Only staid there for 1 night, but it was great
Breakfast was fresh and good, but the hotel restaurant is worth having a few meals there, we had one dinner there it was delicious.
The service is great, staff is very welcoming, gave us a welcome drink and fruits.
Rooms are clean and big, bed is very confortable
i would definitly recommend this hotel very well situated
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
If you want excellent value, style and a great night's sleep, look no further than the Serene Palace in Hue. This hotel is run by an efficient team, all be it slightly OTT, that also doesn't miss a thing!
It's location is right in the centre of all the restaurants and bars. The beds are firm and extremely comfortable and the room was modern and very stylish. Even the breakfast was spot on.. in that they catered for European and Vietnamese tastes. There was a widescreen TV that showed popular movies and documentaries plus they also provided a PC in the room.
The only negative point was that the hot water ran cold when we needed a shower in the afternoon or evenings.

Steve & Min
h_title_comment: Justifies the ranking of 3/113 on TripAdvisor..
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for two nights 13 - 15 Jan in a Standard room. No balcony with just a view out the back but given the small amount of time we stayed in the room it's probably better to save a bit of money. Room was very nice and clean with good shower. The hotel is quite new so all clean. Good breakfast included. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only down-side I can say is that the location is about 10 minute walk from the main area of bars/restaurants and in a rather dark side street. When walking back at night after dinner and drinks somewhere a but closer would have been handy. But overall a great hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 2n3D in December and glad we picked this place. Location was great, close to the restaurants and just off the Main Street on a quiet lane- there was building work immediately next door but it didn't affect our stay. The Staff were super friendly and helpful and helped us with ideas of sights to see. A special mention needs to be made for the food- we had dinner here and the food and service was amazing.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Me and my husband stayed at this lovely hotel for only a night. Wish we could spend more time here. It is a great hotel, with huge rooms and excellent service. The food we had at the hotel was probably one of the best meals we had in Vietnam. What made our stay so memorable was the hospitality of the staff, they made you feel at home! I would highly recommend this hotel and if we ever go back to Vietnam and Hue I will stay here again without a doubt!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Everything was absolutely perfect. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms were really nice. The hotel restaurant serves local cuisine thats really good at really affordable prices, i recommend to have the bun bo in here.

The hotel is in an alley that makes it a bit hard to find, but once you get there you see that its really beatiful.

Overall we highly recommend it for any trip to Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We booked to stay in the hotel from 7th Jan to 9th Jan and also booked pickup from the airport to the hotel. Reminded Jenny a few days before our arrival. There was no one waiting to pick us up when we got out of the arrival lounge. Called the hotel after 10 minutes and were told the pickup will be arriving late and need to wait another 20 minutes. Pickup finally arrive but was more upset when we saw a 10 seater was sent to fetch 12 of us plus our luggages. Imagine the driver trying to squeeze 12 adults plus luggages into a 10 seater. This was despite repeated reminder to the hotel that there are 12 of us with luggages and assurances from the hotel that they will send a proper pickup. Had to call the hotel again to ask for an extra taxi to fit in all of us.
Was ready to confront the hotel management upon arrival at the hotel but all was forgiven when they set up a good reception on our arrival and took up the cost of the extra taxi.
This is a great hotel for the price that is charged. A four star service for a two star price. Breakfast was superb with a good range of fresh fruits and fresh juice to boot. Breakfast main course is ala carte with delicious local and western choices. Top this up with the smiling service by Lucy and you cannot ask for a better start for the day.
Rooms were clean and well appointed like a four star room.
The duty manager Mary apologised about the bungled pickup again when we were checking out but all was already madeup by our great stay at the hotel.
Would definitely stay there again if visiting Hue and recommend any friends that are planning trip there.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Our plane was late arriving in Hue so we arrived at the hotel 10.30-11pm very tired. It felt like an oasis in a very busy, touristy Hue. It is a lovely little hotel, the breakfasts were great, the room lovely and the staff went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect for you. Lou sorted us out with some bread and cheese when we arrived late and had no energy to leave the hotel to find food. We ate there one night when we couldnt face the chaos of Hue and it was a great choice. The food was delicious and a good selection. The restaurant was busy the whole time we were there with people coming into the hotel to eat there. The staff arranged a car to take us to Hoi An on our last day for $65 for the trip. The hotel is in a little lane but as prevous TA peopel have said, this makes sure it is quiet and you get a good nights sleep in a busy city.We walked to the Imperial Palace one morning (20 min walk over the large bridge) so its well located too. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it. Very friendly staff.
h_title_comment: The staff make this hotel wonderful
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrived late in the evening and had some butterflies as the taxi turned into the narrow lane where the hotel is located. Gulp. Half way along and we stopped outside beautiful entranceway. We were greeted by happy, smiling and attentive staff. We were starving and went to the restaurant at 9.45pm. Great meal. We were there for New Years Eve 2014 so chose to have the dinner in the restaurant - awesome as well. Hope I can review the restaurant somewhere on this site as well.

Anyway, back to the hotel. We had a room on the 5th floor. Loved it. The bed was rather hard, compared to other places we stayed at. The room was spacious and clean. Centrally located, we recommend this to hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is great value for money. Located at the end of the main street Le Loi and surrounded by a lot of restaurants and market place around, this is the busiest area in Hue.
The hotel is located in a very small lane which you can miss and so be careful, its around 30 meters walk from the main street. Our stay in Hue was not that great because it rained non stop on both the days, but we were advised to take a private guided tour by the Hotel, both the Driver and the tour guide Ms. Linh were fluent in English and the tour was amazing even in the rain we went to the imperial city and the tombs.
The breakfast is good, the restaurant is nice and Ms. Sally will serve you with a smile.
We stayed in a room with balcony, we couldn't enjoy the balcony because of the rain, but the room is nice spacious and functional. The staff is very helpful and pleasant.
h_title_comment: Nice hotel in Hue, great value for money !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great room, great location on a very small street with the real Vietnam feel. The staff and service were beyond outstanding. We were treated like friends. Our top floor room had a nice seating area and a large balcony with views of the city. The bathroom was basic but everything very clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a very good dinner at the restaurant and the à la carte breakfast was very generous with options and everything was delicious. We would definitely go back to that hotel if we ever go back to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Welcoming hotel helped us maximize our two days in Hue. Set us up on short notice with good tour guide. In the week before we visited, we had to change our booking plans twice. Not only was the hotel accommodating, it was quick and without hassle, even getting complicated deposit bookkeeping right at check-out.

Hotel also arranged transport to and from Hoi An and Da Nang, with good, safe, timely drivers.

Good food, dinner and breakfast. Entire staff from front desk to restaurant servers engaging.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our best hotel in Vietnam. Stunning clean room, kind attentive staff and great location. Reception always quick to help us book any tours and made excellent recommendations of where to best spend our time. Also very helpful to have the best restaurant in the city on the ground floor. Must try the banana leaf salad!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: when the minibus took us down a narrow bumpy road I thought what have I booked, but soon all my fears were quashed because from the moment we stepped out of the minibus to the time we left we were welcomed by the most fantastic staff. The hotel is very clean and modern and within walking distance to many bars and restaurants. The breakfast is excellent and so was the evening meal it was also very good value. There is an excellent choice of cocktails all reasonably priced. I would like to say a big thank you to Sally, Lucy, Iris and Lee for making our stay so special. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We had a huge high level room with a balcony that looked over the city. We were even welcomed with a surprise cake for our honeymoon. Staff are lovely too and the restaurant is reasonably priced.

About 20-30 min walk from the Citadel.

Highly recommended!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Medium size hotel with top notch services from staff in good location. The hotel is in an alley, but accessible by car and easy to find. Rooms were spanking clean, fixtures and bedroom furniture were in mint-conditions. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were extremely pleasant, attentive without going over board. Services in all areas were spot on, from restaurant to car rental, taxi, tour info, and pricing.

I checked in after noon, agreed to rent a scooter for a full day. When I received the scooter, the staff automatically cut down the price in half without being asked. The next day, I wanted to ride out at 8 PM, an employee lent me her own scooter without charging. Transportation desk explained multiple options to get around, and was knowledgeable about the city.

Services were on par, if not higher than some 5 star hotels I'd been to; and it's not just the receptionists. Restaurant hosts, waiters, doormen, transportation employees, room maintenance, etc. - all provided consistent services. The approach was low key and non-invasive, but highly efficient.

Breakfast consisted of self-service food/drinks combined with ordered items. I saw other guests ordering more than one item, no extra charge.

Dinner was excellent, Viet dishes were authentic, some were lightly modified to suit a more generic taste (less spicy), all were excellent.

Welcoming and goodbyes were warm and quick. This hotel has it all: Location, facilities, and best of all, excellent staff. One of the best hotels I've been to on a 2 month long trip throughout China and several SE Asia Countries.
h_title_comment: Excellent staff, good location, spanking clean facility, and moderate pricing
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for one night and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful and did bookings to see the sites for us, tais etc , the rooms were very comfortable, very clean and the location was very central. The price was great and we would definitely recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: As Im travelling, Im only using Hostels, However after several bad sleeps and bed bugs I thought I'd splash out and get an actual hotel! We had been riding from Hoi An to Hue which took soooo long, when I arrived at the Serene Palace I was greeted by the concierge who took my backpack and parked my motorbike. Gave us fresh juices and fresh fruits whilst we were waiting and then took us straight to our room. The room was luxury! Huge, with bathrobes, a PC, TV, Fridge, a Bed big enough for 4!! Bathroom shower was great, really fast and Hot.....everything was just what I needed after a cold grueling MC ride, Breakfast was superb! You can have as much as You want from the A la Carte Menu and we ate like Kings! Trust! Try the Pho for Breakkie, it goes down a treat. Staff were lovely and helpful, especially Sally the waitress. Cant wait to come back
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The location is good- close to restaurants and about 20 minutes' walk to Dang Ba Marlet. The staff were great and helpful from the time of check-in to our departure. The rooms including the bathroom are big and comfortable. The airconditioner provided hot air to cater to the winter period. The inroom computer was an added bonus.
h_title_comment: Very nice and clean hotel in a good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
we stayed here for 1 night. Decent sized and comfortable room. Service was good.
Good location, forbidden city within 25 mins walk or 5 mins by taxi. The food in the hotel was one of the best vietnamese cuisine among the ones we had during our whole Vietnam trip.
h_title_comment: Great Hotel at good price. Amazing Food.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is situated in a fairly hand place to restaurants and night life. The room is clean and very well appointed. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I was unwell one morning and the staff were very helpful and rushed around to get help me in any way possible, offering tea and whatever I needed which was such a lovely touch. The one criticism would be that the room felt very damp, but that didn't stop our enjoyment of the hotel and we would still recommend this hotel to anyone.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We could not have been happier with this hotel. Such a hidden gem and one we are happy to recommend and hope that other travellers get to experience not only amazing and genuine service but some of the most delicious food we have had so far in Vietnam from the Hotel Restaurant. Not only delicious but so reasonable on price.
This is the perfect spot for any traveller from singles, couples to families and one you won't regret.
Thank you
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Great hotel situated in a calm street. The staff is extremely friendly and speaks perfect English. They gave us lots of information about Hué and its restaurants & sightseeing places, it's even better than a tourist information center.

The beds were great, good pillows. Bathroom is big with a very good shower. The restaurant serves wonderful food for very good prices.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Just to reiterate what most reviews say, the staff are excellent, they cant do enough for you. They efficiently collected us from the airport and quickly arrived at the hotel and were given a refreshing smoothie and a fruit plate. We were then shown our room and we were upgraded to a larger room. The room was spacious with 2 double beds and very clean, only minor issue was it was quite noisy from across the lane in front of the hotel, but we were prepared with our ear plugs anyway. Breakfast was excellent with a great choice.and they arranged a day tour of the Citadel and the emperor's mausoleums where the guide was very interesting and informative. Well located, an easy walk to all the sites, bars & restaurants, markets etc.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The small road leading to the hotel is a bit dodgy but the hotel itself is very good. Nice big rooms with great bed, balcony and good copious breakfast. Staff is competent and very helpful with advice and tips abou tje city and makes you feel welcome. Go there.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I don't think I can say enough here. The staff are delightful. We arrived to lovely welcome drink and fruit. The staff provided very comprehensive tour information making it easy for us to plan our activities. After a long day out we decided to eat at hotel, the food was wonderful and beautifully presented. We ended up eating there all 3 nights. Whilst we cannot thank everyone enough a special thanks to Laura, Sally, Ivy and Mary.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The staff really make this hotel. Very friendly, proactive, and always trying hard. Good value for price.

The rooms are inconsistent. We reserved two of the same type; one had a glass shower, and the other only a tub with a hand shower wand but nowhere to hang it to shower standing up. Very odd, and needs at least a wall hook for the shower head. Similarly, one room was missing a bedside table. The rooms have PCs that, because they're shared, give me the virus/malware heebie-jeebies. We didn't use ours. The wifi was decent (a bit flaky) in the common areas but didn't penetrate to our room very well (it showed signal in the room but actual data transfer was iffy until we went outside the room).

Breakfast (included) was a small fruit buffet (but the fruit were all fresh, ripe and of excellent quality!) as well as a menu you could order from. We mostly stuck to the noodle soups (like bun bo hue -- delicious, and not dumbed down for the western palate). The eggs were perfectly good as well, although one day the "sausage" accompanying mine was half of a cold hot dog! The dishes to-order are small, but it's fine to order two.

The location is good, on a semi-paved back lane (meaning relatively quiet) but a very short walk to tons of cafes, restaurants, and bars. It's not a place where one can hail a taxi, but the hotel will happily call one to arrive in just a couple minutes.

We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant one night. It was pretty good, but nowhere near as good as the locals' place we went for lunch for local specialties.

The only major problem we had was the playlist of the same bad Christmas music, at high volume, on repeat at all meals at the restaurant (including breakfast). Really unwelcome, especially for non-Christians. We thought by going to Asia we could escape the ubiquity of Christmas!
h_title_comment: Great staff, nice breakfast, wifi needs work, Xmas music got on our nerves
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: I was traveling solo and stayed for two nights at Hue Serene Palace. The staff was very helpful and spoke very good English. They always remembered my name and they helped me book a motorcycle tour of the tombs and a car to Hoi An. The room was clean and comfortable. It was fairly quiet. The hotel was easy to find and close to many restaurants. Breakfast was excellent and included at least 10 different kinds of tropical fruits.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Throughout our travels in SE Asia the Serene Palace stood out in terms of value for money. For the price the rooms were palacial and the quality of finish good.

The service was very helpful - and delivered with good humour. This applied to advice given for seeing the Imperial Citadel and planning trips outside of town as well as in the restaurant.

We have only two complaints to an otherwise faultless stay:
1) The hotel arranged a driver to take us on to Hoi An. The route taken included the spots we had been advised and requested. However, on arrival in Hoi An the drivers "friend" hopped on in - supposedly under the guise that as a local she would help find our hotel. In reality it was purely as a sales pitch for her family tailoring shop. This may have been a purely personal initiative of the driver and not sanctioned by Serene Palace but I mention this so that the management will also know what is being done in their name.
2) There was a follow-up email to request that if we had no issues with our stay could we please give a 5* review. The 5* rating I have given therefore relates to the stay itself and not the overall experience as the driver and email were too pushy for my personal taste.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed at the Serene Palace Hotel with my family of four for two nights in December 2014. We booked a family room and was very pleased with it. It was big, spacious with furniture that was well-appointed. There was even a desktop computer! This hotel seems relatively new and everything was in good condition and working order. Staff spoke good English and were very helpful in giving suggestions and directions. Breakfast was great and the food we had at the restaurant for lunch and dinner was some of the best we had in Vietnam and were of reasonable prices! It's really convenient to have stay and dine at the same place. The only (minor) minus point is the location. It's a bit far out and a taxi is required to reach the Citadel. Nevertheless there was a few restaurants near the hotel and I would definitely stay in there again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very nice hotel - room and bathroom was superb and the complimentary passion fruit on arrival and in the room was a nice touch. Breakfast was great - one of the best phos I've had in vietnam. Also a nice restaurant for dinner. The staff were also very friendly and helped a organise transport to Hoi An. 5 stars.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel staff including the waitresses at the serene restaurant are wonderful and attentive to guests needs. The food at the serene restaurant is also very nice and reasonably priced.
h_title_comment: Very good service and friendly staff
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Grossly overrated backpack traveller hotel in a filthy back alley. Bunk beds and a mediocre breakfast await you at a three-star price. My wife and I were so disappointed that we spent only a night at the Serene and moved to the Saigon Morin for our two last nights, which had very attractive rates for an incredible value. Come on, TripAdvisor, check the facts before posting nonsense rankings!
h_title_comment: Third-ranked hotel in Hue? You must be kidding...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed three nights and were very impressed with the service from the staff and the little touches such as welcome drinks, daily fruit bowl, Xmas present in our room. Sally was very kind when my partner was sick with a cold, arranging him ginger tea. The rooms were clean and modern. Ours smelt a little mouldy from the bathroom but Hue is basically very damp so maybe that is just a fact of life. Don't be alarmed by the side alley location - it makes for a quiet sleep and is very central.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Just great.Stayed here 3 nights. The moment we walked in we were treated so well. The rooms are big and all have there own balconies. Fantastic staff who can't do enough for you, nothings too hard. The breakfast was great, a menu that you can pick what you want and they always ask if you want more. Down an alley way but the taxi from the train station knew how to get there.Close to lots of eating places. Si, one of the staff organized a cooking class for us,great and she even helped us with our transferr in the next city we visited and with our kareoke night, which is next door to the hotel, fun.We would definitely stay here again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace hotel attracted us by amazing quality record to start from.
We just turned up without reservation on Saturday morning straight from the night train, were greeted by welcome drink and a plate of fruit. Unfortunately, no rooms free! By the time we drank the juice and used their excellent Wifi, the manager Marie came up with cancellation: room became available but was above our budget. It was huge family room with two double beds, flat screen TV, computer in room, complimentary corner with fruit/drink/water, bath robes, you name it! (203 just above the front entrance). Although last room available, Marie reduced price to a very fare $30 which we could not refuse.
We loved the room and friendly staff so much, we stayed extra night!
The hotel is very well built with quality finishings, tasteful decor and immaculate hygiene!
Organised DMZ tour for us and onward taxi to Hoi An, both very successfully!
Breakfast perfect with plenty of fruit, fresh juices, omelets, Vietnamese offerings, nice spacious back of reception area.
Wifi throughout, computer in room worked well too.
Location down the tiny alley did not detract from hotel but made it quieter, even though we initially were worried our room was right over the entrance. The area just at the end of this alley IS the centre of tourist life at night!
We see now why there were only excellent reviews! Well done, team Serene!
h_title_comment: So good, we did not want to leave
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The service in this comfortable hotel is awesome. Although we were by no means the only guests, the friendly young ladies who work on reception and in the breakfast room went out of their way to address us by our first names.

An elevator took us to our large, comfortable room with its king-sized double bed. It was equipped with a safe, tea/coffee , water, and fruit (free) but we had to plug the kettle in the bathroom. The bathroom has a walk-in rainforest shower, ample hot water but little room to place toiletries around the wash basin.

There is a good Wi-Fi signal throughout the property, and an added bonus for us was the flat screen TV that could pick up both BBC World and the ever-optimistic Russian First Channel. No CNN!

Breakfast is great: a buffet of exotic fruits, yoghurt etc. In addition you can order as many items as you like from the a la carte menu, including cornflakes with cold milk and omelettes.

The hotel is located in a quiet backstreet within walking distance of the buzz in the street with the DMZ Bar and Backpackers Hostel.

Hotel staff arranged a car and local guide (Amy) for a tour of the DMZ sites for $US 130 which was more comprehensive that the consolidated minibus tours and afforded us the opportunity to ask many questions of our guide, and to include a special visit to the Mines Advisory Centre in Dong Ha. British charity MAG are doing great work helping to clear unexploded ordinance. Hotel staff also arranged door to door transportation to the Hotel Kiman that they recommended and booked for us in Hoi An. For $US 65 we thus had a car available all day, and could stop for lunch in Danang and spend time exploring the caves of Marble Mountain 10 km south of Danang.

This hotel and its welcoming, helpful staff richly deserve the many 5 star ratings bestowed by TripAdvisor contributors.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Our interaction with the staff of the Hue Serene Palace started well before we arrived in Hue. Vietnam Airlines cancelled a Sunday flight from Hanoi to Hue and diverted us to DaNang. We contacted the hotel to inform them of a possible delay in our arrival as we were unsure of how we were to get to Hue from DaNang. The staff at the hotel immediately arranged for a private car (priced competively) to meet us at the airport and drive us to Hue. We actually arrived in Hue earlier than our initial schedule. It was the first of many amenities extended to us that made the stay perfect. The finest hotel staff in Vietnam!

We checked into a clean and comfortable room. The breakfast buffet offered wonderful Vietnamese cuisine and Western options. To our surprise, the hotel restaurant was the best in Hue. The young waitresses made every dining experience unique and personal and great fun!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We hit Hue during a rainy spell and this hotel was a beacon of warmth. The breakfasts were wonderful. Good variety of selections. The servers were so friendly and we enjoyed their smiling face every day. We ate dinner in the restaurant twice due to not wanting to go out again in the rain. It was delicious-both Vietnamese and Western. Front desk folks were very helpful in setting up tours and answering questions. We would return for sure. Hotel is down a side street/alley that is a bit tricky to find so be sure you have good address for getting there.
h_title_comment: Loved our stay at Serene Palace in Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We have just left the Serene Hotel, what a beautiful place to stay, the staff are lovely, breakfast good, we had the Merry Christmas dinner last night and it was delicious, the room that we had was perfect, I cannot fault anything. Thank you to all employees for making our staff so wonderful.
One point though and this is not the fault of the hotel, they arranged for driver to take us from the hotel to our next stop in Hoi an. We have arrived safe, but I must say the driving left a lot to be desired, I am not the best of passengers at the best of time, however, I did fear for my safety, the driver was concerned with his mobile phone more than he was for our safety I think. This is only my personal opinion, but one I feel that you need to be aware of and in no way does it take away from my wonderful experience at the Serene.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Stayed with a group of 6 in November this year and was pleasantly surprised by both the service and accommodation.
Don't let the location down a small alley put you off, once inside the hotel is clean, the service is good and the food excellent.
All the reviews are true, this is one not to miss and all our party agreed to recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This is a very clean, comfortable hotel in a great location but what really stands out is the service. The staff at Serene Palace hotel were by the far the friendliest, most professional and most helpful we encountered during our Vietnam travels. I'd really like to give a special shout out to Emily on reception, she was impeccable. Do try the hotel restaurant, food was excellent! If i had to list a negative it would be a hard mattress but this didn't really bother us. Would definitely recommend and stay again if we returned.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
After a 6 hour ride in shiitty weather I was greeted by super friendly staff along with a well need welcome pack consisting of fresh fruit and OJ. The rest of my short stay was just as pleasant!

Ps and the laundry was great. Only 2usd for 1kg! Bargain for tightwards like me
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: What can we say!! Just brilliant. Staff were so friendly and helpful welcome drink and fruit while we waited to check in. Room was large spotless bed so comfortable and in room computer with free WiFi. Bathroom luxurious with spa bath and hair dryer. Breakfast choice was great and included in our rate of US$25 per night. It was our 25th anniversary and we were greeted with cake flowers and rose petals on our bed. Great location close to river and short walk across bridge to citadel. Thank you Serene Palace.
h_title_comment: Excellent service and value for money!!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The rooms and location of the hotel are adequate but what stands out is the service. Every member of staff was constantly friendly, helpful and well-organized. Meals were delightful, but the staff were happy to suggest other places if wanted. We will be happy to stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We are really glad we chose this lovely hotel over the other we looked at.

Wonderful friendly, helpful staff and a special mention to Jenny and Sally.
Bright, clean, modern and really well maintained this hotel will surely please all. You have a lift to all floors and thank goodness as we were on the sixth.

Our room was super. Big and bright with a full patio door to a balcony with a decent enough view....even if it was of the rooftops! But the weather was not kind to us so sitting and chatting on the balcony was not on the cards.

The bed was king size, very comfy with a choice of pillows made for a very good nights sleep.
The bathroom matched....modern and spotless. No less than three ladies came in the morning to clean! Flat screen TV with a decent selection of channels.
And what is that I see on the table? A full on computer in every room!! Other hotels please take note. A truly excellent idea!

I am a bit fussy about breakfast as this for me is the best meal of the day. I had all I needed here and a nice touch is that the girls will serve you whatever you need. Fruit, bread and other small items you help yourself to....but ask and it will be served.

Any drawbacks? We did not like the rough, potholed lane this lovely hotel is down. It is in bad shape and when it rained (as it did!) you could be splashed by motorbikes and they do come really, really close to you. You are a mere few minutes stroll from the center with as many restaurants and bars as you could want.

Recommended and we would stay again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This was our first visit to Hue and my wife and I and our friends had rooms booked at the Hue Serene Palace. We were there for just 2 nights, but if I'm ever back I would absolutely stay here. The room was comfortable, and the breakfast was great, but what set it apart was the quality of the staff. They were welcoming, friendly, very helpful and really wanted to make sure our stay in Hue as pleasant as possible.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We arrived at the hotel after a tiring, rainy drive from Hoi An. We immediately felt the warmth of the service we would get at the Serene Palace. We were presented with welcome drinks and a selection of fruit. Up in our room, there was more fruit, a computer for our use (as well as wifi), a pot to heat water for tea. The only complaint I have is the tub/shower combination. Some guests do like a tub, but they are not safe for us older folks.

The hotel also had a restaurant, and we were quite pleased with the dishes we ordered for dinner the two nights we stayed there. The restaurant staff was also very attentive. This was probably one of the most service-oriented hotel we have ever stayed at in over 50 years of travel to countries around the world. We were quite pleased with the guide the hotel arranged for us to visit sites in and around Hue.
h_title_comment: Such great service and comfort, too.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff in the hotel are really great and they make they stay very easy. They can arrange any tours you need and you do not pay that much extra for them to do so. The rooms have everything you need and the breakfast is ok with a choice of eggs and Vietnamese food. Would recommend the hotel and would stay again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We only stayed in the Serene Palace for just one night but could have stayed there many more nights
The service from the Hotel staff was fantastic so friendly and welcoming
When we arrived we were greeted with a fresh bowl of fruit and glass of juice
Then the staff member explained all about the Hotel and Hue before taking us to our room
We would recommend the Hotel to anyone visiting Hue
h_title_comment: Great place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: One of the best thing I experienced in Hue was the hotel! I had a wonderful stay at Hue Serene Palace. Location was just right. It was clean and well maintained. We were greeted by Jenny, a very friendly and most professional staff there. She took the trouble to personally show us the room and explained every detail to us, including some wonderful attractions in Hue! Mary was fantastic as well... she directed us to a local eatery where we had the most tasty noodle in the entire central Vietnam. Mary also gave us some great shopping tips! Our journey was very smooth... thanks to Mary and Jenny who helped us in arranging our transportation. Besides, all the staff that served us breakfast gave their first class services. I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Value for money. It was a very relaxing experience. Anyone who travels to Hue have to stay here. I highly recommend it. My 5 star ratings to this hotel. Well done and keep up the good work!
h_title_comment: Best Hotel To Stay In Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Incredibly warm welcome that carried through my whole stay. Very helpful recommendations and knowledgeable, friendly staff. Room was lovely - comfortable and ready even before the designated check in time, so after the delicious welcoming drink and fruit I was shown right up to the room where I enjoyed the spa. I was then invited down to breakfast - so considerate as the staff were aware I had just arrived from an early flight. All in all I was made to feel very comfortable and as a solo traveller particularly appreciated the friendly atmosphere.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Hue Serene Palace is located in a side alley a few blocks from the main drag with bars and nightclubs. But that just means it's nice and quiet. It's by no means far away from the action, you can easily walk to the

The room I had (705) was located on the top floor, not facing the street and far away from the elevator. Again, nice and quiet. The room was very spacious, with modern and stylish interior. Very clean.

The staff was fantastic, very pleasant and helpful. Thank you to Thuy, Hao, Si, Thanh, Tien, Lee, Henry and everyone else whose names sadly now escape me, for making my stay in Hue a wonderful experience!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This hotel is only about a year old but operates like it's been in business for decades. It is located on a slightly dodgy alley, but you will be welcomed by a staff that works very hard to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are modern and very clean and they provide free and fast wifi throughout the building. The breakfast is outstanding - make sure to try to Hue noodle soup! Highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
I was refered to this hotel by the sister hotel in Hanoi, hanoi charming 2 which if you read my other review is just as amazing.

Rooms: rooms are huge, my first night I got a balcony view and didn't even realize it. Everything was immaculate and best of all they had free hbo.

Staff: simply awesome from the time I arrived to the time I left. Jesse, lee, Laura, Si, Julia and Emily treated me like utter royalty and we're always smiling when I entered and when I was leaving (in a good way) their English was impeccable and had the best tours and ideas to offer.

The restaurant: I'll do a separate review for what at the moment is the best rated restaurant on trip advisor. But I felt I should mention how convenient it was to have the best place to eat in the city in the lobby of my restaurant.

Loved hue would come back just for the service of this hotel.
h_title_comment: Perfect staff, perfect restaurant and perfect location for solo traveller
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This hotel is the perfect place to stay in Hue. Rooms are inexpensive by western standards, the rooms are equivalent to staying in a Hilton, and the staff is fantastic and incredibly attentive. The entire staff knew our names within hours and would greet us and help arrange taxis, meals and more. The location is perfect, in the heart of everything, but we also found it to be quiet and restful. The restaurant downstairs is also excellent, serves great local cuisine and ironically is the #1 rated restaurant in Hue on TripAdvisor.
h_title_comment: The Place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed in room 701 for two nights and really enjoyed this hotel. Staff are very friendly and get to know you. Rooms are large, clean and comfortable although we did find that the Wifi connection was a little temperamental. The computers in the room work well as an alternative.
The hotel is down an alleyway but is very safe and not far to walk to the food/bar area or the citadel. The staff allowed us to check in early which was also a bonus.
Highly recommended as a great place to stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel has a good location but we chose it thinking the rooms would be a nicer than many we saw online. They are mediocre. But it seems that Hue's hotels are like that in general.

Staff were lovely and very accomodating.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is a hidden gem in the beautiful city of Hue! The pricing for the room seemed almost to good to be true when I booked it, but after reading the other reviews, I knew we had made a good choice. We were greeted with fruits and juices upon arrival, and then escorted to our room. We were shown the room by the manager and how to operate the safe. Very professional. The room was huge! We had two queen beds, plasma TV, plenty of storage and a great bathroom. The room was so large and so nice we didn't want to leave! If it hadn't been raining we would have stayed another night! When we return next year, this is where we will stay! The staff was awesome, the room was spotless, the beds were comfy, and the price was great!
h_title_comment: Top shelf service and a great hotel to stay in!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: What fantastic staff we had here. The staff are amazing and so are the rooms. Wish we had more than two nights here! The staff went out there way to organise the rest of our trip by arranging a driver to hoi an and also our hotel. Driver was duong (pronounced tree) who was fantastic and knew his Vietnamese history. Well recommended!!!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: I am missing this hotel already having arrived at the next one in Danang that reminds me that not all hotels are the same . The wi fi code is posted everywhere from the table you sit at on arrival to have a drink to your bedside table and restaurants. So you are not forever asking for the code. I relaxed in this hotel. The location is just where you want to be. If you arrive in the dark the lane may be a bit intimidating but in the morning all looks well and seems perfectly safe.
h_title_comment: Several staff new my name within a day or so.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: I can only say, it was wonderful to stay in this hotel and can fully recommend it to every traveller. Lovely rooms, lovely and competent reception staff and what I appreciated most was the great great personal treatment by the restaurant service. Especially Amy and Sally, but also all the others, many many thanks. I never enjoyed breakfast and dinner more than with you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Great service and caring staff. We stayed for 5 nights in Nov 2014 and could not fault the service or the rooms. Staff advised us of the best local places to eat so we had great local food experiences. My husband became unwell and the staff made sure he had lots of ginger tea and got a great doctor in to see him. Great restaurant downstairs and they gave us room service when my husband was unwell.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here in Nov 14 and enjoyed our stay. This is a high spec boutique hotel. Up a side street and away from the noise. We had a back of the hotel room and less noise again apart from the chucks who no one can avoid. Lovely reception and staff, fruit and juice on arrival and plenty of info on hand. We booked 2 private things with them, 1 was the DMZ and tunnels, great informative day. The other was a transfer from Hue through the pass round the mountains to Hoi An, great day again. Room was very nice including free internet, safe, fridge and we had breakfast which was fine, staff very attentive and doormen the same. We ate in the restaurant and was nice, food and drinks at amazing prices and i saw people from outside dining in, why not in this clean competitive hotel. In fact it was cheaper than outside but with superior surroundings. Airport pickup was arranged without fault and the cars are comfy big ones that made us feel special. I would recommend this hotel in Hue without a doubt.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed in the hotel in October 2014. The staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast was great, rooms were very clean. it was a very nice stay and i would recommend to any who want to stay in Hue to stay at this place.
h_title_comment: Excellent stay at Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
From the moment we made our reservation the hotel was in contact with us. They were kind enough to let us know how to get from where the van was dropping us off. And as soon as we stepped in they were very friendly and approachable. We were received with a fruit platter and cold drinks. Rooms are big enough, clean and beautiful. They had free water, tea, coffee and more fruit in the room for us. The staff is very informative and extremely helpful.
The breakfast was probably one of the best in our trip to Vietnam and their food for lunch was delicious and fresh.
At last, the location is great, 5 minute walk to shops, restaurants, bars and 15 minute walk to Perfume river and night market. You can walk to the citadel from the hotel as well, it's only 30 minute walk or take a tuk tuk. The street right in front can be a little sketchy at night but is not dangerous just a little dark and narrow.
We bought the tour to Hoi An with them and it was exactly as they mentioned to us.
We really enjoyed staying there and we highly recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We were very pleased with our stay in Hue and would have liked to stay longer. The food in the hotel is excellent, with some of the nicest presentations we saw in our travels. I am a chef and was absolutely wowed by the tastes. The staff is very accommodating and we found Hue to be a very low key town to visit.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at this hotel last September, shortly after it opened. Therefore we got the room at a special rate (8 Euros per night per person, including breakfast). And what we got for the money was absolutely perfect: the room was huge, the breakfast was very, very good and the stuff was friendly and helpful. This hotel was one of the best hotels we stayed in, absolutely recommendable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
A very warm welcome with extremely easy and fast check-in. Guests are served a refreshing drink as well as some fresh fruits. Luggage is being brought to the room while one still sips the welcome drink.
The room is large with two big and comfortable beds. Large bathroom with a spacious shower.
Very friendly and supportive staff.
h_title_comment: Staff make you feel like home
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Recently stayed at this hotel. Welcoming drink and fruit on arrival. Lovely room. Staff extremely helpful, attentive and friendly. Great breakfast. The best hotel we stayed in in in Vietnam. The hotel is excellent value and conveniently situated in quiet road. Highly recommended.
h_title_comment: Excellent stay at Serene Palace hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Special thanks to jenny & Mary who are very friendly and helpful during our stay at the hotel. They go out of their way to recommend the best places to visit in Hue and the best food in town. This is the top rated hotel and you get a wonderful service. It is clean and beautiful too. Highly recommend to anyone if you are in Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel. Strategic location with just 10 min walks to the local bars and pubs. Super value for money. Serving good breakfast too where you just order your meals instead of buffet style. Love the Bun Ba Hue, the local noodle soup. All the staff are very friendly even though with their limited English. They are always trying to help. Have to specially mention the front desk Sales Executive Jenny. She speak good English. Very friendly and patience despite so many questions asked. She practically help us in everything from food to transportation etc. Well done Serene Palace, the excellent service and cleanliness really differentiate you with other hotels. Will definitely recommend this hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I stayed at this hotel for two nights. I only have praise for the entire experience. My room was large and comfortable with a nice balcony. The bathroom featured the best shower experience throughout my 4 week trip to Southeast Asia.

The staff was very accommodating and gave personalized service. When I was delayed in arrival by a day and had pre-booked and paid for my room through Agoda, the hotel agreed to refund my first night by 50% which was more than generous. Mary, who works at the front desk, greeted me upon arrival with a smile and made me feel welcome.

She recommended the restaurant on the first floor for dinner. I am not usually in the habit of eating in hotel restaurants as the food is often mediocre and over priced, but I checked on TA and the place was rated #1 so thought I would give it a shot.

My dinner was wonderful and the service I received from Sally was terrific. She made menu recommendations and spent time with me telling me about local specialities. The breakfasts included in the price were also very nice with lots of options.

The hotel is located in an alley and does not look like much from the outside, but once inside everything was great! It is jus a short walk from the river and the Citadel. A great value for the price. I would absolutely stay here again on my next visit to Hue.
h_title_comment: Top notch staff, nice accommodations, excellent restaurant!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
On arriving in Hue we had nowhere booked but planned to try a few places last minute including the Serene Palace. They were full but the staff were so friendly and helpful that we were literally amazed!

They let us relax in their lobby, brought us some free drinks and fruit and offered us some good recommendations for hotels nearby. They even gave us a map and marked out all the key attractions on it. All of this came despite us obviously not being actual guests at their hotel!!! After a short chat the receptionist called a newly opened nearby hotel (Charming Hotel - Hue) and arranged for them to pick us up for free and sorted us their deluxe room for a reduced rate.

We returned to the Serene Palace in the evening to try out their restaurant after reading the reviews. The food was awesome and really good value and the service was again impeccable! Try to book this place early if you want to stay there as it is as popular as it deserves to be and will not disappoint!
h_title_comment: Didn't even stay but wish we did because...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is simply a fantastic hotel. Very centrally located with its own "five points" restaurant, you simply can't ask for better. The best place we stayed in nearly five weeks in Vietnam, along with its sister hotel in Hanoi. The rooms are immaculate, and the staff (Si is a fabulous hostess!) is simply wonderful. I have travelled all over the world and I can honestly say this is one of the best places I've stayed in anywhere. Don't hesitate to book here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very happy that I chose this hotel for a few days in Hué!
Super nice and friendly staff, always here to help you, give you tips and show you around.
I shortened my time in Hué and they agreed to give me back some cash what they weren't supposed to do! Nice surprise!
Otherwise, nice, clean and big room, super wifi connection, correct breakfast and nice location in the heart of Hué!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
It was a bit tricky to find at first, but it was definitely worth the effort.
This is a small hotel tucked away on a side street away from the bustle of Hue, yet within walking distance of most things.
The room was spacious with a large bathroom and a deck with a view - the perfect place to cool off at the end of the day.
The staff are remarkable - welcoming, friendly, helpful.
I wish I could have stayed longer
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
This is a lovely friendly hotel.The location was excellent location, down an interesting lane with other hotels and eating places, but very peaceful and quiet and an easy walk to all the attractions.
We were on the top floor with a great outlook. Our room was very spacious and the bathroom and the shower was excellent and didnt flood the bathroom floor like in many other places.
It rained for most of our stay so it was good to have a restaurant with great food in the building.
Emily at the front was very helpful and knowledgeable and all the staff there could not have been more welcoming. Would definitely return to this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed three nights and it was a delight. We had an upper floor room with a view and could not have chosen a better location. The room was very clean and the breakfast was one of the best - just don't compare it to Hoi an food as not much beats that!
