Perhaps best of all were the girls at reception Sally and Emily who could not have been more helpful. All staff in fact were just great. One example: I mentioned to Emily that my wife had a birthday and asked if a cake could be arranged. Not only was that done but 3 of the girls were in our room after our excursion to the Citadel, and surprised her with the cake and a happy birthday song. They also decorated the room and had happy birthday written in petals on the bed. Such a lovely thought. You will enjoy.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We only stayed 2 nights at this hotel but that was long enough to feel very welcome, and to appreciate to high quality staff that work here. We chose a room with balcony and were very impressed. The room was good size with a comfortable bed. There was a small desk and our room was equipped with a desktop computer. It worked well and internet speed was fast. The bathroom was well maintained and the water hot. Our balcony was a bit small but still nice to have, and it gave us a great view of the dragon dancers making their way up the street.
The hotel is down a side street but comfortable walk to the river where there were plenty of good restaurants.
Breakfast was a small buffet with a-la-carte for the main choice. The food was good with a reasonable range. You could also see into the kitchen from the tables and everything seemed pretty clean and professional. The staff were a credit to the place. Efficient and friendly.
Overall, this was a great place to stay and I was sorry to leave.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
If you are looking for considerate friendly people, service, pleasant-tasting breakfast and clean beautiful rooms located in well position to everywhere for good price, stay here!

We were very satisfied and would come back everytime.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We ( 3 adults) stayed here for 2nights in November 2014. We felt very welcome by all staffs! The quality of customer service is amazing, thank you very much! The room with balcony was spacious enough for all of us, great bathroom, clean. The breakfast was excellent, you can order a la carte with a great choice. They organized our onward trip to Hoi An with a comfortable care and good driver. We highly recommend this Hotel to all travelers who like a personal atmosphere and we are looking forward to coming back again.
Thank you Silvia, Regina and Ursula from Switzerland and Australia
h_title_comment: Beautiful boutique Hotel, clean, nice and modern rooms,outstanding customer service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: What a lovely place to stay, located in a slightly strange lane way like an oasis! Thank you Sally, Emily and Anne especially but all the staff were great. The food Sally organised was superb and extremely just great value! Emily organised our transfers and arranged a short stop for us at their sister hotel in Hanoi to refresh as we were transiting to the night train to Sapa later that night after flying up fro Hue. This hotel is excellent value and I believe you won't find better at any price...seriously!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Good value for money, next step up in Hue would have to be 5 star!
Very helpful staff, rooms are nice enough but a bit rough around the edges.
If you are not looking to book the premium five star hotel in town, this is the next best on a fraction of the price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed here with our 2 small children in August 2014. The Serene Palace was amazing! Staff are beyond helpful, the room was very clean and spacious and the bathroom was one of the best we saw during our whole 3 week stay in Vietnam. The breakfast was really really great and there was always at least one person ready to attend to our every wish.
They organised our onward trip for us which really helped as it was one less thing for us to do, plus it was a very nice way for us to travel on to Danang in a brand new 7 seater. They driver even stopped along the way to let us shop at a supermarket!
I would definitely stay at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel again, it would be a pleasure.
h_title_comment: One of the best hotels in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We enjoyed a great meal, one vegetarian. Very good service all around. We will definitely go back. It is a little off the beaten track and slightly difficult to find, however having found the Serene Palace it is a little gem. The decor is quite upmarket and well kept. The toilets were also to a high standard.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stop! Don't look any further, book the hotel now! For value for money, location, service, comfort & dining, The Serene Palace Hotel is by far the best in Hue. Don't waste your money on a 5* hotel, when you can get everything a higher * hotel has to offer, at the Serene Palace. Ask for the top floor with balcony. The restaurant was especially good.
h_title_comment: The only place to stay in Hue - The Serene Palace hotel! It's simply great.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We booked this hotel after reading trip advisor reviews and we were very pleased with our choice. This is a great hotel with really helpful friendly staff who went out of their way to look after us.
They all knew our names and made a big fuss of our children.
The room was very big and comfortable and breakfast was varied and plentiful. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring and off the Main Street .
We had our last evening meal in the hotel and the food was delicious, it was very busy so obviously has a good reputation which is well deserved.
Thanks for a wonderful stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed here for two nights...what a great time! Breakfast was delicious, and the restaurant was probably the best meal we had in vietnam....and very well piced. The waitress named Mary and Sally were very adorable, helpful and friendly, and made our time fun! The rooms are clean and very large. Great location as well.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The staff was immensely friendly and helpful. Helped with tours, planning, and ensured our rooms were up to standard. It's true that tours here are pricey, but paying more for the convenience and guarantee of the tour is only logical.

The WiFi is amazing. Using the wired connection that connects to the computer provided, I did a speed test that hit 25mbps. That is an amazing speed in Vietnam, let alone Hue. My 4 star Hanoi hotel barely hits 1mbps.

Breakfast is a huge spread. Order as much as you like, and the staff will accommodate as far as possible to your requests. The fried rice with garlic and egg is delicious.

My second visit here, and if I'm ever back at Hue, I'll be back here!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Our experience has been Perfect, especially with the quality and service of restaurant, and inmediatlly was very clear where to go to lunch, and dinner, breakfast have beeen fantastic, thanks for your sympathy, Lucy, Sabrina, And Sally!.
Rooms are well equiped, the hotel is near the river and Emperor Citadella, as we like a lot to walk everywhere, it is very convenient for us.

Prices are low, and quality of service very high.
h_title_comment: Nice Boutique Hotel with EXCELLENT RESTAURANT!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: One of the "Sister" hotels of the Charming Hotels in Hanoi, the Serene doesn't disappoint. As with the other hotels the Serene is well managed and the rooms are a clean and comfortable. The restaurant serves good food, the hotel is well located and offers many close by eating and drinking opportunities. Also, like the sister hotels, what they do best is offer outstanding customer service. I am made to feel at home immediately and the feeling of kindness seems genuine not mandated. All in all a great place to stay and a bargain as well.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Really nice hotel, very nice staff, fantastic restaurant! The tours were a little overpriced and the price for the tour did not cover lunch and entrance fees etc as would normally be the case. The restaurant had fantastic food from Hue and was really reasonably priced, the staff were incredibly lovely.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
A really nice hotel in a quiet lane near the main tourist area in Hue. Good location, a five minute stroll to the main tourist street. Some great local eating places between the hotel and there, which are worth checking out.

Greeted with a refreshing drink and some fruit on arrival, before being taken to the room. The room was far nicer than I expected. Massive comfortable bed and a great shower in the bathroom. All very modern and tastefully decorated.

The staff are extremely helpful. The breakfast was good. On my final day I had a late flight and they stored my luggage as well as offering facilities to shower later on. Before catching my flight I dined in the hotel restaurant, which was better than any of the tourist places surrounding the hotel and was very reasonably priced.

If I ever return to Hue then this hotel would easily be my first choice. An absolute bargain for the quality and service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed at serene hotel and when we git there they received us with a welcoming breakfast which was great after been travelling from ninh binh by train tge whole night, the staff is so nice and always is looking after you, they upgrade our room which was a plus and the breakfast is good! Worth the stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Well located in a quiet street. The staff was extremely nice. I would like to thank in particular Lack AKA Emily for his great attention and good conversations. We felt really well treated during our stay and would come back again without doubts. The room was big and was at the penthouse having a nice terrace.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at the Serene Palace for 8 nights and really enjoyed the hotel, the food, and especially the excellent staff. Our spacious, comfortable room with a balcony overlooking the town was a great place for exploring the city. When you step out the front door of the hotel into the lane you are already in authentic Vietnam with families going about their daily lives, roosters strutting in the fenced gardens, and you are within walking distance to the restaurants and many of the city sites. Well, on the hot, humid days the inexpensive taxis are everywhere to zip you onwards to the next site if you don't feel like walking.

I recommend that on your first trip to the Imperial Palace/Citadel that you ask the front desk staff to call you a taxi and tell the driver to take you to the gate that is open for ticket sales…there’s only 1 gate open and it is an immense site. You won’t want to waste so much time trying to find how to get in like we did the first time we went! Try to budget 30 minutes to watch the fabulous costume dance and music performance at the Royal Theatre – shows are only at 2:30 and 3:30 INSIDE the Imperial Palace complex.

The front desk staff will arrange for a car and driver to take you on the 4 site excursion to the Thien Mu Pagoda, The Lang Minh Tomb, the Lang Khai Dinh Tomb, and the Lang Tu Duc Tomb. You’ll read that you can take a river boat or ride your bike, but don’t believe it if you want to see everything on a 1 day excursion. It takes the best part of the day to see these sites and that is with a car/driver who will drive through several small villages and drop you in just the right spot for each site. By the way, don’t panic if you feel as though you are running out of time before you arrive at the Lang Tu Duc tomb – it is mostly under construction but the BEST part of it is open and very close to the entrance so you can fully enjoy it in 15 minutes or so.

We loved sitting on our balcony after a day’s exploring to watch the evening return of the birds just as the sun sets and to observe the kids playing and the night lights coming on in the city around us. I realize this is a bit odd for a hotel review but so much of our exploration was made pleasurable by the hotel staff that I wanted to share this since it can be difficult trying to find out this information while you are in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a great hotel. Our room was spacious, super clean, comfortable and had all the amenities you could ask for including a computer with good internet access. The staff is wonderful and very helpful in making tour and travel arrangements. The hotel is clean throughout and breakfast is tasty. The location is god, it was an easy walk to the river, shopping and restaurants. The rooms are a great value at around $50 a night. You cannot go wrong staying here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We have just returned back to Australia today after travelling through Vietnam and the high point of our travel was the Serene Palace Hotel. Centrally located in Hue and although in a side street it is worth the effort.to find..We ate in the restaurant for most meals ( breakfast included in price ) with most food being all traditional Vietnamese..very affordable and good value. Hotel staff were the highlight of our stay..all six restaurant ladies were extremely friendly and helpful...reception and porters all well trained friendly and professional.Rooms clean tidy and ours was on the sixth floor with balcony and city views.Can't wait to return here..Highly recommend.
Mike.Robyn.Alana Shane.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed at Hue Serene Palace Hotel for 4 nights with a late check out and were treated like VIP's from the moment we got off the bus. The hotel arranged for us to be met by staff, who arranged a cab for a seemless trip to the hotel. The fruit and a cool drink in the elegant foyer was a lovely touch. Staff were attentive to any requests for information and booked tours with ease. Nothing was a problem. Lovely relaxed stay. The inhouse restaurant was nice to access when tired from a day of tours. The warnings on their website re taxi/hotel scams was a useful heads up too.
h_title_comment: Welcoming, clean, modern with all the comforts you could wish for.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed here for 2 nights with my family. The staff are lovely. Very welcoming and helpful without being pushy. They don't try to push tours on you, unlike a lot of other hotels I've been to.

The rooms are modern and clean with lovely added touches such as petals on the bed. They provide lovely complimentary fresh fruit daily as well as a welcoming drink and fruit.

The breakfast selection is amazing. Best I've had in Vietnam. Unlimited choice of cooked food and a great selection of fresh fruit. The restaurant staff are also very lovely and helpful.
h_title_comment: Amazing breakfast, lovely staff and room!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Located in a very narrow side street but just a five minute walk to everything....only a minute to great banana fritters though! This hotel is relatively new with large, clean and well appointed rooms including free wi-fi, which appears to be standard in Vietnam and Cambodia. The staff here are friendly and very obliging with organising tours at the last minute and refunding part of the cost due to the limited time available.

Just around the corner is a great bar and cocktails at Hot Tuna. Try the MaiTai for $4usd where you can sit upstairs and watch all the action. The Hang Me Me is just down the road. They are known for there Vietnamese cakes but are actually steamed rice pancakes with shrimps and pork. Worth trying.

The breakfast at the Serene was very good especially their local noodle soup, Bun Bo. It's better than Pho as it's a little more flavoursome.

We had two nights in Hue but would suggest that you spend three nights if you want to visit the demilitarised zone or visit all of the tombs in Hue. We went to the citadel, pagoda and the tomb of Tu Duc which was worth seeing. We went via boat to the pagoda and then had a driver pick us up there rather than being on the boat for an hour. We'd recommend doing this rather than the boat trip up and down the Perfume River and then getting a car to take you around the tombs. Once you've done the river one way you've seen it all.

The hotel also arranged our driver for the trip from Hue and Hoi An. This is a good way to see the scenery and you stop of at a number of scenic sites including the lagoon, China Beach at Da Nang, the Pass and also Marble Mountain. This cost us $65usd for the three of us and we had Tre as our driver. He speaks very good English and has fun.

A great place to stay with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Thanks for making our stay so memorable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
What a lovely hotel and the staff were lovely too. There was nothing the staff would not do for us.
We also ate many times in the restaurant which was great and reasonably priced. Airport transfers were terrific. Highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This small hotel is run by a team of young and energetic women. They are exceptionally friendly, organised and they deliver an amazing service. Beyond what was a regular requirement, twice they brought us in mussel soup, as they knew we enjoyed trying local food. It was so kind of them to go out of their way to make us happy. Which we were.

The hotel is very clean, the rooms are of a good size, the air con works well, breakfast is good with yummy fresh smoothies and noodle soup. We enjoyed the incredible hospitality, friendliness and great service. Incidentally the food served in the restaurant is very nice, so make a point of eating there if you stay.

The location is also convenient, close to the river and plenty of places to eat and drink. Jenny on the travel desk will organise tours; we took their tour to see the tombs.

Highly recommended if you want a warm welcome in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Staff were the friendliest we have come across on our travels across SE Asia. They really cannot do enough for you. We got caught in the rain and the staff came running to the door with towels for us and made us a hot drink. Just so kind and thoughtful. Si helped us arrange an amazing trip to Halong bay at a reasonable price.
The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are lovely and spacious and you have you own PC in the room. Would definitely stay again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I stayed at the serene palace for four nights, and we loved it! The room was large , airy, clean and was stocked with complimentary fruit every day. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. However, what really stands out is the staff, they are amazing people! They are kind, helpful and friendly. We were sad to leave. This place offers real value for money, and all with a smile.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A must. Staff are great. The rooms are clean and big and european standard and as good as the photos. Hotel is a little off the main strip. But 5 to 10 mins walk from bars and other restaurants not a bad thing. It was raining when we got here and so had both meals at hotel rest. Very nice, only missing street atmosphere.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 3 nights on our trip through Vietnam. At first the room the gave us smelt mouldy so we asked to be moved, they happily did this for us and even gave us an upgrade to a massive room at the front of the hotel. The rooms are large and well appointed with flat screen TVs and safes. The beds are really comfy..I mean really comfy, always good.
The breakfast is really good, try the Pho Bo it's amazing! We also had dinner here and it was also great.
The staff are more than friendly, they cannot do enough for you! The only down side was that there was building work going on next door but it wasn't too bad, just as for a room at the back and it should be fine.
A great stay in a great hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: If my usual London or Paris £200/night hotel would give me the same value for money as Serene Palace then I would be sleeping at Buckingham palace or Place Vendome. And that is actually not the case...And left aside the attitude of the staff. Smiles are really from their hearts. No fake ones.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed with friends at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The hotel is excellent, the rooms clean, tidy and well appointed and breakfast good. All the staff were friendly, helpful and professional.

We arranged some tours with Si at the hotel. Si recommended a boat tour on the river which stopped at the pagoda and a visit by private car to the tombs. All of the tour was excellent, the scenery, pagoda and tombs were a highlight and the driver spoke good English and was informative. Si recommended tours which were good quality and good value.

We booked another cheaper tour with a travel agent outside the hotel but it wasn't good.

Si also arranged a tour by private car and hotel accommodation to Hoi An. The tour and hotel were both excellent.

Thank you Si and the staff, I will stay at the Serene Palace Hotel when I come back to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed only one night (we wish it could have been more) en route to Hanoi. The staff were among the friendliest and most helpful that we came across during our honeymoon, as amongst other things they decorated our room with flowers, made up the bed with rose petals and even went to the trouble of getting us a cake with a "Happy Honeymoon" message.

It's a bit tricky to find, as it's tucked away down a narrow, alley-type street, but it's actually very well situated for the city centre bars and restaurants in the backpacker district (from what we could ascertain, these seemed to be the only venues that stayed open late). All the staff were terrifically helpful, but Sally in particular was absolutely fantastic, recommending places for us to go out and experience Hue at night
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had half an hour to spare before leaving Hoi An to catch the train North to Hue. We used the hotel computer to look up Hotels/Reviews for Hue and decided based on these, that when we arrived we`d make our way(without a booking) to the Serene Palace. Fantastic choice -no hoofing around any other hotels required.Staff weren`t at all put out that we hadn`t booked and as others have mentioned offered us a seat to have a cool drink and some fruit before we went to check out their room availability. We got a great price on a 5th floor room with a large balcony looking out over the city. The room was beautiful and the staff (of all the hotels we stayed in in our 3 week trip) were the friendliest and most sincere in wishing to be genuinely helpful without being in any way over-bearing. We stayed for 3 nights, loved the hotel and really enjoyed the walk-ability and real working town feel of Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A modern hotel with excellent and friendly staff and modern well equipped rooms. The breakfast is excellent as well. Its location is close to the main attractions including the Imperial City. The staff are also very helpful in arranging trips.
h_title_comment: Great hotel in the heart of the city
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our first visit to Hue. On our arrival, greeted with warm and friendly staff...Laura and Julia at the front desk were extremely helpful even finding the local number for our motor bike guide. The breakfast was very satisfying (great Vietnamese coffee)and we ate at the restaurant on the first night....lovely. Sabrina our restaurant host was utterly delightful and encouraged to practice our basic Vietnamese words. Stayed on top floor with balacony...great view.The room was very clean and comfortable and would certainly woild choose to stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I liked this hotel so much I immediately booked for another night on arrival. I got a welcome drink adn plate of fruit on arrival and my room was available very early which was great after a long overnight bus ride. The rooms are lovely and spacious with everything you need. Complimentary water and coffee making things, safe, computer in the room, wi-fi, TV, all bits and bobs in the bathroom. It;s down a little side street away from noise but a great location for getting to the Citadel. The breakfast is good and the restaurant also serves good food. They also have a laundry service and can organise tours although I already had that prepared. Lovely attentive staff who are always willing to help with a friendly smile
h_title_comment: Great hotel with very helpful staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Great hotel, great servive and staff. Good rooms, nice view, clean and safe. Good breakfast. Great location, you can walk everywhere, near the cidatel, the market and other points of interest. I recomend this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Excellent local food had to go back for dinner two nights in a row. The staff are very friendly helpful and enjoy having a chat. If your looking for dinner in hue I recommend the serene restaurant. Hello from mitch and Paul!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Lovely hotel, clean neat rooms, good breakfast, friendly staff. In side alley which is good cos less noise. Be careful of booking tours from hotel as they are pricey, can DIY much much cheaper. Recommended, will stay again
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed two nights at Serene Palace. We found the hotel light, fresh and well priced. Staff were friendly and helpful. Restaurant service and food was outstanding. More than happy to recommend to others.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We recently stayed at Serene Palace Hotel. Our room was a little noisy but clean & spacious. Breakfast was good with buffet for fruit & drinks & menu to order hot food. Staff overall were very friendly, however when we arrived the sales staff tried to sell us lots of tours of the city. We booked a half day tour & we forced to sign for it immediately. We paid $20 for 2 people for a taxi to the river (which was easily 2 mins walking distance) & a boat ride to the pagoada (which we could have paid for ourselves for €2 each). The boat waited for us at the pagoda & dropped us to the citadel & that was it. We paid to enter the citadel ourselves & made our own way back to the hotel. We also booked a taxi transfer from Hue to Hoi-An but later cancelled it as we booked a scooter ride tour transfer ourselves, which turned out to be the best part of our visit to Vietnam so far.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The staff at Serene Palace were fantastic! We were only here for two nights, and only one full day but the staff helped us make the most of our short stay. The city tour they recommended was fantastic and the private driver was great! Only bad thing was that the drive from Danang to Hue took at lot longer than we were expecting but it wasn't the hotel's fault, more our assumption that it would only take an hour whereas it took two and a half!
After we had left and travelled down to Hoi An, the staff at Serene were frantically trying to contact us at our new hotel. We thought perhaps we had left something behind, but there had been a mix up with our bill and we had overpaid by $10. They offered to have a driver bring it down to Hoi An for us!! After such great service during and after our stay we were more than happy to add our overpayment to the tip box!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I found the hotel to be an excellent choice. The room was spacious, comfortable and well appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful and the restaurant was quite good as well. I have no complaints whatsoever about the accommodation, but was not overwhelmed by Hue as a destination. The Citadel is younger than many US sites and paled in comparison to other Chinese fortresses.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: I went to Hue in my holiday with my Mom. We stayed in this hotel for 3 days. This is the first time My Mom and me traveled together. We felt so comfortable in this hotel. The hotel is very nice. I like the breakfast and coffee time in this hotel. Especially I luv the staffs there. they r really take care us. I feel that I had a great choice to stay in this hotel. Thanks a lot. Let's stay in this hotel if u r coming to Hue. Its not expensive hotel. So lovely hotel that want I love to say!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed in March 2014 at the Hue Serene Palace and felt it was a very comfortable hotel and the staff were excellent. When we first arrived my husband got a little nervous because you drive down an alley to get to the hotel, but as soon as we arrived we were greeted with welcoming smiles and given a lovely beverage while checking in. The breakfast was really good. It was my birthday while staying at the hotel and on that morning when I went down for breakfast the staff gave me a beautiful bouquet of flowers and a cake. Any time we returned to the hotel the staff would say Happy Birthday. It was certainly a birthday to remember! It is great for families. We are a family of 4 (2 adults/2 children) and reserved a room with 2 double beds. It was clean and walking distance to restaurants. We recommended the hotel to my parents and Uncle and Aunt who will be staying there in November.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Stayed here en route for South arriving by plane, leaving on the train.

Hotel is located near river and in a quiet street. The ladies on reception were welcoming and friendly and the hotel is fairly new. Our room was enormous, very clean and was very good value. We also ate there in the evening and the food was extremely good - it was raining.

There didn't seem to be much to do but the Citadel and Palace were interesting. The staff were very keen to provide additional services but these didn't seem particularly good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Had a great stay at this very comfortable hotel, the staff were so welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. The restaurant serves amazing meals, the staff in there were always smiling even at 7 in the morning. The room was perfect complete with a computer - free of charge. Recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a quiet hotel just a minute away from the hustle and bustle. Thank you all for making our stay so enjoyable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This was the best hotel I stayed at in my whole two months traveling in Vietnam! The staff was absolutely amazing, every one of them remembered my name and always stopped to chat or ask me what was going on. The room was very comfortable, I barely left the hotel in 3 days! They also had great recommendations for food and activities in the area. Breakfast was also wonderful, they have a fresh fruit, bread and coffee bar and a breakfast menu that you can order as much as you want off of (no extra charge for eating 2 or 3 breakfasts!) I would go back to Hue just to stay here again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: "We had a marvelous stay in Hue at the Serene Palace Hotel. Comfortable room, gorgeous staff with excellent service and great dining at Hue Serene Restaurant serving some authentic Vietnamese food. Serene PP is very reasonably priced too and highly recommended for travellers of all ages" ~Ron, Josh, Chris~
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
You are all amazing! Food was the best quality and quantity we seen in Vietnam - staff were
Cheeky and so much fun! This is a very well run establishment where u can tell the staff enjoy going to work each day! The staff have all adopted English names - Emily Sami Sally Amy etc and are precious xxxx the room was gobsmackingly huge even fitted with its own pc - nothing is bad about this oasis in the tropics xxx thanks u mob xxxxx
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We arrived late evening after a flight from Hanoi.

Warmly greeted and were provided refreshment. As we were late arriving, the restaurant had closed, so they recommended a very nice restaurant a short walk away.

The room was very well appointed and the breakfasts were amazing. Even though they do have a buffet counter, everything was brought to you by the staff.

Mary, Laura and all the other staff are just so warm and will bend over backwards for you. The hotel is in a quiet street and still very close to all the activity of Hue.

We also found the hotel excellent in arranging tours and airport transfers. They were able to do this competitively priced.

They arranged an amazing full day tour of the DMZ, Khe Sanh and Vinh Moc tunnels. Our driver was excellent and the guide provided so much information about the history. This was probably the highlight of our whole trip to Vietnam.

Hue is a beautiful city and we regret not spending more time there. The hotel arranged another excellent driver to take us to Hoi An.

We still want to see more of Hue and will look forward to returning to the Hue Serene Palace Hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The SerenePalace Hotel is all quality, the rooms the staff the breakfast the restuarant are all of the highest quality, it is probably a ten minute walk up a rough road lane way, the staff can be a bit smothering at times but it is hard to fault someone for trying too hard. We even had a meal in the restuarant which was one of the best Vietnamese meals we have had , the Hue specialities were very good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This place was absolutely wonderful. The staff were so amazing, welcoming and incredibly helpful. Three friends and myself shared a room which was spectacular - the beds were extremely comfortable and bathroom facilities were fantastic. It was a really great place to stay and would definitely return.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Thank you for the stay!

It was a very pleasant stay with lots of help from the staff and delicious fruit juices, fruits and breakfast.

A spotless room and the perfect location completed our dream stay in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I was booked into this hotel as part of 12 day tour of Vietnam and only had one night there but would have loved to stay longer. The room was very impressive, the staff were lovely, breakfast was excellent, and it was in a convenient location for the town centre.
h_title_comment: Wish I could have stayed longer
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: What a wonderful hotel. I loved my stay here mainly thanks to the wonderful staff who work here. Having travelled SE Asia now for 5 months, The Serene Palace has to be up there as one of the friendliest places I have stayed. From the moment I arrived to the moment I left :-( every member of staff were so attentive and friendly. In fact with in hours, most of the staff were calling me by my first name. The room was lovely. Spotlessly clean, lovely comfortable bed, electronic safe, tea and coffee and water all complimentary and complimentary fruit every day. Breakfast was great - the girls who served me each morning were friendly and the breakfast was hearty. I would absolutely recommend you stay here if you visit Hue. On leaving I was even given a complimentary lift on a motorbike to the Vietnam Airlines office which was only a 10 minute walk (I have a big heavy backpack, so that was much appreciated!) thank you too the whole team at Serene Palace. You obviously all work very hard hard and as a team. Your boss/es should be very proud of you! Apologies too but a special mention to Laura too. A delightful young lady is super friendly and helpful - as the whole team are! Thanks again. If I return to Hue (I have been several times now) I will not hesitate to stay here. Best wishes and thank you to you all for your kind hospitality.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in September - got a special discounted rate which meant it was great value for money - the cheapest place we stayed in Vietnam, but still with excellent standards! The hotel was situated near the main tourist hotel street, but not actually *on* it (which was nice) and it was still close to the citadel etc. The staff were all incredibly friendly, and were virtually tripping over themselves to look after you and help you with any travel plans you might have to make, whether in the local area (do make time to see some of the tombs nearby as well as the citadel) or helping you make the most of your stay in Hue (Laura was especially helpful in assisting us with things to do in Hue.) The rooms were large, clean and came with their own computer (very useful for travellers) and the food in the restaurant was pretty good too. Can't find much fault with this place - would definitely recommend for a short stay in Hue.
h_title_comment: Beautiful hotel, great value for money!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were 5 girls staying at Serena Palace Hotel for 2 nights, and we had the most amazing time. The rooms and bathrooms were great and the breakfast was the best I've had in Vietnam (they had a whole range of dishes on the menu and you were allowed to order everything you wanted!). They have a perfect location, hid away from the mainstreets noisy traffic and caos, but still very central.
However, most importantly they have the most enjoyable staff! Everyone was so friendly and helpful and they made our stay in Hue fantastic. They recommended some really nice and cheap places to eat, arranged a car for us to go around and see all the beautiful sites around Hue and helped us arranging further travelling.

In addition they put a smile on our face every time we walked through the reception.

Highly recommended, great value!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: 2 night stay. Happy, attentive staff without being over the top. Greeted on arrival with fresh juice and fruit platter. Room was clean, neat and new, perhaps lacked a bit of character (but only a small criticism). Breakfast was DELECTABLE!! Fresh and made-to-order, no awful buffet! Don't forget to try their banana/mango smoothie! Plenty of options proposed for day tours and places to eat for dinner. This small sized hotel cannot be beaten on price/value and offers a very personable experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had just a couple nights here and my two children fell in love with the staff. They were friendly and helpful and gave great advice on where to go for local, non-tourist food.
Rooms were a good size and clean and the driver they organised to take us on to Hoi An was great. For the price we paid it was great value though at the time the building next door was being renovated and there was a lot of noise during the day and the sound echoes up through all floors so it can be quite noisy from doors banging and people moving about.
Breakfast was very simple but the pho was lovely and spicy.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed in the Serene Palace for 3 nights in September 2014. The rooms and bathrooms are good, spacious and clean and you have a PC in the room. What makes this hotel special is the service, everyone knows your name within an hour of your arrival (makes you feel quite notorious actually) and will do anything within their power to help you. The breakfast had a lot of choice and the staff just kept bringing food out until you are finished- one day my boyfriend had 5 vietnamese coffees because they kept giving him more. There is construction happening next door so one of the days it was a little loud. It is quite close to the bars and nightlife but a bit of a way from the citadel.

Overall a nice hotel with fantastic service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Nice clean and tidy.
All the staff were WONDERFUL & EXTREMELY
My partner was not very well at the time of our stay. The reception staff Googled OUR medication that was needed and translated it to Vietnamese and off I went to the Pharmisist.
Tour desk organised a private car for us down to Hoi an. Great drive over the mountain pass etc
Very well priced.
Computer in room with free Wi Fi
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for two nights.

Pros: amazing service, comfortable bed and good sized room, strong in room wifi, central location on a quiet street, adequate hotel breakfast.

Cons: there is construction happening next door at the moment which could be heard during the day at times. TV wasn't working while we were there too for about 24 hours.

Very good hotel, book away!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I must preface my remarks about the Serene Palace by saying that I chose it on the basis of all of the great reviews that it receives on Trip Advisor. Can absolutely vouch for the great service from this energetic young team and the restaurant is one of the best that we came across in our three weeks in vietnam.
However it was a mismatch for us as retirees in that the "comfortable" bed so often mentioned in the reviews was in fact so hard that we were unable to lie comfortably on it. The staff did their best to help by providing extra quilts to make up sleeping pads but it still made for a couple of uncomfortable nights. We realised after we arrived that it was a haven for young fit backpackers who doubtless relished the otherwise wonderful service and amenities. We made the strong suggestion to the staff that they look at changing a few of the mattresses to less firm ones or at least purchase some foam sleeping pads as an option should they be requested - in fact a "mattress menu" could be quite a selling point. It is unfair to compare the Serene to the other high end properties we stayed in but a comfortable bed is one of the prerequisites for any stay for us.
h_title_comment: 5 star Service in a 3 star - but..........
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We've been in Vietnam for almost 7 weeks now and this hotel has been the best place we have stayed in. Though the hotel is a 3 star, the service you get is equivalent to a 5 star. The room was great in size, very cozy and all facilities were great within the room. The hotel restaurant is one of the best places to eat in Hue. They offer most of the Hue specialities at very good rates. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The staff and the management pays attention to almost every single detail during your stay in the hotel to successfully get you the perfect hotel experience. We highly recommend anyone visiting Hue to stay in this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed for two nights at Serene palace hotel in Hue
I would come back and stay there as it is reasonably price and the staff is wonderful. The room is nice and Wifi is adequate
By the way, if you stay there go no further to dine as Serene restaurant has excellent food: good presentation and delicious
h_title_comment: Touring beautiful Hue at reasonable budget
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Great rooms and great service. The staff was extremely nice and helpful with arranging tours, train tickets, and other last minute things that other hotels wouldn't have been able to help with. For the price, the experience at Serene Hotel in Hue could not possibly have been better.
h_title_comment: Best hotel I've ever stayed at in this price range
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Staff here are very well trained on customer service. From welcome drinks to remembering names and where you went for dinner you feel like you're being looked after - even though it is obviously we'll rehearsed.
The room was great and similar to places I've paid a lot more for. Excellent
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I am very please to have stayed in this hotel, the staff were very friendly and they were more then willing to help in anything.

They put on a bright smile and are always ready to greet the customers.

The rooms are very clean and well decorated which made the stay very comfortable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We did not stay at the Serene Palace Hotel, but had dinner one night and found a gem of a place to eat. The food was simply delicious, full of flavor, and in our opinion it should be rated the No. 1 place to eat in Hue. Also, I would be remiss if I failed to mentioned the excellent and attentive service from Lucy, Sally, and Sabrina. Keep laughing you all, you made our dinner experience memorable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
All I could say about Hue Serene is their service. Their staff are very helpful and friendly. Furthermore, the facilities surprised me with that rate of roo. It is worth staying and enjoying.
However, the morning meal (which is included in the room rate) is not quite delicious, that is one of the cons of the hotel, but with 22$ you couldn't ask for more.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I had a great time at this wonderful hotel. The room was very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. One in particular, Si Dep, helped me with all my tour requirements in Hue and surrounding area and educated me about the special Hue cuisine. Definitely a place I will stay again at.
h_title_comment: Serene Palace Hotel and Helpful Staff Member
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: It was amazing experience stay there! The room was extremely clean, modern bathroom, there is a computer in room. Nice breakfast, can ordered more than one meal. The staff very friendly and helpfull, also taught me some Vietnamese words. On the last night we met one staff member (who usually serve breakfast) at the night market and she came to talk to us and say goodbye. I felt like family there!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a fantastic stay at the Serene Palace Hotel in Hue. We only stayed for one night but would definitely stay longer. We were greeted with a fresh passionfruit juice, a plate of fruit and a cold towel which was very much appreciated after a flight, bus ride and motorbike ride. The staff were super friendly and very helpful giving us lots of advice for restaurants and what to do in Hue as well as how to get to Hoi An. It was brilliant to have a computer in the room with a very fast internet connection. We needed our laundry back very quickly which the staff were very kind to arrange for us. Breakfast was big and delicious. Very clean and confortable with hot showers. Thank you!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I would recommend this hotel to all visitors to the city. All staff speaks perfect English, very friendly and helpful, the hotel perfectly clean, very nicely decorated, air conditioning clean and very quiet, breakfast 'sensational.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel was very friendly. We were received with some fruit juice and fruit. After this excellent start we were taken to our room which was spacious and clean. This hotel is excellent value for money. There is absolutely nothing bad to say about our stay in this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel in the buzzy part of Hue has attracted a lot of positive comments from travellers and its easy to see why.

I made my reservation by internet before I left home. From the outset they were very helpful with the booking and help with trips I wanted to make to areas around Hue.
When I arrived their friendliness and helpfulness went up a gear.Their whole team, receptionists, kitchen staff, waitresses, concierge have been imbued with this friendly service ethic.
The disappointment on the waitresses face when I couldn't finish my Pho(beef noodle soup) was entirely genuine..
There were a couple of things that needed doing in the room, like the tv needed tuning.But these were sorted out as soon as I had asked.
h_title_comment: A hotel with a great service ethic
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
This is my 5th time to Vietnam and this hotel is by far my favourite. My wife and I are on our honeymoon and stayed here for 4 nights. Service and value was probably the best I've had anywhere in any country. The staff were so friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. They gave us a welcome drink and fruit upon arrival and took our bags to the room for us which was nice after our long bus trip. Our room was really nice, stylish and clean, as per the photos on Agoda. Soft comfy bed. Laura gave us lots of info about tours and what else to do in Hue. The BEST aspect of this hotel (other than the staff) was the breakfast. There were a lot of choices on the menu. The first morning we ordered 1 meal and 1 drink each then the waitress said "anything else?"...turns out you can choose multiple dishes! So every morning I had, for example, bacon & eggs + banana pancake or cereal with yoghurt + fruit juice + cup of tea/coffee. Then you can also help yourself to the table fresh fruit, toast, tea & coffee refills! It was literally "all-you-can-eat". When you're thinking about the price of this hotel (already great value), consider this free delicious breakfast and how much it would cost if you ordered it at a restaurant outside the hotel. Every morning our rooms were cleaned before we came back from breakfast and there was complimentary fruit and bottled water waiting on our table (yes, more fruit!).
LOCATION: Down a quiet lane approx. 5 min walk from Pham Ngu Lao Street (the main tourist street with lots of restaurants & bars inc. DMZ bar). Perfect location as you don't get any noise from the bars but it's a close walk to them. Don't be fooled by the plain hotel exterior, the interior is beautiful. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone- cheap enough for backpackers to have a minor splurge and nice enough for a honeymoon!
P.S. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant on the first night because we were too tired to go walk around. We had some Hue specialty dishes and it was some of the best food we had in Hue. Because the hotel is "hidden away", we were the only ones in the restaurant so the service was really quick.
h_title_comment: Our FAVOURITE hotel in Vietnam- LOVELY staff, HUGE breakfast!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The first thing I noticed about this hotel is that it's located in a quite lane, which I thought was great. The staff provide professionally friendly and efficient service. The hotel dining room has an excellent breakfast and the strongest coffee I had in Vietnam! The room also was excellent - spacious, quite and comfortable. The staff were also very helpful in organising my motorbike tour guide for the day, Tri. He was a great young guy and a truly was wonderful guide. I really enjoyed staying here and will definitely be back next time I'm in Hue
h_title_comment: Excellent place to say in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: I visited this hotel many months ago and my stay here was very pleasant. Rooms were clean and very nice. The staff was very helpful. Si helped me with anything i needed. I could ask her for any info. All the tours i did she arranged for me and everything was quit well organised. i have to say this hotel is lucky to have a girl like her. See you again next time. definitely coming back next time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: lovely hotel, service was top notch and breakfast was not a buffet, we could pick what we wanted off the menu and it was quickly bought to us. city tour we arranged through them was good. though couple dollars more than elsewhere, but we didnt mind, it was convenient. food in hotel was good. On the last day, it was a bad storm so we ate in the hotel, better than other places we ate in hue. Room clean and large.
h_title_comment: Far better than we expected, considering the cheap price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My daughter and I stayed for two nights at the Hue Serene Palace. The staff at the front desk Si and Julia were fantastic and very knowledgable. They arranged a private boat and car tour to the Pagoda and the tombs. The driver Nin spoke English very well. My daughter became ill while we were there and Nin took us to a pharmacy and translated for us.
The restaurant staff were so friendly especially Ivy and Sally. Ivy made toast for my daughter while she was sick. They asked us our names and remembered them making our stay more personable.
We had a balcony room on the 7th floor which was spacious and very clean. The hotel is in a great location. It is close to the center.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
My partner and I stayed for 4 nights at the HUE Serene Palace. From the check-in through our departure everything reflected high quality, well trained staff, with incredible knowledge of their city as well as outstanding English language skills, sense of humor and degree of professionalism I have found only in Five Star properties during my years of travel and living in Vietnam.

We upgraded from a "superior" room to a more superior one (for five dollars more) and had a balcony, great morning light and a view of the city. Upper levels are better owing to construction and noisy karaoke nearby (the only downside of staying here)

Breakfast (included) was ample and good - not great but good - as the Vietnamese cuisine seems diluted for "Western" palates. Good variety, great fruit, lots of decent coffee and very friendly, warm waitstaff.

We arranged day trips (private boat rental, motorbikes and guide) and Laura and Emily (two of the many stars at the hotel) got us good price and even better quality (less expensive and safer options than elsewhere).
Superb wi-fi, cold air conditioning, great rain forest shower, and incredible cleanliness throughout. I recommend the hotel highly on all counts
h_title_comment: Outstanding, friendly professional service and more
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for a couple of nights back in August, and absolutely loved every moment of it. This hotel beats most 5 star hotels, as it is extremely modern and elegant, and worth more than what you pay for.
We had stayed at their sister hotel, Hanoi Charming 2 hotel, and the helpful staff over there had booked this hotel for us, and because of that we got a free upgrade to a room with a balcony.
The room was extremely clean and amazingly modern, which was our favorite part about our stay.
When we arrived there, I had started to become sick, and the staff were so helpful, they kept giving me ginger and lemon tea for my cold, and even on our last day, after we had checked out and were waiting for several hours before getting to the airport, the staff were still being extremely helpful, by providing me with ginger and lemon tea all day. Can't even begin to thank them enough, they are all wonderful people.
Breakfast was delicious and came with the room package, and they have a very clean modern restaurant, so you can just have lunch or dinner there if you don't feel like going out.
Location is really good as well, even though they are located in an alleyway, there were a few really funky looking coffee places down the road, but the Hotel is just walking distance from the main town.
Overall, I would extremely highly recommend this hotel, as you just can't go wrong here :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Wonderful hotel! Spacious rooms with a private pc and fastly working Internet connection. Nicely decorated. All facilities provided. There is a great restaurant downstairs with a huge variety of meals and a nice personnel. Breakfests are amazing and delicipus. Hotel is located close to all main attractions of Hue. Everything was perfect! I note it however 4 for the following reasons: refurbishement works in august (a lot of noise already at 7am!), quite expensive trips and the personnel at the reception that could be warmer and more pleasent. One girl wad basically standing next to me all the time so that i finish mworking on the computer.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: My girlfriend and I spent 11 nights as guests at this hotel. While we have grown accustomed to receiving top-tier customer service in Vietnam, the staff at Serene Palace Hotel took it to a new level. Their smiles and greetings are genuine, and there isn't a much better feeling especially given our circumstances. My girlfriend had to spend a full week in the hospital in Hue, which the hotel staff were well aware of and helped coordinate. Each morning when I would return to the hotel for the great breakfast and a shower, members of the staff would individually come ask me how she was doing and if there was anything at all she needed or wanted. Even when I would say that she didn't want anything, they would still make up a bag of little snacks for me to bring her (the selection of hospital food in Hue is rather limited). A few of them even came to visit us in hospital outside of their working hours, bringing with them a hawaiian pizza (which my girlfriend had been craving badly) and a huge bunch of bananas (as I would bring a banana for her each morning from the hotel). We felt so comfortable and welcome at the hotel that we stayed for an additional 3 nights after she had been discharged from hospital, and again the treatment we received was excellent. The rooms are very stylish and comfortable, the free wifi was great, the advice and service was top-notch, but as I've described above, it's the warmth and kindness of the staff that really sets this place apart. If you are going to Hue, do yourself a favour and stay at this hotel, you won't regret it!
h_title_comment: Incredible staff at stylish and friendly hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We have now come to realise that many good quality hotels are down some back alley like this hotel.
When we arrived we were given a welcome drink and snack. The quality of the room far exceeded our expectations.
The breakfast was average, not so good for me as I do not eat eggs, but were more than willing to cook food on a individual basis, which I was impressed with.
Overall a good hotel, with staff willing to go out of their way to help you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I wasn't sure what to expect upon arriving to Hue, the town. Upon arrival to Serene Palace Hotel my girlfriend and I were blown away by the friendliness of the staff, we were greeted with a plate of fruit and fresh juice while our luggage was taken up to our room. When we got to our room it was very clean and comfortable. Free wifi in the hotel but our room had a computer in it which was faster to use for bookings etc.. For our entire stay the staff would always be there to assist us. Brekky is cooked to order (inc. in price) and the restaurant cooked great food as well at a cheap price. I was so impressed with this hotel and recommend it to anyone, budget or not on a budget, solo, couples or families.... You will not be disappointed. Thank You so much Serene Palace Hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was in a narrow street which made it very quiet and peaceful, specially when you walked on surrounding streets full of huge and noise hotels. The room was great with a free computer. Breakfast was ok, and you could ask for as many dishes as you fell like. What we value the most is the staff. We chose Serene Hotel in Hue, cause we stayed at Serene Hotel in Hanoi and the experience was fantastic. I have to say that the staff at both Serene Hue and Serene Hanoi were extremely nice, professional and helpful, they made our stay great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Situated down a narrow lane gives this hotel a quiet aspect away from the hustle and bustle of the surrounding streets. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable and inviting. The room had a free computer and WiFi. The front desk, tour desk and restaurant staff, all excellent English speakers, couldn't do enough to help and were willing to take time to talk with us and give suggestions of things to do and places to see. The front desk staff even organised motorbikes for our use at US$8 a day. We had emailed the hotel prior to arriving in Hue to arrange pickup at the airport - we were coming directly from an overnight train, taxi and then early morning flight and didn't want the hassle of then finding a bus or taxi - the car was waiting for us and this luxury was worth the US$15 the hotel charged. It also meant that the hotel knew we would be arriving much earlier than the recommended check-in time and they gave us access to our room on arrival (at no extra cost). The hotel's buffet breakfast was very good and we could also request other food such as noodle soups, eggs or even pancakes. The restaurant has a wide selection of food on offer for the evening meal. We ended up having both our evening meals there selecting traditional Hue dishes, which were excellent and very reasonably priced. On leaving Hue we were going to take the train to Da Nang and then a car to Hoi An, however, the staff suggested booking a car. This way we would get to see all the scenery we would have from the train but also be able to stop anywhere and as often as we liked to take photos or visit places. The staff at the hotel organised this for us for US$65 and, among other things, we got to travel the Hai Van pass and visit the Marble Mountains and then be dropped at our hotel in Hoi An. Choosing the Serene Palace made for a memorable stay in Hue and we will certainly return there the next time we visit Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A lovely hotel, with really friendly staff who go above and beyond to help you! They helped us to organise tours and airport transfer. Good location as walking distance from most places but on a small quiet road which can be difficult to find. Rooms facilities had everything you need including a desktop computer and extremely comfy beds!!!would recommend to anyone!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
I recommend this hotel for staying at Hué. The staff is symphatic and we thank Julia for her good advices for restaurants, shopping...
Finding the hotel is not evident the first time but not vwry complicated.
Well isolated of noises.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: first of all the rooms are super clean and cleaned everyday the breakfast is excellent the staff is fantastic will help you with any problem if you have one the location is very close to sites and to top off all of those great things they picked me up at the airport and my plane was delayed 2 hours and they were still their for me i have travel to all of Asia and price wise this is the best hotel in Asia!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We moved to this hotel because the first hotel we booked was over booking. I choose this one because they had many good reviews on TA. Hotel was clean, bright and a bit luxury more than other 3 star hotels. We were welcomed by juice and cold towel, check in was very prompt and decent. Staff called us by our name and almost remember all guest's name so we felt like home. Serene Team were so lovely and funny, love the way they made us smile :). We stayed many places but it was really the best one. Thanks Emily and Laura for caring us so well!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel is excellent value for money. We received outstandingly good service from the moment we arrived. We were greeted with a drink and were allowed to check in to our room immediately despite arriving very early in the morning having taken the night train from Hanoi. Our room was lovely...it was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. Also, the breakfast was great. Don't hesitate to book this place, you won't regret it!
h_title_comment: Best hotel we stayed in on our two week trip to Vietnam
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel is one of the best we have stayed in during our trip to Vietnam. It is located close to good shopping, restaurants and Pearl River. It is modern and comfortable, the room was clean,spacious and even had a computer supplied. We arrived by private car and were met outside by Laura. From there it was all friendliness, attentiveness and smiles. I do not know any other hotel that offers this wonderful service. After a cool drink and fruit, Laura escorted us to our room and made sure we were comfortable. A few minutes later I realised our driver had left before the porter had removed all our luggage. The one missing was a backpack with my heart medication inside. Laura's rang the driver's company and had the driver return with the backpack. Thanks Laura. She also made sure we knew where the pharmacy was in case it was needed, took us to the hairdressers and showed us where we could get good coffee. Laura is efficient and a great asset to Hue Serene Palace Hotel. Her English is excellent. Staff like Laura who are very helpful, customers will return. We are next year.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My boyfriend and I stayed in a junior suite? Which was on the top floor of this hotel with an amazing view of Hue. Location is great and good for explorers. The best thing about this place was its trips. We booked a cheap (£20) boat trip to the pagoda which picked us up within an hour and had the most amazing private tour from hoi an to hue, stopping at marble mountain, danang beach (from Apocalypse Now)hai van pass, an American bunker and a fish restaurant near Langley Co beach. It was $65 total and we'll worth it. We were only in Hue for a day so we needed help organising our time, and the staff were so helpful and efficient- thank you!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 3 nights after a short flight from Ho Chi Minh. The hotel offers airport collection too. A lovely warm welcome waited with fresh fruit, cold towels and watermelon juice. The staff were so friendly and welcoming-they had maps with directions to the citadel and other sights. The room was lovely and spacious-absolutely spotless with bath robes.
Breakfast is a selection of fresh fruit, tea/coffee and toast plus eggs or pancakes. The service was excellent! We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant which was one of the nicest meals we've had in Vietnam. Staff also helped us plan our next journey to Hoi An. You really can't get any better value for money than this hotel! The staff are amazing and it will make your stay in Hue extra special. I can't recommend it enough!
h_title_comment: Best place to stay in Hue!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We just had one night in Hue and the stay was great. Got a free upgrade on our room, welcome drink and the staff even organized a trip to Hoi An the next day. We booked the trip at 11 PM! Would recommend staying in this place anytime. Everyone was super friendly!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We selected this hotel based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor. Arriving into Hue in the evening, we pre organised the hotel pick up through the hotel. Pick up was seamless with the driver being on time, very friendly and in a nice car. Check in was easy, informative and welcoming.

The room was large with two double beds, plenty of room for our bags plus a table and two chairs. It also came with a desk with a computer (we used the wi-fi instead). The bathroom was very large, clean and with great water pressure in the shower.

The hotel assisted us with organising a day tour around Hue the next day. The driver ended up being the same guy who picked us up at the hotel. A lovely man who was informative, friendly and stopped as many times as we liked for photos. He gave us water throughout the day as well. Out only negative about this day is it was 40+ degrees and when we went to the Citadel instead of driving us a little closer and dropping us off near the main gate within the walls. He parked a little further away and didn't give us directions to the entry gate so we initially went to the wrong gate only to be sent to the other side. Not fun in the heat.

The hotel also booked me into a group DMZ tour. The tour was run by Huong Binh who maybe I got on a bad day but he was rude and wasn't the greatest tour guide. Yes, the sites were interesting but I wouldn't recommend doing this tour. Use a different DMZ guide or take one of the hotels private tours. I met those guides and they seemed lovely and informative.

Overall our stay at the hotel was really good. The staff at the hotel are so lovely and welcoming. The breakfast is good, the laundry is cheap (just double check how long it will take) and the hotel is a short walk to bars and restaurants. Yes it's down a laneway but we never had any issues.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 2 nights and did not want to leave this hotel, because it could only get worse. We had a extremely clean spacious room with a computer. The bathroom had a really nice bath. Everything looked new (but it was't because I believe the hotel exist there since 2005). Breakfast was okay, there was toast with jam or cheese (la vache qui rit cheese, no slices), delicious fresh fruit and fruit juice and you could also order noodles. Staff will help you with anything, even opening the door to the entrance of the hotel. They booked flight tickets for us to Hanoi for a better price than we had found, but I heard from a local that it's cheaper to do this somewhere else. Ah well, if that is the only thing. The most friendly staff ever! Prices on Tripadvisor does not seem right, we had a room for 30 dollar per night (5 dollar discount). Hope to see you again! Thank you for a very lovely stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We chose this hotel base on the review on TripAdvisor.com and Booking.com and it was perfect choice. I stayed many different hotel from 1* to 5* in SEA but Serene Palace was the best.
- Room: Big, Western style, very clean and bright
- Breakfast: So nice, order to cook but very fast and fresh. I like their "Pho" so much.
- Staff: 10/10 for Serene Team who were very friendly and smiling. They always be ready to help you about the local info, arrange transportation (taxi, car...) We took their car to Hoi An and driver was so good and can speak English. We had fantastic time on the way to visit the Cloudy Pass, Marble Mountain and the beach.
Totally Serene Palace was the best stay in my trip. Thanks for all staff from Front Desk, Bellman, Waitress and Chef.
*** We tried the downstair restaurant for the dinner and it was also perfect. The best hotel restaurant in my opinion with cheapest price.***
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great hotel, great staff, superior breakfast, big and clean rooms with balcony, very comfortable beds, good location.
For us was a pleasure to stay there, they are superb!
Special thanks for our honeymoon!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 3 nights. Selected it due to other positive trip advisor ratings and they were all pretty accurate. Pick up from airport worked perfectly and a very warm welcome on arrival. The rooms were perfect, clean and spacious and location was perfect for access to the the main eating and shopping areas and all the sites you want to see in Hue.
Breakfast was fine but not as fantastic in our opinion as many other reviewers but there was a fruit and juice offering and a menu of cooked egg dishes or Vietnamese noodles - perhaps we were spoilt coming from a previously reviewed hotel in Hanoi.
Nothing about this hotel would not make me want to recommend it anyone looking for a great little hotel in a perfect location.
As with everywhere we have travelled in Vietnam, the hotel staff were fantastic, very responsive to questions and very helpful in organising trains, taxis and hotel transfers.
Thanks to everyone for making our stay in Hue a memorable one.
h_title_comment: Great little hotel with very friendly staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Found this hotel on booking.com. going by the reviews we decided to take a chance. So glad we did. It is pretty central for everything. The hotel staff are amazing and just cannot do enough for you. We booked trips and transfers to the airport from the reception. Even the bell boys are great. Can't fault this place. Cheap enough and yet not skimping on quality. Good breakfast and staff so helpful. Not far from the river front but in a quiet enough alley.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The arrival experience was excellent airport pickup, friendly staff, welcome drinks, assistance with the luggage which's not common in budgeted hotels.
Room is huge, nice view & clean, aircon & hot water is working perfectly, Breakfast was so Good & excellent choices.

Julia " super star" the receptionist was more the amazing with the Best smile all the time, she assist us to know the best in the area, provide us with the Map explaining everything perfectly and arranging a rental motorbike.
all team members was very helpful, polite with good English skills.

I would defiantly recommend the Hotel :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We loved Hue and we thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay at the Serene Palace. It proved to be exceptional value for money; the room was spacious and extremely comfortable, the breakfast was really good and the service was superb. The Serene Palace exceeded our expectations. Thank you to all the staff.
We took the Hanh Café sleeping bus from Hue to Hoi An. It cost $4 each and was brilliant. The views from your "sleeping style seat" are breath-taking and the journey is as quick and efficient as taking a taxi. Thoroughly recommend this style of travelling but do book in advance.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The service here was wonderful and we were greeted with efficiency on arrival. We had a very long train journey overnight but our pick up was there despite us being late and they allowed us to check into one of our two rooms early. A delight in that we could all have a shower and nap. The hotel is well located and a street with a range of restaurants is in walkable distance. The rooms are clean and the largest of the ones we stayed in during our time in Vietnam. The hotel also allowed us to eat breakfast early on the day of our departure as we were catching an early morning train to Danang. Great staff and hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Room: Huge, very clean, beautifully decorated with a comfortable bed. Aircon worked really well. The shower was great.

Location: Great, easy walking to everything, close to bars and restaurants and key sightseeing places.

Staff: AMAZING, good English, polite, friendly and helpful. They couldn’t do more for us to make our stay excellent.

Breakfast: Was good, loads of choices on fruit and not too busy. Waiting staff were really friendly.

Price: Excellent for what you are getting.

Overall: Best accommodation we had on our tour of Vietnam. Would definitely return if in the area.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
So good to sleep. Some i come to here. But this is the first time I write on the Tripadvisor. Serence palace Hotel is great to stay. very clean and high quality equipments. The service is so good too.
I will come back at the end of year.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We were so pleased with this hotel! We were welcomed with the customary welcome drink. All the arrangements that we have done in advance worked out excellently. The Sales Manageress answered all my email queries and went out of her way to confirm our bookings with local tour operators. She pre-arranged for a pick-up service at the train station upon our arrival and also took care of a day trip to Phong Nha Caves. We also had our breakfast much earlier than normal to accommodate us for this early morning pick-up. Our Superior Double Room and en suite was spacious and comfortable. The interior of the whole hotel is really beautiful and stylish. Everything was spotless and the bed linen and towels were clean and fresh. In the beginning it was difficult to find the hotel because it is situated in a side alley, but as soon as one get to know the way around, it is actually very central and within walking distance to some good restaurants. We definitely recommend this hotel to all tourists who want to stay reasonably affordable. We really get much more than what we paid for and was so surprised with this high standard. Keep up the excellent work !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed in during my vietnam trip.the location is located close to main area,staff friendly and helpful and room clean .would recommend that you check it out when looking for accommodation.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very modern and comfortable, very close to the river in a quite ally. The room was very clean and spacious. This is a highly recommended hotel in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were attentive and helpful. Great location with lots of restaurant options near by. The breakfast was excellent and a good variety of choices. There was building work going on next door but only during the daytime so this did not impact on us at all. The staff organised our transport to Hoi An and we could not fault this.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Lovely staff, doing its best to make our stay very pleasant. The Hotel seems quite recent, with new amenities. We recommend it. The restaurant was OK too, but maybe avoid the wine (a problem of storage ?).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family
