h_content_comment: We stayed 2 nights. The staff was so communicative during our email exchange before our arrival. The staffs are so friendly and helpful. Never see any 3-star hotel that offers 8 different kinds of fresh fruits and told us we could order breakfast as much as we want. A few minute walk to food area and perfume river.
h_title_comment: Excellent service, wide variety of breakfast
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: A hard act to follow the sister hotel 'Hanoi Serene' but this place ran close. Budget-Midrange hotel where Superb staff hospitality and good value for money make the difference. Our room was spotless, nice and quiet with proper doors, quiet aircon and comfortable. The shower (over bath) had some proper pressure behind it which was nice change for asia. Breakfast was excellant, with plenty of fresh fruit and cooked meals to choose from. Location is average, but its not a big walk to get anywhere and a moto was easily arranged by the hotel for hire for $5 for the day. Would happily go back.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed at Serene Palace hotel in June, 2014. We had a best time there with funny and friendly staff who always be ready to chat & share their knowledge with you. Receptionist was so helpful about tour, local information and food recommendation. Breakfast was fab with many choice, waitress were so nice and took care us every meal. Our room were very h-u-g-e, had balcony, a PC for free, wifi for free, safe box and a fab bathroom. I didn't think that we were staying at 3 star hotel! Staff treated you as kings and queens, do anything you request with a big smile. What a strange if you dont like this lovely palace. We will come back with our family in next Oct, thanks all! Xxx
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Average hotel

We stayed here for 4 nights, the hotel was ok but we thought they could change a few things to improve the quality of stay.
We received a lovely welcome from the reception, all staff couldn't do enough to help us during our stay and all very very pleasant.
The first thing I had to do when we arrived at our room was to tighten the toilet seat, which was very loose.
Our room was a really good size, which had 3 chairs, a table, a desk, a bedside table with a lamp but no socket nearby to power the lamp from. One cupboard for hanging clothes, 4 small shelves which were filled with ornaments and behind the shelves was the only mirror in the room, a fridge,a safe and a PC.
There was only one electrical socket in the room, no mirror in the room apart from the one hidden behind our clothes (we removed ornaments and put our clothes there).
In the bathroom is a bath with a hand held shower, no bracket for holding the shower, one socket which the hotels hair dryer (which lacked power) was plugged into, any of our personnel items fell out of both sockets, we managed to push a chair against the plug in the bedroom and there was a phone next to the socket in the bathroom which we wrapped the phone cable around our electrical plug to keep if in place.
The breakfast was ok, nothing special.
Improvements -

Add more electric sockets in room, with stronger springs in sockets to hold items, one socket isn't enough.
Remove lamp if it can't be used.
Add a large mirror in room next to an electric socket.
Add more shelving in room.
Remove chairs and ornaments.

We really enjoyed our time in Hue, but we both felt these little improvements would have made the quality of stay all the more better.

We stayed here for 4 nights, the hotel was ok but we thought they could change a few things to improve the quality of stay.
We received a lovely welcome from the reception, all staff couldn't do enough to help us during our stay and all very very pleasant.
The first thing I had to do when we arrived at our room was to tighten the toilet seat, which was very loose, and couldn't be used.
Our room was a really good size, which had 3 chairs, a table, a desk, a bedside table with a lamp but no socket nearby to power the lamp from. One cupboard for hanging clothes, 4 small shelves which were filled with ornaments and behind the shelves was the only mirror in the room, a fridge,a safe and a PC.
There was only one electrical socket in the room, no mirror in the room apart from the one hidden behind our clothes (we removed ornaments and put our clothes there).
In the bathroom is a bath with a hand held shower, no bracket for holding the shower, one socket which the hotels hair dryer (which lacked power) was plugged into, any of our personnel items fell out of both sockets, we managed to push a chair against the plug in the bedroom and there was a phone next to the socket in the bathroom which we wrapped the phone cable around our electrical plug to keep if in place.Wifi signal was also poor.
The breakfast was ok, nothing special.
Improvements -

Add more electric sockets in room, with stronger springs in sockets to hold items, one socket isn't enough.
Remove lamp if it can't be used.
Add a large mirror in room next to an electric socket.
Add more shelving in room.
Remove chairs and ornaments.

We really enjoyed our time in Hue, but we both felt these little improvements would have made the quality of stay all the more better. The cleanliness off the hotel and also the staff can't be faulted.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
A great hotel in an excellent location. Our room was comfortable, clean and modern.

The staff were friendly, welcoming and provided excellent service. I was feeling well when we arrived and they arranged for the most amazing vegetable noodle soup and ginger tea to be delivered to my room and they even sent someone out to buy paracetamol for me!

We would highly recommend this hotel and we wished we could have stayed for longer!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Greeted with cold towels after a long but interesting train journey from Hanoi. Very warm welcome and friendly staff ensured our stay was comfortable and faultless. Very nice room with good views of the city . Thank you for the lovely chocolates flowers and birthday cake and romantic rose petals. Good breakfast included in the room rate which I would defy anyone to say was not excellent value for money. Unbelievable - Would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Hue !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The rooms were quite spacious and offered a range of features such as a desktop, a large flat screen TV, a bath, complimentary fruit, fast WiFi, soap, shampoo, bubble bath and, a reasonably priced mini-bar. The staff here are very friendly and connect with you on a more personal level than most hotels. Julia was particularly helpful and took great care accommodating our needs you can really sense that she takes great pride in what she does, her demeanor was pleasant and charming as were all the other staff who smiled generously and provided only their very best services. The restaurant was small and unassuming but the food emulated traditional Vietnamese cuisine while remaining accessible to a wide range of palates. Also on this site, it is noted that the restaurant is the best in hue which despite our short stay, I have no problem agreeing with. There is little to no mention of this restaurants high rating I recommend the set menu which brings you the very best Vietnamese tradition. for breakfast don't miss out on the fried dumplings if you're a fan of the dried plum drinks in Asia don't miss out on the lemon-licorice-dried plum drink that the servers make with finesse for a small fee it is worth it. DO NOT EAT THE PANCAKES. Bring conditioner, there is no pool, be sure to bring a power bar or a splitter if traveling with many electronic devices. Enjoy your stay in so far the best hotel I've had the pleasure of staying with in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The tone my stay at this hotel was set as soon as I walked in the first time. I was invited to have a seat by a very friendly hostess with excellent English skills while she took care of my check-in. Staff then brought me a free plate with an assortment of fresh tropical fruits and a non-alcoholic fruit drink to relax with while my check-in was being finalized. This was standard practice with all guests - the staff treated all guests like kings and queens. Every time I walked by the front desk, they said hello to me by name and asked me how my visit was. When I asked how to mail postcards and letters, they took care of it for me. They made my stay truly enjoyable. My room was also excellent. The room was immaculate and the furnishings also looked like new. The bathroom was large and spotless. Breakfast was included with my stay and I ordered off a menu, usually having a fresh omelet, fruits and toast each morning (I stayed 3 nights). Also, the hotel, which I would describe as a 3-Star boutique hotel, was within easy walking distance (7-10 minutes) of the restaurant district frequented by U.S. and European travelers, as well as Vietnamese. Just the friendly treatment of the staff makes this hotel worth going back to, but it is the complete package. If I go back to Hue City, I WILL stay at the Serene Palace Hotel again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: 2 couples and stayed 4 nights. Welcome drinks and fruit appreciated on a really hot day Good breakfast. Great value, friendly, informed staff helped with tours and onward travel to Hoi An and advice on local shopping
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed only one night but would have liked longer. Friendly and very helpful.
Good breakfast and service, extremely comfortable room with good amenities.
Helpful organising guide and travel onwards to Hoi An.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Outstanding value for money. Faultless service. Welcome drink on arrival. We got a very spacious (perhaps too empty) room with a desktop computer connected to the internet. Location is at least a 15 minute walk away from the tourist action, so that's the only con.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed here for four nights. Very good rooms with AC and desktop included. Rooms are pretty big, bathroom as well. Staff was extremely helpful and understanding. When arriving we were served fruits and a welcome drink. But also when sitting in the lobby longer than 5minutes a glass of tea was offered just complimentary. Fresh fruit in the room every day. The prices were very, very reasonable, one of the cheaper hotels we visited. The hotel is situated at walking distance of the Citadel and Dongba market. Other attractions a bit farther away. But Staff can arrange bikes, tours, taxis. Breakfast was great. What a pleasant surprise this hotel.
h_title_comment: Very good service, great value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed 2 nights here last week and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful and attentive. We booked a car transfer from Hoi An which was reasonably priced as well as a boat trip to pagoda /citadel and airport transfers. All arrangements went smoothly and staff were helpful. Our balcony room was spacious and had good views over city.
My only criticism (and its a small one) is that the power point in bathroom is positioned too close to light switch so it is impossible to use an adaptor plug for electrical appliances. Otherwise the facilities were great and breakfast was generous. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: For $37 a night you really can't fault this place! Very new, immaculate, clean, great service, comfortable etc etc. It's in the heart of the tourist precinct close to restaurants and services. Very quiet, good beds and nice bathrooms. What's not to like? The breakfast is also good. Staff are friendly and helpful with good suggestions for seeing the sights. Highly recommended hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at Hue Serene Palace for 2 nights in a very spacious family room. I can't fault the hotel or the room for the price- it is excellent value. I had mentioned in an email that we were on a trip to celebrate my husbands birthday so he was treated to a bunch of flowers and a birthday cake on arrival. The staff even sang him Happy Birthday when they showed us to our room. Staff were very eager and attentive. Food was great. Location was excellent.
However, I'm only giving this hotel 4 stars as I don't like the way they try and get you to give a good Trip Advisor rating. Upon checkout we were asked how our stay was. I told them we were very happy, and of course they then requested a review on TA. We were met with this request many times on our trip, and I understand how important it is for new hotels to get a decent rating so I said yes I would. I was then asked by another staff member, 'how many stars will you give us?' I assured them I would give them five stars, as they were so eager. Then, when they showed us to our car, they asked, 'When do you think you will write your review? When you get to your next hotel?' I found this really off-putting. I obviously wasn't quick enough, as I have also received an email from them reminding me to review them with 5 stars.
You really do have a wonderful hotel here, but please lay off the requests for TA reviews. Good hospitality should be provided without expecting anything in return.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Good hotel, good rooms, good choice at breakfast, friendly staff, nearby a lot of recommended restaurants. We alse booked a car there to take us to Hoi-An, which was reasonably priced.
Walkable distance to the citadel (if you can cope with the heath)
We recommend to anyone going to Hue!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: When our taxi from the airport turned up this tiny lane way we wondered what we were in for. What we got was a brilliant hotel tucked away from the main road. From check in the staff and service was brilliant and attentive. You are made to feel incredibly welcome. The rooms were clean and very well presented. The breakfast buffet is simple but well stocked and fresh. The tour service and local advice was flawless. Overall a fantastic establishment that does not disappoint.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This is my first time for traveling to Vietnam and my brother found such a great hotel for me. Since first time I arrived the hotel staff gave me a great smile then I felt so warm and I did get a lam juice for welcome drink. This shown a great service of this hotel provided by the staff there. The breakfast was included and it was just perfect for either Asian or western travelers. This hotel made me really a great feeling with an unforgettable experience of Hue city. Special thank to all staffs who remembering my name so well, Julia , Mary ( her nick name) Tout and some others who works for both apartments. I will definitely go back if I have chance :)
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
we spent two nights and really appreciated the hotel from welcome, reception, breakfast, room size (quite big according to standard) and its quality, location, staff kindness, etc.
all were great ! especially for couples or family.
definitely recommended to all.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We only spent one night at this hotel, it was a smooth in and out, friendly staff and convenient location. Breakfast was uneventful, but I guess at this price you cannot set the bar high :-) Otherwise the room is large and clean.
h_title_comment: Convenient hotel with a good price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I cannot express just how great this hotel is! From the moment we arrived everything was just perfect! We were welcomed by very friendly staff members with drinks and fresh fruit before being shown to our room. The room was very spacious, modern and clean. Excellent value for money! The breakfast was great and we also had dinner at the restaurant which was delicious. The staff were able to provide lots of information regarding Hue. The hotel is conveniently located close to great restaurants and shopping. Outstanding food, staff and location!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I booked from Hoi An and they sent a driver to collect me from there for only slightly more than the cheapest private car options but with the comfort of a new Toyota SUV and the flexibility to stop or not anywhere along the drive. Met by very friendly staff in reception who quickly showed me to my room even though I arrived before the check in time. No issue. The room was clean, well maintained and well equipped. I do agree with other comments that the beds are hard. Breakfast was sufficient although the buffet portion was small they will cook pretty much whatever you want.

Located off the main street on a narrow laneway (not fair to call it an alley as some do) with several cafes/restaurants and hotels. Certainly safe. Walking distance to the main restaurants and shops. The current construction next door was sometimes a nuisance when trying to relax in the room from the afternoon heat but is due to be finished mid July. Also some afternoons I heard nothing.

This is a lovely little hotel and excellent value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: What a nice welcome we got, fresh fruit and fresh juice, etc The service was outstanding, we stayed 5 nights, traveled with our boys, 8 and 9 years old. The team of Serene Palace spoiled them rotten, not only at breakfast time. When my husband fell ill, they made fresh ginger tea and and and... We would always stay here again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Very friendly and helpful staff, even in very complicate situation. Nice and clean room. Fantastic food. Next to the center of Hue, We can recommend this Hotel to anybody who wants to have a great time in Hue.
h_title_comment: Very nice place in the center of Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I booked this hotel as a base for my 2 day trip to the Tu Lan cave system in Phong Nha, and found it to be excellent value, very comfortable, and the breakfasts were awesome! I booked for 5 nights, although one of those nights I was out camping, and the service was great. Upon arrival, I was given fruit, a welcome drink, and a cool towel. The staff helped with buying my train ticket from Hue to Dong Hoi, and as it was an early morning train (2am!), security took me to the train station by motorbike, which was unexpected but very appreciated! My only issue with the location was that it was difficult to utilise the airport shuttle buses, which are the best options for a solo traveller. There was also a lot of construction noise from the building next door, which is obviously not the hotel's fault, but worth noting if you're staying until mid-July, otherwise it's a very quiet location.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed at Hue Serene Palace for 2 nights. After an overnight train we were able to check in immediately hours before check in time. This was very much appreciated. The staff were very friendly and helpful offering us a welcome drink and complimentary fruit upon arrival. The hotel is located down a narrow lane. It is in a perfect location for tourists. Close to restaurants, bars and shops. Breakfast was very good and was included in our booking. Fruit, breads, pastries, cereals and juice etc. were provided and eggs were made fresh upon request. The room was lovely but the mattress on the bed was very hard and not particularly comfortable to sleep on. Overall we had a nice stay at Hue Serene Palace and recommend it as good value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We loved this hotel and particularly the staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. They organised a driver to take us to the tombs, citadel and pagoda. They advised us on restaurants and booked us into a vegetarian eatery where all the locals were gathered. The building works are due to finish by mid July, didn't start until 8.00 am and were finished by 5.00pm. This hotel proved excellent value for money and we were very happy to have stayed there.
h_title_comment: Excellent retreat from the city streets
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This was a excellent hotel with really good rooms and staff, a bargain. This was the most luxurious place we stayed in Vietnam. The room was very new, clean and organised. The breakfast was the best included breakfast that I had in VIetnam. They were excellent at booking tours - a car trip to see the tombs and a separate boat tour to the pagoda and Citadel. The staff at reception were lovely, but the girls working the restaurant were the best.
h_title_comment: Exceptional Hotel at a very reasonable price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed at 8 hotels in our trip to Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos and this was by far the best.The staff were marvelous, the rooms were excellent, and the location was quiet, yet convenient. The value was incredible. Urreservalby reccommended
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We loved our 6 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is lovely, the staff are all fantastic and the food is great. We had most of our meals in the restaurant as the food is delicious and inexpensive. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Hue. We spent time interacting with staff and they are all a delight without exception. However, a special thank you to Emily & Julia in reception and Lucy, Ivy, Sabrina & Sami in the restaurant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Lovely new hotel down a quiet alley a short walk from the central area of Hue, and about 25 mins walk to the Imperial Citadel. We had a huge room on the fifth floor with a balcony overlooking the city - only downside was no chairs on the balcony but easily fixed by bringing some out from inside. Room is well appointed, even with a computer and internet, and the bathroom is very luxurious.

Breakfast was good - the usual Vietnamese mix of fresh fruit and bread, plus whatever you want cooked to order. We also ate there one evening based on Trip Advisor reviews and although the food was great, the atmosphere was lacking (we prefer to sit outside in any event, which wasn't an option).

Staff were friendly and helpful, especially in the restaurant, and we were allowed straight into our room on arrival on the overnight train from Hanoi - following welcome drinks and fruit of course!

Bed was huge but a tad hard - but then that seems to be the norm in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of main streets, the Serene Palace hotel is still centrally located. Overall this hotel met our family needs well. Clean and mostly comfortable, even though the extra fold out bed was a tad hard and breakfast was not quite to the standard of other hotels.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We reserved this hotel based on what we could read and see in tripadvisor and other travel websites. The ratings, reviews and pictures were good. The only apprehension was the location in a narrow alley off a main thoroughfare in a busy downtown area. As the taxi driver approached the alley he hesitated going in because of the narrowness and obstructions by motorbikes parking. Warning bells were ringing in my head, I had to walk in, asking for directions. Luckily the taxi managed to get through and we arrived at the front of the hotel, which stands out from the neighborhood. It has a nice clean front with attendants helping us off the taxi and carried our luggage to the air-conditioned reception area where we were seated and offered cold juice drinks and fresh cold towels to cool off.I mentally checked 1 plus for the hotel. After registration we were helped to the room with luggage, I mentally checked another plus, all the modern amenities were available including the excellent Wi-Fi reception, the bed was comfortable enough for two, the room and bath area sparkling clean, the air-conditioning was quick and highly responsive. The hotel has an integrated restaurant which took care of the free buffet breakfast, providing an excellent array of coffee, tea, juices, Western and Vietnamese style breakfast. One of my American colleague managed to have Pho for breakfast every morning for 3 mornings in a row. Could Pho be really that good in a hotel restaurant? I chose to stick to the royal three courses of coffee/juice at will followed by eggs/sausage/bread and cocktail of fresh fruits to cap off the morning meals. We discovered that the restaurant served very reasonable lunch and dinner for a very good price. So on a day when we were tired of being in town the hotel restaurant was our quiet retreat for a simple meals. The restaurant was the third plus. The fourth plus came from the staff, always smiling, helpful, catering to all of our needs including scheduling taxis and tours. So if you don't have lots of money for four or five stars hotels in Hue, the Serene Palace tucked in a narrow alley is a place to consider.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment:
My husband and I were going to stay in Hue for 1 or 2 nights but ended up staying for 4 nights mainly because we were feeling so comfortable during our stay at Serene Palace Hotel.

Our stay began with a receptionist helping us get out of a very exhausting arguement with the taxi driver.( the driver was trying to charge us 40,000 VND even though the metre showed 25,000VND). We paid what we were supposed without much trouble thanks to the receptionist. And there were freshly ground mango juice and freshly cut fruits waiting for us at the lobby.

The surprise continued with free upgrade for the first two nights, and the wonderful breakfast with so much fruit selection, and the motorbike tour they arranged for us that turned out to be wonderful. All the staff we saw was professional, and seem genuinely nice. Especially, we were very impressed with the restaurant staff named Sabrine(or Sabrina,I believe) was exceptional and it was lovely to see her beautiful smile some mornings and some evenings!

We would definitely stay there again!
h_title_comment: What an amazing place to stay!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great hotel in convenient location for restaurants and waterfront. Staff very helpful and rooms very large. Only downsides were the noise from the building work (which is hopefully temporary) and compared to our previous hotel in Hanoi the breakfasts were not so good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: At first we arrived and they gave us a welcome fruitplate with fresh melonjuice. Then they gave us an upgrade for free. It was the most beautiful room we had in 4 weeks. When we arrived at breakfast the next morning the breakfast was great. We especially loved the staff: An, Thuyn, Than, Tuy (nicknames; Sabrina, Ivy, Macy, Lucy). They really made our stay unforgetteble! We even become Facebookfriends : )
h_title_comment: Fantastic staff, great service, beautiful clean rooms
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Good clean place to stay. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Situated in a quiet side street which is still close to main shopping area. Everything is in walking distance. The breakfasts were of a very good standard and catered well for westerners.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The service is amazing, you feel like your in a 4 star hotel, the room is beautifull and you are treated with high regards!

The breakfast has many option and they are all Nice.

I needed to see à doctor and they brought him to my room for 20$ 30 minutes after I asked for it.

I felt like this place was way too good for the price I paid!
h_title_comment: Best quality for price you can find !
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Serene Palace hotel was the best hotel during 1 month in South East Asia. It was better more than 5 star hotel we stayed. Room is very large with nice Western decoration, has safety box, wifi pass for free, big bathroom with shower, complimentary fresh fruit delivered to your room everyday... Especially there is a scales which put in your room for checking your luggage before the flight. It means they care everything you need. The most beautiful of this hotel is receptionist. They were very helpful and friendly. They had English name so very easy to remember, maybe you don't like it but very convenient for me who could not speak any Vietnamese word. Only one negative thing is the construction next door. It was really noisy in the date time but ok. Because of great team so I gave this hotel 5*.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This reasonably new hotel was a great find, a bit of a diamond in the rough! It's street location appears a little scary at first, but it is a little oasis once you get inside. Our family room was fantastic, really BIG, in fact it was the biggest hotel room we had during our trip around Vietnam. The staff were really lovely and treated my daughters like little rock stars (which they loved of course!). The reception staff were very helpful with tours and booking taxis for us. We had a great stay at the Serene Palace Hotel!
h_title_comment: Great place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We can't speak highly enough of this hotel. It is located in a narrow lane which is wonderful because it is quiet and not busy. In our experience everything was of a very high standard and all the staff are so helpful with all our requests for advice. The meals were so good and so well priced that we ate there most of the time. Air condioners in room are extremely efficient and rooms are a great size. We stayed 4 nights as it was just such a great place to be and a highlight on our trip.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We didnt expect the location to be in the middle of the backpacker area but it was a good thing because there were lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance, it was a bit far from the Citadel and Markets but we got a boat across which was great ($5 each). Staff lovely and rooms good for the price. We had just come from a 5 star $200 per night resort and the welcome was better at thsi hotel with a cold drink, towel AND a plate of fruit!! Only issue was that there is building work right next door which wont last too long but did disturb us when we wanted an afternoon rest. Rooms did have a slight musty smell and the shower flooded the bathroom. We did however get our own personal computer in our room which again was something we didnt get in far more expensive resorts/hotels. Overall a nice haven when walking around hot and busy Hue, we had endless cold showers which was nice and the air conditioning worked really well
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
the welcome and follow up service were truly astonishing.the special price was budget.the room was spacious and comfortable.the hotel is also very new.the staff were honest and knowledgable
about places to see and eat.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Nice hotel in a bit of a strange place.
it's located in a narrow alley, which looks a bit dilapidated.
The service is good, especially for this rates.

Rooms are good, but bathroom is a bit less luxurious then you'd expect when you see the room.
Everything is well finished in the rooms and the beds are great.

We stayed only for 1 night, because we wanted to visit Hue.
But I really recommend this hotel, if you're only looking for a hotel to stay at night.

overall we enjoyed our stay in Hue Serene Palace Hotel.
h_title_comment: Good hotel, close to the city center.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Loved this hotel- stayed for only one night with my boyfriend in June 2014 but was definitely one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in!

When we arrived we were given a fruit juice and plate of fruit and our bags taken to our rooms.

Rooms lovely and clean and modern.

No bad things to say! Thank you to the staff for their wonderful service and hospitality! :)
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
At USD$30 a night, this is not budget, but it's certainly good value. You get a very reasonably sized clean room, complimentary fruit and water, free breakfast and a good bathroom. I really enjoyed my stay here and though the staff were superb, knowledgable and friendly.

There is room to improve the breakfast which was pretty greasy both mornings. Furthermore we ordered a double room, which consisted of 2 wide-singles pushed together then the 2 sets of sheets and duvets were laid horizontally across the bed, this led to waking up a little tangled when they could just get proper sized sheets and duvets!

On balance I would mist certainly return.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed at Serene Palace 3 nights in June and 2 nights in their sister Serene Hotel Hanoi. Both of them is also very nice. There is no thing to complaint about Serene Palace, perfect service! They welcomed me by fresh fruit, passion juice, cold towel and a big city map. Serene staff was very helpful and tried to help me everything I need. In the raining day the bell man gave me an umbrella for free when I took the tour around their city. I was very comfortable about everything in Serene Palace. The restaurant downstair served some lovely local food with the best price I have never found in other hotel restaurant. Try their food you won't be disappointed. Staff of hotel is the best staff over the world, let ask them if you have some question about Vietnam tourism. If I come back definitely stay in Serene Palace Hotel. Thank you to Mary and her staff (Lucy, Ivy, Shee, Laura ....)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed for two nights. Staff were excellent. We arrived before check in time and they gave us breakfast while waiting. The room we got was a family room as all the doubles were taken, so they gave us the room at a discount. Room was huge, two queen sized beds. A/c, computer, tea coffee etc. My wife was sick one morning and they made her ginger tea and took up a light breakfast for her. Breakfast in the dining room was great, also ate dinner there one night. i would highly recommend this hotel. Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend Hue itself. Keep away from anything touristy.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrived to the hotel, and we got such a warming welcome!
The stuff was very kind and helpful, they took the luggages to the room and gave us a plate with fruits and watermelon shake!
The room is amazing! Super clean and h-u-g-e! There was everything with extra like a computer in the room, fruits, coffe&tea, minibar, and more and more!!!!!! Oh, and i forget to tell that is also amazing breakfast including?!
In conclusion the- Best value for your money!!!! We really enjoyed from our stay here!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Stayed here for three nights in June in an upgraded room (upgraded for free on arrival).

Staff very friendly and welcoming in terms of day to day routine interactions with fairly good english but we found it difficult to get unbiased onward travel advice and information on local tours. The default position appears to be to encourage use of overpriced private cars and staff don't appear very well informed about tours or national/international travel e.g. buses or trains.

Unfortunately due to "face" issues if you ask about a novel/unknown topic then your likely to be made to feel awkward rather than helped to find an answer. Though this is obviously not unique to this hotel it happens all over Vietnam (and China).

Aside from these minor issues (plenty of useful information on blogs etc anyway) the stay was good and the location is at the more local end of the main drag in Hue so restaurant and bar prices a bit cheaper. Would recommend a stay here.
h_title_comment: Great hotel slightly let down by tourism and travel advice
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The Serene Place Hotel is well located close to the bars and restaurants of the backpacker area of Hue and not too far away from the Citadel. We found the rooms to be great and the breakfast decent too. Overall good value for money and we enjoyed our stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed 3 nights at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel and it was wonderful. From the time I arrived to checkout, all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, my room was clean and comfortable and the hotel is very centrally located. Breakfast was included and was delicious with fresh fruit, Vietnamese and Western options. The hotel also helped arrange transportation to and from the airport and train station for me. All in all, I couldn't have been happier with my stay here and would definitely recommend it to others.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel and we were welcomed with a wonderful cold drink as we waited to be checked in. The staff is friendly and helpful, we had problems with the in-room safe (we didn't follow the directions!!) and they couldn't have been nicer. Location is down a small road, close enough to the river and lots of restaurants and shops. Breakfast was cooked to order with lots of choices.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I have just recently returned following a fabulous trip to Vietnam where I stayed in some amazing accommodation and the best compliment I can give this hotel is that this was the best hotel we stayed at during our entire trip.
The room was spotless and massive, the food was amazing and great value for money and there is not a single thing I can fault in this regard.
However what makes this hotel stand out above all others is the amazing staff that works there, they literally can't do enough for you. As soon as you arrive you are given a beautiful drink, the whole lot of Hue is explained to you with a map, when I was having food I was shown the best way to eat it in a Vietnam way, they help sort out taxis and everything you can ask for.

After our return we look at what we paid for every hotel and we were astonished that our favourite hotel this one is the one we spent the least on.

Top Hotel with some Top Staff.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed at the Serene Palace for 1 night. The customer service was great, as we were checking in we were given great advice and even had our room upgraded. The room was really nice, infact it was one of the cheapest hotels we stayed in throughout Vietnam and also one of the nicest. Really clean and spacious and modern. The food in the restaurant was also really nice, try the Beef Pho. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends as a great stop in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My partner and I stopped off in Hue during travelling Vietnam for one night in December 2013.

We had got the overnight train from Hanoi so arrived early - however; the hotel staff could not have been anymore helpful. They immediately allowed us to get some breakfast and coffee before checking in far earlier than the stated check in times.

As we only stayed in Hue for the one evening we didn't spend masses of time in the hotel; but it is clean, quiet, friendly and very reasonably priced.

I would highly recommend staying here while visiting Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrived from Hoi An using their Hue-Hoi An private car service so that we could stop at Marble mountain and the Hai Van Pass, which was worth it ($64 for two for a private car for the day, which was comfortable and we got to make our own itinerary) and got a free upgrade when we arrived. The room was outstanding: looked great and new, very clean and comfortable.

The restaurant and breakfast were very good and most importantly convenient. I loved the food and going out, but after travelling for weeks, it's nice to be able to go to the lobby and get a delicious, authentic meal without the fuss of "dining out".

We were relatively close to the citadel (a 30 minute walk which isn't bad at all when it's not the middle of the day) and Perfume river. I wish we had stayed in Hue longer because it would have been great to do a day-trip on a dragon boat and see some of the sites out of town, and because we were very satisfied with the hotel too :)
h_title_comment: Wished we had stayed in Hue a day longer
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Fantastic hotel with great rooms and excellent staff.
We stayed one night but really enjoyed our stay. It's down a small lane and was very quiet (location on agoda's map isn't right so check google maps to make sure)
They recommended number of options for activities and helped us arrange our days and onward travel.
We ordered dinner from their newly opened restaurant which included a number of the hue specialities - they were delicious! A must if you are in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We picked this hotel as it was #1 on trip advisor and couldn't really decide on any others. It was a nice hotel, clean and staff were friendly (overly friendly - it actually felt rather false and not genuine compared to other places in Vietnam).

The food in the restaurant was okay, again not comparable with other places. The balcony was good with a good view over the city, big beds that were semi comfortable and the reception staff were very helpful and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay however the value for money is not as good as others we experienced in Vietnam - perhaps it depends on when you stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We initially longed to go to the jade hotel but as it was full they redirected us towards the serene palace and it was perfect. Welcome with juices and fresh fruits, super comfy bed, spacious and well equipped room, high-standard staff service. We payed 15$/night on special, with free fresh fruits, coffee, tea and water bottles every morning, and they helped us to rent a motorbike for the day and to book the bus from Hue to Hoi An (6$) the night before we leave.
In a nutshell, an excellent feedback for an excellent hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was one of the nicest hotel I've stayed in Vietnam.The rooms are exactely like in the pictures shown which is not exactly like other hotels that we've been.The staff are very helpful,pleasant,so it makes your stay very enjoyable.The rooms are very clean with fresh fruits every day,tea or coffee etc.I definetly recommended this place for your stay at Hue and you won't be disappointed.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
My family’s stay in this hotel was very pleasant and enjoyable even though we only stayed for one night. The hotel kept up with the expectations I had based on the reviews of travellers who came ahead of us. As forewarned, I anticipated the narrow road leading to the hotel from the main road. But this road seemed interesting with its line of cafes. Too bad, we did not have the chance to try them. We had some difficulty finding the hotel because of the rather small sign posted among the clutter of other signs, but that was no big deal. The staffs, particularly the front liners Ken and Jenny, were all so welcoming and so were the other staffs that were equally warm, attentive and very helpful. Most of them spoke English which made our stay even more convenient. Welcome drink and fruits were served when we checked in. Having been out in the hot and humid summer day, the drinks were refreshing but it could have been more so if it were ice cold.

The room we had was spacious, beautiful and tastefully decorated with pastel colours contrasted with patches of brown. The hotel is relatively new and the room and bathroom were spic and span. The room came with complimentary fresh fruits, bottled water, sachets of ice tea and 3 in one coffee. It had a hot pot, mini-bar and flat screen TV with good English programs. ,

The restaurant was also very good. It is has just opened and the cooking was excellent. We enjoyed all the Vietnamese cuisines that we tried, like the banana flower salad, the vegetarian spring roll, the seafood fresh spring roll, fresh noodle with grilled pork and the traditional pancake with shrimp and pork. But what I missed was the authentic Bun Bo Hue, the Hue noodle soup. My first taste of this Hue noodle delicacy was in Ho Chi Minh and was looking forward to having the “real one” in Hue. I wish the Serene Restaurant will serve the original bun bo hue.

This hotel is highly recommended, excellent service, good room, good food, wi fi access everywhere and very reasonable price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We really appreciated the warm welcome and the quality of the staff (very attentive and customer oriented).

Rooms are big, new and well-equiped (TV, Personal computer, beautiful bathroom).

I highly recommend this place in Hue ! For sure you will enjoy and appreciate your journey.
h_title_comment: Excellent hotel with a great sense of service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We were staying at the Serene in Hanoi when Emily suggested we stay here on our way though to Saigon. We love the Serene at Hanoi (have stayed twice now) and decided to try it out and were not disappointed at all. Started with a standard room but A/C was noisy and when we notified staff we were promptly upgraded to a Deluxe room along with many apologies. Breakfast was freshly cooked and were encouraged to order more, choices were not huge but more than adequate. We had dinner and as its a new restaurant were not many people there but we're looked after by Ivy with her gorgeous smile and cheeky Lucy the food was delicious and reasonably priced. Have stayed at varying rated hotels from budget to five star in Vietnam the only downside is no pool but once again the staff make it a wonderful experience at the Serene in both Hanoi and now Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This is the best hotel in Vietnam. Definitely stay here again.
- Room: Biggest I haven't seen before with PC, complimentary fresh fruit & water, 2 double beds with balcony... Everything is perfect!
- Breakfast: Big breakfast with lots of choice: Egg, pancake, Vietnamese soup, fried rice... Food is very fresh and delicous, good value!
- Staff: Super staff. Especially FOM Mary who helped me arrange everything in Hue. She gave me a color map with full information about Hue, arranged private car for the tour visit all royal tombs and Hoi An city. We see their smile everyday, so sweet. Keep smiling girls!
Totally, this is the best choice if you intend to stay in Hue. Let talk to them if you have some question.
I love Vietnam and love Serene Palace Hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for a couple of nights and enjoyed it very much. The rooms were lovely (with a PC and big TV) and a nice bathroom.

They have a good in house restaurant which is quite new but serves nice food. I think they are starting cooking classes soon too.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were very happy with our one night stay at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly, attentive and keen to please. We had travelled from Hanoi that morning having got off the overnight train from Sapa so when we arrived at Hue around lunchtime, the hotel offered us a welcome drink followed by breakfast at no extra charge. We also enjoyed our breakfast the following morning before checkout. Both were good so really no complaints here.
The one thing we thought could be better was at the Reception Desk. Not all the front desk staff spoke good English. While those who appeared to be supervisors spoke English well and were extremely helpful, there were others on Reception and information desk who we struggled to understand. Usually the staff who spoke English well were the ones who gave directions and information, but when those people were not on duty, it was difficult to get information from some of the other staff.This did not in anyway detract from our overall positive experience here. We enjoyed our stay at Serene Palace Hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We only stayed here for 2 nights but had a lovely stay. The staff really helpful and friendly and the hotel very clean and comfortable. We had a balcony with a great view of the city of hue,
. The location was great for access to the perfume river where we took a boat trip to them citadel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Could not have asked for more from this hotel. It was located in walking distance of local markets and the river. The staff was extremely welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The breakfast was great and the room was super clean and comfortable. For price and high quality, this is a great choice!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We only stayed here one night but it was very nice.
Fresh fruit in the room when we arrived, comfortable bed, even if it was a little firm.
The room was quite spacious, and the bathroom was of a good standard.
Breakfast was very nice, not a buffet so it took a little longer than we expected but it was all cooked very well.

The staff were by far the best part of the hotel. They were very warm and friendly, always smiling, and they couldn't do enough to make your stay pleasant, even if it was just for one night.
I would definitely return to this hotel for that reason.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent four nights at the hotel. We were met at the station. Our room was located at the back of the hotel, not much of a view but we were happy not to face the bars and restaurant in the street. A basic but perfectly adequate and comfortable room. Clean and pleasant, and it came with a PC too. The staff were extremely welcoming and friendly, perhaps too much welcoming after a while. They were always happy to bring a coffee up to the room or find a biscuit. Arrangements for our car trips were efficient and effective. Hotel well located but down an alley. Breakfast was plentiful and efficient. Thoroughly recommended. Amazing value, the best we had in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 3 nights and chose this place due to reviews on TA as well as recommended to us by sister hotel in Hanoi (Charming 2).
It is a very nice hotel in a nice quiet location which is very convenient for walking into town. The staff are fantastic and could not be more helpful which is obviously the prerequisite for this group of hotels. Seriously you could not get better staff!
We were very happy with our room which was large and modern and had a balcony. Various tours we organised through the hotel were good and not expensive. The restaurant (which is fairly new) in the hotel has really good food and brilliant service. In fact some of the best food we had in Hue was at the Serene restaurant and we enjoyed talking to the staff very much.
Special hi's and thanks to Sabrina, Lucy, Ivy, Julia, Lavinia and Jenny who made our stay very enjoyable and comfortable. Great place to stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Due to time restraints we could only stay one night, but we thoroughly enjoyed our day there. We arrived early on the train, but our room was ready and after a nice cool welcome drink we could go to our room. All staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was very comfortable. It was in a great location to get to all the sights and restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff tried their best to help us get the most of our stay, even though we did not book any tours with them. we would recommend the hotel without reservations.
h_title_comment: Perfect Hotel with great location and friendly staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had a 2 night stay in the hotel and were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel.

We had a room on one of the higher floors towards the back of the property which was very quiet. The rooms were large and comfortable, albeit the mattress was very firm. The bathroom was simple and clean.

The staff at the hotel were fantastic, always smiling and friendly and very helpful with their knowledge of information about the area. We were always greeted by name which made the experience so much more personal. The staff really do work hard to ensure you are looked after.

There is a small breakfast buffet area but you can chose from many items off the breakfast menu which they will prepare for you.

We organised a private day tour (driver only) and the hotel was able to provide us with a driver that was english speaking, at no additional cost.

Overall, for the room rate, this hotel represents great value for money with service to match many 5 star hotels.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Extremely helpful staff at this hotel made our stay so much better and easier. The room was big and very clean and comfortable. Excellent value for money.
We hired bicycles to get to the Citadel - it was a fun 10min ride in scary traffic.
They try to sell you a boat tour for $20 but you just need to decline it - if you book in travel agencies around it will cost you $6 (same boat tour, same stops along the river).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My daughter and I stayed for two nights in May, 2014. The hotel is very new, well appointed and with great service. It was definitely a most comfortable stay. We could easily walk to all the central attractions of Hue, in particular the Citadel and the restaurant precinct. The hospitality of the staff were a great plus.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed 3 nights in April 2014. Great hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Good location close to the main part of the city. Had a city view room on the 7th floor with a nice view. Rooms are big, modern and very clean. Great value for money. Highly recommended
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The hotel is located on the opposite bank from the old citadel and is a fifteen minute walk from the centre. The hotel is low rise and situated in a quite side street. The place is very clean and the staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful.

On arrival we were given refreshing towels and a lovely cold drink. Check in was smooth and we were soon shown to our lovely room. The room was very well furnished, had an excellent shower and a small balcony. The floor tiles were very good and had a pleasant feel.

There was an excellent choice at breakfast. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and it was even difficult to go and get your own coffee as they wanted to bring refills. Try the noodle soup: it is excellent!

We hired bicycles (2$/day) and these were great for getting about the town. The bikes were fine and in good condition and I certainly recommend doing this. The front door man adjusted the seats to our height; thanks!

We found this an excellent value hotel and recommend it to all.
h_title_comment: Great place for a relaxing stay !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Previous reviews are right in that the staff can't do enough for you at this hotel, it's in a decent location and it was a fairly easy walk to see the citadel and the main town. They had just opened a restaurant in the hotel and I ate there both nights, it was very nice and the Vietnamese wine was very cheap and quite palatable.
My biggest gripe was that there was no shower in the room, there was a shower attachment but there was nothing on the wall to attach it to so you had to crouch in the bath holding the shower over you, I know some people prefer a bath but when it's so hot you just want a nice cool shower. They also managed to stain a top that I had put in the laundry, they told me that the mark would come out but unfortunately it hasn't, the staff were very apologetic however and the price of the laundry was taken off my bill. My room overlooked a back street and was opposite some kind of video arcade so was a little noisy, overall it was a nice hotel though, clean and well presented.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
The taxi from the airport turned into a narrow rough side street and I wondered where I was being taken. But after a few meters the taxi stopped outside the Serene Palace and all was OK.

All the staff were friendly, smiling and helpful, the hotel fairly new and clean. I had booked a City View Room with city view. This was a nice room but unfortunately city view meant large windows facing the afternoon sun and the room was like an oven, the air conditioner could not cope. I transferred to a non view room on the other side of the hotel which turned out fine and cool.

I had dinner in the hotel restaurant, very nice and good value. Again the staff were wonderful.

I recommend this very well run hotel as a base to stay in Hue.
h_title_comment: Don’t let the street put you off.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My taxi door was opened and my bag carried inside. I was welcomed by a receptionist and guided to a couch where I was served a refreshing juice and some fruit while staff checked me in. I was accompanied to the room and everything was well explained. I haven't received that kind of welcome in 4 and 5 star hotels elsewhere.

Great job.

Room spacious and very clean. Lots of complimentary water and some fruit.

Bed, very hard mattress but this seems to be a common theme in Vietnam.

Hotel booked a last minute guided motorcycle tour which was a great way to see town.

This was the best value for money during my stay in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Nothing was too much trouble for the warm and friendly staff at this new, well appointed hotel - freshly squeezed juice on our arrival, booking our trip around the main attractions in Hue and showing an interest in our actvities. The bedrooms are large with modern bathrooms and as well as the usual tea/coffee, a bowl of fresh fruit is provided. Breakfast was the best we had on our trip. It was served by a waitress and not buffet style which meant it was much fresher than other breakfasts we had elsewhere - fresh juice, a wide variety of fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal and bacon and eggs cooked to order. The hotel is excellent value for money and we recommend it unreservedly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed at this hotel during my visit to Hue and am really glad that I did. The hotel is excellently run. The rooms are airy and very clean indeed. The food is well prepared and the real winner. The staff. As with everywhere you have your favourite member of staff. For me it is Thuy (or Sabrina If you use her English name). A real joy. However, all members of the hotel are eager to make your stay an excellent one. I will certainly be using this hotel on my next visit.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Service was excellent - staff at reception (esp. Laura) and breakfast staff were very attentive to our every need. The special tea given to my wife (by one of the breakfast staff) when she was not feeling well certainly helped her feel better. Room was excellent - spacious for two, "new" feeling, clean & functional (including very good wifi). Close enough to walk to Imperial City or Dong Ba markets but if walking is not your thing take a cyclo tour - it's inexpensive & a great way to see Hue. Ask for Minh when he comes around to the Hue Serene Palace!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is really well run, and staff is really friendly and help you for everything. We were welcomed with fresh juice and a plate of fresh fruits. Room was clean and well equipped, seems to be very recent. Wifi available everywhere, there is also a computer in each room. Good breakfast. The location is good too, in a secondary street but very close to the river and the restaurants street. We stayed for 3 nights and I'm sure we will stay here again if we will be back to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The hotel is relatively new and everything is very clean and in good working order.The staff are also very attentive and go out of their way to please.When I arrived and requested a high floor with balcony they upgraded my room at no additional charge.I also booked train tickets to Danang through the hotel and this was done very quickly and efficiently.The breakfast was also very good.Overall this hotel is excellent value for money and we will use the hotel again when we return to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We arrived to warm greetings, fresh fruits and helpful advice. All questions answered easily and nothing was difficult. The rooms are spacious and luxurious (superior room). Location is great and easy to walk or cycle around town. The desk can arrange anything you like at reasonable prices. Dinner was delicious and traditional food at very reasonable prices. The next day we left luggage and rented their bikes to do sightseeing. Returned to even more smiles and helpful advice on where to swim at other hotels. The staff and service here is above and beyond and i will recommend to anyone coming to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Agree with one of the earlier posts about this hotel. The smiles are definitely one of the first and last things you remember about this hotel. The staff are very eager to please and helpful in any way possible. When you arrive at the hotel for checking in or just after a day of sightseeing you are offered fresh fruit juices. Our room was upgraded to a family room (2 beds and a massive room).

The breakfast at the hotel is good, there is a big selection of what you can order such as fresh juices, fruit etc. We had dinner at the hotel once which was great. Tasted like proper Vietnamese food but priced very reasonably. Probably our cheapest meal in Vietnam!

We arranged for the hotel driver to collect us from Hoi An ($65) which was great. The driver was on time and stopped off at a few places (Marble Mountains, Lang Co Beach and Hai Van Pass). His English was very good. It was a pleasant 5 hour car journey. We also organized a city tour of Hue with the hotel. We had another driver to take us to the Citadel, Pogoda and three tombs ($50). Again, the driver could speak good English and was knowledgeable about the local sights.

We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Amazing quality of service. Staff is helpful, friendly/chatty and eager to please. Reception answer your question without trying to take advantage of you. On arrival, you are welcomed with fresh fruits and juice. They are some under cellophane tape in the room too and at breakfast. There s a large choice of dish made on request (sweet and savory). I think you can now also dine in the hotel. Their pumpkin soup is very good and the rest is probably to the same level as a local Vietnamese restaurant. The area is quiet lively. The drawback here to me is that it s located in the middle of a narrow alley where I have seen rats (but then it is Vietnam... I haven't seen any coackroaches in the hotel and) the rooms are clean. I had the chance to be upgraded to a family suite that was quiet spacious. I also saw another regular room with a jacuzzi bathtub. The hotel is relatively recent so the rooms are modern and in very good condition ( modern deco, computer, cable TV).The price might be a little over some other hotels but if you are not on a tight budget, I would recommend paying the few extra dollars as it makes such a big difference. If I come back to Hue, I ll book there again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We are blessed to stayed at Serene palace hotel as their staff are extremely helpful and friendly even though we decided to cancelled our sightseeing tour with them. Moreover, the room is clean & very spacious that fit a 40" LCD TV, dressing table, shoes/luggage rack, tea table with 2 sofa chair, 1 big wardrobe plus a working computer which is connected to internet !! Me and my friend are truely amazed of the room amenities with the price that we hv paid.

Will definitely recommend to my frez to stay here if they happen to stopover at Hue.

Keep up the good work !!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The smiles from all of the staff are the first (and last) thing you notice. Even when we requested a taxi to the rail station at 4.15 in the morning, the duty doorman managed to summon a smile - and a take away breakfast of bread and fruit! They are either very well trained in customer service or very happy. I suspect both.

This is a modern, bright, clean hotel that offers good value for money, a good breakfast and very good service: and is an excellent base for exploring Hue.
h_title_comment: All smiles at the Serene Palace
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel ticks all the boxes. The staff and levels of service were exceptional in every way. Our room was spacious, clean and furnished to a high standard with complimentary water and fruit every day. Breakfast was also really good and the hotel in centrally located for the main tourist area but quiet and secure. We loved our stay here as the staff paid attention to every detail which never seemed to falter. A great hotel regardless of the low price, they should be very proud of the standards. Thank you.
h_title_comment: Probably the nicest hotel we have stayed in Vietnam after 4 trips
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Wonderful hotel in Hue. It is sparkling clean, spacious and very comfortable. The staff are very helpful and kind even to the point of. Returning our Hoi An hotel key to its rightful owners after we took by mistake. Nothing was a problem. Special mention to Julia, Emily and Ken. One little thing is I would prefer if staff used their own names not English nicknames.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful and welcoming. The bedrooms are huge and very spaceous. We stayed here for a couple of nights in a family room with our daughter last month. It would be a difficult location to find without arriving by taxi, but would definately stay there again if we revisit Hue. The staff were all happy and very helpful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This hotel is well put together and an enjoyable place to stay in Hue. The staff were extremely helpful and the room well appointed and all new February 2014. The sunny balcony was a nice feature.

It's a little off the main streets, but still only a couple of minutes walk to restaurants etc.

Recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed in the Serene Palace for 3 nights. It was faultless! We arrived early and were given an upgrade to a family room. The reception staff and the boys on the door could give a master class on how to make a guest feel welcome. I was ill for most of our time there and the restaurant staff couldn't have been more helpful. They offered ginger tea and sent freshly prepared orange juice to my room. Sarina even took my friend to a pharmacy to get antibiotics. My friend ate at the restaurant on its opening night. She said that it was was superb with a wide choice and very reasonable prices. She liked the way that all the girls in the restaurant obviously loved working there and were genuinely interested in the guests. Thanks to all the staff but especially Serina, Lucy and Ivy in the restaurant and Mary on reception for making our stay in Hue such a memorable one even though I was ill and didn't actually see much of Hue!!
h_title_comment: Couldn't ask for a better hotel or staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Deposited it's odd location down a dark yet safe back alley, the Hue Serene Palace was a joy to stay in. The staff were incredibly attentive and friendly. It's located next to some lovely coffee shops and it's a good 30 mins walk to the Imperial City and ten minutes to the popular tourist bars and restaurants, all thought there's more authentic ones near by. The rooms were magnificent and really spacious, with big beds and bathrooms. Breakfast was excellent too. It may be slightly further from the City than other choices but it's such a happy place, and the staff really bend over backwards for you. Wish we stayed longer than two nights.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a family trip with two children. From the first moment until the last we enjoyed the service of the lovely staff. The hotel is very well furbished, and just a minute away from the pub and restaurant area. Recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel for 5 nights in April - the welcome was exceptional - a cool drink and yummy fruit on arrival. We had a family room which comprised of two large double beds and a nice bathroom with a bath - they were comfortable and my children were very pleased to have pay/cable TV and a computer with internet access in the room. The staff were lovely, the doormen and the beautiful breakfast girls and the lovely Julia at the front desk made us feel very welcome. Great value for money and within walking distance to the Perfume River. We would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My partner and I stayed here for 1 night on our way to Hoi An, the hotel was lovely, we were greeted with juice and fruit which was most welcome as it was very hot. The room itself was modern, clean and spacious. The Hotel is very close to the main center or Hue, even though we were only there for 1 night we managed to get out and do a little exploring. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel, it great to find such a nice place to stay for the night especially as you can pay the same money for far less luxurious places.
h_title_comment: Very nice new hotel, lovely staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace is old school charm in Vietnam, lovely friendly staff, my children adored the wait staff from the restaurant, they were so kind and helpful, especially Sabrina and Sami. The restaurant is opening up for evening meals now and their beef in lalot ( not sure how you spell that) is a must try, very delicious. As was the shrimp and pomelo salad, strange combination that really works.

We had a computer I our room so we could catch up with friends back home for the first time on our trip, and the reception staff were really helpful at telling us the best places to visit in the time we had available.

Great breakfasts too, just keep ordering off the menu, I had 3 chocolate pancakes one morning, I'm sure we left Hue a bit fatter than when we got there.

Serene palace is down a cute alley way, so it's nice and quiet, we walked up and down that alley at night with our children and never felt unsafe at any time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
My friend and I stayed for 1 night in this hotel and couldn't fault it. The staff were superb and extremely helpful. The rooms were very spacious.

The breakfast was lovely and the location also excellent for the sites of hue.

Highly recommend it! Excellent value for money.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The hotel is all you need for your stay at Hue! We stayed two nights and were very happy. Nice big rooms, good breakfast and the most smiling and helpful staff. It is located in a small alley but it is walkable distance to everything. Would definitely recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Thanks for the friendly reception after 20 hours spent in train. The team is extremly nice and always tries to help you to enjoy your trip. They gave us many advices to visit the old city "citadelle". The room are very confortable and the hotel is well design.
h_title_comment: A very quiet and lovely place to stay in the Town
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Superb modern Hotel, large well appointed rooms with balcony, spotlessly clean, good breakfast great staff. Located down a little side street nearby are shops and restaurants, turn right out of the street keep going there is a food market. If you want a night out check out Brown Eyes ( just around the corner ! ) 2 for 1 cocktails and free shots then dance with the locals and other travellers to a dj , we had a fun night there.
Overall great little hotel, would recommend it to anyone ....enjoy
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were picked up from the airport and although the hotel is tucked away down a narrow street, it is lovely and spacious. Our room was huge, the staff can't do enough for you and breakfast is delicious. They even presented my husband with a bouquet of flowers and cake on his birthday and sang to him! It was incredible value for money and we can highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our room was spacious and clean, the staff were always very very friendly. It was my birthday and they went to the effort of giving me flowers and a cake, we had not informed them. The location is down a small lane that smells. It is in the back packer / touristy part of town. They recommended a massage spa close by De what, it was shocking don't go there. The reception staff were particularly helpful with helping us confirm other parts of our trip.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 2 nights. Despite the trepidation of the side street where the hotel was situated we were pleasantly surprised.
The rooms were comfortable and had all amenities including a
Computer which you rarely find in a more expensive hotel.
The staff (all of them) couldn't do enough for you, always smiling
and would go out of their way to assist you with anything.
Definitely recommend!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel is in a good location, it's in an area with plenty of restaurants and bars and the staff are happy to recommend places.Rooms are very nice and comfortable and we slept well.

Staff were amazing here. I stayed in 7 hotels during my stay in the various parts of Vietnam and the service here was the best that I experienced. The receptionist greeted me personally when I arrived and she remembered myself and my partners name during the stay which was a lovely personal touch. The staff in reception and at breakfast were so friendly even when you just passed through to go to your room.

I highly recommend booking a tour to go to the tombs and pagodas because they are very far away from the centre of Hue and it would take forever to get between them by taxi. The receptionist organised us a driver for the morning and a boat trip to the other sites and it allowed us to see everything.
h_title_comment: Comfortable stay in a hotel with great staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for 2 night in Hue at this hotel. The city was much busier than we expected. Thanks to this hotel, which is located in a fairly central area, we were able to relax here and enjoyed the trip. There were many night clubs nearby but we didn't hear any disturbing sound at night. The staff were helpful and thanks to them we could hire a car to visit the tombs and enjoyed the boat ride to the buddhist temple. Breakfast was generous and the kids liked it. The computer in the room was also very useful. I would stay here again if I go to Hue next time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: A super hotel! Very friendly staff! Very helpfull! We wanted to rent motorbikes and they gave a correct price! Nice room and good breakfast. They also let us shower after checking out before taking the night train. This was very nice!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A group of friends gathered for 9 amazing days in VN, we booked 7 rooms six months in advance directly with the hotel. The staffs were very prompt and courstesy responding to all our inquiries. We were all agreed that Hue Serene was our #1 choice hotel compared to other hotels we had stayed during the entire trip. From a scale from 1 - 10, we would give it a 12 for the following reasons: The services from all the staffs (reception, breakfast staff, bellhop...) were excellent; the rooms were spacious, new and clean; the location was great with walking distance to many great restaurants, shops. When we first arrived, we were surprised that it located in the alley compared to the main street like many hotels we stayed. However, we later learned that this was the best location because it was quiet, we did not have to counter the noise, people selling on the street, and the area in this alley was nice as well. Just an example to a personal touch from the staff. We were there during Lent week and our tour scheduled to depart Hue to Hoi An at 9:30 am on a Palm Sunday. The night before, we searched the web for next morning early mass. We were just sitting at the reception area discussing about the alternative and mentioned that the website did not list all the mass schedules. One of the bellhop person rode his bike to the church and inquired about the time. Thus, some of us were able to attend the 6am mass and made it in time for the 9:30 am departure.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We were picked up from the airport and headed to the hotel. We were driven down a narrow bumpy street and thought surely this can't be the right place. All of a sudden we were outside the hotel and were impressed by the look of it.

We went to check-in but were taken to a table and offered drinks, towels and fruit first. Once the check-in process was finished we went to our room. We are a family of 5 - with 2 teenagers and a toddler. We opened up the door and found 2 double beds and 1 single. It was nicely set out and really clean. However we asked if there was another room available on the same floor to separate some of us. And there was and they gave it to us at a great rate.
