Our stay here was very comfortable, the location of the hotel is wonderful within walking distance to restaurants and shops. The staff are just wonderful (in all honesty we have found this throughout Vietnam).

We loved our stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This boutique hotel tucked away down a lane way is a hidden gem in Hue. We were welcomed with cold towels and cool drinks. This almost new hotel offers large comfortable rooms with a desk and computer, large balconies over looking the city (on the higher floors) and great bathrooms. The real asset to this hotel are the staff. Very friendly and welcoming with good English skills. Laura on front desk was great, helping us make our plans to enjoy the city. They are among the best trained staff I have encountered in 6 weeks of travel in Vietnam. All this for around $50 per night. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Nothing could have been smoother or more pleasant than our stay in this delightful little hotel. Our pick-up and check-in were seamless and the connecting rooms we had booked were extremely clean, spacious and comfortable with every facility we needed including safe, fridge and wi-fi. The staff were uniformly attentive and cheerful and made it extremely easy to organise tours of the area and a transfer to Hoi An. Consequently, we were able to see an array of things in and around Hue all of which were very interesting. The hotel is very well situated, down a quiet lane but within easy walking distance of restaurants and the river, and the staff really do go the extra distance to provide a fantastic experience for their guests. Online contact for booking through the hotel itself was most efficient and very well priced.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Another example of the excellent standard of service we came to expect in Vietnam! Reception staff are endlessly willing to help. Room was light and airy with massive bed, large bathroom and computer in the room. Would take 30 mins + to walk to imperial city, so we hired bikes ($1 a day) and really enjoyed the freedom and very welcome breeze they gave us.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Fantastic hotel with clean spacious rooms and bathroom and then all the extra home comforts like: desk/computer in your room, wireless wifi throughout building, big screen tv and plenty of complimentary fruit everyday. Julia, Julia and all the other staff we met, thank you for such a nice stay.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Airport pick up went smoothly, all staff very helpful and lovely, breakfast adequate, staff arranged a driver for the morning to take us to the tourist attractions as we only had the morning for sight seeing before our plane departured. Hotel lovely but found Hue the least favourite place we have visited so far.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We were travelling to Hue from ha noi on the overnight sleeper bus which was a first for us.The hotel was to pick us up at the bus station at 8am but the bus was way late,almost noon and we had no way to contact them of the delay. Upon arrival a call to them resulted in a quick pick up and were told they were there waiting most of the morning. Upon arrival at the hotel neatly situated on a narrow street a refreshing cool wet towel and drinks were provided to us and a very big welcome smile from the very tentative staff who all introduced themselves. Checking in was very efficient and soon we were in the honeymoon suite we had booked...fantastic large size room with a king sized bed upon which there were fresh flowers, a bottle of wine and a fresh cake...it was not our honeymoon but we just wanted to book that type of room.

The room and bathroom with a big walk in shower had everything...bathrobes, slippers,all toiletry items including tooth brush and paste, fresh fruit every day and bottled water ....a large sized balcony overlooking the street below and the city.

The hotel is perfectly situated with an easy walk to the river and many restaurants . Bikes are available to rent and we took full advantage during our stay to explore the city and surrounding area.

Breakfast was off the menue both American and local served with friendly and tentative staff who always remembered our names.In fact all of the staff did so.

The unique thing about the staff is that they all had English names so that it was easy for tourists like me to remember ....A special tank you to Emily who arranged chicken soup for me as I got sick within hours of getting there. That did the trick as I was ready to go the next day.

The hotel is beautifull as is the staff, friendly,helpfull,happy,tentative to your needs ...anyone travelling to Hue should experience this excellent hotel and staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This boutique hotel offered great value for money in a good location. The room was well designed, comfortable and clean with a desk and computer, which I found very useful as I had a fair bit of admin to deal with. The staff were very polite and eager to please, and I feel bad saying this as they were so nice, but could do with adopting a more laid back and relaxed approach to their service as they really are doing a good job and don't need to fuss over us guests as much! I left feeling well rested and fed as they proactively encourage you to order as much breakfast as you like, which I've experienced a few times in Vietnam now.
h_title_comment: Lovely hotel with eager to please staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very warm and helpful staff, offering great service e.g. for tours around Hue. Rooms are nice and clean, although the bed was quite hard. Breakfast is very good, offering lots of choice. And we even were invited by kind staffmembers Lucy and Ivy, and tje kitchencrew to taste and comment on dishes they plan to serve for dinner in their restaurant in the near future.

Would definitely go again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel seems to have a good thing going for it. The staff here is excellent. And I liked the way they even memorised my name the first day I was there. I stayed there two nights and really enjoyed my stay here. Great value for your money, and service beyond what you get many other places. Thanks for a great stay!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed for 4 or 5 nights. All the staff, the doormen, the reception, and especially Ivy, Lucy, Sabrina, Laura ....I've missed someone....?? but they were all delightful, interested in our day, offered advice, gave insights into their lifestyle, which always makes the holiday more interesting. And they even remembered that my husband wanted to eat two bowls of pho! BTW the breakfast pho was one of the best pho we had in our holiday. The room was not the deluxe one, but we enjoyed it. Great price, around $38, comfy bed, stylish, big bathroom, clean, workable safe and cheap laundry at $2 kg. What a great happy hotel. Thankyou! Best staff from all the hotels that we visited in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
It's probably all been said before, but this is an excellent hotel. We had a family room with 3 beds so it was a little cramped, but the room was fantastic. Our children didn't want to leave. Having a PC in the room for our use was a major plus, and the bathroom was great, including towelling dressing gowns with SERENE PALACE on the back for those of us who wanted to pretend to be boxers entering the ring.
Breakfast was included and was so good... Order whatever you want!
And the staff... You get used to friendly and efficient service in Vietnam but the staff here go one step further. It was almost eerie how pleasant and friendly everyone was, like something out of Dr Who, where the super nice humans turn out to be a flesh-eating race of extra-terrestrials. Anyhow, if this is the case we didn't stay long enough to see them revert, and only saw the very best and friendliest behaviour.
One comment: we pre-booked a city tour for $55 and thought it would be a guided tour, but the driver only spoke about 3 words of English (3 more than we knew in Vietnamese) and if we hadn't happened to have brought our guide book it would have been a pretty frustrating day. I was going to mention it to the hotel staff, but despite knowing so little English the driver still managed to entertain us, so I didn't.
h_title_comment: Staff so nice - even by Vietnamese standards!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Warm and friendly staff who went out of there way to make our stay wonderful. We arrived after travelling for 24 hours to get there, looking a little bedraggled. Although our room was not ready (as we were very early), they let us shower in a vacated room which was very much appreciated and managed to check us in much earlier than expected. All recommendations they gave us for restaurants were great. Rooms large and airy, clean and fresh. Fabulous breakfast too. Just wish we had time to stay longer!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
The staff here are exemplary (Julia, Jenny, Ivy and so many others I am sorry I forgot their names!)– so helpful and welcoming (a nice cool drink on arrival). Providing advise, map, and arranging bikes for riding out along the river.
The best room service: tea, juice anytime, ice etc.
Rooms here are well appointed, nice décor, and a nice size. Even a small balcony and a computer in the room! Breakfast (good with Viet and western choices ) is served in a nicely lit room off the lobby.
They had us greeted at the train station for a taxi to the hotel and also suggested and arranged a driver from Hue to Hoi An, and to stop to see China Beach, Lang Co Beach, the Pass, Marble Mt area etc. ($65.)
h_title_comment: Helpful & welcoming staff, nicely sized and appointed rooms
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed in April and had a wonderful time. The staff went out of their way to be so helpful,
they seemed to really want us to have the best time possible. It was festival time when we were there, and as there was a bit of a delay getting a taxi for us to go to the Perfumed river, the receptionist and another member of staff took us on the back of their own scooters down to the boat so we weren't kept waiting. The breakfasts were lovely with plenty of food although you had to order from a menu, as there was only fruit and juices laid out, but you could order as much as you liked. The staff helped us with our sightseeing in Hue, and organised a car for us to travel on to Hoi An. Unfortunately we left our lap top in our room on the last day, but even that wasn't a problem for these kind staff, they phoned our driver whilst we were travelling down to Hoi An to tell us they had found it, and arranged for it to be delivered to our hotel in Hoi An the following afternoon at no cost to us! They certainly went the extra mile and I would certainly recommend
this hotel to anyone staying in Hue, I would like to think we will be back one day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace is the best hotel in our trip: Big room, very clean, fresh smell and quite new and lovely service. The best things of Serene is their staff, Mary and her team were so helpful when they gave the map for me, recommended restaurant, local food, explain about Vietnamese history... (They know everything you need). The girls in restaurant was so friendly, thanks to Sammy, Sabrina, Lucy and Ivy who took care me every morning. Love all of you! I make sure that I will come back to visit you next time.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The hotel seems to be lost down a semi sealed road but upon arrival you will be well pleased. Courteous arrival and nice lobby leading to restaurant at back. Staff are very attentive and the room we had was a pleasant surprise. It is unbelievable value for money and our room was in western terms a suite. The staff gave helpful advice for sightseeing and places to eat. All recommendations were spot on. Hue is to me a walking city to get around and the Serene Palace is close enough for easy access. Great rooms, good breakfast- the staff encourage gluttony and very clean. Worthwhile for all travelling types.
h_title_comment: great room with balcony overlooking the city
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Truly a serene palace! We are very enthusiastic about this place and its staff. Clean rooms, good shower. The staff was very helpful and super friend with our kid. Would go here again when visiting Hue.
h_title_comment: Very friendly, great value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed here in April and we had a great time. Our room was upgraded to a triple and we had a balcony to the front of the building. The room was huge. The hotel staff try very hard to make your stay comfortable. They go out of the way to make sure you have a a good time in Hue. We got both a scooter and a car hire from Hue to Hoi An for our stay which they organized. It was no problem for the. The room came with tea, coffee and water which was great. A huge selection of channels on the TV. And at night it was quite as it was no located on the main strip but very easy to walk around where you wanted to (in the tourist area). The attractions are further but all the hotels are on the opposes the Hue palace.

Would recommend again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I booked this hotel based on reviews on TA and was surprised how good it was for price we paid per night. The room was spacious and clean and nicely decorated. Wifi was excellent. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fantastic with the best Pho Bo we had the whole time we were in Vietnam (and I ate it nearly every day).
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for a night and couldn't be happier. The staff is incredibly friendly. Breakfast was great, the rooms were very well appointed, and the location was perfect for walking to explore the citadel. Couldn't be happier.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Arriving via a little alley we did question where we were, however the moment the staff greeted us they could not have been more friendly or helpful. The Hotel is clean the beds are comfy and it is situated in the perfect area to discover the city. The staff gave great suggestions on where to go and what to do. Assisted in tour bookings. Would stay there again anytime. Brilliant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We chose this hotel as it is a sister hotel to Charming 2 in Hanoi. It is fairly new and our lovely room was on the top floor with a balcony and city view. While it did not mirror the genuine warmth and welcome of the Charming 2, this hotel was really very good, with helpful and friendly staff and a lovely breakfast each morning. It is excellent value for money and in a quiet and central location for restaurants and local sites. On first appearances, the hotel does not seem in the most glamorous location, but it really is quiet and close to everything you need. The only downside for us was the bathroom - it was very new and clean, however, the shower was not fixed to the wall but among the bath taps - this made hair washing a chore! That said, we've experienced a lot worse in our travels!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at the Hue Serene Hotel for 2 nights. The staff are very helpful and cannot do enough for you, especially Jenny and Ken on reception. The location of the hotel is OK with about a 10 minute walk to some good restaurants. We were up on the top floor (7th floor) and couldn't hear the traffic noise or noise from any of the neighbouring rooms. The bed was probably the least comfortable out of the 5 hotels we stayed in during our Vietnam trip - very hard!

The hotel helped us organise a car and driver to take us to the royal tombs and pagoda and we had a very good, safe driver with a very comfortable car.

Wifi was ok - for some reason we couldn't connect to the router on the 7th floor so connecting to the 6th floor made it a little slow but still useable. There is a computer in the room which is handy for those who haven't brought their own tablet/laptop.

Breakfast was limited - there was a fruit buffet, and then you could order off the menu. Service was good, we were offered tea/coffee straight away and when we got up to leave they checked to see if we wanted anything else as we hadn't eaten a lot.

The hotel sells itself as a 'brand new hotel that features luxurious rooms and suites' - the reason that I am not giving the hotel 5 stars is because I would not describe the hotel as luxurious - for example there are a few things that gave our room a scruffy appearance such as the plug socket hanging out of the wall in our bathroom, only having a net curtain cover half of the window and only one bedside lamp that was glued to the bedside table! These things can easily be fixed and would give a much better impression.

Therefore, if getting a good price is important then this is the hotel for you as there is no denying it is good value for money. However, if you are looking for luxury I would suggest you look elsewhere.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here 2 nights. I was really impressed by the staff, who were all very friendly, knowledgeable and smiley. The taxi driver who sent us to Hue tried to charge us more than agreed and the staff pro-actively stepped in to negotiate on our behalf. They (Mary) subsequently helped us with travel tips and onward transport arrangements (within Hue and from Hue to Hoi An). This is the place to come to if, like us, you haven't had much time to plan your trip to central Vietnam.

Hotel itself is great: new clean rooms, great location, wifi all around. Look out for their new restaurant (opening next week) - we just did complimentary food-tasting for them :-)
h_title_comment: Highly recommended - new hotel in convenient location and the staff are great
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Incredible value !
Staff is service minded, helpful and very friendly
Quiet , but good and central location.
Breakfast very good
Will definitely stay there again if I go back.
Highly recommended.
Don't miss Hue on your Vietnam visit !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
From the moment we arrived we were well taken care of here. The staff were very helpful in arranging a car to pick us up from the airport beforehand and then having our room ready when we arrived (despite being 9am!)
The room was of good size with a big bathroom. The bed was large & comfortable & there was a PC in the room too.
Breakfast had a good selection of fruit, eggs & pancakes.
The hotel is on a side road, which is good as means its relatively quiet. Its also easy walking distance to most restaurants, the market & citadel (20mins walk)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We enjoyed our 2 night stay here very much. The rooms are clean, comfortable and stylish with computers, and the location is quiet and convenient. The staff are friendly,helpful and welcoming, and laundry service is quick and inexpensive. Breakfast is really good, a combination of buffet and made to order, with many items to choose from. We highly recommend this place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Amazing value and very helpful staff. We arranged an airport pick up through the hotel and a car transfer to Hoi An, as well as a river cruise/tour.
Stayed in a deluxe room which was spotless and comfortable, this hotel is a gem.
Wifi worked flawlessly, the real stars are the staff, who are super helpful.
Would certainly stay here again if visiting Hue, which is a place well worth visiting.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: In a small lane just round from the main action on Le Loi. Julia and her team made us feel very welcome. A short stroll to the river or a short taxi ride to the Citadel. Nice rooms. Up high is good. Great value. But just make sure you check where you are when you exit the lane. After a while they all begin to look the same. Would definitely stay here again. Nice breakfast but no dinner available, but lots of nearby restaurants to choose from.
h_title_comment: Close to most things, but in a quiet lane
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel for a week. From the moment we stepped into the hotel until we left, the service was impeccable. Each of the staff members is committed to providing a top notch experience for the guests. We really enjoyed the room and the service here. Every one went out their way to help us book a trip to visit the citadel, and recommendations for good places to visit, as well as places to try out the local cuisine. The rooms at this hotel are spacious, clean, and modern. And we had a nice view from the window. The breakfast was also lovely, as it was comprised of a sampling of fresh fruits, coffee, tea, and a variety of other menu items. We highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
If you are sensitive to musty smells, be sure to book only the Deluxe Superior front rooms facing the street in the full sunshine and doors that can open to fresh air at night if necessary. The staff were concerned about my health and tried to be helpful, however the Hotel ứa booked out. Fortunately I ứa able to change rốoms with our other family members.
Otherwise the rooms were clean and refreshed every day, computer and free wifi iin rooms, large tiled bathrooms, fantastic breakfast included, and the Staff caring and amazing.
It ứa actually me who ứa the problem :)
We were greeted with cold fresh fruit juice and delightful fresh fruit and really did enjoy the whole experience. They were able to book day tours, cabs and looked after our every need. Thểre is a safe in the room and TV is in English.
h_title_comment: Value for money, however if you suffer from sinusitis or asthma....
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were three couples who spent 2 nights in Serene Palace in Hue. What a great experience. The rooms are modern and comfortable with good air conditioning. The hotel is off of a main road so very quiet. It is a quick walk to many of the bars and restaurants. The breakfast (included) but huge and delicious. The service is second to none and they went out of their way to be accommodating.

Do be careful about booking transport through them. We wanted a driver from Hue to HoiAn which we got but he also wanted to make it into a kind of tour and we ended up having to stop at places we weren't interested in. This is not what we agreed with the hotel. But otherwise a great experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Very well priced. Good location close to the river & town. Room was fantastic - clean, super hot shower with great water pressure. Comfortable bed. Staff were very, very helpful in arranging tours, transfers & providing advice. Special mention to See who is a superstar & Nin (Mr. Dung) who drove us from Hue to Hoi An over the Hai Van Pass which was spectacular. He stopped at all of the scenic spots so we could take photos & we actually felt safe with his driving on some very dangerous roads (which isn't a given in Vietnam!)
The tour that See arranged up the Perfume River on a private boat to see the Pagoda & Citadel was one of the highlights of our trip. For $10 each ($20 for my brother & I). Wow.
h_title_comment: Best Hotel we stayed at in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Lovely welcome by the Team here and they continued to look after us well. Big, clean family room. Breakfast service was very attentive, even gave us breakfast as we arrived off the train at 8:30 am. Good location for restaurants. Just book it, it's great value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Beautiful place with wonderful staff
We had such lovely stay .Our Room got a very big and comfy made us felt like our home is here. Hotel location is ideal and very easy to get around . Hotel staffs were very helpful, which made our stay even more pleasant. Overall, Hotel and the staffs had given us an excellent experience and we will definitely be coming back again!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: A comfortable, spacious room with a large (although not very soft) bed, in-room safe, TV/computer with free Internet access, very clean. A decent breakfast (not spectacular) in the breakfast room adjacent to the lobby, which was spacious but a bit drafty (it was cold and rainy weather during our stay) and definitely not cozy. The hotel is located in a narrow side street (barely wide enough for a car at some spots) in a real neighborhood, about 5-10 min walk to the restaurant/shop area. As others said, do remember how to get back, but it's worth it, it gives you a feel how people really live there. The citadel is a longer walk (we were told about 30 min) but it does no matter since most tombs are too far to walk anyhow so you take a tour. the staff were absolute tops, very friendly and nothing was too much for them. We commented on the hardness of the bed and within 10 minutes, a maid re-made the bed with an additional layer of comforters. We came back cold and wet from a tour and asked for ginger tea, it was delivered to our room before we had time to change. Jenny was the best - thank you! If you book a transfer to Hoi An, remember to leave early, 10am at the latest, to make it through the pass before the clouds pull in and the heavy truck traffic becomes horrendous.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at their sister hotel in hanoi and loved it so we allowed them to book the serene palace for us. Due to the festival, we had booked the family room for one night and the superior room the second. They were so worried about the three of us being uncomfortable the second night that they moved us to the Midtown hotel the second night so we would be more comfortable. The staff are seriously the sweetest people and always looking to please you.
The one night we were there, we had a perfect night of sleep. Quiet rooms that were large and spacious. The beds were super comfortable and not as hard as a rock like most of the beds.
The breakfast is a buffet/made to order food that was delicious.

If I had one complaint, the shower drain is slow so we got the bathroom floor kind of wet. Seems to be pretty typical for many if the hotels we have stayed at. Nothing that would keep me away if I wanted a good nights sleep with awesome staff.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Ok, I said this before to my friends: this hotel is great! I traveled a lot through Vietnam, from Hanoi, to Cat Ba and Ha Long Bay, until I reached Hue. So I have plenty of experience with hotels and the service in Vietnam.
Generally people will be nice in Vietnam, at Serene Palace they are 10x nicer! What stroke me is that from the moment I arrived everyone seemed genuinely happy to see me. No fake smiles and they were extremely helpful. The staff will ask you to sit down while they make sure your room is ready and serve you a delicious fruit juice (nothing like I had before). You'll need that coming from 30-35 degrees Celcius. Even more someone will join you and answer all of your questions concerning the city and available tours.
They provide you with a city map and around Hue map, while even recommending vegetarian or massage places to go. If you get to this hotel ask for Julia, she is just divine! This girl will make sure you are 100% ready to venture out with everything you need. If you ask me she takes the hospitality service to a whole new level. There was nothing that she didn't know and they even rented us bikes.
I really enjoyed my stay and feel sorry I was in a hurry and spent just one night. Don't forget to visit the tombs if you're visiting Hue. Rent some bikes, get a map and your gps and you're set.
The city is extremely easy to get around.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: My family and I were extremely happy south this choice. The staff were exceptionally friendly, remembering you by name and the things you see interested in doing while in Hue. We were even given a friendly reminder call when they thought it necessary for us to leave for a show at the Hue Festival. Rooms were spotlessly clean.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
A bit off the beaten track but well worth the 5 minute walk to the backpacker block and tourist hotels. Make sure you remember how to get back, pick store names or signs to help get back when the power goes out.
This made Hue a better 3 days as we didn't find it a very exciting stop in Vietnam.
A la carte breakfast was great. Room big and clean. Staff super friendly.
h_title_comment: Lovely surprise includes great service, breakfast and friendly staff.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Hue is a great city to spend a couple of days in while traveling through Vietnam. Was there for two nights and stayed at the Serene Palace. I wholeheartedly agree with the other reviewers regarding cleanliness, extra friendly staff, and great value for your money. It is located down a really narrow alleyway which can provide challenges for some vehicles to get through. No big deal but we had to walk to our tour bus one morning since it could not pass.

Location was also located near walkable restaurants, shops and cafes.

Some tips:
1. Bring earplugs because you just might hear a rooster very early in the morning. You will find this more common than not when touring Vietnam.
2. Breakfast is included! Nice selection to choose from which can include your typical egg platter with meat and toast, or you can opt for more Vietnamese inspired dishes like pho.
3. Nice amenities like a flat screen tv, free Wifi and work station with computers!
4. I found that I didn't need to buy an electric adapter for my devices. My chargers fit fine in the outlets. So don't spend extra money on adapter plugs!
5. Make sure you check out the Imperial City where the emperor ruled back in the day. Very massive and can take hours. Bring hats or umbrellas since walking in the heat can be overpowering.
6. The "Perfume River" is also a nice excursion to check out with it's beautiful flowing river with a scenic backdrop of mountains.

If ever in Hue again. I will definitely stay here again. You will be guaranteed to feel welcomed and safe!
h_title_comment: Great Boutique Hotel in Hue, Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and could not fault it. The staff were delightful and the room was good in every way. I have had better breakfasts in Vietnam but it was still pretty good. This is an excellent hotel.
h_title_comment: Great service and very nice rooms
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We recently stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel and found it to be excellent value for money!
Location wise, it was a little difficult to find, but it is still a good location, easy walking distance to restaurants.
The room is excellent, with great amenities. We had two double beds so enjoyed the luxury of a big bed each! The quality of the room is very much what you'd find in a western style hotel, but at a tenth of the price you'd expect to pay for that type of room.
We personally found the staff a little over the top. Service in hotels in Vietnam is really quite exceptional and this is no exception, however, I really felt almost interrogated when we got back after a long day out. I know they are just doing their job and trying to be friendly, but for me, I prefer a I nice hello, I don't feel like having to explain everything I've done in the day. And on checking out, I'm not sure how many times I had to be asked if I enjoyed my stay or did I enjoy the breakfast!
And about the breakfast, seriously, it was beyond average. The cold toast and my fruit drink with grass in it!! The standard really needs to be lifted!
But again, having said that, the price we paid is reflected in the room alone, I guess breakfast is just a bonus! Personally I'd eat out if I were to stay there again.
I do recommend this hotel, you really can't go wrong for value! Just be prepared for overly friendly staff, if you're an introvert you may find this a little annoying!
h_title_comment: Great value, service over the top!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here two nights in March 2014 and can't say enough good things about this hotel. Staff is incredible, they go way out of their way to help you enjoy your stay. Location is perfect, close to restaurants and good street food, but it's far enough off the main tourist streets to ensure some quiet at night. Rooms are spotless, probably one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in April 2014. Rooms are large and clean. Staff are friendly and helpful with any enquiries. Hotel in quiet area a couple of minutes walk from river and restaurant area. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Hue.
h_title_comment: Great Hotel at a great price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: From the moment we contacted this hotel online the service and responsivenes was absolutley fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble.We stayed in the Serene Palace Hotel for two separate nights and were warmly welcomed on both occasions. The rooms were lovely and we received an upgrade on both nights. The staff at the front desk were knowledgeable and on each occasion we received fantastic recommendations for restaurants to try, one being a mid-range restaurant featuring Vietnamese food and some western choices and the other being for a more local restaurant. All front of house staff speak great English and we had excellent correspondence with the hotel in writing who helped to organise a variety of transfers for us. I highly recommend Hue Serene Palace.
h_title_comment: We loved this hotel - the staff are fantastic.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: When we arrived, we were welcomed like royalty. A platter of fruits and drinks were immediately served to us. This hotel is in the same group as Charming Hotel, where we stayed in Hanoi. It shows because they have the same top notch service, very friendly, very attentive to our every need. Our room was huge, clean and brand spanking new. Everything in the hotel is what I'd expect in a four star hotel without having to pay the price. The breakfast is bountiful and delicious. Also, the hotel is in a quiet area but still very close to all the attractions. When in Hue again, we would definitely stay here!
h_title_comment: Beautiful brand new hotel at a great price!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We really enjoy our stay in this extraordinary Hotel. The staff was really increible, very nice persons, that help us in everything we need.
The breakfast was delicious, we really enjoy it. A lot of delicious food.
The hotel has an excellent location. The Hotel is very clean.
We were really happy in this hotel, all is extraordinary, but believe me, the most extraordinary of this hotel is his nice staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We enjoyed our stay here. The staff were great, from the moment of welcoming us at the time of check-in till we left. Well located, peaceful and tranquil street, yet just a few minutes of walk from the hustle bustle of Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel is tucked away in a quiet side street away from the main hubbub of traffic. We stayed in one of the rooms with a city view. Though we only stayed a couple of nights and spent little time in the hotel it was a nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. They arranged for a private car to take us around the sights in the local area as we only had a short time in Hue. The thing to note is that the driver is not a guide and simply takes you to the sights. He did take us to a local place to eat that was incredible. The hotel was close to the local restaurants but is quite a walk from the citadel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They did everything to accommodate our needs and tend to our comfort. When in Hue we would without any doubt stay at the Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very friendly and attentive. They provided a nice welcome drink of juice. Breakfasts were good and there were lots of staff there to make sure that you had everything you needed. The hotel is well located for visiting the town and for walking down to the river.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel for a few days at the end of March. From the moment I stepped into the hotel to the moment I left, the service was impeccable. Each of the staff members is committed to providing a top notch experience for guests. Minh was especially helpful. I was able to organize trips through the hotel, as well as get some great recommendations for restaurants and places to visit. The breakfast that was included was also quite lovely, as it was comprised of a sampling of fresh fruits, coffee or tea, and a variety of other menu items. The rooms at this hotel are also quite nice. They are spacious, clean, and modern. I can't say enough good things about this place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Our 4 night stay at Hue Serene Palace was incredible and we could not have asked for more.
The arranged pick up from the airport was seamless and we were welcomed, checked in and briefed regarding the hotel, services and tours with complimentary fruit and juice.
The room was spacious, large, beautifully appointed and modern. Yes the hotel is down a small lane but that was not an issue at all.
Breakfast was terrific and all cooked to order, fantastic pancakes served with a smile and a chat by the lovely girls.
What makes this hotel exceptional is the staff. Everyone we came in contact with went to great lengths to be welcoming and make our stay as good as it could be. This includes the bell boys, reception staff, housekeeping and the girls serving breakfast. All amazing!!
We were provided a great map of the local area and could easily walk to sights of interest.
We also booked the day tour to the tombs and a transfer to Hoi An via the hotel and all went well.
Book this hotel and you will not regret it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was booked for me while staying et the Holiday Diamond hotel in Hanoi - they also booked the train for me. After travelling overnight in a soft seat in the train which was late I was met at the station and taken to the hotel which was a very welcome relief. Fresh fruit, water and a really lovely well furnished room - the best I had in Vietnam. Down a little side street but not far from anything. I also booked a tour with them but it's easy enough to walk to the Imperial Palace on your own and potter around but take a picnic as there's not much on site but it's an extremely relaxing place to spend a few hours. They also booked me on the open bus to Hoi An. And they phoned from Hanoi to see whether I had arrived safely. After two nights stay I wanted longer but the hotel was full so they booked me in across the road. The staff at this group of hotels really look after you very nicely.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The hotel was the best we stayed at during our two week trip. Our room was clean, well-maintained and well-equipped. We even had our own computer. Location is quiet. The breakfast is excellent. The service was just right for us. Welcoming drink and fruit, and staff who greet you by name and do not push tour services. Would definitely stay again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
A spacious hotel with big bedrooms and complimentary toiletries, fruit and water bottles in your bedroom.
This hotel is new and aims to please. This it does with outstanding results. The staff are all very professional and nothing is too much trouble. We asked about flights and they came back with a choice of times and prices. We booked our flights back from Danang to Ho Chi Minh City with the hotel
The breakfast is of good quality and has a varied choice.
Reception staff were full of tips on our city tour of the emperors tombs etc.
We booked our onward journey of a car and driver to take us to Ho an and making stops on the way to Champ Museum, beach, Marble Mountains and finally Ho an. This was slightly more expensive then booking outside but the driver was good although his English was limited.
Thank you for making our stay so good and comfortable with outstanding service from all the staff.
h_title_comment: New and lovely hotel in a good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: After staying in the Hanoi Serene Hotel, we arrived in Hue and realised this hotel is part of the same group! Once again, excellent service- some of the best in Vietnam.... Warm and friendly staff and nothing is too much to ask. Room was clean and a good size with air con etc, breakfast good varied choice. Would definitely stay again if returned to Hue!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The staff were so welcoming and friendly. We received a welcome drink and fruit platter like 5 star guests. Breakfast was amazing with Western and Vietnemese choices. Location of hotel was great, near a lot of great places to eat and shop and a nice walk away from the Citadel.

Tour choices and information provided by the hotel was excellent and their city map was the best one I have ever seen!
h_title_comment: PERFECT - 5 Star service at excellent value
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
we just staied 3 nights at the serene palace in hue city.

it was the best hotel during our travel through vietnam.
clean rooms, friendly staff and good price.
we travelled from saigon in the south and end up in hanoi, the north of vietnam...

luckily we stopped over in hue, the beautiful central of vietnam, the lovely hotel "serene palace"!!

from the check-in we felt like king and queen in the hotel, the staff was
so nice to us. at the reception they informed us about everything we can do
in hue, what we should see and made us love the vietnamese...

so we came to the imperial city, visit the tien mu pagoda, some tombs and the citadel.

thanks to one of the receptionist "miss si", which took care of our desires...
we saw everything we intent to see in hue (known from the travel books).

she was really helpfull to arrange our short time in the lovely city of hue, thanks again for that!

thanx also to the lovely team from the restaurant / kitchen, we loved the food and service you offered to us...

greetings from swiss
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: I stayed at the Serene Palace Hotel for 4 nights and I thought that it was a great hotel. I had a lovely quiet room with a big comfortable bed, flat screen TV, my own computer ( a first ! ) and a spotless bathroom with plenty of hot water. All the staff in the breakfast restaurant and the front desk spoke good English and everyone was friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The hotel is located down a quiet narrow street a few minutes walk from Le Loi but I had no problem finding it at night. The next time I visit Hue I will stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We booked an Exec Double and it was a lovely large room with a very comfy bed. Reasonable wifi and the TV had a good number of English speaking channels & good film channels etc. Bathroom was okay too. Check in was swift and staff very friendly. The girls at breakfast (especially Lucy) were all super friendly chatting to us, whilst bringing the breakfast food to us. Breakfast is okay with a limited choice of foods / fruits / juices / breads etc. Locationally, the hotel is down a narrow lane which you may struggle to find yourself. However, our taxi driver knew where it was without an issue. It's within an easy walk to the main tourist bars / restaurants and we also walked to the Citadel (25 mins). We wanted to get the train down to Da Nang so we walked to the station to get tickets (30 mins) - its an easy straight road. Overall, nice hotel.

Talking about our train journey, we mentioned to reception that we were thinking of going to Da Nang (Hoi An) by train and could they help us get tickets. From which, we were told that the hotel could sort out a car for us for a similar price. When we asked for clarification on the price of the car, we were told it was $65. We then said that the train was only $8 and that it wasn't a similar price do we declined the car option. Feeling a bit miffed at us not wanting to take the car, the girl behind reception (Si) bluntly told that if we wanted to go by train, we would have to go to the station and sort the tickets out ourselves (which we did). We just felt that Si was pretty sharp with us as we didn't want to book the hotels car option.

Apart from that incident, it's a nice, clean hotel and the staff are great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here with our 2 kids for one night. It is a wonderful hotel with a full breakfast. The service is great. They even offered to go get Bun Bo Hue for us for breakfast. Close to the citadel and the river. The rooms are clean and nice. We are sad we don't have more time to sirens in Hue. Would stay here again!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This is a lovely place was very clean with fantastic, friendly staff and comfy beds. We had a lovely balcony as well! As mentioned by others, it's down a very small street (more like an alley), but once you're there, it's in a great spot to explore and very close to the river. Breakie was very nice too; all inclusive, but rather than serving yourself, the servers come take your order then deliver your food. VERY good value for your money. Would definitely stay there again if in Hue!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Best customer service we had in a month long trip throughout Vietnam. The location is slightly difficult to find, down a little side street, however from the moment you walk through the doors you will be treated with a level of customer focus that would shame many 5 star hotels.

Room was perfect, spotless and very tidy. The breakfast was excellent with many of the items cooked fresh from the menu.

Can't fault this place. Enjoy.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel is good, staff is very warm and helpful. Only caveat is that the hotel is located in a not very nice street, not easily accessible. But for the price you pay I believe it is quite convenient.

But the rest was quite good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
my wife and i had the great pleasure of staying at the Serene Palace Hotel for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. the hotel is only 7 months old, the rooms are spacious, spotlessly clean and complete with your own personal computer.
the breakfast is outstanding with Asian and Western food, yoghurt, 7 kinds of fresh fruit, any type eggs and true vietnamese coffee with condensed milk (try it, it is strong and beautiful).

but the hotel's greatest asset are the staff. they are courteous, try to remember all the guests names and greet you by name when you arrive for breakfast, get out of the lift or get back to the hotel.

the hotel is situated close to restaurants and entertainment, it is in a narrow street off the main road, which makes it quite.

this hotel group has another few hotels in Hannoi and i am sorry i had made previous bookings for Hanoi because i would have loved to stay in one of their Hanoi hotels.
speaking to other travellers who had stayed in Hanoi, they said it was fantastic (i think the names in Hanoi were Serene Hotel-Hanoi and Hanoi Charming Hotel 1 and 2 and Hanoi Holiday Diamond Hotel)

early reservations are necessary because they are often booked out.

thank you "all the pretty girls" in the restaurant (i could not remember all their names and just called them pretty girls and that got me out of an embarrassing situation) for looking after us and making our stay in Hue a memorable one.

hope to see you all again next year.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Great little hotel hidden down a back street at the end of Le Loi street. Spotlessly clean and really quiet. Lovely staff and great food. Most amazing bakers at the end of the street too, so keep an eye out.
Two streets away from Backpackers Hostel which is a must drop in for any English speaking travellers as trips great value and food good there too
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I found the Hue Serene Palace to be a pretty great hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff. The rooms were very spacious, new looking, and comfortable. The bathrooms came with an actual bathtub, which I found pretty rare in my Vietnam travels. There was even a computer in the room itself for easier internet access.

The breakfast was very good. The staff were incredibly friendly. The only downside is that it's a bit hard to find at first. All in all, I would highly recommend the Hue Serene Palace hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I have travelled extensively and stayed in many hotels from one to five star. I do not think that I have stayed in a hotel anywhere with nicer staff or a more pleasant atmosphere. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. the breakfast is varied and well presented. The staff are very friendly, very helpful, and very efficient. they make you feel like part of a happy family. We stayed for four nights and did not want to leave.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for one night at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel, very spacious room, light and bright and very comfortable, with a good size balcony. The hotel is down a little lane so is really nice and quiet. Staff were lovely, friendly and very helpful and breakfast good with nice fresh juices.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Arriving at the Serene Palace Hue, you might think it is a regular hotel down a back street, and in a way it is just that, but the staff make it something special. They really go out of their way to make you feel welcome and take care of anything you need. When we arrived, and most times when we came in after a hot day out sightseeing, we were greeted with warm smiles and cold drinks - and none of the drinks appeared on our bill when we left. We got lots of tourist advice and restaurant suggestions from them. The breakfasts were good, with enough choice to suit most tastes, and the room was comfortable and quiet. While it is a little difficult to find, the Serene Palace Hue is worth the search, conveniently close to the main restaurant and shopping streets, and just over the river (20 mins walk or 10 mins by cyclo) from the main sights. We'd definitely stay there again if we go back to Hue some day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our stay in January 2014 was very pleasant. Great room, comfortable bed and shower facility and very clean. Great breakfast and considering the rates, was overall, very good value in a new facility staffed by really helpful happy staff.
h_title_comment: Very pleasant stay in Hue Serene Palace
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My parents and I shared a very big, clean and confortable family-room. We had a perfect time.
The staff is super friendly, polite and helpfull and the service in total is incredibly good. Amazing Breakfast!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
What a great welcome to Hué! Refreshing towels, juice and fruit on the lobby and a early check-in hours before "normal" check-in time. We felt so welcome and appreciated!

Room spacious and bright. No noise from the street. Good wi-fi and AC. Big bathroom. Everything clean. Complimentary coffee, fruit and water. 

Service great at every occasion. Breakfast tasty and plentyfull. 

Hue advise: opt for the green Mai Linh taxies. They use reliable meters. But be sure to have some small bills. The drivers seldom seem to have change (or grant themselves a tip!!)
h_title_comment: A truely good hotel in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel, and I was sorry to leave. It is new, off a back alley, but close to the River. The cleanliness and the staff is what makes this hotel the Best. There is a welcome drink plus fruit and after a long day touring you can have another drink if you are thirsty. The lemon juice is great.the back alley is punctured by pot holes, but it is a quicker way to get into the tourist area and restaurants. I would have liked to stay longer, and it is a shame that other hotels don't follow their exemplary etiquette.
h_title_comment: Best hotel in 4 months in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel was amazing and has a contemporary, modern design. It was a very comfortable stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were able to help set a private car transport for us to Hoi An for a reasonable price. The hotel was a bit hard to find because it's tucked in an inside street, but the overall location is very convenient and close to good restaurants and bars. Breakfast is ok but at least they offer breakfast.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent 3 nights here on our third trip to Vietnam and first trip to Hue. What can I say it was above expectations. Hotel was new clean and modern, Staff are mostly young. Value for money and breakfast you pick from a menu and they make it for you but you can eat as much as you want. Wonderful experience thanks to Emily, Ken, Sammi and Jenny and all the others who treated us like family. One of the nights we stayed there was flooding and I havent had such a fun experience in my travels it was so funny! Watching a fellow aussie carrying his wife across the road over his shoulder as she didnt want to get wet. Even in knee deep water the staff took it in there stride and it didnt faze them they still went out and got food for guests and took a group of 8 to the airport for there flights out in water that was up to the doors. Great experience thanks to all staff especially Emily "shes a lovely girl with a huge smile and very helpful." We will see you again in May 2014. Sam & Daryl
h_title_comment: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Good Location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
As your taxi turns off Main Street up the pot holed lane, it's natural to assume the worst. Fear not! This smart little hotel shines amongst its neighbours. Centrally placed for restaurants, bars and boats on the Perfumed River, yet quiet enough to sleep, it is really well located. Speak to the manager if the bar opposite is too load after 9pm, he'll go and sort them out!

The reception and breakfast room are on the ground floor... Very functional. The bedrooms on floors 2 to 7. The higher the better. I was on floor 5 and facing the lane. The room was above average size with the usual air-con and TV but also with its own PC. It was clean, smart and comfortable.

Staff are brilliant, really helpful and striving to make the hotel the best in its bracket.

Stay here ( but book tours with Mr Cu at the Mandarin Cafe)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Where can i start!
My partner and I stayed at the Hue Serene palace hotel for 3 nights in our month long trip in Vietnam. After the hotel we were staying at previously in Hue was booked out we had to find a quick replacement close by. Within minutes of inquiring, Jenny (a very helpful receptionist) emailed me back with a confirmation and next thing we knew a hotel staff member had walked in the rain, 2 umbrella's in hand, to pick us up from our first hotel which was around the corner.
Once we arrived we were greeted by such smiling faces we were instantly impressed. We had a complimentary fruit platter, welcome drink and tea and coffee before we were taking up to our room.

The room was amazing. For a cost of $35 USD a night i felt like I was staying a a flash 5 star hotel. It was immaculate, clean, bed was comfortable, bathroom was big with a bathtub (which was perfect as the weather was quite cold and wet) and the TV had a fantastic range of channels.

The location was central, only a 5 minute walk to shops, restaurants and bars. Ordering a taxi through reception was easy and would arrive with minutes.

The door boys were very well presented and always helping you with bags and supplying umbrellas!

Breakfast was a fruit buffet and a menu that you could choose as many meals as you wanted, all inclusive in room rate. I have got to say, out of our whole month trip of Vietnam, this was BY FAR the best breakfast we had.

Now for the best part. My boyfriend was very unwell on our 3rd day at the hotel so we had to cancel our car to Hoi An and stay an extra night - which of course they accommodated for us without any problems, amazing. Within an hour of extending our stay the staff came to our room to get our bags and relocate to our new room.
They brought breakfast to our room for him as he was too sick to get out of bed. Later on in the day they brought him so toast and tea. Then in the afternoon they brought him a fresh juice. The staff here truly went above and beyond to help us out.
As i would pass through the lobby they would constantly ask if there was anything they could do to assist him or if they could call the doctor. We are both very very grateful for how the staff accommodated us.

Special thanks to Mary, Jenny, Julia, Emily and the rest of the staff at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. We honestly had the best experience and I would highly recommend staying here. I cannot fault this hotel one bit.

THANK YOU !
h_title_comment: The greatest hotel experience i've ever had. We were treated like family!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent 3 nights here recently and wished we could have stayed longer. The Hue Serene Palace was the perfect place to stay in Hue. The location was perfect for walking around town and seeing the sites. There were plenty of restaurants and cafés nearby. Our room was very large and extremely clean. The breakfast was excellent, especially the pho! The hotel is not huge, so it was very quiet and personnel. The best part was the staff. They were all so helpful and friendly. The answered all our questions and recommended good restaurants and shopping. They also arranged our driver for the day we toured the Royal Tombs and the same driver for our drive to Hoi An. The choose a very professional experienced driver. I would highly recommend a stay here and enjoy being treated well.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I travel weekly for work all over the world staying in some fairly upmarket hotels (which I fortunately have to thank my employer who picks up the tab). So when I came to Hue on a holiday, I was greeted with a smile and warm personal service that not even the Hilton or Pullman could match.

We were checked in by Ken who took great care in looking after us, offering a drink and a light refreshment even though we arrived after hours.

In the morning, ALL of the hotel customer facing staff had learnt my name and were greeting us immediately.

The ladies in the breakfast were engaging and remembered orders from previous days. They also remembered that I promised to eat more next time. They're certainly not stingy!! Very generous indeed.

Door staff, particularly Tom and Henry were always happy. I don't think I saw Tom with anything other than a big broad smile on his face when he saw a customer.

As alluded, breakfast was generous, tasty and well presented. Hygiene is important and the hotel and public spaces are cleaned and tidied.

Beds are a bit on the fim side. Probably too firm in all honesty. I can live with that for a few nights but more than a week I would struggle.

Surrounding ambient & environmental noise is present. Not unbearable, not unpleasant, but bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper in this part of the world.

This is a fab hotel, nicely styled, conveniently located to most of the sites without being tacky.

But by far it's best assets are it's staff - absolutely amazing. And the best bit is, they really seem to love their job.......
h_title_comment: Best hotel I've stayed in for a long time
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My wife and I recently passed through Hue for a short visit and we stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. We had a very enjoyable stay at its sister hotel in Hanoi so we thought the facility in Hue would be worth a go. The bottom line is that the Hue facility was absolutely terrific. Sincere, very caring staff, beautiful rooms, great breakfast. The staff helped us book a tour of Hue on the back of motorbikes (Cafe on Thu Wheels, highly recommended) as well as a ride to Hoi An. You can't go wrong at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. By the way, the price is ridiculously low.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel is very well located though very quiet. Though we only stayed for a short time, the staff were wonderful. They were helpful and had a great sense of humour. It was a delight to stay there. The hotel is beautifully presented with very clean and comfortable rooms. If you are visiting Hue I would highly recommend this hotel.
h_title_comment: Fantastic staff - great place to stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: By far the nicest staff of any hotel I've ever stayed in. They really go out of their way to help out and make you feel at home. The room had everything a 5* hotel would have, simply amazing and good location too. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: My wife and I enjoyed it a lot in the past three days here. The staff was really friendly and very polite. Thank you for this welcome. The central location made it possible to walk to the beautiful river side and Cittadel easily. We will recommend to all our friends this Hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I stayed at the Hue Serene Palace for 3 nights in Feb & had a great experience! Staff were very friendly and helpful. I'm a female and was travelling on my own, the staff were so helpful that they even told me the areas best to stay away from once it was dark. Even though the hotel is situated down a very narrow alley, I had no issues around the area at night and felt safe. Breakfast is included in the room rate (as it is at most places in Vietnam) and though the buffet itself is only juice, fruit and bread, there's a whole menu of western and Vietnamese breakfast dishes that are made to order (all included in the rate). I would definitely stay at this hotel again as it's pretty central, service is great and it's small and comfortable.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: What an a complete delight it was to stay at the Serene Palace! Firstly we'd been on the night train from Hoi An and arrived at the hotel at 9am. We weren't supposed to check in until 2 or 3 pm but we just hoped that we could leave our bags and maybe wander around until it was checking in time. We arrived at the hotel and the bell boys were straight out picking up our bags. We explained to the lady on the desk that we weren't due until later but could we leave our bags? They said "no problem, please come and have complimentary breakfast". We'd not slept for probably 24 hours and we were saying oh no but we are disgusting we've been on the night train and we arent booked until later. They said "please dont worry you're room isnt ready so we have upgraded you to another room and when you've had some breakfast you can go up immediately and shower" We were totally blown away, we were paying £75 for 3 nights with breakfast and here we were being effectively given a free night and breakfast. We ate a tremendous breakfast (and that was the same every morning - gorgeous and fresh - a really lovely pho bo too) and the ladies in the breakfast area were so lovely, they insisted on knowing our names and then constantly using them, which was incredibly cute because they smiled every time they got our names right! After breakfast we were taken to our room and it was a lovely room with a bath with a jacuzzi! The bath itself was a tad too small for us (my hubby is 6ft 6inch) but it was still a bit special. Really clean and, as with everywhere in Vnam free wifi! Room was comfortable but a tad noisy from bar across the road and bloody cockrell at 5am every morning :) but it didn't detract from how we felt about this place. It really was a pleasure and we were seriously sad to leave. Hue is not the greatest of places to stay for a long time, lots of backpackers hanging around waiting for something to happen, but if you're coming to Hue then you cannot do better than stay at this hotel. Thank you so very much Serene Palace for making our stay extra extra special
h_title_comment: An absolute gem - staff are incredible!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights on our anniversary trip. We were surprised with a fully decorated room upon arrival, complete with a small bottle of wine and cake! The staff were all wonderfully friendly and helpful (particularly Emily and Ken), very personal service. The room was lovely and had a nice view over the city from the balcony. Location was very good, being close to lots of restaurants, bars, shops etc in the old town area, and just a short walk to the river and citadel. The hotel helped us to organise a car and driver to take us around on the first day, and also to book our train tickets, really couldn't have asked anything more of them. The breakfast had some good options, but I prefer a buffet when I'm away as I can never decide what to have and want to try a little bit of everything! Only other thing that could be improved would be a nice bar area (maybe rooftop) to sit and relax after a day of sightseeing. We were told that one was on the way! Will definitely go back if we're in the area again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Positives:
+ INCREDIBLE customer service and staff
+ spotless and spacious rooms
+ luxurious ensuites
+ super comfy beds
+ delicious breakfasts
+ good location by lots of great restaurants

Negatives:
- NONE

I have been traveling SE Asia for 3 months now and this is by far on par as the best place i've stayed in. The other place being their Sister Hotel; Holiday Diamond Hotel. Customer service at both is out of this world! Thank you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed 3 nites in a twin room in this comfortable small boutique hotel, Room was good size,nicely ac, clean and comfortable with a generous good breakfast included in the rate. Airport pickup and return was available at a taxi competitive fee and without the hassle. Citadel complex was an easy 10 minute walk. We took a perfume river private boat tour arranged thru the hotel which was very interesting.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Four of us had a recent stay Feb 15 2014.When we arrived we were a little worried since hotel was located on a small hidden side street although close to restaurants and shopping in old town.
Then stepping into hotel we were welcomed by the most smiling ,helpful and cordial staff we encountered in all of our IndoChina trip of 35 days.Rooms were perfect.
This is a must hotel for any stop in Hue.
One happy camper...

Montreal Canada
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This new little hotel sits quietly on a alley in Hue - very close to the waterfront and local restaurants -- its name it appropriate. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are well appointed - fresh fruit is provided daily. They offer a good breakfast with a variety of foods from eggs to pho. Highly recommend this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The staff of the Serene Palace is extraordinary, very kind, friendly and lovable. It's composed by several young girls with a beatiful smile, very similar one to the other (at least for me) but I remember only one name, Si. The hotel is new and located in a very quiet location near to the river. Our room was simply exceptional. It's the first time I find in my room one computer connected with Internet and perfectly working, and even a scale. Least but not last, the hotel is also cheap, above all if compared to all it offers to its customers. Sorry with the readers for my bad english.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The staff at the Serene Palace are exceptional, being friendly yet professional, and very service oriented. The hotel environment is modern and light and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom luxurious; breakfast is a wonderful start to the day with a generous selection of dishes and the most attentive staff including Thuy. Ivy and Sammy. The hotel is in a very convenient location for restaurants and attractions and can help you with tours or hire cars and transfer to the airport. Reception area staff such as Mary, Julia, Laura, Ken and Si, will go out of their way to make sure that you have a great stay at Serene Palace. (Thank you Thuy, for the afternoon coffee and snack outing! and Julia for the in hotel lunch and lots of cups of coffee delivered with such a beautiful smile!)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
The hotel is in a great location, very central. The rooms are modern and very pleasant, although the bed was very hard- too hard for us to be comfortable. We didn't complain to the hotel, however, so perhaps unfair to mark down for that. There is a computer in the room with internet which is really useful.

We were recommended this hotel by it's smaller sister hotel, charming 2 in Hanoi- (outstanding little hotel and definitely worth a visit).

The serene palace offered the same quality experience, and ken was very friendly and helpful!

For the money, you can't go wrong with this hotel. 1 star taken off for the bed.
h_title_comment: Very good and well worth the money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I have to echo the vast majority of comments about this place. It's practically brand new so facilities are great. Arriving down the narrow, bumpy lane can give you the wrong impression but persevere. Very welcoming, helpful staff from organising pick up from airport to the car to take us to Hoi An (our next destination) which was $5 dollars cheaper than the quote we got in town. Breakfast was probably the best we had, thanks to it being cooked to order rather than the standard buffets we were met with in most places. Could perhaps do with a residents bar, just to top it off, but that's a minor point and I'm not sure where they would put it!
Recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
If I could give this hotel 6/5 I would.
The service here was exceptional and the hotel was the best we stayed in in Vietnam.
From a welcome drink as we arrived, to friendly staff everywhere to the large breakfast and very nice rooms, this hotel should be on everyone's list for Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Yep i have to agree with the majority on this one. We stayed just two nights here at a cost of $25USD a night for the standard room and were very impressed!! We reckon we ate $50 usd worth of breakfasts and got a room thrown in for free!!!!
The pick up from the airport was effecient the welcome was warm and our time in Hue was great (although possibly too short.
Great hotel...... Excellent value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed at Hue Serene Palace Hotel in Feb 2014, The staff at this hotel were incredible, Helpful and caring and always made us welcome when we entered the hotel. The welcome drinks were also a wonderful touch. The rooms were big & comfortable and also had a computer which i have never seen before. The hotel was also very affordable and within walking distance to bars & restaurants.
If i ever return to HUE i will definitely be staying here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This was the great hotel and an amazing value.We had a beautiful, large room with a view of the city. Though it is located on an alley, the hotel is easy walking distance from restaurants, shopping and the river. The staff was exceptionally attentive and accommodating.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Excellent hotel, very good value for money, friendly staff helped us with everything. Rooms are nicely done, clean, well equipped. Breakfast is typical vietnamise, pho ga is a very good choice. Good location, close to the river.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is really one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. It is located in a small lane but within a five-minute walk, you will find restaurants of all kinds.

They offered me welcome drink and fruits during check-in, so unlike other hotels you don't need to wait at the counter. All you need to do is to sit back and relax, they will just prepare everything for you.

I stayed on the 6th floor and the room was comfortable and clean. There was a computer in the room for you to use too.

Breakfast is all-you-can-eat type. You can order pho (Vietnamese noodeles), or pancake, fried egg etc. And lots of fruit to choose from.

The most outstanding part is service. Really superb service. Every single staff smiled when you entered the hotel. Special thanks to Mary and Emily who were attentive to my requests and they really made my stay enjoyable. You can feel they care every single guest staying there and they know their guests' names and where they have been to during the day. Not many hotels can do that. When I checked out and was just about to call a taxi to the train station, they said they had already arranged it for me and the taxi was already waiting for me!

I have to say the service quality is better than many of the 5-star hotels. If you are in Hue, I would definitely recommend you to stay at this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We booked online and requested pick up from the train station which was arranged. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we booked tours through the hotel which were not expensive. Breakfast was great and the staff in the breakfast lounge provided exceptional service. The rooms look fairly new or recently renovated and the décor is quite nice. The bathroom also looks new and the bath was great however the hot water runs out after a while which is typical of most hotels in Vietnam but lasts plenty long enough for showers. Dale, Andy and Liz.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
This hotel has amazing staff so friendly and helpful, they can't do enough to make your stay enjoyable and ensure you enjoy their city.

The reception team Emily & Laura are very knowledgeable and so helpful always trying to ensure you have all information you need and checking arrangements. Always service with a smile and genuine concern that you will have a great stay, cant recommend highly enough, excellent.

Hotel is well located, rooms are large and clean, all in all a great hotel and very good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Wonderful staff, very helpful in every way. We couldn't be happier with our 2 day stay. Perfect location, beautiful clean rooms, kind staff. All for an amazing price. True bargain. Loved it and would absolutely stay here again when we return to Hue. I just wish all hotels could be this great.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for a couple of nights in this hotel and booked a room on the top floor with a balcony. The hotel arranged for a pick-up at the airport and also for a day tour of the temples etc. which made our brief stay very memorable. The hotel is very near resturants and bars and the food is excellent in this region famed for it's cuisine. The hotel staff were very good and overall this hotel mertis more than it's 3 stars. Highly recommended.
h_title_comment: A great hotel in a beautiful city
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
At $50 per night with breakfast included, this is a great value hotel! We stayed on the 7th floor (top floor) with a balcony and city view and the room was spacious and clean. The staff is excellent and you can tell they really care about making sure guests are happy. Especially Ken! He was a sweetheart and you could tell he really wanted to make sure we were happy with everything. After staying at some more expensive hotels during this trip, my husband and I kept saying how the service at Serene was so much better!

Just a heads-up. Located on a small alley, don't be scared as your car/driver approaches this dark lane. It is safe! My husband and I walked around the area on our own each night and it was totally fine.

The only thing to note is that the water heater runs out pretty quickly. Even if my husband took a shower at night and I took one in the morning, I couldn't stay in there for a long (or even normal) amount of time before the water would start getting cold. Again - at this price though, it really is a great value.

Also! If you don't feel like eating out at night, the front desk can also help you order food so you can enjoy it in the dining room/breakfast area of the hotel. We did this and was just what we wanted!
h_title_comment: Great Value Hotel With a Friendly Staff Who Really Cares
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: beautiful large rooms,great breakfast, fantastic staff, have stayed in 5 star not as good as serene palace, very quiet lane but close to everything. most helpful staff we encountered.have paid much more for lesser quality hotels.
h_title_comment: best value for money in vietnam
