h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel staff made every effort to make our short stay comfortable and hassle free. They sorted bike hire for us, gave us maps of the local area, and suggested some great places for dinner. The room was clean, fitted with all the mod-cons, and mist importantly the bed was very comfortable! Highly recommended if you've got a couple of days in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed at the Serene for two nights in late-February. Wonderful experience. Excellent, friendly staff, delicious breakfast, great rooms, and nice ability to rent bikes for $2/day to explore the city and the Emperor's Tombs. We were in a top-floor City View room our second night, and I would highly recommend spending the extra $ as the views from there are really lovely. All in all, would highly recommend staying here and look forward to returning my next time in Hue!
h_title_comment: Excellent place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel is located in a small lane, off the main road. The room is very clean and has the usual in room safe, computer, wifi, flat screen TV , tea/coffee making facilities and bar fridge. The staff explained everything in the room and make our stay very comfortable. The breakfast bar has the fruits, drinks, toasts etc.. Hot breakfast is made to order. Eggs, omelette, noddles etc.. All the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Within 100 meters there are restaurants, clothes shops and street food stores. The old historic castle is 20 minutes walk. By bus it will cost you 50,000 VND from the airport.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We had a lovely stay for two nights. Big, clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast and in a great location. The price is very cheap for such a fantastic hotel. We got our laundry done, very cheap at $2 per kg. We would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The Serene hotel was simply amazing. The hotel and rooms are beautiful and clean. The rates are very reasonable. And the location is nicely tucked away but very central.

But on top of all that, the staff is just amazing. They are very helpful, friendly and professional. From the moment you step in, they welcome you with fruit and beverages while they whisk your bags away to your room, which they give you an in-person orientation for when you are done with your snack. Thereafter, they always seem to be there to explain everything you need, where to eat, what to see, help you arrange bikes and cars, take your laundry, help you with the safe. Always with a smile.

The breakfast is also really delicious. We had the pho a few times, and also eggs, fried rice, pancakes, and fruit and coffee.

I would stay here again in a second, as well as recommend anyone I know to do so.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
This hotel is tremendous value for money and the service is extremely good.

We arrived off an early morning train and were pleased to see our hotel-organised transfer waiting. Our room was ready when we checked in but we were taken immediately to have a complementary breakfast first. The hotel also set us up with a driver to tour the tombs and citadel, and next day the same driver drove us down to Hoi An making sure we saw all the sights and had all the essential photo opportunities.

The only reason I am not giving Serene Palace five stars is because their laundry service was a bit rough with our clothes and they didn't have an iron and ironing board available. Another small niggle was a lack of shelves and drawers in the room. However, these small things would not stop us recommending the hotel and staying there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 2 nights. The property is located within walking distance to the main tourist street, down an alley. The staff here were incredible and we were always greeted with a welcome and they were more than happy to assist us. The breakfast is a buffet, where you can choose as many items off a set menu. It is a new hotel and I think they will do well. We booked transportation to see the sights through the hotel. We had an issue with the transport and mentioned it to one of the girls on the desk. When we checked out they informed us that they reduced the cost for us, which I thought was good of them. In addition, we received a thoughtful follow-up email.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights and had excellent service from all the staff, from reception through to the cleaning staff. Reception were very helpful when booking trips and the staff at breakfast couldn't have been more helpful. One morning I made a gentle enquiry about a local dish and the next day, it was collected from a nearby hotel for me to try!!
Unless you want to pay silly prices, I can't think of anywhere better to stay in Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed here in January and were impressed by the unbelievable friendly staff. We arrived after a 15 hour train journey and were absolutely shattered. The staff insisted we sit down for breakfast while they prepared our room. The service was incredible, very friendly and efficient and the breakfast was very good too. Our room was large, clean and although the hot water was intermittent that might be because it's a relatively new hotel. The imperial city was about a 15-20 minute walk away which wasn't too bad considering the excellent value of the hotel. All in all, we would happily recommend the Serene Palace if you're staying in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We arrived late hoping they would have a room available. Unfortunately they were full. But they sat us down, gave us coffee while they phoned around to find us a room. Lovely people, couldn't do enough for us even though we weren't even paying guests. The hotel looked lovely, would highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed for one night at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel in February 2014. This is a beautiful hotel, wonderful amenities, friendly staff and a superb breakfast. They are centrally located so it is easy to walk to great restaurants and the Imperial City. The bathroom is huge, there is a computer in the room, the balcony was delightful. I just can't say enough about this wonderful place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
the staff and the service are absolutely excellent the rooms are confortables and the breakfast very good. this is a three stars hotel with a five stars service.
this hotel has been one of the best in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Absolutely superb service at this new hotel - welcome drink and fruit, coffee whenever you want it (Julia makes a very strong Vietnamese coffee...yum!), staff couldn't have been more helpful (especially Mary and Julia). We were a little put off at first by the location - alleyway just off main street but don't let this put you off - its busy with restaurants, bars and other hotels so no need to worry.
We only had 24 hours in Hue so invested in the services of the hotel car and driver for the day which was a great way to get the most out of our day visiting the tombs.
Good breakfast and very comfortable room.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel opened July 2013 and couldn't be nicer, cleaner or friendlier. Hidden away on an alley on the south bank, it is about 30 minutes walk to the Citadel and only a stone's throw to many great restaurants. The staff is super helpful and bend over backwards to help in every possible way.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Fantastic hotel in excellent location, near shops and restaurants. The hotel is down a small alley which at first glance looks quite shady, but actually it's a nice quiet lane with lots of cool restaurants and coffee bars. The main tourist attraction in Hue is maybe a 20 minute walk back into the centre, but aside from the citadel and museums its mostly residential, so the hotel is in the best location.

The greeting at the hotel is first class with porters on hand and a warm welcome with drinks and fresh fruit while you check in.

My room was large, bright and had a balcony looking out over the street and rest of town. Room was well equipped with minimal, complimentary coffee and fresh fruit, and a PC at the writing desk!!

I am mystified as to how the hotel offers such a great service at such good rates!
h_title_comment: One of the best hotels I've stayed in
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We only stayed here for one night as we extended our stay in Hue but I wish I had booked it for the whole four days. Spotlessly clean, really comfortable rooms and wonderful staff. I could not fault it in any way and would happily recommend it as a four star hotel, with a two star price tag. Wonderful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed a wonderful, wonderful night in this hotel, which is absolutely fantastic! The hotel is less than a year old, and is splendid and luxurious. Don't be fooled by the external appearance...inside, this hotel is the nicest we have seen to date in south east Asia! And the staff is beyond nice and helpful. They make you feel right at home, and are doing everything they can to make sure you have everything you need. This is a very very strong recommendation. I would give it a 6 stars if I could!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I cannot imagine any hotel with a better value than Serence Palace. There are more elegant hotels in Hue but for the traveller who wants more than a touch of luxury at modest prices, this fit our bill perfectly. From the warm welcome with cool towels and drinks, attentive concerned staff and very comfortable rooms this was an easy, uncomplicated experience. All travel arrangements were effective and with no surprises. They did arrange a car with driver - I think that was about right - the sites in Hue are spectacular - and quite close to the hotel, those in the city and the tombs in the surrounding area. This hotel really is amazing for the cost and the service exceeded our expectations. Re: laundry - within a day easily and when the staff couldn't find the invoice they insisted on a charge well below what I thought it should have cost. Nice consideration.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Can't speak highly enough of this hotel and the staff. Just brilliant. My wife and I are on our honeymoon travelling around SE Asia and this hotel provided the best customer service we have experienced in nearly 3 months! Definitely recommend this for anyone visiting Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Rooms were clean and spacious. Staff was nice unfortunately their English was not as good as other place we stayed so we had a few confusing conversation. No fault of the hotel because I don't speak Vietnamese. I really like the welcome drink and the size of the rooms. There is a bar across the street that plays some techno disco music throughout the day and early evening but they did tone it down at night for sleeping. I would stay there again.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Our room was big & spacious. Overall was good, the hotel staff were all very helpful. The staff took the initiative to remember the name of each of the hotel guest. Enjoyed the breakfast especially the pancakes. Internet connection was strong, no problem to connect at all. The only complaint I had was the hot water. The hot water was only available for a while and then the water just turned cold. It made it so hard to take a nice shower. Other than this, everything was good.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: our room was huge, our bed was huge, and everything looked immaculately clean. we paid $50/night and was on the top floor, overlooking the city. it was a gorgeous room, but the hotel definitely has some quirks. those are: the tub has jets but is pretty small (not so good for my tall white fiance). there's only enough hot water for one person to bathe/shower. i asked the receptionist about this and apparently it's some sort of regulations--you just have to wait for about 30 minutes and there will be more. they have laundry services, but not cheap ($2/kg, which is about $12 for small load). we couldn't figure out how to turn off the outside light on our balcony and learned that this controlled by the front desk (they'll turn it off if you ask). weird. they helped us arrange a tour of the royal tombs and citadel for $50 with a private driver. also, not cheap but not terrible considering it was about 5 hours long (there's really no other way to get around on a rainy day in foreign country!). overall a good hotel though.
h_title_comment: pretty good but has some quirks
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We spent 3 nights here and wished we could have stayed longer. The hotel was very clean, breakfast was plentiful and the staff were fantastic. Our room had two double beds, TV, personal PC and a super bathroom with fantastic shower. After some other hotels we had stayed in this one beat them all. When we arrived we were led to a sofa and were given glasses of fresh juice and plates of fresh fruit whilst our bags were taken to our room. The friendly staff helped to organise our stay culminating with a driver and car for a day to visit the tombs and pagoda. The hotel is in a good location with only a 10 minute walk to the main shops and restaurants and is fantastic value. Just can't say enough about this hotel, it's pure paradise!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We were very warmly welcomed on arrival. Lucy gave us fresh fruit and a welcome drink and asked about our plans. When we explained that we only came for 1 day she recommend some places to see and the restaurant with lovely food.
The room was nice and big with a huge comfortable bed and a computer. Bathroom had a bath tub and all needed accessories. If I ever come back to Hue I will stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
What a fab hotel with lovely helpful staff!! At first I thought it a bit secluded down a little dusty road! Alarm bells! Then showed to our room after a lovely welcome to a room with a river view:-) ( that was never going to happen unless you were on the roof and I'm not sure you would see it then! Lol!)
Never the less it was great!!! The room was very spacious with a very comfy bed! Very clean and fresh fruit in the room every morning! The breakfast was great ! The staff made it special! They couldn't do enough for you!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We were collected from the airport as arranged and taken to the hotel where we were greeted warmly by the staff. We were given a cold drink and some fresh fruit before the check-in process. We were given a map and we asked about tours. After the information was given we booked one and a car trip down to Hoi An our next stop. We then went to our room. It was lovely and clean and even had a computer.
Breakfast really set us up for the day, it was varied with lots of nice fruit juice as well as coffee. The staff were always attentive and Ken even sorted a top up card for my phone, a great help. Keep doing what you are doing, it's a great hotel. Thank you everyone
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel for 3 nights in February and loved it. This hotel is a fantastic value and I highly recommend it.

During check in we were given a welcome drink, fresh fruit, and a cold towel which was a very nice first impression. Our room was large and attractive. We liked the comfortable bed, fast wifi, tea kettle in the room, and modern bathroom. They brought us fresh fruit everyday which was a nice touch.

The location is good for Hue--just a short walk to all the restaurants and shops in the tourist area. The staff can arrange a taxi or car to see other sights and to bring you to/from the airport. In fact, the staff will go out of their way to make sure you have a nice stay.

You can't go wrong with the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. One of the best values in a hotel we have had in our travels. I highly recommend it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: From our arrival to our departure, everything was perfect. Huge breakfast, classy welcome with flowers and cake for my wife's birthday, very clean room and well trained staff. Our stay was a real paradise in Hue. Thank you Serene Palace hotel !
h_title_comment: A 5 star hotel for the price of 3 !!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Spent 3 nights here, and just loved it. Very friendly and caring staff- always smiling & welcoming, checking if we wanted a (complimentary) coffee/tea or refreshing drink on our return back to the hotel. Gave some good tips - eg to buy the concession ticket at The Citadel to get two Tomb entrances- way cheaper than individual purchases and not publicised anywhere at the citadel itself. Organised tours efficiently for us - high standard of guide.
We did stay in one of the rooms that has windows into the corridors with louvre blinds - lets in more light that would prefer- the addition of curtains to pull across would fix that problem to make the room darker at night.
Large room & lovely bathroom - very clean. Complementary fruit plate each day, water/ tea/ coffee.
Would definitely stay here again - one if our all time favourites.
h_title_comment: Serene by name, serene by nature!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Enjoyed our stay in Hue Serene Palace very much. Staff were very helpful, didn't get all their names so hesitate to mention just one, as they were all so good. Really enjoyed their plentiful and varied breakfast and also sitting on our balcony looking out over Hue as the lights come on and dark descends, very relaxing in the middle of such a busy city. If we visit Hue again, will definitely stay here.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at this hotel by default, having mistakenly mixed up the arrival date for our booked hotel. We were told that this hotel was rated at No. 2 however with the excellent service we received from all the staff, and in particular by the reception and tour officer, we would rate this as No. 1 in our opinion. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was awesome with plenty of fresh fruit. In particular I would like to mention Emily for the time she spent arranging our Halong Bay Cruise and accommodation in Hanoi at their sister hotel, Holiday Diamond Hotel and also our receptionist (I wish I could remember her name). They were so friendly.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: On our one month trip in Vietnam and Cambodia Dec 16 to Jan 14 we stayed in many very good hotels, all selected after reading good reviews. Among all those this hotel turned out to have the best service and also the best value for money. Hurry there before they raise their prices! :)
h_title_comment: Best value for money in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The Hue Serene Palace Hotel is located in the tourist area of Hue. Very helpful andfriendly staff. For Breakfast, the hotel offers a wide variety of dishes. Special thanks to Mary for your kind advice and help!
h_title_comment: Quality hotel for a low price
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed two nights at this hotel and wish we could have stayed longer. From the moment we got dropped off we were treated exceptionally well. We were greeted by the bell boys, given some fruit and a cold drink while we checked in. Our room was immaculate, we were even surprised to have our own computer in the room. Breakfast was great and Emily and the team gave us helpful advice about the city. They helped us book excursions and taxis and definitely made sure we were well looked after. This place is probably too cheap for what you get, it's really a first class hotel that exceeded our expectations. Of our 5 weeks travelling Cambodia and Vietnam, this would easily be in our top 3 hotels. We would definitely stay here again if we returned to Hue and we will certainly be recommending it to anyone who is headed to the former capital city of Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
During the last three weeks we have been in many hotels in Vietnam and this one is by far the best experience we had. Where to start.... First they arranged transport from the Da Nang Airport to the Hotel, this was excellent and the Driver also had a paper with our name on it making it easy to identify him. When we arrived at night we were greeted by a fruit plater and a nice smile. Emily is the lady that welcomed us and she was really nice and answering all our questions. She then came with us to show us our room, it was a nice room (BIG), nice shower, nice bed, laudry service (cheaper than anywhere we went in Vietnam), nice balcony... every amenities you expect from a 4-5 stars Hotel at a fraction of the price. Breakfast was superb with a lot of choices; including Pho and Western Food... and the best.... you can order as many things as you want!!!
In the morning, we talked to Emily at the front desk, we asked her about the attractions that were in the Cities and she gave us a Map including everything, she even gave us the price of every attractions and could arrange a driver for us for the day at a reasonable cost. We had a friend that went to another Hotel to look at the tours they were offering and the other Hotel had the same tour for 30$ more dollars. Based on that we can certainly say that the staff at the Serene Palace Hotel are the most honest you can find :)
The Hotel is well located, in a quiet street. You can basically walk 3 minutes and you will be in the action of Hue with all the local people. The Hotel is very safe (all new doors and windows) we went walking at night with no problem and there are many Coffee Shop close by. Everything in the Hotel is new and clean with great Architectural Design. Anyway I will stop there because I could talk hours from the great experience we had at the Serene Palace. If you go through Hue you must go there!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
The location is near main road along the river, although it's at the small lane.
The staff are always smiling and helpful. The breakfast is serviced as western style and Vietnamese style. You may ask for private car or tour information at the front desk.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: An over zealous warm welcome serenades your arrival to this new hotel in Hue. It offers great value for money as the room is spacious, there's movie channels on TV and a huge bathroom. Deviating from the buffet breakfast it's an order breakfast and service is a bit hot and miss. Improvements can be made on staff bring quicker to remove plates, but the food is really good. This is a great gem and the exuberance of the young staff make it a delightful place to stay in Hue.
h_title_comment: Great warm welcome and great stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We were here during Chinese New Year. It was a little hard, as so many places were closed! The staff were so helpful, making sure the places we wanted to go to were open as well as organising tours. The staff are the difference here. Absolutely lovely.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at Hue Serene Palace for 4 nights. It was one of the better hotels we have stayed in Vietnam. It is clean, modern, in a convenient location and the best staff we have come across. We booked three day trips through the hotel and they were all excellent. As far as value for money goes, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed for two nights at the Serene Palace (2 separate occasions) and we could not fault it given the very good tariff.
It is certainly as good as many 4 star hotels we have stayed in and for service, it is far better and attentive than most 5 star hotels.
The staff are very welcoming, friendly, polite and helpful from the minute you arrive. We did notice that there seemed to be a few staff "in training" and it was great to see how they were being well looked after and supported and never undermined by the "experienced" staff - a very good HR operation is in place.

The welcome drink and fruit platter was a real surprise along with the fresh fruit plate in your room - they seem to go out of their way to go the extra mile in hospitality.
The rooms are a good size, very clean and the personal computer was great. We just wanted to stay in our room and chill out as it felt comfortable as soon as you entered.

We booked a tour with the very helpful guidance of the staff to see the local sites plus a few other places that we wanted to see and the driver John could not have been more polite and accommodating. We picked up English speaking guides when we could onsite which worked well.
The hotel also arranged our transfer north which included stops on the way and a very long 8.5 hr day and John was also our driver on this. The recommendation by a hotel of private drivers does very much reflect back on them and in our case, they once again get top marks.
The staff are very knowledgeable and proud of their city and this is a bonus for tourists.

On one of our arrivals at the Serene, our train was an hour and half late but at the station was a staff member to greet us, still smiling. Due to the late hour and needing dinner they promptly organised delivery from a local restaurant for us. Once again, the staff were so obliging.

The Hue Serene definitely gets our tick of approval and we will be recommending it. Look forward to hopefully returning next year to see the sights of Hue that we missed this trip - an interesting and we felt somewhat underrated city by a lot of people.

Thank you to the staff for making our stay so pleasant.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 3 nights in the family room. It was very spacious, clean and the beds were great. The staff was very friendly and their recommendations were very helpful (restaurants, activities...). Breakfast was also very good.
It was situated only a few minutes walk from the citadel and all in all it was very good value for money.
It was by far the best hotel we stayed in during our Vietnam trip.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: The value of this hotel is incredible for Hue. My room was large, clean, modern, well designed and always had plenty of hot water. The breakfasts were good and they would make you as much food as possible!! The hotel is hidden in a back alley of Hue surrounded by houses and local cafes, but it is still in the middle of all of the activities of Hue. I only had one full day in Hue and the ladies at the front desk set up a moped tour of all of the tombs, temples and the citadel in Hue. It was with another employee of the Hotel on his day off. I would recommend you ask for Ken and see if he has time to take you around. He took me on all of the back roads where I was able to see and interact with locals and see these amazing temples come out of nowhere!! He was overly nice and considerate throughout my day with him. He took me to a great restaurant filled with locals and tourists with exceptional food. Ken definitely made my experience in Hue. I would stay here again.
h_title_comment: Great hotel with kind and informative staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This is an excellent value for money hotel.Rooms are very clean and a fresh fruit basket is served every day.Had a little issue with our laundry,but the staff at the reception did deal with it correctly. No need to book the hotel airport transfer...only paid 200000 VND with a safe Mai Linh taxi.Did book the same cab for a trip to the Khai Dinh tombs for 260000 VND.A restaurant we can recommend when staying in Hue is "Les jardins de la carambole".Breakfast at the hotel was ok but can be improved.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Don't let the drive up to the hotel put you off, this is an excellent hotel.

We were welcomed by Julia to the hotel. She was so friendly and very informative, telling us about the local sights and pointing them out on the map for us while we sipped our welcome drinks. She then took us to our room and the staff had surprised us with cake, wine, flowers and balloons for our honeymoon - this was the best surprise we had out of all the hotels we stayed in for our honeymoon - thank you team for making it so memorable.

The rooms are excellent - everything that you need and all very clean.

Breakfast was included in our room rate and again this was excellent, friendly service and great food.

If you want fantastic customer service, excellent value for money and a modern room then book this hotel now. You won't regret it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed here for two nights. These are my findings:

POSITIVE:
* very friendly and helpful staff
* well equipped rooms (including PC)
* great breakfast
* welcome drink and fruit plate on arrival
* tour arrangement and bike, motorbike rental
* complimentary water, cafe and fruits in the room

NEGATIVE:
* house keeping should be improved (is presently not on the some level as hotel)
* not enough power outlets in the room
* poor quality toilet paper

Tip: Try to avoid room numbers X03. They are near the elevator and two windows are looking on the hallway (no clue why). During the night a lot of light is coming in.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: The lobby is impressive.when we arrived,we were warmly received, and we like the welcoming juice . The room is really nice and big, and the clerks are really warmhearted and caring, we booked a twin room, but when the clerk saw we have kid, he immediately gave us a bigger room. we had a very good experience in Hue. Strongly recommend it.it was a pity that we had only one night in here. We would have to stay longer.
h_title_comment: the hotel is really nice and we would like to stay here again if we come to this city.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: The hotel is a little difficult to find, but it's an absolute gem nestled away right off the busy streets of Hue. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable, and the staff are wonderfully welcoming and attentive. The hotel's very well situated, in walking distance of the river and a strip of great restaurants in the center part of town. The room was an absolute steal - fantastic value for a fantastic hotel. Highly recommend!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The service at this hotel was exceptional. All staff members were extremely cheerful and eager to assist. Hotel is centrally located with lots of restaurants nearby and rooms were clean and comfortable and tastefully decorated. Having a computer in the room was a real bonus with good internet speeds. Breakfast was good and more than adequate. This was a very budget friendly hotel and I would highly recommend it. Only problem we had was our room (close to lifts) had two windows with venetian blinds facing the interior hallway. This made the room very light at night and difficult for sleeping if you like a dark room. I would try to avoid these centre rooms.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Staying at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel has been a wonderful experience. It has an air of peace and tranquility about it. You are greeted at the door and asked to sit and wait with a welcome drink and plate of fruit while they go about checking you in. Your luggage is delivered to your room and they get it ready for your arrival. When you are ready, they take you up and go through the room with you. Everytime you come and go, the staff great you with smiles and ask if there is anything you need and how your day was. It was in a great location and close to many restaurants. Breakfasts were great and they love to pamper you. Would highly recommend staying here if you want to be treated to 5 star treatment at a great price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here in mid January 2014. The first thing is the staff are superb . Everyone of them was courteous ,friendly and eager to help. I have some involvement in the tourist industry (at home) and recognise how good these people are.
We were also met at the station even though the train from Hanoi was at least an hour late.
The rooms are very clean and breakfasts good.
I would recommend this hotel .
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
What an exceptional experience!
Firstly, being met at Hue station from my overnight train from Hanoi which was 90 minutes late by a beaming member of the Hotel staff with my pre-arranged transport, to being greeted in reception by attentive staff who were very keen to ensure that I got everything out of my stay in Hue, advising me about historical sites and facilities in the area.
My room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean, and well equipped (I have paid five times the room rate in other countries and been less impressed).
On my departure, all the reception staff came outside to wave me off - made me feel like royalty!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed there in September 2013 and everything was perfect. Staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Rooms are clean. Food was great. A bit of a distance to the main sights but it's worth the walk. Highly recommended!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Don't hesitate one second and book at Serene.

We stay at all sorts of hotels, from 5 stars to dormitories and I have to say we were really impressed with the quality here.

The room are spacious, the bed is of of a very good quality and it's even quiet at night. Everything is clean and services such as laundry are not overpriced.

But what was even more amazing was the quality of the service. We truly felt we were in a much higher ranged hotel. It's all in the little details such as the staff calling you by your name, offering information and making you feel welcome at all time.

We honestly don't think we have ever had such a service at this price. Anywhere.

Thanks to Julia, Ken and the rest of the team. Keep up the good work !
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: After traveling in Bangkok, Thailand, Hanoi, Vietnam we flew to Hue Vietnam and were referred to The Serene Palace Hotel. It is located very close to the City on an unusual alley but once you step in the Lobby you are in a heavenly place. Very, very, clean and beautifully designed with the friendliest people who will do any and most everything to make your stay pleasant. Beds are very comfortable, bathrooms as modern as you can imagine with rainhead shower, chairs and small table for a cup of coffee, fresh fruit and water complimentary everyday as well as wonderful breakfasts also complimentary. Staff is totally awesome: so kind and so sweet and really care about you and your stay. In room computer, free wifi, and much more. Love that place and those people. Balcony with chairs and table as well
h_title_comment: New Hotel Serene Palace in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
This hotel is tucked up a lane but is in a good location for bars and restaurants and tourist attractions. No safety concerns about getting to and from this hotel.

The room was comfortable and amenities were good: in room computer, wifi, kettle, complimentary fruit each day.

The bathroom was big enough.

The room and hotel were always clean.

Breakfast consisted of fresh fruit, cereals, baguettes and eggs cooked to order.

The staff were welcoming and helpful.

There is nothing to fault in this hotel.
h_title_comment: Would be happy to stay there again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We booked two deluxe double rooms and were more than impressed with the rooms and service. We arrived 2 hours before check in time and were greeted with happy smiling faces, welcome drinks, fruit tray and were checked in within half an hour. The staff speak very good English and were so helpful with directions, booking a tour and van to Hoi An.The hotel is very new and as beautiful as the pictures on the web site. The rooms, bathroom, breakfast were fabulous, and so clean. We wish we could have stayed longer. Our friends we were travelling with had an injury to his knee and was so glad to have an elevator. An amazing hotel in a central area, close to many good restaurants on trip advisor site. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.
h_title_comment: Amazing service, excellent rooms, great location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I'd like to recommend this hotel to travellers. The service was great. I arrived at Hue very early (at 9h00). They offered me the breakfast and could checkin at 9h00.
My suprise was to find out how beautiful and comfortable was the room.
Very good matress.
Enjoy this hotel and beautiful Hue!!
Gloria
h_title_comment: Stay at Hue Serene Palace Hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We booked a superior double and were ultra impressed with the hotel as soon as we arrived. The incredible staff met us with a fresh fruit plate, coffee and juice while they checked us in. We were also really impressed with the room; the decor is lovely, the bathroom is large and our view was really nice - the computer and robes in the room were fantastic additions as well. There was complimentary fruit and water in our room every day, and we could order coffee up to our room at any time. The beds were really comfortable and the shower was great.
The hotel's location makes it easy to get around and everything is within easy walking distance.
The included breakfast is delicious and varied. We had the beef pho every morning with extra orders of bacon on the side - so delicious. There's also a great assortment of fresh fruits, toast and fruit juices to have.
The staff are incredible here; it was only 3 nights but they made us feel like family. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and to make sure you're enjoying every moment of your stay with them.
We were really impressed with this hotel - at the end of a long day of touring it was nice to know we were returning to such friendly faces and wonderful hospitality.
We would definitely stay here again, we thought it was outstanding from start to finish.
h_title_comment: An awesome little oasis in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff can speak very good English, and warm hearted, they helped me a lot to help find the pharmacy as my child had a fever, help me to buy what I need, help me to do what I need. They are not only staff, but more like friends. Thanks them from my heart.
h_title_comment: good service，Iwould like to recommend others to this hotel.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This lovely hotel with very accommodating staff who speak English very well is a great place to stay in Hue. The room is very comfortable and spacious, the location was convenient and on a lane so not at all noisy. Close to many restaurants. The hotel can arrange bicycles to tour around the old city and can also arrange private or group tours to the local sites. We highly recommend this place.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Lovely rooms, great view of the city from the top floor and some lovely staff. Of all of the places we stayed in Thailand, Cambodia and Vietnam over five weeks this was our most extreme service experience unfortunately. We felt we had stepped out of adulthood into a land of overbearing, at times invasive, although always well-meaning staff. Probably fine to stay here if you like every little step being taken care of for you (including toasting your own toast or picking up your own baguette from the buffet) but we would probably choose somewhere with a slightly more normalised relationship between the staff and customers next time.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: You get something for your money (room is nice), the hotel is really new. But some of the staff members had problems understanding us, e.g. ordering more than one pancake in the morning turned out to be a difficult thing. Breakfast didn't meet my expectations. We had a power shortage for a whole morning and a loose connection on the computer in the room.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We only had the one night stay here and I wish I stayed more. Staff very welcoming and helpful, fruit and tea on arrival, they also organised a taxi for us from Danang Airport for $60 USD.
We pre-paid for our room through Agoda, staff members took us to check if the room was right for us, once we confirmed they then brought our bags up. The room was great, in a twin room with plenty of space and a big bathroom! We also had a wonderful view from the top floor.
Breakfast in the morning is fantastic, a lot of variety and all cooked so well!
Highly recommend staying here, very close to hub of Hue - down an ally way off one of there main but quiet streets.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: After a day of traveling to Hue on a Motorbike complete with flat tyre. When we arrived at the Serene Palace Hotel we received a wonderful welcome and offered fresh fruit and a welcome drink which was very much needed. For $25 per night you cant fault this hotel, very friendly staff (almost too friendly if you cant get such a thing!), they looked after the motorbike at no extra charge. Breakfast was a choice from the menu, but you were welcome to order multiple dishes. Very central location to Restaurants and bars. The only negative was it was a little hard to find at first especially when driving and not walking. Otherwise a wonderful hotel and a brilliant price.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: In terms of value and friendliness of the staff this hotel is hard to beat. Stayed there three nights at the end of December and absolutely enjoyed it. Of course not everything in this hotel is made of marble and rosewood. Our room also did not have much of a view. But what do you expect at those rates? And it was warm and cozy -- temperatures were quite low at the time of our stay. They kind of managed to make four stars out of two. Chances are that after a couple of days at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel everything else in Vietnam will seem somewhat overpriced. They do have a little markup on tours that you book through them and they will try to sell you one first thing after checking in, but we were very impressed by the fact that they changed our Dollars into Dong at the bank rate. A big thank you to the absolutely wonderful staff!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
For 40$ a night this was a great place to stay. Service was fantastic, free wifi and good location near tourist centre and 20 min walk to Citadel. Arranged driver for us to go to Hoi An for a reasonable price.

Rooms are clean, pretty new and come with computer in room. Is this a 5 star hotel? No. But for 40 $ are you getting very good value? I would say definitely. Would stay here again in a heartbeat
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The Hue Serene Palace Hotel was an incredible value, so I had no idea what to expect. We arrived on the overnight train from Hanoi exhausted (due to our battles with cockroaches on the train), and the staff instantly welcomed us with a free breakfast. Let me say right now that their breakfast spreads are consistently awesome. A choice of cook-to-order items like eggs or pho as well as a fantastic fruit spread including exotic fruits like dragonfruit and passionfruit (two of my personal faves). The waitstaff and front desk staff spoke much better English than almost everywhere we encountered in Vietnam.

Despite our early arrival and cheap rate, we were given a prompt check in as well an upgrade to a more spacious room. Awesome! The room is generally quite comfortable and spacious with a small balcony, very clean. The mattresses are a bit firm for American standards, which is quite comfortable for European standards. Rooms are fairly quiet for Vietnam standards, although there will be ambient noise from the outside most places. The hotel is centrally located and a short walk from the Perfume River.

I just want to say that this was hands-down about the best service I've experienced anywhere. The front desk went out of their way to be genuinely friendly and helpful. My friend was not feeling well and spent most of the day in bed. The front desk staff somehow remembered my name and asked several times how Mr. Andrew was doing. They arranged a very reasonably priced motorbike tour for me to the sights around town. When I returned, one of the friendly ladies at the front desk, got me a complementary fresh-squeezed fruit juice and sat down for a chat to ask about my day. Where does that happen! Awesome.

Like I said, the service made this hotel a shining spot in our visit to Vietnam at a reasonable price. We were sad to leave and subsequently found that this level of hospitality is not universal in Vietnam.

Just a note about Tripadvisor and Vietnam I'm adding to all my reviews:
Unfortunately, in my research for the trip, I discovered a huge number of fake reviews on TripAdvisor in Vietnam, a much higher fraction than in the west. They're mostly pro, but a few con from competitors. Take your time to read the quality reviews from reviewers with multiple reviews in multiple cities. Be wary of someone from London, England that has trouble subject-verb agreement or uses the word "staffs".
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Excellent location, extremelly nice and helpful staff. In our next hotel we already missed this incredible staff.
Very clean and nice room. Large bed. Very good choice for a breakfast.
Best choice for your money !
We stayed for two nights in january 2014.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel is amazing. It's friendly, clean, good location, great breakfast, has a spa in the room, balcony and even a computer in the room. Way above average.

Having said all that, the BEST thing about this place is the people who work here. Without exception they are lovely people but a particular mention for Laura, Julia, Emily and Jenny nothing was too much trouble and they were always happy to laugh with us.

Feeling very lucky that we have another night here :)

Linda and Terry, room 701
h_title_comment: I can't fault this hotel, highly recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This lovely new hotel was excellent value. Our room was quiet, very clean and very comfortable. The staff were so obliging and nothing was too much trouble. They gave great advice when I was looking for nearby restaurants. Hue is a lovely city and I am glad I chose to stay at Serene Palace.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The stayed there just for 1 night, all the staff are super nice and polite. Room is a 4 star room, very big, bed is confortable, shower great. I just don't give a 5 star review because They only serve breakfast, there is no room service.
I recomend this hotel to anyone going to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at Serene Palace for 3 nights in January. Clean rooms, amazing service & wide choice of breakfasts included for $25 a night. They organised laundry for us at $2 per kg and it was back within 24 hours. All the staff are really friendly & chatty. Just a great find. The only negative we found is it can be noisy in the morning with banging doors, but it just gets you up & exploring Hue so probably for the best!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Greeted by Ken on our first night, after the train was late, there was still a staff member waiting for us.
All of the staff were SO friendly, excessively helpful, thoughtful, polite & considerate!
Great breakfast.
So very pleased with our stay at Serene!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
I and my friends arrived in Hue so late and didn't have any plans. we asked taxi driver for cheap & good hotel, he don't know one. Then he call for his friends. we went to serene hotel, it located in small hotel, I think it's a guest house. but it's impressing. hotel so beautiful, with good location - in the center (it takes 15 walking - min to go to citadel), especially, staff always welcome us with friendly smile.
we have good trip in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I like everything in this hotel. The room was big and included balcony and add'l room. The entire building was nicely designed. Fruit was offered as I checked in and breakfast was great. Staff was extremely attentive
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Our 3 night stay at the Serene Palace Hotel was awesome. I think they may have solved the hard bed problem that seemed to be a concern. Our bed on the 7 th floor was the most compfortable bed we have had in Vietnam. It was not hard at all. I think the mattress cover now has a feathered quilt under it. The rooms are also super clean, spacious and bright. The breakfast can't get much better. Staff is also phenominal. Sweet little hotel, don't miss out.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were absolutely bowled over by the warmth of the welcome we received here from the second we arrived. Every member of staff went out of their way to help and give advice, even offering to go to the post office for us. The only reason we aren't able to give a 5 star rating is due to the lack of clothes storage in the room which in all other respects was beautiful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Young hotel and beautiful staff workimg in !!!
The help of Jenny, Julia, Ken, Se(i), Helen and the others i forgot the first name was really appreciated.
Thanks for the confortable and pretty decorated room !
An adress that mixed good quality, service and afordable price.
h_title_comment: Thank you for the warm welcome !!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel was great - the hospitality, the helping and smiling waiters, receptionists, the restaurants, and the rooms are excellent. The laundry costs only $2 per KG of clothes - what a great idea. More importantly, they took care of our vegetarian parents so well! I strongly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Brilliant hotel ! The staff were so friendly and extremely helpful! They couldn't go out of their way enough to make my stay more comfortable if they tried! They sorted out everything from scooters to directions and recommended a superb local restaurant. The rooms were clean and modern and the staff even bought up a noodle soup and egg rolls at 11pm when I was hungry even though they don't serve food in the hotel apart from breakfast. 5 minute walk from all the bars and restaurants , located In a little quite alley so it's nice and quite. Would defiantly go back there if I was to return to Hue :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Arriving fairly early in the morning by train in Hue we were first of all invited to have breakfast- which was just perfect. After that we could already check into our room, which was spacious and light. There was even a computer in the room.
The staff was extemely friendly and helpful, but not in an intrusive way at all. They were all excited when my daughter told them her name was Emily, because they also had an Emily in their team and the next morning Emily's breakfast pancake had her name written on in chocolate!

So: breakfast was a buffet with fresh fruit and toast, and you could order fresh juices, pancakes, omelettes etc as many as you liked.
The rooms were clean, light, with a little balcony even. We paid 40 EUR for the 4 of us with a double bed and 2 single beds, which was fantastic value for money.
It is very close to the restaurants and touristy shops, so at night you can walk.

Compred to the other hotels we've stayed at it is obvious that this hotel is managed very well and the staff does care about little things that just make the difference.
Without having stayed at their other hotels I presume with this management they must be just as good.
h_title_comment: best value for money on our trip
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We stayed for one night in a double room in this hotel.

The hotel is located down an alleyway (perfectly safe) and is central in Hue.

The room was excellent - very spacious and clean. We were even provided with an inroom computer. The bed as large, spacious and very comfortable. The in room safe also came in handy. The bathroom, again, was very spacious. The shower was powerful and always had hot water.

Breakfast has plenty of choice and you can order as much as you want. The staff are very friendly and always helpful. They ensured we knew how to get to the main tourist attractions and also we were ok with out onward travel.

Great service, great room, great location. I will definitely be staying here when I return to Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: Hidden in a little laneway and out of the way. Staff were excellent and remembered us and had conversations every time. This was lacking at other hotels. It is obvious they are trying hard. Shower rose was made for midgets, not sure why they water in bath wouldn't go down the drain but please, please remove the planks of wood from the beds. Previous reviewer commented on having laid on softer marble and he is right. Stay for a short time and your back should be OK. Excellent (9.7/10) hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This hotel, tucked down a quiet alley is a gem. We arrived tired, bike weary and in desperate need of some pampering. From the moment we arrived at the front door we were well looked after. Fresh fruit and juice magically appeared from the friendly and helpful staff and before we knew it we were in our very comfortable and spacious room overlooking the city. The shower was without doubt the best we have experienced so far in Vietnam, plenty of pressure and hot water. The bed IS hard, but for those of you who sleep on Tempura or memory foam you will find it just right. Breakfast is ordered from a menu and served promptly. This small hotel prides itself on service and friendliness and I would definitely stay there again. The location is great, just a short walk to cafes, shops and the night market. Value for money I say.
h_reviewer_address: Las Navas de la Concepcion, Spain
h_title_comment: A great place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The hotel is in a great location with plenty of restaurants/shops nearby. Staff are extremely friendly and very attentive.

I can't fault the hotel at this price point but those beds.....I've slept on softer marble rocks!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Perfect hotel. Amazing staff the helped us in everything, Wonderful breakfast and wellcome. Big clean and beautiful rooms.
Everything perfect.
Todo perfecto. Inmejorable. Recomendado 100% habitaciones preciosas limpias y grandes. Personal fantastico y calida bienvenidA
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
We stayed at Serene Palace for 4 nights just before Christmas and we had an amazing time there.The room for so clean and spacious, everything was just perfect for us.The staff couldn't do enough for us and made our stay extra special.Even provided brollies for us when we were going out as the weather wasn't at its best . They even ordered a meal for us from a local restaurant, which was delivered to our room on a tray! Would definitely recommend this hotel
when staying in Hue, we would certainly return there.Deserves an other star!!
Thank you for a wonderful holiday.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were traveling almost at only 5 stars hotels in Vietnam, but after reading reviews for Serene Palace hotel, we decided to try this, and we were happy that we did. This hotel is situated perfect in the city, the service is in top, the cleaning is in top… actually we can not say anything bad about the hotel. The first day I complained about the bed, and the day after they had bought a new wonderful madras for me. The price is also more than fair (including breakfast, which was very delightful too). Our best recommends to everyone - don't go anywhere else in Hue.
h_title_comment: Book this hotel if you stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I recently spent 4 days at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel and can't say enough good things about them. The staff was very helpful and extremely friendly. The rooms were very nice and definitely very good value for the price. The hotel was much better than another hotel I stayed at in HCMC that cost me 5 times as much.

Besides the great deal, what made the stay for me was the staff. They were very helpful and very friendly. They helped me arrange a couple of tours via email before I even arrived and they always greeted me with a warm smile. Somehow they all even knew my name before I'd even met them! The thing that really impressed me was how they helped me find things to do after I had canceled a tour due to some stomach issues. What started out as a bad day ended up turning into the best two days of my entire trip. Without their recommendations and help that day my trip would not have been as great as it was.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: All of the small details make this an amazing place and a highly recommended place to stay. We enjoyed everything--From the delicious welcome fruit plate, beautiful rooms with many nice extras, filling and good breakfast, and helpful staff that all spoke wonderful English. I might recommend asking around to different places for day trips as we ended up paying a lot more than if we had shopped around and once the tour is booked you've agreed to pay 50% of cancellation fee. Nonetheless, our private car trip to Bach Ma national park was one of our favorite Vietnam experiences.
h_title_comment: no complaints, just complements for this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We are a family of 4 (2 children). We arrived at the railway station and met by an employee who escorted us to the hotel. The train was very late (as usual) and the employee was waiting for some hours and was extremely friendly and helpful. We arrived at the Hotel to be treated to hot drinks and made very welcome. The exceptional service continued right throughout our 4 day stay and made us feel very special. The food was excellent, and lots of it! Ms Helen and Ms Mary were fantastic as are all the staff. We inquired with Ms Mary where we could buy a cake for our son's birthday. Ms Mary said "leave it with me". Later that day we returned to the hotel and again offered drinks. When we entered our children's room, much to our surprise were greeted with staff singing happy birthday and the room decorated with balloons and a large "HAPPY BIRTHDAY" spelt out on the bed in lollies. Ms Mary also supplied the great cake! During our 4 weeks in Vietnam, this was by far the best hotel we stayed in. Many 5 star hotels could learn a lot from this establishment.Thank you to all staff. If we could give it more stars, we would!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Centrally located in Nguyen Cong Tru street, which has many hotels and restaurants, about 25 minutes' walk from the Imperial City - a good location. The Serene Palace is not a big fancy hotel, but it is new and the staff are trying their very best to make your stay there a good one.The blistering service smiles may be a bit extreme, but they really are very helpful indeed.
The rooms are good too - airy and beautifully decorated, and spotlessly clean.
Negatives? Only minor things: the restaurant only serves breakfast, so if you want a snack at other times, you have to go out; the breakfast is fine, but the menu not that extensive. Also, the hot water runs to cold when the bath (which is a Jacuzzi!) is half full.
But for the price, this has to be one of the best bargains I've seen. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Upon arriving from our transfer from da nang to the hotel (US$60 organised by the hotel a day ahead), the owner came out and thanked us for choosing his hotel.

We were then asked to take a seat and 'would u like tea or coffee?' Emily (staff member) then bought hot tea with fruit... Including passion fruit! Emily was so lovely. Made conversation, jokes and made us laugh.

Emily took us to our room - 7th floor. Amazing views, 2 large beds, big shower with detachable head and rain shower head(!), computer with Internet (fast as well as wifi), tv with English stations and asked 'is this ok?' WOW!

Then we visited a vegetarian cafe and their directions were perfect.

Breakfast in the morning was the best we've had all around south east Asia. Eggs, pho, bacon, pancakes, fruit, tea, coffee... And you don't chose one from the menu - chose as many as u like! I suggest the omelet with everything and then pancakes with banana and honey, then add passion fruit to them.

I cannot speak highly enough about this place. I know it's a bit more than the usual $10 or less backpackers but the breakfast and hospitality make it worth spending a touch more.

I will definitely be staying here again. If only all staff over Asia were as kind and happy as the people at Serene!
h_title_comment: The only place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: I stayed at serene hotel for 2 nights. I was greeted with breakfast as they knew I had come on the night train. After this was given a map and taken through tour options. Everything was fantastic about this hotel, from the staff, to the food options and rooms. I will be staying at this hotel if I am ever back in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Wonderful and clean, staff were amazing and friendly.. Can't say nicer things about the wonderful service that was provided. Not to mention the amazing fuss they made for us since we were there on our honeymoon. Highly recommended!
h_title_comment: Best value for money hotel we found in Vietnam..
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: After riding our bike under the pouring rain for a few hours, we couldn't have a better welcome. The staff was very kind and friendly. The room was magnificent and quiet. Great bathroom with steamy hot water. We felt refreshed in no time. Pleasantly located away from the main roads, the hotel is located near restaurants and shopping area. The market is not far and the river a across the avenue. The price is reasonable. Very worth a try!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We are on our honeymoon and were passing through Serene Palace for our last night in in Hue after a few days at a hotel at Thuan An beach because of an early flight, and after only a few hours here we wish we had stayed at Serene Place the whole time. Service and the rooms are impeccable. We mentioned our honeymoon in passing (we weren't staying long and didn't want to make a big thing of it) and came to find our room decorated to celebrate our nuptials. The only thing I can find to complain about is the location being a bit off the beaten path, but it's still walking distance to the Citadel and the main sights in Hue. I can't praise this hotel and its staff enough (especially Emily). Keep up the amazing work, you are a model for hospitality service in Vietnam.
h_title_comment: Deserving of it's #1 and amazing value for money.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: I spend my Christmas in Vietnam travelling from south to north. This hotel is definitely my best memorable one. Room is clean. People can speak excellent English. And they have good manner and always prepared to help
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel offers what many 5 star hotels can not get right. Early check ins without fuss, free cooked breakfast if you arrive in the morning, impressive birthday celebrations without telling them, seemless organisation of trips and arrangements without hazzle, smiles and service all over. The hotel is excellent value for money, it offers all what you need in the rooms and the PCs with quick online access is great too. The hotel is in the middle of the tourist district, walking to the citadel is possible, but takes around 30 minutes. We can highly recommend this place and congratulate the staff of being such nice hosts. Thank you again.
h_title_comment: Brilliant service, excellent value for money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Small cosy hotel with big rooms. The staff were attentive and helpful. I love the breakfast. Not the typical buffet spread but eat what you order. The only inconvenient is hotel is located in a small lane and it seem many drivers were either not familiar with it or the vehicle is not able to pass through the lane. Do also take note if you are going on a wet season. The lane can be very muddy and uncomfortable. Other than that, the price and the level of service is something I strongly recommend people to consider.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
The staff were very good in this hotel. No complaints at all.
However watch out for taxi drivers especially from the train station. They take you to a different hotel and tell you its the Hue Serene Palace. FYI it is half way down a narrow street so taxi driver may just drop you outside the entrance to the street. Best advise to deal with this is to downloaded an application called offmaps2 which you can use on your phone without data roaming to locate where you are in relation to the hotel. It also helps with showing you if the taxi driver is taking you for the scenic tour rather than the fastest route to places.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Hue Serene Palace Hotel is probably an excellent option in Hue because it has a good location, the rooms are big, the service very very friendly and helpful, and breakfast is one of the best in Central Vietnam (cooked food rather than buffet, although you can order as much as you want). Like all small hotels in Vietnam, there is only one lift, and the best rooms are on the top floor. During my stay, there was a power failure, but only temporary, and luckily I was in my room. The only complaint I have is that the hotel is located on a dirt lane. During the wet season (which is very often in Hue), the lane is muddy so that you have to avoid puddles of wet ground. Hotel would lend you an umbrella. There are lots of cafes on this dirt lane so you're in coffee culture in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
I stayed in the Hue Serene after staying at the Serene in Hanoi and was equally as impressed with the level of service and friendliness of the staff. The entire staff went out of their way to ensure my stay in Hue was the best as it could be. They were very helpful in arranging my tours and activities and extremely accommodating - especially Ms. Jenny who I corresponded with via email for days before my arrival.

The hotel is fairly new so the rooms are very modern and a good size. My room was very clean, well maintained and comfortable. I also enjoyed the complimentary fresh fruit. The breakfast selection was very good (mixture of local food and Western) and they encouraged me to offer as much off of the menu as I wanted, plus there was a nice selection of fresh fruit and breads. The location of the hotel was well situated and easy to navigate. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed for two nights in Hue and the hotel was fantastic. Our experiences of the service in Vietnam was good already but the staff at Serene Palace took it to another level. They were very polite, extraordinarily helpful and went out of their way to ensure we had a memorable stay. I would struggle to name a place where the level of service among all staff that we encountered that would be consistently so good. The breakfast included had a good range of both Western and Vietnamese choices, as well as a wide variety of fresh fruits and juices. The rooms itself were very comfortable and well furnished, with a desktop computer in the rooms. The windows were double glazed too which meant the rooms were very quiet. This hotel was remarkably good value for money (around $25USD a night for a twin room) and would really be one of the best hotels we stayed in. Location wise it was close to the main eating streets, although a little way from the river itself. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
One of the best Hotels during my recent trips around Vietnam. There are 5 Hotels in the Country (a chain)- this one is the best. Extremly friendly and knowledgable and helpful Staff. The Hotel is very clean and serve a great breakfast.
The rooms have Windows and are good sized with good beds and quite. The Location is perfect
and easy to walk from there around the City and sight-seeing places.
The Overall experience was fantastic and should I go back to Hue this will be the place to stay.
Ask for Mary- a professional Public Relations Manager who will make your day.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We had a 3 night stay and the staff was so attentive. They helped us for every little thing. Great advices and the breakfast is delicious. Rooms are spacious and come with a good computer.
Do not hesitate to ask them to book tours or taxi for you.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Really lovely hotel in Hue. The staff was so helpful. We were only in town for a very short time and they helped us map out the best way to see all the sites we were hoping to fit in. The location is very convenient to the Citadel and night market. We highly recommend this hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed in Hue Serene Palace Hotel for 5 nights and the only word to describe it is amazing. Clean and well equipped rooms, professional services, friendly staffs. Very well done, Hue Serene Palace Hotel team!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Nothing too much trouble attitude taken to a higher level..
Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Great breakfast with plenty of fruit, eggs, toast, jam and tea/ coffee.
The staff is super friendly ( they want the guests to have an enjoyable stay and they are almost too attentive).
I would highly recommend this hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Excellent hotel, very helpful and attentive staff, perfect location. Big rooms, good breakfast. We will certainly stay there the next time. We recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Hue in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Have to admit to being a little disheartened when arriving in Hue - the weather was awful - cold and raining so probably didn't get the best view of this coming in.

The Serene Palace had arranged our transfer from Da Nang airport - they arrived on time and we had a good journey to the hotel - cost about $60 US. On arrival we were greeted with fresh fruit and tea and one of the staff came over and went into some detail about the tours on offer. I don't think they are trying to do a hard sell by any means but could definitely understand previous negative reviews of this because after a long journey you probably just want to get to your room!

When we did eventually get to the room we were pleased with it - it was a really good size - very large bed and everything you would want in it (apart from breakfast tea and milk!). The mini bar was adequately stocked and it was relatively cheap.

It was a good sized bathroom with a rainforest shower although the hot water does run out if you're in there too long!

Breakfast was ok, the staff are very attentive and will be with you straightaway to take your order. I thought the Pho was pretty poor compared with many that I have had in Vietnam, so on the second day I had scrambled eggs which were fine. My boyfriend had the pancakes which were tasty despite being a little crunchy! You can also help yourself to fresh fruit of which there is much variety.

The hotel is in a good location - it's on a little alley where if you turn left coming out of the hotel within 2 minutes you're in the areas where the bars and restaurants are. The DMZ bar is a popular one with Westerners and I really enjoyed it there. Great place for a beer, you can watch the football and the food is pretty good too. The hotel also recommended that we went to the Golden Rice restaurant which we did - nice cute place (especially with the doors shutting out the cold!) - food was so / so but pleasant enough.

The hotel is also a 20 minute walk from the Imperial City - it's really worth going to this (even in the rain!) - take a Rough Guide or Lonely Planet with you and it will give you more than enough information on the buildings there - plan for a good half day. The market is about 10 minutes from there and it's huge!! You'll be able to buy pretty much anything.

We booked a trip to the DMZ with the hotel. This was a full day tour - our guide could have done with speaking better English - it felt like the driver had a better grasp of what was going on and he was definitely more entertaining. However - it was a good tour - you get to cross the bridge which was the North / South divide, you go to the Vinh Moc Tunnels (which I thought were far better than the Cu Chi in HCM) and to the Quang Tri Citadel (which is basically being rebuilt). You also go to many 'memory monuments' with accompanying museums which talk about the American War (can start to feel a little propaganda-ish)The tour cost $95 with the guide.

And then finally - the hotel booked our car for the journey to Hoi An and this was brilliant. Cost $65 and we were on the road for around 5 hours stopping on Lang Co beach, crossing the Hai Van pass and spending a really good hour at Marble Mountain - I would definitely recommend you doing this with the hotel.

Would give a special mention to Judy/Julie )?) who was brilliant as front of house. My boyfriend was pretty sick on the day we arrived and she was really good with getting him ginger tea (apparently good for sickness!) and checking constantly that he was getting better.

I am pretty sure that if the sun is shining Hue is a wonderful place - and I would say that the Serene Palace would be a very good, and cheaply priced hotel to stay at.
h_title_comment: It's the staff that make this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Smooth check in, competently done by friendly (effusive?) staff. The room was spacious, comfortable with a huge, firm (too firm?) bed, efficient aircon and a window that actually opened (other hotels take note - not all guests have lemming-like tendencies). Bathroom also good, large walk in shower, which suffered from a loss of hot water during one shower. Informed front desk staff on check out who were aghast and promised to sort it out. Breakfast good for the grade - a mix of buffet and some choices served by the same charming staff. In all a great stay and for the price, you really cannot go wrong. Would return.

Recommended.
h_title_comment: Friendly staff, comfortable room, well priced
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I stayed at the Hue Serene Palace for two nights in room 403. This is a solid three star hotel, but there are definitely things that could be improved.
Pros:
*The hotel is new, so rooms are fresh and quite clean.
*Bathroom is big, great water pressure and hot water; beware getting out of the tub - I stepped out the first time and it was a longer way to the floor than I expected. I climbed out after that.
*Definite A for effort for the staff - there are a lot of them and they try very hard; they are also very receptive to feedback.
*Price is really good for the quality of room - I paid only $25 on a special "just opened" promotion.
*Area is decent, only about 10 minutes walking to the key streets with restaurants and shops.
*They recommended a great motor bike tour to see key sites because I only had one day in Hue: this was an excellent experience.
Cons:
*I arrived at night and the staff that checked me in did so efficiently, but their English wasn't great so they couldn't answer some of my other questions; the staff the next morning had better English and provided excellent recos about a gym and a tour to key sites.
*Breakfast is so so in terms of food quality, but again staff get A for effort on service.
*Beds are incredibly hard - like wooden board hard; also, I had an issue with some bugs found on the mattress cover (NOT bed bugs, but still unsettling) - the staff came up right away to address the issue and sent housekeeping to completely strip and remake the bed with new linens, mattress and duvet covers.
*Perfume scent is very strong in the detergent they are using on towels and robes; this should be changed if possible.
*Plugs are really inconvenient - one at one end the room by the chair, and one hidden behind the mattress. I had to pull the mattress out to be able to charge stuff.

I was very honest with my feedback, and the staff credited me one night of my stay as a result of the bug inconvenience. I appreciated the gesture for sure.
I think the property itself is a good solid choice for clean, new, mid range accommodations, and amenities are decent for a three star; once the staff iron out some kinks, I think the overall experience will go from average/good to excellent.
h_title_comment: Pretty good, need to iron out some kinks
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: I stayed three nights at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel and from the moment you step into the hotel you are treated like a VIP. What more do you want....a 4 star boutique hotel with a huge fabulous room - the bed fit for an Emperor - Internet everywhere, all you can eat breakfast and a thousand smiles every time you step into the lobby. Make the most of their opening rates that are incredible value for money!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
