After a long day travelling we arrived at Serene in Hue and had the warmest welcome from Julia and Emily. The staff were so so friendly and our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We only had one night and then had to travel to Hoi An the next and Julia helped us to arrange transport and suggested the best routes for us, it was perfect and so glad we followed her advice. The only reason I didn't give this hotel a 5 is cause I thought it was a little noisy out in the corridor and I could hear the family
In the room next door but all minor to an overall lovely experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very nice and new hotel, with warm and friendly staff. The room was big, clean and cosy. The breakfast was delicious and teh guest can choose from several options. The Hotel is a little bit tricky to find but when you are there it is one of the best Hotels in Hue.
h_title_comment: Very nice and new hotel, with warm and friendly staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed at the Hue Serene for one night in order to see the main sights in Hue. The staff here was the friendliest we encountered. Upon arrival we were given juice and fruit and they showed us a map and gave a little introduction of the town. The bed was a little firm but we didn't mind because it was huge! I think it was a king size bed. It also had a really nice large walk in shower. Pretty much everything you could want in a hotel: spotless, large room, nice shower, close to central area of town. The bonus is that the staff is SO friendly and polite!
h_title_comment: Friendliest staff!! Plus large room and good location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed for one night on the strength of the great reviews and the hotel was as good as everyone says! We emailed to be collected from the airport and even though we landed late, the transfer was smooth. Glad we had as we would not have been able to tell the taxi driver where the hotel is as down a tiny, un-made up side road with few signs so recommend arranging with hotel transfers from airport. We had a huge room & it was very comfortable with wifi, fridge, fruit, t/c even free toiletries included. The staff were very helpful & arranged laundry cleaning plus a car & driver to Hoi An, all of which can be paid for by credit card.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Great service from staff from check-in to check-out - they really go the extra mile with their friendliness; helpful with arrangements for trips and local tips; great breakfasts; very clean; easy to walk to river but off the main tourist strip
h_title_comment: an excellent choice for Hue accommodation
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: moderate price and good service is what I'm getting at here ... amazing! 'll come back here if I need to stay close to this place. it meets the needs gentle, sweetest. food does not have that much ...
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Great service from the staff who had contacted me before our trip to check if we required pick up from airport or train station. We arrived early in the morning (8am) the staff offered us breakfast while they check the staus of our room and checked us in early which was greatly appreciated after our overnihgt train journey. Rooms were huge with a balcony over looking the city, plenty of extra facilitys like a laptop in the room. Good location and great value. Wish we had stayed longer than one night!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Today I had a wonderful experience in Hoi An-Day Spa.
Wow. Super affordable for very nice rooms.
I do not think you will find a better hotel than this in Hue for around $25 per night.
Excelent Service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: This review has been a long time coming (we traveled in mid-August 2013) but I really wanted to write it. We spent a delightful time in Hue. From helping us find alternative accommodation for our one night early arrival (as they were fully booked) to excellent facilities, the Serene Palace Hotel contributed to our memorable stay in Hue. All the staff were excellent and the complimentary breakfast was much appreciated. Although situated on a side road, it was easy to get to the main road to find a taxi (or simply walk to a nearby restaurant). I cannot speak highly enough of this new (at the time) hotel. I would recommend it to families, couples and single travelers. If you have children, don't be afraid to ask the front desk staff when they feed the fish in the fountain as they'll gladly allow the children to help.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hue Serene Palace. It is a new hotel and so everything is clean and new, the rooms are large and well furnished and having access to a computer in the room is very handy. The breakfast was a wide spread and very tasty, with buffet fruit and all you can eat ala carte menu. The staff were all very pleasant and welcoming. The only downside to this hotel is its location, quite a walk to the ancient citadel.

The staff went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible, initially we were booked as a party of 3 in a twin room and a trundle bed, but the twin room was quite small so free of charge they upgraded us to the much larger family room with 2 queen beds and they put another trundle in their, making it very comfortable. Went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
On our honeymoon, they decked room with roses, rose petals, big bunch of flowers, bottle of red wine and a cake!! Staff were so friendly, so welcoming, they could not have been nicer!! Helen and Emily at the front desk were an absolute pleasure to deal with!

Top marks for this hotel!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Arter a pretty Rocky start in Hanoi we found a super good deal at this hotel and decided to book it. The Staff is Very atentive and nice, Very clean and nice rooms. They helped us book a private driver to take us around the City who Was Very profesonal. All in all a Very good hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Wow. Super affordable for very nice rooms. The staff arranged everything including day tours and transport to the Danang Airport, and you just charge it to your room so you could pay for everything at once. The staff remembered our names and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. We arrived cold and wet from a motorcycle tour, and they allowed us to immediately get to a hot shower before getting down the business of checking in. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and big, and the beds were cozy.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We arrived by train and took a metered taxi to the hotel (cheaper than provided by hotel). Fresh fruit and juice was offered and Hue attractions/map were explained.We rented a Scooter through the hotel to explore the tombs and pagodas around the city. We booked the transfer to Hue Airport through Vietnam Airlines (50.000 VND per person and pick up at the hotel) and went direct, as no other guests.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I do not think you will find a better hotel than this in Hue for around $25 per night.
I have no complaint about this hotel. Is new, the service is like a 5 star hotel, the breakfast is included, the room big and clean..what else.. Is all what you need to spend a good stay in Hue.
Do not be afraid when you acces to the main road, is narrow and a little bit dark at night but it is 100% safe to walk around.
Is located near restaurants, shoping areas, spa's and just 15 minutes away fron the airport.
Just two aditional important comments. Walking around the city I lost my lauggage lock key. The hotel team solved the issue and even they gave me a new lock for free to be replaced. Next day i did the checkout before my breakfast. They approach to me and gave me back my ipad charger that I forgot in my room.
The service and hotel was superb. That is way it has all those excellents comments on here.
Thanks Hue Serene Palace Hotel for the great hospitality, you really make me feel at home.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Had a wonderful stay at the hue Serene Palace...dont let its location deter you (down a dang alley way) this place is spot on. Their staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms were some of the biggest we've stayed in. Great location...within walking distance to the Perfume River and a lot of restaurants. Rent a motorbike for the day for $8 and have a blast cruising around the city. Would highly recommend this place to anyone!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
staff very helpful and friendly
when arriving we got first a breakfast even before the check in.
everyone is helping quickly to address all your needs : travel booking, visit of the city, taxi etc
everything is done with smilling
the hotel is new , very clean has excellent rooms and well equiped bathrooms
good value for the money
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Nice new hotel. Solid rooms, lots of backpackers. Service was very friendly and effective. Nice check in process providing fruits and drink.

They set up cars and tours for us with good coordination.

The breakfast had good fruit and hot food options. My wife liked breakfast here more than at the Park Hyatt Saigon. Laundry service was cost effective and quick.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: It's a new and modern hotel with great friendly staff. Upon my arrival on overnight train, they offer me breakfast while they check-in my room. I'm grateful for the early check-in so I could get some rest. For the price I paid, it was value for money :)
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 1 night after arriving on the SE1 sleeper from Hanoi, a 13 hour journey may I add.We were shattered and bit delirious after our journey, the taxi took us down some back streets and we were a bit concerned as to where the hotel was. We needn't have worried as from the moment we arrived at the hotel there was a whirlwind of geniunely kind and helpful people, they offered us a free breakfast which was delicious, it wasn't a 'choose 1 item from the menu' deal, we could order as much as we wanted. Anyway, as we were short on time we wanted to fit in a visit to the DMZ as well as visit the main attraction in Hue, the citadel. Within an hour, a driver and a guide had been organised for us along with the assistance of exchanging our train tickets for later train the next day so we would have time to visit the citadel. All with, and I'll say this again, with genuine care and kindness.
After our excellent and informative visit to the DMZ, we finally checked into our room which was extremely great value for money, it came with two double beds, a computer, water, fruit and was clean and spacious, a very high standard. If you are considering somewhere to stay in Hue, I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. You will not be disappointed!
h_title_comment: Best value Hotel, Extremely friendly, helpful genuine staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel completely new and very modern. We arrived early in the morning and were completely exhausted after a 14 hour train ride. The staff had a warm welcome for us and even offered us free breakfast! They also offered us a wonderful motorbike tour with hue motorbike trail private day tours!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The staff were very helpful without being pushy. We were stunned with our room - for $25US it was unbelievable value even for Vietnam! It was huge, clean, big bathroom, PC - even bathroom scales provided to keep an eye on our weight gain from all the wonderful Vietnamese food! Easy access to restaurants and attractions. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends.
h_title_comment: Best value hotel of our holiday in Vietnam & Cambodia
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Brand new hotel, good location. Excellent service and nice breakfast. Would definitely recommend in terms of value for money. Only slight complaint would be the bed was rock solid- literally no give, however they give you two quilts so I slept on one of them and slept well. The staff are really helpful in providing maps and organising tours, however we did the boat tour to the tombs and citadel and didn't really enjoy it. You end up being captive audience for sales pitch from the owner of the boat and felt uncomfortable because it was jut the two of us. You can have lunch on the boat for the journey back from the tomb had this been explained to us we might have had it but it was over priced and the menus handed to us straight away and we'd only just eaten breakfast so were confused! Then an array of items were put in front of us and we thought if we brought something that would take the pressure off but no on the return journey we had to say no several times to the clothes they were trying to sell us. I think if we'd known what to expect it wold have been fine, the owners of the boat were only trying to make a living and it was a good hours journey to the tomb so worth the $35 tour price but just be aware! Overall great hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Beautiful property in a good location for accessing the local township. Rooms are very nice and spacious with all the mod cons and the bonus of a spa bath! After all our exploring this was a delight. Staff were very courteous and greeted us with a welcome drink! All in all a very nice experience, would definitely recommend.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We stayed here for three nights in November 2013. Convenient location (though the street itself leaves something to be desired) and good promo rate. The room was very nice, clean, and spacious, with nice linens. The bed was a little firm for my preference, and when I mentioned it they put an extra duvet under the bottom sheet which really did make a difference. You can probably find a similar room for less money, but where this hotel really shines is how they will go above and beyond in terms of service. We mostly dealt with Miss Emily, who is a total delight, and Miss Helen, very adept on the computer, but the entire staff seems genuinely motivated in doing whatever they can to make your stay enjoyable and problem-free. One area that could use some fine-tuning is the breakfast, which offers some items to be cooked to order from a menu and other items that are laid out on buffet-type tables, but it was a little unclear as to whether it was meant to be a self-serve buffet. A minor point and one that I am sure will be worked out as the staff matures.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Don't be put off when you head down the alley Serene Palace is located on for the first time, it is no reflection of the hotel its self!! Its a brand new hotel with large spacious rooms and bathrooms, with a lovely lobby and dining area. And the staff are extremely helpful and friendly! We booked their airport up and drop off, and arranged a car tour during our stay all through the hotel is was perfect, hassle free, easy and the tour was great!!
We enjoyed our stay at the Serene Palace very much!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Brandnew hotel. Very clean, spacious and nice rooms. As we still had the promo rates this was very good value for the money. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Breakfast was nice but could maybe use some more finetuning. Location good but in Hue it's nice to rent a motorbike (available at the hotel) to go and see the city and the surrounding tombs.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We had two very nice nights in this great hotel with a cordial, wonderful staff and brandnew, well furnished rooms. The hotel staff welcomed us with a fresh fruit juice, fresh fruits and a map with recommendations where to go and what to see. No matter what you need, everybody is keen to help you. The staff seem to remember the name of every guest and the atmosphere is very personal. Especially Emily and Ken helped us to plan our stay in Hue (we booked with them a day trip to the tombs with our personal boat and a tasty lunch on the boat - freshly prepared from the mother-in-law of the boat driver). We could plan the boat trip individually according to our needs and it went well (with our personal souvenir market on the boat ;)...).
Unfortunately due to our tough travel schedule we just stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Next time in Hue we will definitely stay with you again!
Everything here fulfills the needs of the guests (rich breakfast for every taste, personal computer in the room and a lovely staff)!
h_title_comment: This was the best hotel during our Vietnam trip.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: An excellent hotel in the city centre. Very friendly and helpful staff. A clean spacious comfortable and well equipped room. Clean ensuite bathroom with good shower. Reasonably priced mini-bar. A good breakfast with a good choice menu; hot dishes and fresh fruit buffet. Good value.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This was probably the only hotel in our three week long trip to Vietnam that I had zero complaints about. Sure, you are used to little things for every place, and I have given five stars where there were small issues, but these people really have it down - it is clean, beautiful, nice bathrooms, great breakfast, excellent service (we got the room we requested with no battling for it, two keys, etc.). A woman by the name of Catina was particularly genuine and darling, I really enjoyed meeting her.
I will also add that I thought the location was perfect. It is a very small town, and I prefer not to be in the most touristy area - yet, still close. Beautiful views, too.

Btw, the old lady's restaurant exactly across the road from the end of the hotel alley has excellent excellent food.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Serene Palace was the best hotel we stayed on our tour in Vietnam. We were sad, that we had just planed one night there. The hotel is a perfect location to stay much longer. The pick up service from the station was perfect. The welcome was very friendly. We felt very comfortable... Thank You
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We arrived early in the morning after an over night train, tired and hungry. The wonderful staff offered us breakfast straight away (unexpected) and saw us to our room immediately after. We were so grateful!

The rooms were spacious and contained everything we needed, great value for money. Mary at reception showed us a map of the town and nearby sights along with suggestions on how we could structure the time we had in Hue. Mary also booked a driver for our onwards trip - I can't thank her enough for her friendliness and help, Mary was our favorite part of Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The best hotel during our three weeks travelling in Vietnam. All staff very helpfull, attentive. Newly decorated rooms, wonderful service, delicious breakfast. In this hotel we ordered a private car to transfer us from Hue to Hoi An with making stops for visiting the Museum of Cham Sculptures in Danang, Lang Co beach, the Marble Mountains. Highly recommend!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My friend and I checked in the hotel on 22/11 and checked out on 24/11. We have a late check in due to the flight delay from Saigon. We had a warm welcome from Ken upon check in. The room is spacious, clean and comfortable with large bathroom.

We were greeted by the friendly and cheerful staffs during the breakfast.

I would like to extend my gratefulness to both Helen and Si whom provided friendly advice and excellent service during our short term stay in the hotel.

If I have an opportunity to visit Hue again, I would certainly stay the hotel again. It is certainly deserves 5 star rating in tripadvisor.

Regards,
Frank Tan
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel is just great. Very new and modern with everything as it should be. From the moment of arrival the staff were so welcoming and attentive, even presenting me with personalised cake and flowers on my birthday. Special mention to Emily and Si on the reception desk. Great value for money, the room was the best I've ever had at a hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for you stay in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 3 days and had a great time. From our airport pick up to our departure the staff went out of there way to make our stay memorable. Our room was spacious and spotless and the location on a quiet lane was great. Sami , Sabrina and the other girls on the staff were gracious hosts. Have Sami make you a glass of Vietnamese iced coffe . You can't beat this place for the price or service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
The rooms are clean and comfortable.

The location is ok but could be better.

The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and continually bent over backwards to assist us.

Special thanks to Jennifer and Ken for organising the special surprise for my newly engaged friends.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We stayed for three nights in the Serene Palace Hotel. It was spotless clean, the hotel still has that new look about it. The location handy for shops, restaurants, and the river. the room had a large comfortable bed and large bathroom, with fluffy bathrobes, a godsend in the monsoon weather we had while there, and the staff were genuinely friendly. The breakfast good. Overall a great hotel is excellent value. Could highly recommend it. The only minor inconvenience is the back ally access to the front of the hotel - Potholes, debris, builders rubble, puddles etc., and it's still worth it.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Very good service. Very good looking rooms with an excellent hygiene. This all for an excellent price.
The only not so good thing was the location. It's in an back ally and we had some trouble finding it a couple of times.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and the staff. Breakfast was great, we were always stuffed when we left to explore the city. The rooms were large and spotless. The bathroom was great. We asked them if they had room for us for an additional night and they put us in a top floor balcony room with a whirlpool tub.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We were lucky and were upgraded to a family room which was great for two of us! We had a lovely bathroom everything is really clean and modern, staff are lovely, very friendly and helpful they helped us book our onward travel to Hoi An. It is in a strange location but within easy walking distance to restaurants and bars. Breakfast was OK enough choice. This is in the same chain as the Holiday Diamond Hotel Hanoi. They have a great formula and treat guests as special individuals. Would recommend both hotels.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
This hotel was built in July so everything is still in excellent shape. Got a taxi from the train station as we had traveled down from Hanoi. Initially I was a bit disappointed as the hotel is located down a alley that does get muddy when it rains and the exterior is very plain.

However all that changed once we got inside the hotel, we were welcomed by fresh fruit drinks and warm towels.

We stayed in a Superior room which was very spacious. It included a pc and flat screen tv with Vietnamese and English channels.

It is very close to the river and central Hue. Lots of restaurants/shops within 5-15 minute walk including two recommended restaurants by Lonely Planet.

The staff are extremely helpful and nice, after checking in we went out for lunch and the staff immediately gave us umbrellas as it looked like it might start to rain. About 2 minutes later it started to really come down and we were thankful for the umbrellas.

When we came back from sightseeing for the day, staff would offer us drinks and towels to freshen up before heading back to our room. Staff's level of English is pretty good and every question we asked was promptly answered. They even helped my dad locate and buy some Vietnamese coffee.

The breakfast is done via a menu so everything is freshly made with a good selection of Western and Vietnamese items offered.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: We found this hotel after moving from another hotel which had problems with damp after all the recent heavy rains. This Lovely hotel had no such problems and it was a delight to stay here. the staff are all genuinely friendly and they went out of there way for us and made us feel truly welcome.On arrival we were given a fruit drink and fruit platter as well as a great city map. There were staff on hand to help with our bags . The hotel was new and very comfortable . We had room 401 for our family of three and it was huge. We enjoyed the bathtub and the lovely view from the balcony. Don't let the little lane way location put you off. This meant that we were not bothered by busy traffic and we were just a short walk away from an are with loads of restaurants and close to the river too. We will never forget the great service given to us .Thank you, it was truly 'Serene' .
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
- wonderful,incredibly helpful and friendly staff
- fantastic breakfasts
- PC in room
- big, comfortable bathroom
- good location
- one of the best hotels, I´ve ever stayed in

We arrived one day latter, than we should, because of typhoon, but the staff
was great. They arranged for us great one day trip, with very helpful driver.
We can highly recommend this hotel. During our 21day stay in Vietnam,
it was simply one fo the best, or simply the best..
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This is really one of the best hotels we had in Vietnam. The staff is great, very friendly and helpful! The rooms are very new and the breakfast is delicious. It is a pity, that we just stayed one night in this hotel, but we enjoyed our time.
h_title_comment: One of the best hotels in Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed in a City View Room on the top floor. It was really nice, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great and the staff were very helpful. We also booked all our tours in and around Hue including a day trip to the DMZ through the hotel and didn’t have any problems. Location was good near the tourist area but a few streets away from the main street so quiet too. Would stay here again if in Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Very new, comfortable small hotel. The staff were wonderful, happy and attentive. Organised tour guides, restaurant bookings and taxis. Retrieved a phone left in a restaurant and sorted out a problem caused by our misunderstanding of the value of the local currency. Bed a bit hard but not terrible. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Perhaps the location could have been better (in a muddy lane) but in walking distance of shopping and nice restaurants. Taxis and tour guides cheap in Hue, so location not of prime importance. Our group of 4 thoroughly enjoyed our stay and especially appreciated the high level of service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Incredible value, helpful staff, everything you need.
I can’t praise this hotel enough. For the price you pay I doubt you could find better quality or service.
Rooms were faultless and of a much higher standard than you’d expect from a 3 star hotel. Fantastic shower, air-con, wifi/computer, tv, safe, kettle, fridge, complimentary fruit and drinks. Breakfast was one of the best we had during our entire trip, plenty of choice and as much as you like.
Hotel is within walking distance to the Perfume River, Citadel and a number of restaurants and cafes.
The biggest selling point of this hotel is the staff. Everyone was very attentive, well-spoken and helped with absolutely any query we had. We were delayed in Hue during a typhoon and the staff were incredibly helpful; we were upgraded (due to rooms being available as other travellers had to cancel bookings due to weather) and helped us for hours trying to contact local airlines regarding our flight cancellation. This will be the first place I recommend to anyone travelling to Hue, no matter their budget.
h_title_comment: Best value for money you’ll find in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We were surprised to find a such a nice hotel for such a reasonable price. The staff are very attentive and the rooms are first rate the breakfast was the best we had in our time in Vietnam. The location leaves something to be desired but it is within easy walking distance of most sites. Would defiantly stay her again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Despite only staying here for one night we were overwhelmed by the level of service from when we entered the hotel to when we left. Our room was spacious & had a bath, which was a welcome treat after a rainy day!

Would definitely recommend this hotel to close friends & family.
h_title_comment: Fabulous service, beautiful & spacious rooms perfect stay
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
When I read the reviews about this hotel they simply didn't match the price! How could they? However, we took a chance and booked and THANK GOODNESS we did!

From the moment we were welcomed by "Si" to the moment we left it was PERFECT! Don't hesitate - this is by far the best of the best.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 3 nights as a family of 5 persons. We were treated superbly; welcome juice and hand towel on arrival, advice on tourist sites to visit and an English map provided, fantastic daily breakfast with wonderful smiles. One of the few hotels in Vietnam where they remembered my name and greeted me each day. A new hotel with great facilities. They are really trying hard to build the reputation of their hotel- which all employees are hugely proud of. If any criticism, perhaps staff were trying too hard and need to relax a little more!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel is really really good and calm. It's new, the rooms are clean, large and modern. The bathrooms are clean, large and modern. The staff is so nice, the breakfast perfect. If you go to hué, go to the Serene!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in, their service is unequalled by anywhere I have stayed, it may be a 3 Star Hotel but service is 5 Star plus. From the moment we arrived which was late at night, tired and hungry to our final goodbye 4 days the service was amazing. Being given a Welcome Drink and platter of Fresh Fruit while the booking in formalities were completed was much appreciated. After the first morning all the staff knew our names and Julia even remembered I liked Mango and put some aside for me the next morning for breakfast. Nothing was to hard, I misplaced my Mobile and they helped me track it down and volunteered to get a driver to collect it for me. The staff are so helpful and always smiling. The rooms a spacious with Computer, Flat Screen TV and each morning after the rooms are serviced a plate of fresh fruit is left on the table. My only fault with the Hotel is that the beds are to hard, my Tip, if you sleep on the Doona cover it isn't quite so bad. Don't look anywhere else, I'm sure you will enjoy "Hue Serene Palace" as much as I did.
h_title_comment: Fabulous, friendly and service always with a smile
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
We stayed 4 nights in October and were delighted with the staff and rooms. We arrived in Hue at night and the hotel had sent a car to pick us up at the airport for a fee. The driver met us with a smile and unbrellas as it was raining he had also brought cold bottles of water in the car.

This level of service continued through our stay getting to the hotel we were greated by the ever smiling manager Ken. He went out of his way to greet every guest by name and make sure they were happy. The hotel itself was lovely it is new and is in excellent condition as you would expect from a new hotel.

The breakfast was good with a wide variety of food cooked to order, they also said they woudl try and make anything else you wanted if it wasnt on the menu but the noodle soup and some fresh fruit set us up nicely each day.

Possibly the nicest hotel we have stayed in while travelling around the world and at the price we got the room it was exceptional value.

We walked to the citadel from the hotel which is easily acheivable for anyone, we used the hotels car service to go to the tombs this was a little expensive but probably in line with other hotels for hiring a private car, If your on a budget you might want to stop in to one of the travelers cafes and see what they can offer you or negotiate with a moto driver to take you.

The hotel is located in a quite alley but this is within easy walk to the main restaurant and bar area.

Cant recommend this hotel highly enough you shouldnt stay anywhere else if visiting Hue unless they are fully booked.
h_title_comment: Best hotel in a month travelling Vietnam
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: I thoroughly enjoyed the Hue Serene Palace Hotel, and wished I'd had the time to stay longer. We were spoilt by the wonderful attention from the staff at the Serene. Having recently stayed at two of their sister hotel's in Hanoi (Hanoi Serene and Charming 2), I have no hesitation in recommending this group. The hotel was only 2 months old at the time. Very flash for the amount we paid. They even turned up at the train station to pick us up, even though we hadn't requested a transfer. This saved us from the onslaught of two taxi drivers arguing over us. The hotel rooms are brilliant, everything you need for a city stay. Plenty of food on offer at breakfast, and wonderful staff and service. Thanks to Helen, Ken and Catina, we had a fab time. Great rooms, fantastic service, and a handy location for eating out.
h_title_comment: The perfect place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed for two nights, arriving at the time of the pending typhoon. From the moment of entering we were greeted by friendly staff with a welcome drink, informations about our stay and places to visit. Our room was spacious, very clean, with tasteful decor, flat screen tv that was a charm as we bunkered down for part of one day due to torrential rains, plus there was a computer on the bureau. From our balcony we had a stunning view over Hue, especially the morning after the storm had passed. The staff were charming and so friendly. They have adopted English names in their workplace and politely enjoy engaging in conversation with visitors. We had seen the rave reviews on tripadvisor and the hotel and staff were above expectation. The access to the hotel is down an interesting narrow path which adds to the charm of Vietnam. Without doubt the best hotel and amazing value, we have had in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for two nights and had a lovely time, The staff are all very friendly and helpful. We got a welcome drink on arrival and one of the staff members sat down with us and showed us on a map the places she recommended we go. They also booked a car to take us to all the tombs and to Hoi An. The hotel is down an alley but don't let this put you off. it is close to all the restaurants and bars.

Our room was a superior double which was spacious and came with complementary fruit and water. Breakfast was great with a large all you can eat a la carte selection and a brilliant fruit buffet. It was amazing value for what we got, stay here before they realise they can charge much more!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed here for 2 nights. Our room was very spacious, very clean and an amazing view from our balcony over looking Hue. The staff; Emily, Helen, Sabrina and all were absolutely brilliant. They were extremely polite and made the effort to remember your name and make sure everything was right for you. Breakfast was a great selection. The location of the hotel was just off the main road up a quiet alley but only a gentle 10 minutes stroll to the bars and restaurants.

On the day of our departure we were due to get the late train to Hanoi. The hotel had arranged for us a day around Hue visiting the Royal tombs and then back to collect our baggage. As we returned from our trip earlier than expected and receptionist explained that even though we had checked out if we wanted to we could use one of the rooms to shower and rest in until it was time to go to the station FREE OF CHARGE!! Fantastic so kind and generous. We really felt so welcomed and sad to leave. We would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Stayed here for 2 nights. The staff are fabulous. Cant do enough for you. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Breakfast has a good selection. Very close to Hué restaurants and bars. Would definitely stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed recently at this nice, reasonably priced property in Hue. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, shower with rain shower head and nice flat screen. The hotel is in a fairly narrow alley but after a time or two walking in and out no problem. The wifi is a bit wonky but they're working on it, breakfast adequate not fantastic. What makes this hotel worthy of 5 stars is the amazing, charming and helpful service provided at the front of the hotel by Mary, Helen and Si..thank you ladies for everything.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel just fantastic. The staff had great English were very charming, efficient and helpful. The rooms were spotless with very comfortable beds and had all the things you would expect. Breakfast is lovely with a variety of things to choose from. It is a great choice if you visit Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Stayed here for one night - amazing service from an ultra-friendly staff. Can't say enough about how nice and helpful everyone at this hotel was. Rooms themselves were clean, with western-style bathroom. Location was in a good part of Hue, with good access to restaurants. It's set aside on a side street (can be kind of hard to find), which is good because it's quiet but may not be for everyone since it's not "in the heart of the action". For $25, it's really hard to beat!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Excellent value for money and both myself and husband were impressed with our stay. The staff were very attentive,friendly and helpful and seemed to have bounds of energy for each and every guest.

The hotel arranged all our transfers and gave great tips on where to go and best value for money on tickets to the imperial city and tombs.

If you visit Hue make sure you stay at the Serene Palace-you will not be disappointed!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
By far, the cleanest, friendliest, best value hotel we stayed in in Vietnam. The staff were helpful and gracious, the rooms were very very nice and the location was excellent. I still can't quite believe how good the value was, even for Vietnam.

Would only ever stay here in Hue.
h_title_comment: Best hotel we've ever stayed in
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: My friend and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it could not be faulted for its value for money and customer service. Large room with internet and flat screen TV and good air con is all you need. Breakfast served fresh and service with a smile by the kitchen staff is excellent. Private car to drive to Hoi An arranged with a minimum of fuss and at a reasonable price. All in all a very good choice when staying in Hue and even though it is in alley , close by to Perfume river and citadel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We highly recommend this hotel. Staff is very helpfull and kind, the room is large , well furnished, clean, and beautiful. We could rent bikes and motorbike. The location is also good, quite in the center but the street is quiet. The breakfast is good, with quite a lot of choice.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: For US$25 a night, we got a nice big room, aircon, cable TV, a desktop computer and wifi in the room, complimentary water and coffee, a safe and hairdryer, a bathtub and slippers, and bathroom amenities. Breakfast was very good too, with a choice of Vietnamese or Western. Wonderful, friendly staff who let us borrow the hotel umbrellas when it rained. Hotel is in a quiet street, but as Hue is a small town, it is no more than 10 minutes' walk to the main restaurant street. Great value for money.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Don't look for anything else boys and girls, this is the place you want to be if visiting Hue.

The place is so gorgeous, and don't be scared of the alley in which the hotel is located, super safe.

The stuff made you feel special, and bended backwards to help you out. Stayed in the 7th floor, where I had a battle with my bubble bath...story to be read in my blog.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
I stayed in 4 hotels during my recent trip to Vietnam and this was the best hotel. The good reviews are justified. As others have mentioned, the hotel is only 2 months old but it is the staff that makes it very special. All the hotel employees are warm, friendly and very helpful eg, Laura (restaurant staff) asked me my name (which is not easy to pronounce) and the next day, every single of the restaurant staff greeted me by name and they did this for all the other hotel guests too. Tina (reception) will organise tours for you and will even make suggestions and help organise the best /cheapest way to the airport.

Pros: Warm, friendly staff. Great breakfast (best cheese & tomato omelette I have had), computer and free wifi in room (however be careful as my computer had spyware), fruits and drinks on arrival, complimentary drinks if you’re waiting in their lounge, cheap laundry (US$2 /1 kg), full range of complimentary bathroom toiletries. fruit plate in your room. Huge bed. Close to restaurants.

Cons: The hotel is in a little, narrow lane which is hard to find. Shuttle bus can't come into the lane. However taxis are cheap and hotel will help organise this for you. There is no view from the hotel but if you are only there to sleep, it’s not necessary.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: As soon as we arrived at this hotel the staff were extremely welcoming and offered us drinks, they also sat down with us to provide a map and an outline of the area. This great service and friendliness was consistent throughout our stay. This hotel is great value for money, very clean and modern rooms, with everything you need. Breakfast was also very good. The only very slight negative is its location, the hotel is located down an alley which is a bit rundown.
h_title_comment: Great value for money and lovely staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: A beautiful and new hotel with the most charming and friendly staff we experienced so far in Vietnam, when ever we come back, for sure we will choose this hotel again, we have never had such a warm feeling in a hotel.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Our stay at serene palace hotel was one of the best in South East Asia!! The room was clean and beautiful complete with personal laptop and flat screen tv for an incredibly great deal! Special thanks to staff member Emily who kindly took us to the hospital to check on a health issue and stayed to translate and guide us through the 4 hour visit despite being off work for the day! She was incredible and we cannot thank her enough. Great staff great rooms great service! Do not miss!!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Beautiful, new hotel with fantastic service. We stayed for 2 nights in a spacious and comfortable room on the 7th floor with a city view. We only had one day to explore the city, and the hotel arranged a private car for us to see all of the major sights during our stay at a fantastic price. Breakfast each morning was delicious, and the staff could not have been nicer.

We would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone. Also, they have a sister hotel in Hanoi - the Charming Hotel 2 - that delivers the same warm welcome, fantastic service, friendly faces, and well appointed rooms.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This lovely new hotel was recommended to us by the staff at Holidays Hotel in Hanoi (same owner). The facilities were superb and all the staff were incredibly welcoming and friendly. The room was amazing and very comfortable and quiet. Handy location, within walking distance of good restaurants and the Perfume River. Staff were very helpful at recommending places of interest, arranging tours and also our flights to Ho Chi Minh City. We loved it here and would definitely recommend the Serene Palace Hotel to other travellers.
h_title_comment: Great hotel, great service, great staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This place deserves all the good reviews it has received - it's a great hotel, with a very high quality to price ratio. We checked quite a few other places in Hue, which also had very good reviews, but this place was far superior. And they gave us good restaurant recommendations.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Unfortunately we only had 1 night here and experienced the typhoon. Electricity was mostly off. Staff tried their best to make the situation more comfortable. Rooms were a good size and clean. Bed was rock hard. Hotel was noisy, echoed a lot when other people were opening and closing doors.
h_title_comment: Good size rooms and friendly staff
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
First of all: we got Promotion rate, so we payed 25 USD for a superior Room. This included a nice breakfast with many fruits. We cannot compare the normal rate because we never pay more than 25, but for 25 USD it was unbelievable! The staff is so nice and friendly (seriously, outstanding!), the rooms are very comfortable, clean and the beds are SO good! Bathroom over the top!
We would recommend this hotel, the location is indeed a small street, so it is quiet and still in walking distance to the bridges.

One and only thing you could improve: your bacon indeed is no bacon, it's ham! ;)
We wish you the Best! :)
h_title_comment: Best hotel we stayed in Vietnam
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The rooms themselves are quite good, with a flat screen TV and foreign channels. The double bed is massive and the bed is quite comfortable. Communication beforehand by email was very good. The staff speak a very good level of English.

Breakfast was pretty good. You can order Bun Bo Hue and they will get it from the market.

The staff are very friendly. We left Hue a day early and they were quite flexible and fast with the arrangements.

We also booked several transfer services with them.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The staff at this hotel were the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel I have ever stayed at. Emily and Ken were both very attentive and gave us excellent restaurant recommendations with directions and advice on where to go and what to do. And Yes Emily the Hue rice pancakes are the best in Vietnam. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. Our room looked over the street with a big window. It is in a quiet street with restaurants and bars close by and the river is a short walk away. Hue and Hue Serence Palace Hotel were the highlight city of our holiday in Vietnam.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My husband and I stayed at the Hue Serene Palace hotel in October for one night. We absolutely loved the place and thought it was a great hotel especially given the price tag. The rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. They provided free internet and breakfast. In addition, the staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us tips on things to see while we were in Hue and helped setup our motorbike excursion. In addition, they allowed us to store our stuff at hotel during the day before we headed to the airport.

The location was also very convenient in that we could walk to all the main attractions.

We highly recommend this hotel to all travelers to Hue.
h_title_comment: Excellent stay at the Hue Serene Palace!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We only stayed in Hue for 1 night but the staff helped us make sure we made the most if our time.

We were welcomed with refresher towels, juice and fresh fruit and the staff provided a couple of handy maps of the area to help is find our way around.

The room was well appointed and comfortable.

The staff helped us organize a tour and airport transfers and we're super friendly all the time.

Breakfast was simple but tasty (unlimited a la carte menu).

There are 2 small opportunities for improvement:

1. the hair dryer in the bathroom - one of those old clunky wall mounted ones that is hard to use. This is a minor issue!

2. The hotel itself is down an alleyway and we had a bit of trouble finding it. A sign or clearer instructions/map on the website would help this.

Overall this was wonderful. Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Beautiful new hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. From the welcome drink with fruit plate to the gorgeous and huge room, everything was great. They went out of their way booking onward transportation for us. The breakfast even includes an all you can eat fruit buffet! We only stayed for one night, but would have liked to stay longer (like we did at their sister hotel, Hanoi Charming 2). Highly recommended.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: Very new hotel near centre of Hue. You get to it down a small lane but don't let this put you off. It isa terrific hotel. They cannot do enough for you. From the moment you arrive you are well looked after. Rooms are excellent. We were in a superior room to start (which had a bath) and then because extended by a day, we moved to deluxe, which has full walk in shower. Deluxe had a balcony but it was the rainy seadon so it did not get used. Breakfast staff were excellent, particularly Laura and Sabrina. Ken and Helen on reception are also worth a special mention, although in all honesty they were all first class. If we returned to Hue we would definitely look to stay here again.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: From the moment we first made contact, we were impressed with this gorgeous hotel. It's tucked away in a little alley, but still within walking distance to major sites of Hue. All the staff were friendly and extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble: one of the reception staff even accompanied us on a shopping trip to help track down an obscure purchase. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. As well as WiFi everywhere, there was a computer in our room - very useful for sorting photos and keeping family up-to-date. There was complimentary water and fruit every day. I cannot emphasise enough how much we enjoyed our stay here - it will definitely be on the itinerary when we return.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
a simply stunning hotel tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Hue on a little alley. The hotel is amazing and looks more like a 5* hotel than a 2* hotel - we thought we were in the wrong place to start with! We arrived very early in the morning looking bedraggled from the rain and smelly from our 10 hour night bus from Hanoi. When they saw us they rushed towards us, grabbed our backpacks off us, ushered us in sat us down in the restaurant for a free breakfast to relax while they checked us and in and took our bags to our room for us - fantastic service!

Our room was huge, very modern decor, flat screen tv, great AC and we were only in a standard room. Excellent breakfast with food cooked to order rather than a buffet. The staff are the stars of this hotel though - so friendly, helpful and knowledgable giving us great tips on restaurants and activities.

I can not recommend this place highly enough and wish this new hotel all the success it deserves. Thank you!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
I had a fantastic stay at the Serene Palace. The staff were absolutely great, and were ever at my disposal. I have traveled around the world three times and stayed at hotels in over 65 countries.
The Serene Palace in Hue is by far the best hotel I have ever visited. It is my view that the staff at this hotel are the best possible. I would guarantee anyone staying here, will probably have the same view. This was a stay I shall never forget.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled on business

h_content_comment: I stayed here for 2 days, this hotel is immaculate and the staff are so friendly. This hotel is a great place to base yourself in Hue as it has lots of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Highly recommended.
h_title_comment: Excellent Hotel and Super Friendly Staff
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We had a great stay at the Hue Serene Palace Hotel. The hotel is very new and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The staff are all very warm, like most of the people we encountered in Hue, and extremely helpful. The only regret is that I wish we had planned for more time in Hue. The city around the citadel has a neat feel and the people are wonderful.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We were met at the door with someone to take our luggage to our room. We were given drinks, fruit and towels. When we went to our room thy habit done us or us (honeymoon)- roses, rose petals, swans, candles and cake. It was amazing. The room was big, clean, pc computer, wi fi, tv. It wa very clean and cleaned well every day. The staff are more than helpful and very friendly. Breakfast was as nice as we've had in Asia, cooked to order. Within walking distance of town-restaurants, pubs, sights. Hotel provide maps. Would highly recommend but needs a restaurant for dinner
h_title_comment: Amazing hotel, great value, great service
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Wrapping up a two day stay here, the majority of which I spent inside waiting out a typhoon, I can confidently say that the staff here will bend over backwards to make you happy. Upon entering, you're greeted with a chorus of hellos and it seems like no fewer than four people are asking how your trip to the citadel, tombs, wherever, went. Just now, I slipped into the WC for literally, no longer than 30 seconds, and there was a watermelon juice and scented towel magically waiting next to my seat in the lobby.
In addition, they arranged a guide and a motorbike at short notice and helpfully answered all my questions. So, they've got service down.
The room had everything you could need, including a PC, which was nice for typing some longer emails. I can't think of anything to complain about, though there is no pool or outdoor space (not that I would've used it in the recent weather). For the money, probably the best value I've encountered on my trip.
They're really trying and it shows.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment:
Serene Palace is an amazing place to stay in the city of Hue.
Value for money is its great advantage. Services are great, staff polite and rooms very clean. Hotel is opened few months ago so everything is great.
Definetely recommended!!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: Every staff member was extremely friendly, helpful and efficient in whatever role they had. As soon as they saw us walking up the lane the bellboys came rushing out and took our bags, the reception staff took us to a table where we were given cold juice, fresh fruit and beautifully rolled cold cloths, tied with ribbons, to cool ourselves off. This was the same treatment we received each time we came back from an excursion into Hue. We had a fabulous room - a family suite (we are a couple) with two beds, desk top computer, wi-fi and flat screen TV in the immaculately clean room. The breakfast food was plentiful and beautifully cooked with attentive wait staff. The hotel is within walking distance of the main city areas.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: The employees are amazing, exceptionally helpful and cheerful with the goal of making our stay at their hotel an enjoyable experience. Our room and others we saw are very large with 2 king size beds. The breakfast buffet was big and delicious. A tremendous value for the low room rate. I will encourage friends to stay at the Serene Palace when in Hue.
h_title_comment: A tremendous value hotel with exceptional courteous, helpful service, large rooms and delicious breakfast.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
The hotel is brand new, the staff is extremely friendly and the rooms are fantastic!
Located in a quiet alley it's the perfect getaway from the buzz of the city.
Major sightseeings are in walking distance as well as restaurants and bars.
The best choice if you're looking for a nice experience in Hue!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The hotel is brand new. What makes this hotel stand apart is the very friendly and helpful staff. They went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and worry free as possible. The rooms are bigger than the typical size hotel room. We had two king size beds in our room and had plenty more space. The breakfast was also very good. We had fresh fruits served buffet style and had a choice from the menu for a western or Asian breakfast.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Thoroughly recommend the Serene Palace. Quiet (soundproofed!) rooms so we slept beautifully. Its an easy walk to the citadel, lots of restaurants and the night market by the river. Don't be put off by the little alley it is hiding in, this just makes it quieter.

The staff were extremely helpful. Lovely cold drinks on arrival and help with maps etc to make Hue easy to navigate. After we checked out, our train was cancelled and we had to wait until 2am for the next one. The Serene Palace were happy to look after our luggage and call a taxi at 1am to get us to the station in time. Couldn't ask for more! Thanks Jenny et al for looking after us so well. Good luck to you with this new venture.
h_title_comment: A great little hotel with friendly staff in easy walking distance of the citadel and restaurants
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: This is a little gem of a hotel. The staff are very helpful and welcoming. They have a knack of making every guest feel like an old friend. The rooms are immaculate and breakfast is excellent. The location is ideal of exploring Hue, though the hotel is tucked away in an unmade alley that makes you think there can't possibly be a nice hotel down there. The hotel represents excellent value and deserves to be a success story.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
No wonder this hotel is rated #1. It is brand new, so everything is perfect, squeaky clean and feels like 5-star.
The rooms are great, bathroom is only missing a bathtub, and they even provide a PC in each room as well as wifi.
Service is excellent, with very attentive staff, almost over-attentive but all in the best spirit.
Awesome breakfast with lots of fresh fruit, and many choices including eggs any style and pho (noodle soup).
I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Hué, thank you Serene Palace for a true luxury stay.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Upon arrival at the Serene Palace at 10am we were delighted to not only get an early check in, but a complimentary breakfast! This was just the beginning, of what became one of the friendliest, cleanest and most professional hotels we visited in Vietnam Nam. Thank you to Miss Sue and all the staff.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: I chose this hotel because of previous reviews. The hotel is situated down a dubious looking side alley street and I wondered at first if we were at the right place. But myself and travel weary friends stepped into an oasis. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and served us with tea and fresh fruit while we completed the formalities. The rooms were beautiful, and well set up. The breakfast delicious and plentiful. The reception staff couldn't do enough to help. One lady in our group turned her ankle while we were there. The hotel staff checked on her, massaged her foot, and went to the pharmacy for bandage and anti-inflammatory drugs. I can't praise this place highly enough, and all for a very reasonable price! The only slight drawback was the hard bed..
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment:
Brand new hotel located down a quiet alley, 5 minutes walk from the main shopping and restaurant area of Huế and 15 minutes walk from the Citadel (Imperial City). Exceptional staff throughout, one of whom drove me to the station on his scooter during a typhoon due to having lost a personal possession there. It was quite an experience in gale-force winds and rain, but he got me there and back safely and the hotel did not even charge me for it.
The rooms are of a very high standard with in-room PC and high speed internet, flat screen TV, large bathroom and walk-in shower. Extremely comfortable bed and pillows, with rooms cleaned and made up daily.
Breakfast offers a variety of hot Vietnamese and Western dishes cooked to order, in addition to a large selection of fresh fruit, again all to a high standard and served by attentive restaurant staff.
Special thanks to Emily for her extensive assistance and hospitality throughout the stay. I wouldn't even consider staying at another hotel next time I am in Huế.
h_title_comment: Fantastic Staff, Brand New Hotel, Central Location
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: I am currently staying at the Serene Palace and am shocked over how nice the hotel is! Staff are very friendly/helpful and the value for money cannot be beat. I live in Vietnam and this is the best hotel for the price. My room is huge with two beds, sat. TV, Wifi, even a desktop.....all for $23. Brand new and clean as can be. Don't be put off by the side alley location, it is well worth the slight effort.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Me and my friends had a wonderful stay in the Serene Palace Hotel! We lived in the 7th floor and had a wonderful room/view over the whole city! The welcome was great, the meals very good and the staff was just excellent (friendly, helpful and nice). We can only recommand this hotel to other guest and my next stay in Hué will be for shure in the same hotel! Very clean, very good and a very fair deal! Thanks to the wonderful staff - the best hotel in town!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We only had 3 days here at Serene Palace. Unfortunately it rained most of our stay but that didn't stop us enjoying this wonderful new hotel and its amazing staff. Rooms are very spacious with wonderful large balconies. This is an amazing hotel for the price. Location is within walking distance to the restaurant area. Very quiet location down a laneway. Would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about visiting Hue.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We'll, what can I say! From the moment we walked in EVERYTHING and EVERYONE was wonderful.. The girls at reception (marg, sarah and Paula!) are sooo fun! And all of the guys are ready for a chat and to help out. Great comfortable rooms in a perfect location and breakfast was brilliant... I saw one person complain on here, I don't know what the hell they are talking about!!! We've been travelling s/e Asia for the last 9 months and this is my favorite place !!!! We miss everyone there and wish we had stayed longer... We will come back as soon as we can!!!! Xxx
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: As an international environmental educator and lawyer, I am well travelled. I have never received such impeccable service as I received at the Sue Serene hotel. Everyone received me with such a beautiful smile and made every effort to know my name from the front desk to the cleaning staff. Their friendliness was contagious! I recommend this hotel without any reservations.
h_title_comment: I had a great time at the Serene Hotel!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: We stayed only one night but it met all of our needs and expectations. Particularly enjoyed the laneway location and the staff provided excellent advice on what to see during a too short visit to Hue.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This brand new hotel has everything going for it except for having to walk down a muddy side street to get there. But it is worth it. The staff-especially Emily and Jenny- go way out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Similar to hotels costing three times as much
h_title_comment: A great place to stay in Hue
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Absolutely loved staying here! My partner and I originally were only staying a few days, but after befriending all the staff and loving the hotel we extended our stay another five days! It is rare that you find a hotel like this where the accommodation is 4 star and the price is still so low! I can't recommend this hotel enough!! Thank you John, Emily, Mary, Helen, Minh and all the rest of the crew for looking after us...Can't wait to go back! :)
h_title_comment: What fantastic staff and a beautiful hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
As others have pointed out, this hotel is an incredible bargain. Rooms are spacious, amenities are well-stocked, and the location puts you within walking distance of most of the sights in Hue.

But what really makes this hotel stand out from others is the level of service and attention to detail provided by the staff, which was absolutely outstanding. Not only do they provide welcome drinks and always greet you with a smile, but they're also willing to go the extra mile for guests. I arrived at the hotel late at night after a long day and a flight from HCMC, and didn't really feel like going out for dinner, preferring instead to have a bite to eat in the room and go to bed early. The staff offered to send up a bowl of hot noodles to my room, which were much appreciated.

After a few days in Hue, I flew to Hanoi and checked in at their sister property. Upon arrival, I noticed that one of my shirts was missing from my suitcase; I figured that I must have accidentally left it in Hue. I sent them an email to see if I had, and not only did they locate the shirt, but offered to send it straight to my hotel in Hanoi. I don't know how they did it (perhaps one of the staff members was already traveling to Hanoi and offered to bring it?), but when I arrived back at my Hanoi hotel the next day, there was my shirt!

Overall, a customer service experience that went way beyond my expectations and one that made my stay at this hotel a true delight. They opened quite recently (during summer 2013) and are really doing their best to make an excellent first impression. If you're going to Hue, stay at the Serene Palace; you'll be glad you did.
h_title_comment: Absolutely fantastic service, very highly recommended
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled solo

h_content_comment: Dspite all the good reviews, our view isn't as sunny. First off Agoda never confirmed our booking to us. So we got our hotel in Hanoi to phone ahead. He spoke to several staff who couldn't find our booking. So we booked over the phone and made arrangements for an airport transfer. What transpired the next day can only be described as confusion and prolonged discussions about our booking. Breakfast was weird with bacon that wasnt bacon. But most annoyingly we got cornered at breakfast by a waitperson who wanted us to use her suggested driver. What would have cost 400'000 VND she suggested would be $45 USD. Shame really as we've only had great experiences in this lovely country.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
We stayed at Hue and in Serene Palace Hotel for two nights and absolutely loved it. The staff was so very friendly and helpful and did everything that we felt comfortable. I think they were one of the few people in Vietnam, who spoke excellent English and even some words of German!
The rooms were very clean and spacious for an attractive price (20 USD promotion off-season for superior double room per night), with an own computer, TV and DVD and, as in all Hotels of the "Holiday-Group", with a reasonable price for beverages out of the minibar.
The breakfast was excellent and when we got soaked one night due to a tropical storm, they arranged for ordering dinner as we could not leave again because of the heavy rain, flooding and power blackout. A little note: the emergency power generator in the hotel works fine :D
They also arranged first seats in our night bus back to Hanoi for us as we had to stay next to the toilet on our first night bus before at the other direction and did not want to travel that way again. So we were picked up first and could select our "accommodation". Before leaving, we were allowed to have a shower in a special room which was also very clean.
All in all, we would highly recommend Serene Palace Hotel and would definitely stay there again.
h_title_comment: We loved the hotel and the staff before all
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This is a new hotel,in a quiet location.Ms. Lyn and all the staff here were all so helpful with organising tours to all the local attractions and private transport back to Danang via the scenic route.We chose the larger room with a verandah,which was great.We highly recommend this Delightful, small hotel to all who visit Hue.
h_title_comment: Delightful hotel,great staff and good location.10/10
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Being new, the facilities are of great quality and excellent value. However, the best part was the great service from the staff who were eager to help with any request. I barely mentioned that I wanted to cycle and they had arranged it and followed up with a map and suggestions of places to visit. They were also very lovely in letting us get changed at the end of the day we checked out, before we headed for the overnight train. As a result, we sought out their stable mates in Hanoi, where we also received great service.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: We like many others had just arrived off the overnight sleeper train from hanoi..all i can say is walking into this hotel and seeing the amazing rooms made that horrible trip worth it..the rooms are so big compared to what we've stayed in for double the price..note we were lucky enough to have availed of there 50%off opening offer but i would happily pay the full price for this hotel again..the staff were so friendly and helpfull.a special thanks to emily(lac lac) and julia for making our stay so special.
h_title_comment: Immaculate hotel with big rooms and great service
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This hotel was indeed a hidden gem. The staff were very helpful and offered Thoughtful service, clean room with all we needed. Complimentary fruit as well as juice on arrival. A pleasure to recommend this hotel
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
Best hotel we stayed in in Vietnam!
Clean, roomy and new rooms, very friendly and attentioned staff.
Location is great generally speaking, but it is in a small back alley, so a bit hard to find.
Enjoy the hospitality!
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment:
Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for one night after an overnight train to hue from Hanoi. We got picked up from the train station and got to the hotel, got a lovely welcome and breakfast and early check in for free.

Very helpful staff, rooms were immaculate and really spacious.

Would recommend both Serene hotels - 5 stars.
h_title_comment: Excellent standard, very spacious clean rooms
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: We had such a lovey time, the people we so attentive,the breakfast was worth the cost of the room. Easy to find in a cheap taxi, clean new, spacious we could not fault it. Nice cafes an shops near by, close to citadel with nice walk along the river
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with friends

h_content_comment: This hotel really is a hidden gem! It offers incredible value for money - the staff are extremely helpful, the breakfast is fantastic, and the rooms are beautiful! The staff offered us welcome fruit and juice, as well as tea while we waited for a taxi before tea, which was most appreciated!The staff also booked us a great motorbike trip to Hue. Would definitely recommend this lovely hotel!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights and didn't want to leave. Gorgeous, modern, tasteful rooms and lobby. Service of the type you'd receive at a pricey US hotel. Fresh fruit and juice on offer whenever you walk in.
h_title_comment: Spectacular, hospitality out of this world
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Amazing hotel, Couldn't believe what we got for what we paid a real deal. Rooms were spacious beautifully decorated well equipped, clean. The mini bar in the room was really cheap the water was less then you can buy from the street which was a first for us in Vietnam, for the price you pay this is truly an unbelievable deal. Breakfast was great. staff were brilliant helpful friendly couldn't do enough to make our stay wonderful! Loved the whole experience.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: We stayed here with the 50% discount offer and were overwhelmed with the quality, service and value for money at this hotel. The staff all learnt our names even though we were only staying one night. If we didn't have our accommodation booked for the following night we would definitely have stayed longer. Breakfast was fantastic too.
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment:
Service was amazing and confort incredibly high for the price.very good value for money, we wish we had spent more than 1 night there .breakfast is good and restaurant very cosy.
Location is good as it is in hue center .
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: This brand new hotel is very nice. The Rooms and bathrooms are large and well appointed. For me the highlight was the strong water pressure in the shower - refreshing! They also have a great free breakfast.
h_triptype: NA

h_content_comment: Thank you very very much for having looked after us so nicely!!! We are a Family with 5 children and we have been traveling for 3 month all around the world. Serene Hotel in Hue was definitally one of the best Hotel we have been! The staff is so lovely, they realised every wish and more. the staff found us a super guide with car. He drove us aroud all Hue and surounding... a pitty we had so Little time. The room and specially the beds were so comfortable!!! No noise at all, the street is Little and very quite!! We Feld so welcome... and at the end every staffmember helped us ( even the Girls with there hightheels!) with our laggage because we were late for our bus... the carried it 500m down the street and we so didnt miss the bus! Thank you again!!! We will come back!!!!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled with family

h_content_comment: This hotel provides you a great value for your money, staff is very efficient and warm, breakfast is served as per your particular request , and rooms are confortable and very clean. Staff in the reception is very efficient, they gave us all the necesario support to continue wit our trip to Hoi An.
h_title_comment: Great balance between price and service
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment:
My wife and I stayed here recently for one night as part of our honeymoon tour around Vietnam and Cambodia. We got a special offer price of $20 for the night and they included a free early morning check-in and breakfast on arrival for us, which was a great and very welcome bonus.

The breakfast is decent and the rooms are a good size, very nicely decorated and clean (the beds are much harder than I like, though this is pretty common in Vietnam), with a good safe to leave your valuables in, as you'd expect for a fairly new hotel. In addition to that, the staff were all tremendous, being hugely friendly and helpful, with very good English too, should that be important to you (my wife is Vietnamese, so this isn't a concern for us).

The location is down a small side street/alley, which is fairly common in Vietnam and it's not too far away from the main attractions and town centre. If you want a taxi, go for Mai Linh (green taxis), as they're a national company and usually very reliable and legitimate. The number on the meter is the price you pay, so if it says 30, that equates to 30,000VND and a tip rounded up to the nearest 5,000 or 10,000VND is the norm.

If you're going to Hue, definitely check this place out, as the quality of the hotel and its staff are way above anywhere else in this price band, with service on a level with a lot of way more expensive and allegedly higher quality establishments. A top place to stay and we'd happily stay there again if visiting Hue.
h_title_comment: Tremendous value hotel and great staff too!
h_triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

h_content_comment: The serene palace was the best Hotel we had on our trip around s e asia. The staff was very polite, very helpful and very friendly. We arived in the morning and were told we would have to wait until 2pm for our room, as usual. The unusual part was, that we were offered a breakfast and half an hour later our room was ready. It was modern and very clean. We had a big flat screen tv, a pc, a nice hot shower, a very comfortable bed and a silent A/C.
